Job Description:
About Zilingo

Since being founded in 2015 by former McKinsey consultant Ankiti Bose and ex-Yahoo engineer Dhruv Kapoor Zilingo has advanced from being a purely online marketplace to an all-encompassing ecosystem that unlocks value across the supply chain.

Our businesses include B2C & B2B Marketplace Private Label as a Service E-POS & Inventory Management Trend Forecasting and Fintech. Each business complements the other creating compounding benefits for the platform.

We've grown exponentially on the back of the platform strategy making us one of the most successful and fastest growing startups in all of Asia. Headquartered in Singapore we have offices in Thailand Indonesia Philippines Hong Kong and India.

We're actively looking to hire the world's best talent to join us. If you have the passion and ambition let's build the next big thing together!

THE ROLE

Having hundred brands coming from all over the world requires a strong logistic team to support activity in all Zilingo countries. Driven individuals with a very detail oriented attitude and excellent communication capabilities will be able to find their place here. The international and fast paced environment provides numerous stimuli and various opportunities to grow and develop with visible and direct impact on the performance and direction of the company.

Responsibilities
  • Coordination of cross-border freight movement between factories suppliers buyers and logistics providers.
  • Preparation and checking of shipping documents required for international and domestic movements of B2B goods.
  • Monitoring of shipping activities to ensure goods reach by the stipulated date.
  • Daily handling of relationships with service providers and suppliers ensuring that the supply chain runs smoothly.
  • Management of Singapore's B2C market operations ensuring that service level agreements are achieved.
  • Tracking of orders with service providers to ensure that orders are fulfilled in a timely manner.
  • Analyse data collected to look for areas of operational improvements such as reducing lead times or higher costs efficiency.
Must haves for this position:
  • Preference for someone to have at least 1-year experience in a related field (ecommerce / logistics).
  • Experience in MS Office.
  • Possess positive work attitude good time management and able to multi-task.
  • Demonstrate integrity dependability responsibility and team player.
  • Able to work in a fast-changing environment and to make decisions required to resolve the situation at hand.
  • Good management of multiple projects and responsibilities with the ability to prioritise.

The Operations Specialist will work with the demand planner to ensure that we have the right inventory available at the right time in the right place and at the right price. This is primarily done through a variety of operations planning duties – initial print run coordination spec changes forecasting product line analysis and initiation of reprints as needed. They will work closely with internal and external customers and teams to make sure that we can meet our sales goals effectively. This role also administers several different systems and processes to support the broader sales finance and logistics teams in achieving Wizards’ goals. This role must be a relentless problem solver process orientated and demonstrate forward thinking when it comes to providing recommendations.

What You'll Do
  • Coordinate the regional product planning process ensuring effective accurate forecasting.
  • Track and optimize WotC inventories in all APAC warehouses maintaining correct levels to meet sales demand and mitigate potential obsolescence.
  • Manage the process of setting up products for forecasting.
  • Oversee the shipping of products from production centers to APAC warehouses.
  • Review and propose improvement to APAC demand planning and supply chain processes.
  • Address demand planning related issues in a timely and effective manner.


What You'll Bring
  • 2+ Years of Sales Supply Chain or Logistics Experience
  • Experience with SAP John Galt or other Enterprise Level Sales & Inventory systems


Knowledge Abilities And Characteristics
  • This individual should be technically minded and love digging into systems
  • They should be process minded – comfortable following a process and looking for improvements in that process
  • Forward thinking – Identifying potential problems before they’re a critical issue is important here
  • Clear proactive communication is a must. We need to hear about the problem before it’s a critical issue
  • Able to work with a very diverse group of people in different time zones countries and cultures.


Education And Training
  • Four-year degree in business administration sales management finance or similar field or equivalent work experience required.
  • Proficient with Excel

• Based in Tanjong Pagar
  • Must be able to work full time Monday – Friday 9am-6pm
  • Competitive Salary
  • Fluent in English and Mandarin is a must for this role
  • Fluent in Japanese a major plus but not essential
  • Office based role
  • Must be located in Singapore and able to legally work full time in Singapore

We are seeking a passionate driven and proactive individual to provide assistance to the Operations team. This is a challenging role where you will be part of a dynamic team in supporting the Operations Asia Pacific team.

Duties and functions 

  • Remote onboarding of new restaurant partners to the Quandoo System
  • Provide restaurant partners with remote technical support and training
  • Remote customer service - inbound and outbound for restaurant partners and consumers using the platform
  • Full responsibility and realization of your KPIs (quantitative and qualitative goals).

Day to day activities

  • Adherence to and achieving outputs in line with daily / weekly / monthly activity requirements targets deadlines & escalations
  • Office based consumer and restaurant partner support.
  • Daily inbound & outbound calls emails & salesforce case management
  • Uploads to the Quandoo Portal for restaurant partners

Requirements:

  • Similar operations experience essential
  • Some experience in the hospitality industry preferred but not essential
  • Outstanding communication skills 
  • Good spoken and written English and Mandarin is essential
  • Fluent in Japanese a major plus but not essential
  • Be efficient assertive and have quick decision-making capability
  • Ability to prioritise tasks and able to multi-task
  • Able to work in a fast pace environment
  • A demonstrated empathy when communicating with restaurant partners and consumers
  • Self-disciplined to work independently and as a team  
  • Good MS Office & Desktop IT skills
  • Experience with Google Suite and Drive is an advantage

What we offer:

  • Dynamic and friendly working atmosphere within a successful international team
  • Chance to take on responsibility and develop your skill set
  • Support and training by experienced executives. 
  • Laptop and mobile phone provided.

​​​​​Note:  Only applicants who are short-listed will be contacted. Candidate must attach a resume to be considered.

• ENSURE SMOOTH PROGRESS OF ALL ONGOING PROJECTS IN A MAJOR LOCAL SHIPYARD
  • CONDUCT ONBOARD INSPECTION OF WORK DONE ACROSS ALL LOCATIONS INCLUDING TANKS TO ENSURE GOOD QUALITY OF WORK
  • FORECAST & PLAN THE MANPOWER REQUIREMENT TO AVOID MANHOURS WASTAGE
  • RESOLVE ANY WORKER RELATED ISSUES
  • MONITOR & CONTROL THE BUDGET FOR ALL PROJECTS
  • PARTICIPATE IN QUOTATION NEGOTIATION OF NEW PROJECTS AND SETTLEMENT PROCESS AFTER PROJECT COMPLETION
  • ATTEND TO OTHER AD HOC DUTIES AS AND WHEN REQUIRED BY MANAGEMENT

Hugo believes happy prosperous communities are built on healthy financial foundations.

That’s why at Hugo we’re on a mission to make Saving Second Nature.

Through our product vision of Better Budgeting Smarter Spending and Sustainable Saving together we can build a financially healthy and thriving community.

Hugo is a digital banking application and debit card that puts saving first. Our initial market will be Singapore but regional and global expansion will follow swiftly.

Hugo is a brand owned and operated by Atlas Consolidated Pte Ltd.

Who we are looking for and why

We are looking for an experienced Head of Operations to lead the Operations Team and work alongside the Executive Management Team.

We need to define build and implement our operations strategy architecture.

What a “Head of Operations” means to us

Someone who designs and implements comprehensive operations strategies ensuring compliance with local and international regulations oversees operational frameworks like treasury payments both card and banking customer service technology service delivery and drives live operations for the company’s business activities.

The Company depends on the Head of Operations to drive the operations strategy and provide leadership to the operations team including in card payments bank payment processing and reconciliation and excellence in customer service and care.

Requirements

How you can help us

There are certain functions and capabilities we believe are essential to the role
  • Proven experience and success across the various disciplines of operations specifically in debit (and credit) card payments domestic banking and SWIFT payments - ideally within B2C e-wallet FX and payment services sector;
  • Ability to develop our Operations and Treasury strategy in alignment with strategic business objectives - being hands on with building and optimising processes;
  • Responsibility for building training and developing a team which can scale across SE Asia using cross functional training;
  • Responsibility for implementation of robust internal controls to ensure risk management in the day-to-day running of the Treasury and Operation team which mitigates errors through fostering a dialogue of ‘openness honesty and transparency’;
  • Treasury Management - including debit cards cash FX and physical gold of customer and operational accounts ensuring timely payment processing confirmation and reconciliation;
  • Debit Card Issuing program and operational management - working with card networks eg VISA Mastercard China Union Pay etc to ensure operational adherence on network rules and guidelines complete with knowledge of card settlement processes - fees refunds and charge-backs;
  • Work closely with the finance controller to ensure operational third party payments and aggregated customer accounts net balance to zero each day and meet the regulatory reporting schedules of the relevant regulatory bodies by country notably on meeting strict capital buffer requirements for the customer balances;
  • Previous experience with creating operational flows suggesting product improvements and working on onboarding flows to provide seamless customer experience;
  • Work with the Compliance Product and Technology teams to implement automated solutions for primarily for operations compliance customer onboarding and support;
  • Play a lead role in maintenance of quality assurance processes and implement streamlined processes for customers;
  • Develop and manage vendor relationships their contracts and negotiate commercial terms;
  • Experience working with an ASEAN based product market;
  • Combining market research with a data driven analytical approach to drive the strategy understand the value proposition set goals and demonstrate ROI;
  • Creating competitor and market analysis staying ahead of trends and competitor positioning;
  • Working with the Management Team to set budgets;
  • Working closely with Product Data Customer Support and Management in delivering a better experience for Hugo customers;
  • Create a solid network of strategic partnerships;
  • Propagating our purpose mission vision and values.


What we would consider as added value

Skills and capabilities we believe are highly relevant include
  • 8+ years of proven experience in a lead/senior operations role;
  • Bachelors/Masters degree or equivalent in a relevant subject area;
  • Multidisciplinary experience within multiple operational roles in financial services or fintech;
  • Potential experience with Card networks on acquiring side;
  • Experience with consumer asset management operations equity bonds and FX;
  • Strong knowledge of South East Asian markets (particularly Singapore);
  • Passionate about joining an early stage Fintech;
  • Ability to identify build and enhance key relationships influence and challenge as required;
  • Superior time management and very organized with excellent interpersonal and presentation skills;
  • Fluent English speaker and writer ideally with local language skills – Indonesian Mandarin.


Performance indicators to get you off to a great start

A touch down quick win (30 Days)
  • Develop an Operations strategy robust for scaling over the first 24 months;
  • Develop Operational Risk Management (ORM) procedures and guideline documentation for team reflecting risk and compliance policies in place for soft launch including preliminary operational continuity business plans;
  • Check account integrity and implement Treasury management processes and reporting.

Found your feet (90 Days)
  • Further develop ORM procedures and standards from first 30 days to incorporate a cultural awareness of operational compliance and business risk;
  • Develop robust business continuity plan to be updated based on growth of company and annually;
  • Set budget for expansion in conjunction with executive team.

Well into your stride (180 Days)
  • Continue to develop ORM strategies and implementation including cross functional training of your growing team;
  • Improve and develop Operational Technology systems to improve operational efficiencies - automation and cost benefits.


Benefits

Can accommodate flexi-working schedules

Hugo Values being Responsible Open and Collaborative

We are responsible to our customers community and team to help shape a more open collaborative approach to money. This is the way Hugo hopes to make a difference and help us build better communities.

Shared responsibility is not only part of our approach to money but a key part of how we work together. This shared responsibility allows for openness and candour between us as a team and in our relationship with our customers.

Good ideas can come from anywhere so an open and collaborative dialogue between the Hugo community (customers the team the stakeholders alike) helps get the best from us all and helps make the difference.

Everyone is welcome to apply

Job Title: Business Development - Singapore| Business Operations Team Assistant
Job Description:
Job Description:

  • Support seller operations team in regular reporting and other day to day work
  • Responsible to prepare and send out regular reports to sellers and internal stakeholders
  • Report irregularity in trends to supervisors
  • Assist in organizing seller visits preparation of seller visits materials and documentation of discussion points
  • Preparation of seller focus group discussion
  • Manage new sellers on-boarding discussion chat

Requirements:

  • Enjoys working in a fast-paced and collaborative environment
  • Proficient in excel and powerpoint
  • Attention to details
  • Quick learner

Summary
As an Operations Expert you know better than anyone else the satisfaction of getting the latest Apple product into your hands. So it’s up to you to make sure customers are just as satisfied. By guiding and mentoring your team you help keep pace with changing demands and make sure every product and demo machine is where it should be. At the end of the day it’s your organisational skills and dedication that are at the heart of what the Apple Store does — connecting people to the products they love.


Key Qualifications
Ability to think quickly and perform problem-solving tasks even within changing conditions.

Leadership skills whether guiding by example or coaching a group.

Strong organisational skills quickly evaluating every situation.


Description
As an Operations Expert you and your team have the incredible responsibility of ensuring products take the final step in the supply chain: getting into customers’ hands. You’re in charge of the store’s entire inventory — products parts tools supplies and everything else. You make sure your team has the support knowledge and resources required to maintain product availability complete inventory tasks and keep the stockroom organised as new products arrive. You’re in constant contact with the management and leadership teams sharing data about the status of products and parts. And when exciting new products arrive you’re the first to open them up and present them to the entire store team. Apple makes the products but you make it happen by being ready to place our products in customers’ hands.


Additional Requirements
•You can manage and meet multiple inventory deadlines each week.

•You’re willing to observe guidelines to allow secure access to products and movement through the stockroom.

•You’ll need to be flexible with your schedule. Your work hours will be based on business needs.

Description

Description

Are you ready to gain new skills to help run and maintain the latest production technology and equipment for the world’s biggest brands? We’re looking for teammates who know how to take charge of business-related challenges and keep us running efficiently.

Working behind the scenes in our manufacturing plants Plant Technicians are vital to the success of our business at P&G. We do various types of work including running high-speed converting and packing equipment controlling the process from a computer terminal and performing preventive maintenance on equipment.

We hire you at entry level and you advance by demonstrating growing levels of operating maintenance and leadership skills. We also provide you with the opportunity to expand into electrical quality assurance safety and hygiene and other areas of expertise.

Your Team

As a technician you will work with a team that is responsible for keeping production flowing meeting performance goals and maintaining the high level of quality that consumers expect from our products

Key Responsibilities
  • Execute the batch making and packing process according to production plan for the day
  • Execute the job assignment allocated by the team leader
  • Upkeep the safety and quality standard in the plant
  • Own the relevant Standard Operating Procedures (SOP) for systems / equipment
  • Contribute actively to the plant's efforts in eliminating losses at work and learn-do-teach culture
  • Own the cleaning and 5Ss of the assigned area for the day
Qualifications
  • Good analytical and problem solving skills
  • Good collaboration to work with people from diverse backgrounds
  • Strong communication skills in English verbally and in writing
  • Willing to work on rotating shifts and based in Tuas
  • Minimum qualification: Diploma in Engineering
  • Highest qualification: Degree in Engineering
  • Medically and physically fit to operate in a manufacturing environment
About Us

We produce globally recognized brands and we grow the best business leaders in the industry. With a portfolio of trusted brands as diverse as ours it is paramount our leaders are able to lead with courage the vast array of brands categories and functions. We serve consumers around the world with one of the strongest portfolios of trusted quality leadership brands including Always® Ariel® Gillette® Head & Shoulders® Herbal Essences® Oral-B® Pampers® Pantene® Tampax® and more. Our community includes operations in approximately 70 countries worldwide.

Visit http://www.pg.com to know more.

Our consumers are diverse and our talents - internally - mirror this diversity to best serve it. That is why we’re committed to building a winning culture based on Inclusion and our ideal candidate is passionate about the same principle: you will join our daily effort of being “in touch” so we craft brands and products to improve the lives of the world’s consumers now and in the future. We want you to inspire us with your unrivaled ideas.

We are committed to providing equal opportunities in employment. We do not discriminate against individuals on the basis of race color gender age national origin religion sexual orientation gender identity or expression marital status citizenship disability veteran status HIV/AIDS status or any other legally protected factor.

Job Title: Product Strategy and Operations Associate| Apps| Go-to-Market Operations
Job Description:
Due to the current health crisis related to COVID-19 and the escalating visa/travel restrictions in place we're currently unable to extend offers to anyone who cannot work from Singapore due to lockdown visa/travel restrictions or other restrictive measures until further notice. Consequently we will be prioritizing candidates who can start in this location by set date as expected. We're keeping the situation under review and would adjust our position should the restrictive measures be removed later on.

Minimum Qualifications
  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • Experience in Sales Operations/Strategy Marketing Strategy or Strategy consulting.


Preferred Qualifications
  • Experience in stakeholder management influencing and project management (including execution delegating and working across various functions to connect teams around common goals).
  • Basic knowledge of SQL/Database statistics business modeling and quantitative analysis.
  • Demonstrated ability to lead complex operational and strategic initiatives operating with little guidance.
  • Ability to translate data and trends into strategy with compelling messaging and to guide decision-making for the team and leadership.


About The Job

Go-To-Market (GTM) Performance encompasses some of Google’s important advertising and measurement products including Search Shopping Apps the Google Marketing Platform suite and Ads Data Hub. The Strategy and Scale team partners with leaders product leads and cross-functional partners to execute strategic projects set operational rigor guide product priorities and ensure seamless product deployment and activation. As a Product Strategy and Operations Associate you will lead strategy projects and operating processes for Apps and Mobile business. You will help drive excellent organizational performance across the product team and act as a bridge among different cross-functional teams.

In this role you’ll focus on building competitive strategies identifying opportunities to accelerate and diversify the business and create compelling narratives that help influence our global product roadmap and regional go-to-market strategy on an ongoing basis.

The Go-to-Market Operations (GtM) team ensures Google's complex and ever-evolving Ads business runs smoothly. We are instrumental in setting go-to-market strategy and ensuring flawless execution and operations against the strategy. We have teams embedded in each of the major Ads business areas as well as global teams that work across the business areas. Team members are analytical and strategic with a pragmatic sense of how to get things done.

Responsibilities
  • Support and own elements of core planning processes including annual planning product prioritization global business updates and executive reviews as it relates to Apps.
  • Conduct analysis and/or lead cross-functional teams to develop recommendations on future-looking initiatives. Align stakeholders and drive through to implementation ensuring insightful learning from the initiatives.
  • Serve as a thought partner for the Head of Apps and Mobile and as a thought partner to the leads on product strategy and execution.
  • Support the team in the development of a ‘one APAC voice’ on product priorities based on client and specialist feedback to positively influence global product strategy.

Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race color ancestry religion sex national origin sexual orientation age citizenship marital status disability gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation please let us know by completing this form .

Looking for Operation Manager :

﻿

Key Responsibilities : 1 This position is a key leadership role and will require experience in client management including participation governance review meetings good communication complex problem management consultative building and managing high performance teams

2 Manage Daily Operations - Analyze service performance data Analytical skills and drive initiatives aimed at performance improvement

3 Proactive Delivery Management - Suggestions on Improvement Plans;


Technical Experience : 1 Proven experience in ETL delivery including Experience in Project governance Crisis and Escalation management

2 End to end management of IO delivery for a global client including onshore and offshore teams

3 Financial Management should have experience of managing project financials including cost take out initiatives

4 Good Understanding of Automation Analytics ETL and BI Tools and Quality processes

Professional Attributes : 1 Understanding of quality processes and standards such as ISO 20000/BS25999/ITIL

2 Strong Communication skills and ability to confidently communicate a point of view

3 Good knowledge of ITIL delivery processes such as Incident problem Change availability capacity etc

Remuneration

Attractive base salary plus substantial annual bonus will be offered to an outstanding performer.

Company Background

YH2 Capital Management is an investment management company of a family office of which the capital is 100 percent contributed and owned by its founders. The Company employs a global and multidisciplinary approach for identifying disruptive trends for the next decade and picking the best-in-class businesses that can emerge as the dominant companies of the future.

As a result of the owner’s approach and the conviction devoted to each investment the Company maintains a concentrated portfolio. From 2010 till now the team has achieved a compound annual return of about 30 percent far outperforming S&P 500.

The Company is planning to expand its investment team and operations in Singapore substantially in the near future and is looking for someone who is interested to run a successful and growing family office that also has significant philanthropic initiatives to join as its Operations Manager.

Job Summary

To run the operations of a successful and growing family office.

Key Responsibilities
  • Ensure the smooth running of the family office
  • Work on the finance accounting legal regulatory and business aspects of a family office
  • Work on the philanthropic initiatives of the family office
  • Work with a team of support staff
  • Manage counterparties such as bankers accountants lawyers and other major vendors
  • Leverage technology to design and implement optimal workflow systems
  • Any other duties as assigned by the Co-CEOs from time to time


Job Requirements
  • Strong organizational and management skills
  • Strong problem solving skills
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills
  • Ability to work on a wide spectrum of responsibilities
  • Able to work independently with little supervision
  • Good system thinker flexible highly committed and full of initiative
  • Willingness to learn and challenge oneself by diving into new areas
  • Good interpersonal skills to navigate across different stakeholders
  • Reliable meticulous and detailed oriented
  • A degree holder or higher qualifications
  • At least 5 years or more of solid working experience

Job Description:

Get to Know the Team

Our team is the front line of our GrabRentals drivers. We are a closely knit group each with our own unique set of skills and responsibilities that compliment each other. Thus we strongly believe in teamwork collaboration and our abilities to contribute even if only a little to the wider organization.

The work we do involves a great amount of passion for customer experience and operations which usually means that we need to be constantly striving to improve think quickly on our feet and come up with efficient and effective solutions to problems and operational processes.

Get to Know the Role:

We serve as the first touch point to our GrabRentals drivers. We provide detailed rental consultation to our drivers and proactively help solve our drivers’ issues.

The day-to-day activities:

  • Offer car rental options and solutions to the customers and provide a great customer experience
  • Manage inquiries related to Grab Rentals products and services and and proactively solve customers’ issues
  • Perform the related report and backend works related to operations
  • Work together with internal team and other teams in GrabRentals and other vertical to ensure smooth operations
  • Work with various stakeholders to manage enquiries requests and escalations
  • Handle daily arrears tracking and repossession of vehicle
  • In charge of ePR request for Operations team
  • Responsible for GrabRentals key inventory management
  • Process rental waivers reimbursements and credit notes for vehicle related matters
The Must-haves:

  • At least 1-years of operations and customer service experience
  • Fluent written and spoken English is required with local second language as an advantage
  • Self-motivated individual who is capable of getting things done within an allocated time frame.
  • One who is willing to be hands-on as needed and proactively assumes responsibilities for one’s actions.
  • Ability to work independently deal effectively with other related departments or as a team with minimal supervision
  • Able to initiate and maintain strong relationships with our hirers
  • Strong people skills with a customer-oriented service attitude
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office knowledge of Excel formula and functions and Google applications preferred
  • Competency in data analytics tools preferred
  • Candidates with no relevant experience but have an aptitude for operations are welcome to apply

Pomelo is a leading online fashion company in Emerging Asia.  Backed by fashion and technology investors from across the world Pomelo brings its unique fast fashion style to Emerging Asia through a technology-driven vertically-integrated design and production model.  Our growth strategy is to merge our online focus of mobile and social with the latest trends and data.

 

Job Description

We are looking for a SG & MY Operations Associate who wants to understand how an ecommerce fashion brand works and creates a digital experience for its customers. Are you the kind of person who enjoys working across the supply chain to deliver business results? Proficient in data analysis and Excel? Do you have a passion for operations management and 3PL management? We are looking for a talent to join our team.

 

You will be the key person executing the charge in day-to-day operations excellence in Singapore and Malaysia. At Pomelo each team member is expected to work autonomously often setting their own objectives and key results.

 

Responsibilities

  • Assist in executing fulfillment setups methods and processes.
  • Implement quality initiatives process change initiatives and other Lean initiatives to develop supply chain capabilities to enable the business in Singapore and Malaysia.
  • Be the main person to work closely with the warehouse(s) to monitor the end-to-end fulfilment performance drive and provide performance visibility to the team & use that to motivate reward or benchmark the team. 
  • Coordinate with 3PL to ensure timely fulfilment processing and delivery from the Singapore logistic hub.
  • Be the contact point for customer experience logistics retail operations and merchandising for any day-to-day operational enquiries and issues related to shipments and delivery.
  • Collaborate closely within Operations team work with other cross functional teams and partner with 3PL to optimize end-to-end processes for both online and retail stores.
  • Follow set frameworks & metrics to monitor supply chain performances for high level of service quality shortest lead-time and best customer experience.
  • Monitoring return statuses to ensure no long pending returns that are not coming back to the warehouse(s).
  • Administer and monitor 3PL claims in cases of damage or loss.

 

Qualifications:

  • Education background in Engineering Operations Management Business Management or related fields from an accredited university.
  • Comfortable with technology including software hardware and networks
  • Data driven with strong analytical skill. Previous work experience with large sets of data to guide business decision is desirable
  • Constant improver and new processes adapter.
  • Strong passion and aspiration to create seamless omni-channel shopping experience
  • Ability to work well in a dynamic fast-changing environment that requires a high degree of multi-tasking and follow-through with minimal supervision. 
  • Very comfortable working in a high growth company with an entrepreneurial leader under rapidly changing conditions.
  • Candidates must be flexible to work a variety of hours and at a variety of locations as business demands including weekends and holidays. Candidates should also be open to business travel.
  • Previous internship or startup experience is a plus.

Position Description

Service Market Logistics (SML) is a global organization within UD Trucks that provides end-to-end supply chain to service market business of all brands within UD Trucks. SML covers key processes from the inbound flow of spare parts from suppliers to warehousing parts and the distribution of parts to end customers through dealers. The organization is head quartered in Japan and globally active delivering world-class operational excellence for our customers based on smart logistics solutions we have. Our job is to develop manage and optimize the service market supply chain for all brands and stakeholders.

Our Organization gives you a good opportunity to understand how UD Trucks works from supplier to customer. We strive for an innovative and attractive workplace exercising the UD Trucks values with high focus on customer success. With us you can push your own professional skills and drive change together with committed people. We are in an exciting transformation phase – come learn and create a new future together with us!

THE POSITION – Operation Manager CDC Singapore Service Market Logistics UD Trucks

is a key Leadership position responsible for complete warehouse operation and service center such that there is continuous improvement in efficiency quality & customer success. This with strong focus on developing people processes tools working environment and an inclusive culture that can meet or exceed current and future customers demands and legislation within UD Trucks Standards and also Industry benchmarks.

The position is reporting to Director – Overseas Operations SML UD Trucks and is based in Singapore.

YOUR MISSION
  • Drive optimization in Warehouse Operations with end2end Supply Chain Value in line with UD Trucks Supply Value Chain
  • Drive optimization in the Service Center Function which involves working with a wide span of activities ranging from order-management customer satisfaction management handling of service deviations Outbound Transportation Performance and general administrative tasks.
  • To provide efficient Service Market Logistics Services to the distribution network and drive a culture of continuous improvement which requires learning and development in everything one does.
YOUR ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
  • Accountability and optimization of performance for all warehouse operational processes related to Distribution Center
  • Manage operational internal interfaces and external customer demands having efficient communication and relationships to ensure needs of our organization and customers are met.
  • Develop recommend and implement improvements in the internal materials handling and administrative processes to improve quality customer service lead-time productivity and cost efficiency.
  • Develop recommend and implement improvements in the service request handling and administrative processes to improve quality customer service lead-time productivity and cost efficiency.
  • Manage operational internal interfaces and external customer demands having efficient communication and relationships to ensure needs of our organization and customers are met.
  • Compliance to Internal/ External Audits without any non- conformance and ensuring adherence to systems and processes with respect to Audit Standards
  • Develop an engaged and inclusive organization through the insistence on and the application of the UD Trucks Values
  • Provide Leadership direction to operation team and support matters including being responsible for healthy safe working environment and cordial employee relations at the warehouse and continuously drive for better employee engagement
  • That location maintenance is completed on an ongoing basis ensuring spare parts are located in optimal positions for timely and effective binning and picking
  • Manage the investigations of dealer discrepancy claims and nil picks with actionable recommendations on findings securing a reduction in these occurrence’s
YOUR CRITICAL COMPETENCIES FOR THE POSITION

Dulwich College (Singapore) is seeking a dynamic and experienced Sports Administrator (Logistics & Operations) to join its PE Department. This is an exciting opportunity to work at one of the world's leading International Schools.


Dulwich College (Singapore) is committed to providing the most extensive sports programme possible for the students at the College. The Sports Administrator (Logistics & Operations) will assist in the running of sports at Dulwich College (Singapore) by organizing the competitive fixtures and contributing to the administration of the whole sports programme across the College.


The duties and responsibilities of the role are as follows:

  • Support the Sports & CCA Departments in the running of the CCA sports programme assessing the quality and delivery of the programme and reporting any concerns to the Director of Sport;
  • Coordinate the stocktaking and ordering of all sporting equipment developing and maintaining an inventory database to keep track of all items and to keep within the appropriate budgets;

  • Experience of working in a large & dynamic team;

As a SMB Operations Specialist you’ll resolve most complex issues for our SMB users and work cross-functionally to drive projects that optimize user experience and enable Stripe’s growth at scale.

Job Title: Community Operations Escalations Specialist| Risk & Response
Job Description:
Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world gives them ways to share what matters most to them and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating solving problems and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.
Facebook is seeking an Escalations Specialist to join the Risk and Response Community Escalations team. The Risk and Response team develops scaled solutions to user issues protects users by decreasing negative engagement on the site and delivers qualitative and quantitative insight into user behaviour. This individual will work to improve the overall user escalations experience for Facebook/Instagram community and will be responsible for working cross-functionally across different internal and external teams to help us intelligently scale our escalations function. He/she will be part of a team that will communicate clearly to various stakeholders and provide key updates and findings as high priority escalations unfold. We are seeking a team-oriented strategic thinker who can optimise processes go deep on investigations solve challenging problems and most importantly help prevent them in future. This position is full time and is based in our Singapore office.

  • Be an expert on enforcing Facebook/Instagram Community standards and policies including some basic compliance policies
  • Investigate reported escalations across multiple channels on Facebook/Instagram and respond to sensitive global partners inquiries
  • Address traumatic sensitive and potentially offensive content
  • Communicate results of technical analyses with non-technical partners
  • Gather analyze and utilize relevant data and escalation trends to develop improvements to the overall escalation processes and provide recommendations for process policy and product improvements
  • Be comfortable dealing with high pressure escalations grey areas and pulling in cross functional experts when appropriate to resolve issues swiftly while putting users first
  • The role will require tight coordination with global cross-functional teams including Public Policy Legal Community Operations and others to problem solve and develop solutions
  • Attention to details is a must — Remain up to date on key workflow changes operational guidelines policy updates and Community Standards
  • Deliver projects involving quantitative analysis industry research and strategy development
  • Utilize strategic tools systems and data to help the team analyze trends and deliver insights to define goals and improve processes
  • Please note that some weekend work will be required on a shift basis
  • Bachelors degree or equivalent experience
  • Experience in project management and operations
  • 2+ years Escalations experience or similar experience in a fast paced often high pressured environment
  • Passion for helping people and user focus
  • Broad understanding of Facebook Community Standards
  • Ability to multitask different priorities of work in a fast paced ever changing environment
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Demonstrated ability to use sound judgment work in a high-stress environment thrive in chaos and exhibit grace under pressure
  • Strong conflict management negotiation skills and a sense of urgency
  • Demonstrated experience influencing across functional boundaries globally
  • Fluency in written and conversational English (other languages are a plus)
  • Degree in International Relations Political Science Law or related field is a plus
  • Experience working with NGOs and / or government entities
  • Experience in investigations internet safety or equivalent environment
  • Ability to use and learn tools like SQL and Excel to drive analytics and reporting
  • Project management experience is highly desired

Raytheon Technologies (NYSE: RTX) is an aerospace and defense company that provides advanced systems and services for commercial military and government customers worldwide. Collins Aerospace a unit of United Technologies Corp. (NYSE: UTX) is a leader in technologically advanced and intelligent solutions for the global aerospace and defense industry. Created in 2018 by bringing together UTC Aerospace Systems and Rockwell Collins Collins Aerospace has the capabilities comprehensive portfolio and expertise to solve customers’ toughest challenges and to meet the demands of a rapidly evolving global market.

We are currently hiring a Head of Regional Operations Airport Systemsbased out of Singapore to join our Avionics division specifically our Information Management Services (IMS) Asia Pacific team. As a leading provider of self-serve solutions and with a reputation as a master communication network integrator we understand that the flow of an airport is the flow of an industry.

Join us as we REDEFINE AEROSPACE!

Job Summary

As the Head of Regional Operations for Asia Pacific this leadership position functions in a shared service environment and is responsible for overseeing business technical and maintenance service operations. This person will be responsible for managing teams tasked with delivery and support of all projects on time within budget and in a manner that enhances Collins’ technical leadership and reputation and encourages additional business from customers.

Job Responsibilities

Company Description

The IKEA vision is to create a better everyday life for the many people. We do this by offering a wide range of well-designed functional home furnishing products at prices so low that as many people as possible can afford them. We operate in Singapore Malaysia Thailand and Philippines – and have an ambitious expansion plan to bring a little bit of Sweden to new markets in the region. We are part of the Ikano Group of companies and the only IKEA franchisee owned by the Kamprad family that founded IKEA.

We also develop own and operate Shopping Centres that are anchored by IKEA and create walkable communities by including residential office and other types of real estate in our development plans.

We work towards making sustainability a natural part of our everyday work. We are active in our communities driving and supporting social initiatives that benefit children women and the environment.

Job Description

Reporting to the Store Manager you lead the Facilities and Safety & Security teams across the IKEA stores in Singapore to secure the right pre-conditions are in place to ensure efficient consistent and compliant daily operations. Leveraging on the expertise of the teams and tools you are a main contributor in enabling a seamless shopping experience for our customers and a safe working environment for our co-workers through operational excellence. With focus on our customers development of our people and sound business practices and a genuine interest in sustainability you optimize results in customer satisfaction contribute towards the stores’ revenue and profitability and keep our assets in shape as new.

Your assignment
  • Leadership. You lead and motivate the safety & security and facilities teams across the stores through recruitment and retention strategies and lead by example to create a culture that is inclusive and aims to motivate and develop the skills of all staff. Succession is key to ensure continuity and stability of the operations.

    You engage in high level discussions with Singapore country management to design the long term direction.
  • Safety and Security. Leading the Safety and Security teams to ensure that the rules regulation and guidelines from the IKEA Group Risk Manual and local legislations are implemented and monitored in order to ensure the safety of our co-workers and visitors that our stores are safeguarded.
  • Facilities Management. Leading the Facilities teams to secure store in shape as new. Maintain a short-mid-long term plan to organise preventive maintenance and repairs installations or improvements to ensure smooth running of the store’s operations to secure the ease of shopping and safety of our customers. Boost on-site operations by promoting best practices and creating better work processes and improve service reliability level.
  • Sustainability. Lead teams across the stores to manage the facility operations energy consumption waste management recycling rate and circularity ambitions from IKEA and maintenance of the facilities infrastructure and buildings with the aim of being operationally efficient and reducing our carbon footprint. Ensure technical teams are trained and competent for operations and maintenance of the building.
  • Budgeting and cost control. Working closely with the Singapore Business Navigator to oversee budget for operating cost and review CAPEX/ OPEX expenditures across the stores related to facilities management and safety and security
  • Performance Management. Review monthly performance metrices with the Facilities Manager and Safety & Security Manager and provide solutions to drive operational excellence. Implement and ensure systematic KPI requirements are measured reported analyzed and actioned appropriately. Challenge review and improve existing ways of working.
  • Checks & Audit. Partnering with the regional Compliance Manager perform internal checks and audits to ensure that we operate in accordance with internal steering documents regulatory and business requirements imposed by Inter-IKEA System. Conduct or coordinate relevant compliance monitoring activities (audits reviews continuous assessment) and establish new metrics trend reports etc.
  • Relationship Management. Maintain proactive liaison with all associated internal and external partners vendors and stakeholders. Work with Store Safety & Security Manager to establish and maintain contacts with governmental and non-governmental organisations within the scope of safety and security such as police authorities and fire inspectors.

Qualifications
  • Minimum 10 years of leadership experience in facilities maintenance and building management and safety and security and well-versed in all local laws and regulations and statutory compliance
  • Skilled in report writing and giving presentations Must be able to communicate clearly business and technical concepts and issues to fellow co-workers and senior management
  • Demonstrated ability to engage at different organization levels and collaborate with cross functional teams
  • Proficient in analytical and problem solving skills
  • Able to inspire and mentor teams of staff through promotion of IKEA Culture and Values
  • Goal-oriented individual with demonstrated expeience in health and safety requirements vendor management and property technical systems management

Additional Information

Please apply by 31 October 2020

Position – General Analyst Operations


Overview

We are Koru Partners a thematically driven alternative investment firm identifying attractive investment opportunities that are backed by macro-holistic themes encompassing forward-looking social economic demographic and technological changes. As a multi-asset investment manager we manage funds ranging from real asset funds in shipping to venture capital. In addition we also provide investment advice to established companies on their strategic opportunities.

We are looking for an Operations Analyst who is looking to grow with us. If you are a recent Singaporean graduate you will be enrolled into the Finance Associate Management Scheme. In this two-year structured programme you will rotate across the operational functions of a fund management firm including Accounts Human Resources Administration and Compliance.


Responsibilities

  • Accounts Management: Ensure that the accounting data accurately reflects the financial position and the performance of the firm in a timely manner.
  • Cash Flow Management: Maintain cash inflows and outflows to mitigate financial and operational risks.
  • Financial Modelling: Assist in forecasting the company financials and operational needs.
  • Effective Administrative Support: Liaise between internal and external parties in a professional manner while learning the context and building knowledge around the firm’s core activities.
  • Human Resource Management: Assist in managing the entire employee lifecycle from recruitment to retention.
  • Compliance Management: Assist in structuring and implementing frameworks that will ensure adherence to applicable laws and regulations in the relevant jurisdictions.
  • Continuous Improvement: Actively participate in the ongoing updates and enhancements of existing processes and internal controls.


Ideal Requirements

  • Less than 12 months graduate with a university degree or equivalent.
  • Basic knowledge in accounting is advantageous but not a prerequisite.
  • Independent learner requiring minimal supervision.
  • Intensely detail oriented.
  • Logical problem solver.
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite Xero (or any other accounting software) and quick to pick up new technologies and SaaS.
  • Singapore Citizen.


About You

Position Description The Operations Administrator is responsible for supporting the global fixed income investment process. This includes but is not limited to providing timely and accurate support to Traders Portfolio Managers Analysts and Client Services.

Trade Settlements 45%
Resolution of Settlement Problems – Work with brokers and custodians to ensure timely settlement of trades. Resolve any settlement problems and/or settlement failures in order to avoid monetary or trading sanctions.

Research – Coordinate and provide information regarding shares available for sale and outstanding trade issues.

Trade Matching – Monitor internal systems to ensure that block trades and allocations match properly and that trade settlement instructions are accurately communicated to brokers and custodian banks. Verify that affirmations/confirmations have been processed and delivered to brokers and custodian banks. Research and correct any mismatched trades by verifying internal trade data with our trading area and verifying data with brokers as necessary. Maintain files of matched trades as required by internal standards and regulatory requirements.

Trade Notification – Monitor internal systems to be sure SWIFT notifications are correctly sent to custodian banks. Ensure proper notification of all non-SWIFT trades through affirmations or faxes.

Portfolio Administration 45%
Collateral Management – monitor collateral management reports for calls to be made or pending calls by counterparties. Review and prepare wires for collateral receipts and payments as necessary. Reconcile outstanding positions requiring collateralization between internal systems and counterparts.

Portfolio Reconciliation – Complete reconciliation of portfolio holdings cash and transactions between internal systems and custodian banks.

Corporate Actions 10%
Monitor and respond to time-sensitive and valuable voluntary corporate action offers. Coordinate manager recommendations and instruct custodian banks.

Role Description

Homage is seeking an Operations Manager who enjoys working with the people at the heart of Homage: our Care Professionals. In the operations team we’re focused on building a community of dedicated caregivers nurses and doctors who are fully equipped to provide the best quality care to those who need it.

 

We have Manager roles available in both the Strategic Projects and Support teams.

 

=====

 

As a Strategic Projects Manager would be responsible for working across functions within operations to produce analysis execute projects and help devise the overall strategy for the Care Operations team in Singapore. You would need to identify pain points and key areas of improvement across Operations and work with the managers to devise solutions for these.

 

An ideal candidate is someone who is resourceful strategic and willing to be hands-on. We’re looking for someone who is:

  • Fiercely data-driven utilising qualitative and quantitative analysis of data and insights to drive decision making and operational improvements
  • Highly proficient in building spreadsheets and data visualisations; further technical knowledge is advantageous
  • Able to build dashboards and conduct analysis to dive deep into our data discover problems and solve for them
  • An innovative rain-maker and self-starter you have the ability to proactively identify improvement areas and work autonomously to create and drive innovative solutions
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication (written and verbal) skills

 

Requirements for Strategic Projects Manager:

  • At least 3 years of experience working with data and analytics preferably in a fast-paced and high-growth environment
  • Minimum Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field of study (Business Administration Economics Finance or relevant experience)

 

=====

 

As a Support Manager you would lead the team that is responsible for providing top-quality assistance to Care Professionals when they have a question or problem. This is mostly through email but also involves some telephone and in-person support too. You’d also be the first point of escalation for serious incidents and would need to work through them with the team towards a resolution.

 

An ideal candidate is someone who is confident empathetic and willing to be hands-on. We’re looking for someone who is:

  • excellent with people and able to provide high quality customer service while coaching others to do the same
  • calm under pressure and capable of solving disputes and incidents
  • a strong leader with good people management skills and experience
  • highly motivated and resourceful in solving problems
  • comfortable working with numbers and data and proactively uses them to report on performance and inform decision-making
  • excellent writing skills and is able to produce high-quality written content

 

Requirements for Support Manager:

  • At least 4 years of relevant experience with experience working in hospitality customer service or a similar environment preferred
  • Minimum 1 year of experience leading a team

 

=====

 

Every candidate should have a passion for social enterprises and causes. You’re driven by Homage’s core mission and motivated by the impact of our services and platform. In other words you are highly-motivated and want to create a huge impact in a fast-growing start-up.

 

About Homage

Homage is a care platform that combines qualified and trained caregivers nurses doctors and health care organisations and funders with technology enabling care wellness and recovery wherever you are. The work that we do and technology we build transforms lives every hour every day. We’re looking for people who are talented driven and motivated by our social mission.

At Deloitte we believe in the importance of empowering our people to be leaders at all levels. Skills And Experience

What we are offering

About us

We provide a suite of digital asset investment management solutions for institutional and high net worth investors in Asia. With offices in Singapore and Hong Kong Great South Gate brings over 80 years of institutional investment trading legal and operations experience from top global firms such as Goldman Sachs Morgan Stanley JPMorgan UBS BAML and Nomura.


Your role

As an Operations Analyst based in Singapore you will be a critical part of the team that rolls up its sleeves to build and run the platform. The role will require you to manage daily client and trade lifecycle processes in a fast-growing business and industry. You will support our COO and work closely with our client relations trading legal and compliance teams to ensure our platform runs smoothly in a robust well-controlled and regulatory compliant manner. You will also build relationships with external stakeholders including prime brokers counterparties banks and fund administrators.


What you will do

  • Support client lifecycle processes – new client onboarding KYC and ongoing client support.
  • Support trade operations activities (trade execution capture settlement collateral management and reporting).
  • Produce MIS reports detailing position risk P&L and any ad hoc requests.
  • Ensure daily day-end tasks and reports are completed.
  • Serve as a point of contact for daily operations matters.
  • Establish implement and maintain robust operations controls and regulatory compliant policies and procedures.
  • Develop or re-engineer operational processes to meet the changing needs of the business.
  • Build and maintain relationships with prime brokers counterparties banks fund administrators and service providers; liaise with them to resolve any issues.
  • Participate in UAT system testing of new platforms and technology.


What you will bring

  • At least 2 to 5 years of experience in middle office or operations at an asset manager hedge fund investment bank private bank or fund administrator.
  • Knowledge of FX equities credit listed derivatives and OTC markets is a plus.
  • Strong MS Excel skills; VBA and other programming skills are a plus.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills (English).
  • Bonus: a genuine interest in digital assets cryptocurrency blockchain and other distributed ledger-related technologies.


How you approach your work

  • Dedication Detail and Drive. Energetic resourceful and hands-on individual who can operate effectively with minimal direction and pursues goals with a sense of urgency. You are detail-oriented and readily cope with changing priorities take initiative and assume responsibility for following through.
  • Integrity and Ethics. You have a strong ingrained sense of professional integrity and ethics.
  • Entrepreneurial and Effective Team Member. Self-starter who enjoys solving complex problems while being part of a high-performance team in a fast-paced environment.
  • Agile Thinker. See the big picture and map out the details to achieve your goals. You are creative about providing innovative solutions (new processes technologies and approaches).
  • Open to Singaporean Citizens and PRs.

Do you enjoy working in a fast-paced environment? 


As we are rapidly expanding our business we are looking for an Operations Manager to take over the management of our operations team of 15-20 people (mostly aged 19-29).


We are looking for a bright capable hands-on individual who is a fast-learner to learn all the operations procedures and SOPs in a short period of time.


In this role you will be required to work on the ground on the same level as the coordinating team in the long-run.


Qualities we are looking for:

  • Understands the importance of sales and profits as the driver of the company
  • Strongly values efficiency and is an efficiency-driven person in general

  • Able to handle pressure and stress
  • Receptive to feedback and constructive criticism (low ego)

If you consider yourself meeting 80% of the above we woud love to interview you to find out if you're a good fit.


Job duties and responsibilites:

  • Resolving day-to-day problems on the ground that escalate to manager
  • Continuously conduct regular checks on the day-to-day operations to find mistakes loopholes and areas for improvement. This includes allocating time to do coordinating work yourself
  • Conduct regular appraisals with team members to obtain valuable feedback as well as make them feel motivated and encouraged through regular communication. This includes working closely with department team leaders to continuously improve the operation flow and processes
  • Review the roles within the team from time to time to maintain strong team dynamics. Also plan events initiatives and practices that empower team members and promote a stronger team culture

POSITION SUMMARY:
 
Provide the fastest on-time door-to-door service coordinating collections & deliveries processing shipments for exports and imports. Pro-actively clear shipments with Customs and other government agencies where possible. Liaise with airlines international agents and other overseas offices in our network ensuring our shipments are handled appropriately. Rectify operational issues minimising delays to agreed delivery times. Handle time critical shipments dangerous goods temperature sensitive products using special packaging (including refrigerants and temperature monitors).
 
DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Imports:-
- Monitor World Star screens applicable to inbound shipments (1 – 1 12 17 52 53 68) according to SOP 600 and operations email.

- Respond to “ok to send” requests from origin offices.
- Provide origin offices with sending instructions when necessary.
- Verify job details against the shipping document to ensure job details are correct e.g. Drive away service code flight details etc.

- Contact consignee to obtain relevant import licenses and confirm payment method for duty & taxes when required.

- Clear shipments with all applicable government agencies in a timely manner to ensure the fastest possible delivery time. 

- Ensure shipments are stored at the correct temperature condition on arrival until delivery.

- Follow special instructions for each shipment.
- Prepare delivery manifest for the Courier’s
- Send inbound advise and POD confirmation to key customers as required.
- Check and replenish refrigerants for shipments when necessary.
- Submit import permits using Tradenet for controlled articles & substances and or high value items when appropriate.

- Submit CMD within 7 days of the shipment being imported. 
 
      Exports:-
- Monitor World Star screens applicable to outbound shipments (1 – 1 12 17 51 53 62 68) according to SOP 600 and operations email.

- Arrange flight bookings

- Prepare packaging and or refrigerants for each shipment when necessary

- Mark and label shipments in accordance with local regulations and the IATA DGR.

- Follow destination office sending instructions.

- Enter all applicable extra charges for each job.

- Update and manifest jobs including attaching documents to Optiview.

- Submit FHL & FWB data through airline interface

- Obtain necessary endorsements / clearance with applicable government agencies when appropriate.

- Confirm uplift (postflight) for all outbound shipments including agent locations & airline transfers.

- Perform station transfer for shipments transiting Singapore.

- Check and replenish refrigerants when necessary for all outbound shipments including shipments transiting Singapore.

- Submit export permits using Tradenet for controlled articles & substances and or high value items when appropriate.

- Submit CMD within 7 days of the shipment being exported.

Job Title: Assistant Vice President| Business Operations| Program & Projects
Job Description:
Summary


The role will be responsible for driving and maintaining new revenue generation and meeting company revenue targets. You will lead and build a high performance team and ensuring the team meet the required KPIs by maintaining a strong and robust project and program plan for the Sales Team


Responsibilities

  • Develop project & program work plan and ensure compliance with relevant stakeholdersOversee the implementation of new projects and program management to drive growth revenue retention and maintain a strong business relationship with internal and external stakeholders
  • Accountable from meeting maintaining and improving the performance of the agreed customers’ KPI & SLA
  • Recruit lead and build a high performance Project and Program team with ongoing performance reviews.
  • Together with the team build and maintain a channel of high quality customer relationships and partnership
  • Develop scalable sustainable solutions to increase share of wallets
  • Work and collaborate across business units and products to align create innovative ideas solutions and programs by leveraging on our full suite of services and network.
  • Provide accurate and timely performance information revenue forecasts reports and analysis and ensure clear communication to Management leadership and stakeholders
  • Build a high performance accountable result-driven culture with a focus on customer execution and continuous growth and improvement process.


Requirements

  • Bachelor Degree
  • At least 5 years of Sales Management Logistics and eCommerce experience
  • Proven track record of successful project and program management
  • Strong logistics and transportation background
  • Excellent organisation communication and team management skills
  • Have a strong sense of urgency and accountability
  • Strong relationship building interpersonal communication and influencing skills
  • Driven and ability to work under pressure
  • A self-motivated driven individual

About The Team

Since 2015 Revolut has introduced over 12 million customers to a new way to handle their money. From instant spending notifications and built-in budgeting controls to global currency exchange and stock trading customers simply get more with Revolut.

We approach Operations at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else. We take complex issues and create extraordinary solutions that our customers love. From on-boarding flows to new feature presentations our goal is to both inform and delight.

To put simply we build things we want to use ourselves that we’re proud to show to our friends and families.

The Leadership Team provides Revolut with the vision the drive and the direction to continue its rapid growth and development into a major international finance business.

From risk to finance to people the leadership team sets the tone and agenda for all areas of the business and is comprised of some of the brightest and most successful people in the business.

About The Role

Revolut Singapore is looking for an ambitious and self-driven Head of Operations to make the company’s operational footprint highly robust scalable and cost efficient as the company continues to rapidly grow its customer base. This role will be a key part of the Leadership Team at Revolut Singapore reporting directly to the Singapore CEO.

You'll be responsible for:

  • Build and optimize scalable processes to prepare Revolut’s Singapore Operations for hyper growth
  • Lead and execute (end-to-end) roadmap projects
  • Strategy: explore and define which projects the team should prioritize and set a timeline to reach goals quickly
  • Product improvement: proactively search for new features to provide a seamless customer experience
  • Manage critical vendor relationships and build performance tracking systems
  • Develop strategic supply chain partnerships and negotiate commercial terms
  • Responsible for the oversight of outsourced activities to Revolut affiliates oversight of any sub-outsourcing and other third party service providers ensuring duties are administered in accordance with the respective regulatory requirements and internal policies processes and procedures and agreed Service Level Agreements

What You Need To Achieve

  • Work with the SG CEO and the Executive Team to scale up SG operations for future expansion while optimizing the current operational processes
  • Build and maintain a team of A-players who have the right attitude are proactive self-sufficient intellectually strong hungry humble and who have the potential to be promoted rapidly
  • Ensure strong a) operational service delivery and b) technology service delivery for customers in line with entity's KPIs & KRIs
  • Ensure appropriate contracts including SLAs & pricing framework are in place to manage ongoing changes / new demand to match business requirements
  • Ensure appropriate governance controls and assurance are in place to monitor service delivery and relevant risks and to comply with relevant regulatory guidance and to resolve issues where they arise
  • Ensure the right vendors are in place for the territory and the vendor relationships are well governed and strong
  • Develop strong relationship with Group teams with regard to all outsourced in-house operational and technology activities
  • Develop and maintain appropriate external relationships with vendors regulators and other stakeholders
  • Ensure positive contribution to and outcomes from the local Exco.
  • Ensure the local Exco is positioned as the cultural role model for the company in all aspects of the company’s business.

What Skills You'll Need

  • Proven competency in executive position with a focus in operations at a successful high-growth fintech financial services or financial services consulting company
  • Demonstrated capacity to drive strategy with data-driven decisions
  • Deep understanding of high growth consumer products and customer needs in financial services cards or payments
  • Strong empathy for business customers and an unwillingness to compromise on user-centered design of processes
  • You have +10 years of experience in a similar position and have led a team for a high growth company before or a track record of rapid promotion towards a similar role
  • You have a solid track record of achievement
  • You can break complex problems into smaller ones and enjoy working with data to facilitate your work
  • You take ownership and get things done
  • You love solving problems
  • You are curious by nature and interested in making an impact
  • You can make a good business case and convince people to help you execute
  • Are (or rapidly become) highly conversant with Confluence and Jira

A Little About Us

When Revolut was founded in 2015 we had a vision to build a sustainable digital alternative to traditional big banks. Our mission now is to help our customers improve their financial health empower them to have more control and promote financial cohesion across the communities in which we operate. Launching into 2020 with 12 million Personal customers and over a quarter of a million Business customers only reinforced our belief in the vast need across the world for better financial services. As our customer base has boomed in the last year we’ve expanded our team to match that growth. We started 2019 with several hundred employees; we closed it out with 2000.

What We're Looking For

Revolut is being scaled up by people all around the world who share our vision. We’re looking for people who align with our five core values: we build a Dream Team we Never Settle we Get It Done because we Think Deeper and we Deliver WOW. You’re the kind of person who wants to join a community of forward-thinking people all personally and professionally invested in Revolut’s mission. You thrive in a collaborative space where everyone’s learning from each other and learning fast. We believe in empowering our Revoluters in their work giving them autonomy and ownership of what they do. We want everyone at Revolut to own their story and their successes - working with us means you’re not just another cog in the machine.

The Benefits

  • Competitive salary
  • Biannual equity bonuses
  • All the latest tech you need
  • Free Revolut Metal Subscription

The role will be part of the SEAK Business Operations Team focusing on supporting SEAK Sales Team (South East Asia + Korea) in developing and executing sustainable business strategies driving team productivity improvement and managing the sales operations support. The person will be a key business partner to the business leaders Sales organizations ensuring the continued success of the business units. The core responsibility of the individual will be to provide actionable business insights to support the decision making of the businesses. For this it is necessary to have an in-depth understanding of the Go-to-Market models as well as underlying market trends. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in both business analytics and operations. Ability to collaborate effectively across key stakeholders and influence/develop mutually beneficial peer relationships within VMware is also vital.

Key Responsibilities
  • Develop and execute sustainable Sales strategies which drive incremental bookings and accelerate growth.
  • Good knowledge on the Partner Operations / Channels Model / OEM.
  • This role will also cover Global Accounts / Telco & FSI Sector within SEAK.
  • Provide sales operations support to the SEAK organization including defining compensation plans deploying targets and quotas managing forecast cadence process and driving effective pipeline management to ensure business predictability.
  • Drive proactive analysis and produce actionable business insights to facilitate effective decision-making and ensure the continued success of the business.
  • Be a trusted business partner and represent (or be a proxy for) Sales Leaders on various task forces projects and meetings as required.
  • Own the process and overall quality of the final presentation deliverables for key business reviews e.g. weekly/monthly field sales calls quarterly business reviews sales planning meetings APJ / SEAK meetings etc.
  • Manage/present business performance/KPI results in periodic business review meetings to key internal stakeholders and drive implementation of best practices across APJ.
  • Develop and Track Sales strategic plans build automation of reports to keep effectiveness in operations workflow.
  • Provide compliance check and enforce cleanliness in business pipeline in Sales Force.
  • Execute continuous productivity and process improvement initiatives through effective change management and project management methodologies.
  • Lead adhoc / special projects that are aligned with core goals and strategies and have far-reaching impacts on the business.

Key Requirements

Verily an Alphabet company lives at the intersection of technology data science and healthcare. Our mission is to make the world’s health data useful so that people enjoy longer and healthier lives.

Our team combines expertise in healthcare data science and technology to improve the health and well-being of our communities. We are developing the infrastructure and solutions to harness the profusion of health information for good. Our data-driven solutions span three primary areas: research care and innovation. Programs include Project Baseline - our research initiative to increase participation and evidence generation in clinical research; Onduo - our personalized virtual care platform which includes connected tools lifestyle coaching and clinical support; and Debug - our effort to reduce the threat of mosquito-borne diseases by combining machine learning with sterile insect technique. About BI WORLDWIDE


At BI WORLDWIDE our mission is to turn inspiration into real results for our clients. We understand how to inspire employees run custom sales incentives build channel loyalty & engage customers better than anyone else. It all started with founder Guy Schoenecker discovering innovative ways to provide consumer loyalty programs and incentives to various industries. That idea caught on big time. It grew into what is now a multinational company serving Global 2000 corporations in over 140 countries in more than 20 languages.


We design and deliver customizable employee sales and channel solutions that are heavily grounded in the science of behavioural economics. We bring global reach and resources to our clients with offices in US Canada Latin America Australia China India UK and Singapore. Visit http://www.biworldwide.com


The Role

An integral part of BI WORLDWIDE’s client servicing team the Project Operation Manager will lead all operational & functional aspects of Employee and Channel loyalty programs including but not limited to working closely with offshore technical teams to launch new programs lead successful initiation & closure of change requests reports preparation & maintaining project documentation.

New Campaigns & Programs

  • Ensure all launches are successfully completed on plan


Data Management and Reporting
