  • Extract program data and prepare reporting dashboard in Excel and available reporting tools for clients


Communications

  • Coordination of communication design with creative teams
  • Coordination of content writing & sign off with internal & external stakeholders


Requirements

  • Organized & high attention to detail
  • Excellent in excel and SQL queries

  • Willing to take on tasks identified as necessary to the success and growth of the business
  • At least 4-5 years of project operations management experience
  • Experience with Photoshop and HTML/CSS is preferred but not a requirement

TransferWise's employees are currently all working remotely due to the global Covid-19 pandemic. As a result our new joiners will onboard and start working for us from the safety of their own home too.

We’re looking for a new Payment Operations Team Lead to join our team in Singapore. This role is a unique opportunity to join one of the hottest FinTech start-ups and lead our cross-border Operations team to help millions more potential customers save money by using TransferWise.

You’ll receive a competitive package including salary and stock options in a fast growing company and a wide array of benefits.

Your Mission
  • Develop a strong Payment Operations team and support specialists on their personal growth paths.
  • Help the team develop and measure KPIs for success.
  • Managing your team’s resources and their relevant skills ensuring at all times a high-quality high-speed workflow with optimal coverage.
  • Increase the efficiency of the operations team while balancing the health and productivity of your specialists.
  • Drive operational excellence while building sufficient controls and assessing and mitigating operational risks.
  • Ensure the team’s readiness to handle unexpected situations.


This Role Will Give You The Opportunity To
  • Make an Impact - You’ll help drive the definition of our goals and vision while increasing the efficiency of the operations team and dreaming big driving us towards Mission Zero!
  • Inspire Teams - You’ll fuel the revolution with your ideas knowledge self-starter attitude and customer insight which you’ll use to work with product development engineers and other operational teams to help solve our customer’s problems!
  • Develop Wisers - You’ll scale culture and help to create a positive and motivating work environment for our Wisers. You’ll ensure the health and productivity of the specialists within your teams by helping to set the right culture and implement the right approaches. We don’t believe in drama only good Karma!
  • Work Globally - You’ll work closely with internal and external partners and help to figure out ways how to make our customers’ lives better. You’ll also occasionally travel to work and learn with our teams in other locations! We’re 1800+ Wisers with 70+ nationalities located in offices from Tallinn to Tokyo and much like our product we operate without borders communicating across teams and locations. We get it done!


A Bit About You
  • You have experience in leading coaching and mentoring driven high performing teams.
  • You have a proven track record of moving metrics and reaching your KPI goals.
  • You drive to make things happen instead of wondering why things happened.
  • You have at least a Bachelor's degree.
  • You place customers first and you make no compromise on this.
  • You’re a great communicator straight up and honest. You can adapt your communication style to different audiences. You’re able to persuade others and you aren’t afraid to challenge something when you need to.
  • You are data-driven able to prioritise the value-add to customers measure the impact and how the teams perform.
  • You’re comfortable working within teams that face big challenges and taking responsibility in difficult situations.
  • You enjoy creating an inspiring team environment where ideas are shared and openness is valued. You’re comfortable and composed when either giving or receiving feedback.
  • You have passion for technology customer experience and you want your work to have a positive impact on people.
  • You’re a great relationship builder experienced at working closely with external partners as well as product development teams including product managers and engineers.
  • Your intellectual curiosity has no limit and this is your guiding light. You have the self-awareness to understand when you don’t know something and the humility to learn while leading.
  • You are Singaporean or Permanent Resident (please note we cannot sponsor visas for this role)


Some Extra Skills That Would Be Awesome
  • Strong presentation skills
  • Experience leading teams distributed across different locations and time zones
  • Passion for international finance foreign exchange and payment systems


Some Of Your Benefits
  • Company stock options;
  • Paid sabbatical after 4 years;
  • Paid sick leave.

A Bit About TransferWise

Since 2011 we’ve had a clear mission: money without borders. Built by and for people who live global lives we’re the fairest easiest way to manage your money across borders.

We’re just at the beginning of our story and we’re growing at an incredible pace. We won’t stop until anyone anywhere can send spend and receive money wherever they are whatever they’re doing. There’s still heaps to do and we can’t do it alone.

Our People

At TransferWise you’ll be joining a movement of people who believe in a better fairer more transparent way of moving money around the world. You’ll collaborate to do your best work and take on problems that no one has looked at before.

If you’re keen to learn grow try new things and aren’t afraid of a bold plan you’ll fit right in.

How We Work

At TransferWise our strategy emerges from the collective brainpower of all our people who are organised in dozens of independent autonomous teams. Teams stay closest to our customers so they choose what problems to solve and where to spend the most time.

You’ll experience radical levels of ownership and empowerment within your role. Plus the opportunity to see the direct impact of your work on our customers.

Job Title: SGUnited Sephora Singapore - Retail Operations Executive
Job Description:
Description

This position reports to the Head of Retail & Operations. This will be part of the Sephora Management Associate program where s/he will be exposure to the 360⁰ retail eco-system where s/he will be exposed to functions not limiting to: Visual Merchandising Merchandising Marketing Ecommerce Supply Chain and Retail Operations.


Through this Traineeship s/he is expected to continue with Sephora for another 9 months under the Sephora Management Associate (MA) programme and from which will graduate to become our new generation Store Leader who defines the new Omni-Customer experience and store operations landscape.


Key Responsibilities

  • Visual merchandising – support in the animation & planogram process for stores;
  • Track & analyse products sell-thru data points to convert findings on consumer patterns;
  • Brand launches not limiting to merchandising and marketing campaign launches;
  • Manage the inventory of saleable goods in stores to maintain on-shelf availability at optimal levels;
  • Spearhead project including end-to-end development and execution collaborating with stakeholders across functions to implement an innovative solution for stores.


We’re excited about you if you have:

  • Project management and planning skills with the ability to conceive and drive execution in a fast-paced entrepreneurial environment.
  • Excellent communication skills and the ability to work effectively with different stakeholders
  • Innovative and creative – continually looking to demonstrate and drive process improvement


Personal Attributes:

  • Open-minded and experimental
  • Hands-on & enthusiastic
  • Hungry to learn with a passion for self-development
  • Adept at problem solving
  • Team player who enjoys working with others
  • Good sense of humor



Projected Traineeship start date: Week 3 of October 2020


Interested Candidates kindly apply via this MyCareerFutures link:

https://www.mycareersfuture.gov.sg/job/others/sephora-singapore-sgunited-%E2%80%93-retail-operations-executive-sephora-singapore-1dab6d4e10d40a8f52ea5c2ae1cc9cc8

Gigacover is a fast-growing tech company that brings essential benefits to the future of work. We work with insurers banks and healthcare organisations to bring flexible and affordable products and services to safeguard the financial stability of our customers. Come and join us as we rethink and reinvent financial services using data science to serve a whole generation of underserved consumers across Southeast Asia!


We are looking for a Country Manager who will run our Singapore business. You will have a high degree of autonomy and impact and will report directly to the founders of Gigacover.


Roles and Responsibilities

  • Lead the Singapore office by inspiring motivating and empowering each team member towards Gigacover’s mission and vision
  • Work with founders to develop strategy and business plans including financial projections for the Singapore business 
  • Oversee day-to-day operations of delivering insurance healthcare access and financial services to our users including onboarding administration claims billing and collection
  • Maintain and develop business relationships with our platform partners insurers healthcare service partners and finance companies
  • Develop business opportunities in new channels
  • Work with account managers and marketers to drive user acquisition as well as product utilisation and revenue growth 
  • Work with Group HR to plan and recruit a sufficient flow of talent to meet business needs
  • Be accountable for the overall performance of the Singapore business


Requirements

  • > 8 years of professional experience and have proven ability in operating and running local cross-functional teams
  • Experience operating as or effectively-as a general manager or country manager or country launcher would be ideal
  • Experience working in a startup entrepreneurial environment and comfortable with uncertainty and fluidity
  • Experience in managing deep relationships with key clients and suppliers 
  • Domain expertise and knowledge in fintech lending payments or financial services is strongly preferred
  • Ideally understands local culture and the local landscape of insurance healthcare and financial services.
  • Strong analytical and communication skills
  • Possess grit and tenacity to solve problems and deliver mission success
  • Mission-driven with a passion for the Gigacover mission people and social impact

• Responsible for assembly automation components.
  • Handle machine daily maintenance.
  • Other general work assigned by superior
  • Positive working attitude work independently willing to learn and work overtime hardworking
  • Working Location: UBI / AMK/ TAMPINES/ HOUGANG (Mostly these area) or other places like WOODLANDS (Depends on project location)

Description

Sephora Digital is seeking a regional Onsite Operations Executive to power our e-commerce channels with the best-in-class shopping experience and campaigns. The role represents an excellent entry point to a career in digital marketing onsite merchandising analytics and e-commerce operations.

You are extremely organised passionate about getting the details right love beauty and have a track record of excelling in a fast-paced environment. You are also excited about the possibilities presented by omni-channel retail and will be challenged to think out of the box to further enhance our e-commerce experience and improve our operational efficiency.

Responsibilities
  • Site and App Management
  • Manage updates on home campaign and brand pages
  • Manage site-wide product boosting
  • Identify technical bugs and file tickets for timely resolution
  • Tool management
  • Select and moderate user generated photos for onsite feature
  • Ensure a constant stream of new content that’s aligned with guidelines and strategy
  • Analyse performance and improvement suggestions

Prerequisites
  • Fluent spoken and written English
  • Comfortable with Microsoft Office especially Excel and Powerpoint
  • 1 to 2 years working experience preferred (Fresh graduates are welcome too!)
  • Great communicator and team player
  • Well organised and has high attention to detail
  • Eager to learn and results-driven
  • Adaptable and thrives in a fast paced environment

Lloyd’s is transforming and needs curious minds to help define and influence that change. We're looking for people with new perspectives and the confidence to share them so come and join us.

Lloyd’s is the world’s leading insurance and reinsurance marketplace. Yet the world is changing and Lloyd’s is changing too – nimbler faster and able to offer customers and employees more products services and insights supported by technology innovation and the continuing desire to protect people businesses and communities. Lloyd’s is where you can bring your future to life

As a Corporation we run and oversee projects and services that facilitate the marketplace generate good outcomes for customers and meet regulatory requirements. We also deliver and oversee change across the Corporation and the Market in support of our value proposition strategy and objectives.

We have defined our value proposition so stakeholders can see how the Lloyd’s market creates value.

Choice - The world’s largest insurance marketplace and global distribution network competing and collaborating to share risks no matter what the size location industry or complexity

Confidence - We take pride in doing what’s right paying all valid claims. For over three centuries the security of Lloyd’s has protected what matters most to people businesses and communities and helped them recover in times of need

Partnerships - The trusted relationships which underpin our marketplace are one of our greatest strengths. Our community of experts bring a collaborative culture of mutual respect to best serve our customers enabling us to share risk

Expertise - With an unrivalled depth and breadth of insurance expertise new ground is familiar territory to Lloyd’s. We bring together the best minds in the industry and together our underwriters and brokers create innovative responsive solutions

Insight - Lloyd’s has always been an intelligence network and continues to lead the industry. Our insight experience judgement and advice inform decision-making and ensure our customers stay resilient and ahead

Ecosystem - As a marketplace Lloyd’s provides access to economies of scale through consistent standards and shared business services. Our competitive environment and capital efficiencies improve performance and unlock new opportunities.

Reporting into the Head of Operations Lloyd’s Asia Pacific you will be responsible for managing operations of the Lloyd’s Asia platform and support delivery of Lloyd’s global strategy and vision for Asia.

What does the role involve?

As a member of the Global Operations team you will support the Lloyd’s Asia Country Manager on projects across the Corporation and in the market and manage the provision and oversight of Lloyd’s International Shared Services.

You will be responsible for the analysis and reporting of management information as well as managing day-to-day office operations (including IT facilities procurement business continuity planning operational risk monitoring and vendor management) and identify opportunities to improve effectiveness increase efficiency and reduce cost for Lloyd’s Asia platform.

What You Will Need

As someone with experience within the insurance industry and knowledge of the general insurance market you must have experience in managing a shared services function or a business process outsourcing.

You should be adept at working with senior stakeholders both internally and externally with a proven ability to collaborate build consensus and influence effectively.

You will need to be self-motivated with solid project management capability that delivers and implements change while remaining customer focused.

You must have the right to live and work in Singapore.

If you have a query or like to learn more about this opportunity please contact us.

If you are interested please visit www.lloyds.com to apply.

Applications will close 26th October 2020.

Job Title: Regional Operations Manager - Uber Eats| APAC
Job Description:
At Uber we ignite opportunity by setting the world in motion. We take on big problems to help drivers riders delivery partners and eaters get moving in more than 10000 cities around the world.

We welcome people from all backgrounds who seek the opportunity to help build a future where everyone and everything can move independently. If you have the curiosity passion and collaborative spirit work with us and let’s move the world forward together.

Whether it’s a sandwich a burrito or groceries the Uber Eats team builds technology to connect people with what they want when and where they want it. Our Regional Operations team empowers our regional and local teams through insights analysis and thought leadership.

About The Role

On the Uber Eats Regional Operations team we’re helping to scale our most impactful processes and initiatives support markets and drive innovation in the business.

As a subject matter expert of Eater pricing and marketplace products you are tasked with leading all aspects of product rollouts at the local and regional level digging deep into the data to surface key findings that will help us improve or innovate new processes to improve the Uber Eats experience for millions of our customers and Restaurant Partners in APAC. You should be comfortable in an "all hands on deck" environment love solving problems thrive in startup culture as well as working for a global company.

What You'll Need
  • Robust work experience in business management with focus in operations product strategy technology business development or a similar area (5+ years preferred).
  • A builder’s mentality - comfortable developing something scalable where nothing existed before.
  • Data-driven decision-making mentality and sound business acumen through analytical thinking to assess product performance and market strategy fit.
  • Comfortable with quantitative data analysis deep actionable insights modeling and advanced test plan design and analysis. Excel modelling skills necessary and SQL knowledge preferred.
  • Ability to take initiative in a constantly-changing work environment while maintaining flexibility and a collaborative attitude
  • Problem Solving - Being able to seek issues that involve people things and processes by using logic common sense and data. Identifying the root cause of a problem as opposed to focusing on the symptoms
  • Experience in leading multi-layer large-scale product or project launches
  • Balance attention to detail with swift execution - we need to do things quickly and we need to do them well. Balancing those can be challenging and this should be a strength

Be proficient and omniscient of all operational and cross-functional procedures policies reports so as to be able to manage and implement improvement changes effectively. To manage operational related projects successfully ensuring continuous changes to business process improvement for efficiencies increase productivities and introducing latest technology and applications. Strong in communication to the company working closely with all functions including forging a strong working relation with the IT department and supporting the Director of Operations to meet and exceed business needs and expectation.

Reports to: Director of Operations

Location: Singapore

Key Tasks And Activities
  • Improve operational systems process / procedures and policies in support of organizations mission -- specifically support better management reporting information flow and management (EDI transmission & data integrity) business process and procedures.
  • Manage and increase the effectiveness and efficiency of SAP through defects/enhancements on each function as well as preparing and coordination of all BRS UAT & communication between Operations BPA’s ITs and other business functions.
  • Project management of specific operational related (directly or indirectly) business process and/or system process for changes and improvements including all projects enhancements and fixing defects.
  • Provide consulting trainings and supporting services on matters related to business processes.
  • Provide cross functional support on business processes.
  • Serve as primary liaison to backend team in addressing issues with Regional Operations team.
  • Assist to prepare implement and manage Operations budget.
  • Contribute to short and long-term organizational planning and strategy as a member of the team.
  • Drive initiatives in the team and organizationally that contribute to long-term operational excellence.
  • Support all operational task and projects as required by the Director of Operations and business.


Areas Covered: Global

Key Relationships: Operations Product Sales & Marketing Finance Customer Service and Management Team.

Qualifications Required
  • Bachelor’s degree
  • 5 years of related work experience


Key Skills/ Knowledge Required
  • IT literate
  • Project Management skills and experienced
  • Good general management skills
  • Good communication skills (verbal & written)
  • Good interpersonal skills
  • Good people manager open to direction and collaborative work style and commitment to get the job done
  • Ability to challenge and debate issues of importance to the organization
  • Ability to look at situations from several points of view
  • Persuasive with details and facts
  • User experience in SAP is highly desirable
  • Ability to work independently with minimal supervision
  • Open to direction collaborative work style and is committed to complete task
  • High comfort level working in a diverse fast paced environment

Operations Specialist
  • Asia's leading investment management firm
  • Full Exposure in the Asian and Global markets
    • About Our Client
    My client is an award-winning Asia's leading alternative investment management firm managing strategies across various markets globally. They currently hold over 10 funds across the full spread of investment strategies of which some were ranked amongst the top funds globally in the last few years.

    Job Description
    • Timely booking of trades executed by Portfolio Managers and Traders across asset classes such Fixed Income Equities and FX.
    • Handle trade lifecycle events including but not limited to confirmations settlements corporate actions/maturities/expiries/fixings of the portfolio positions.
    • Perform reconciliations of trade and positions between internal systems broker statements and fund administrator system.
    • Generate reporting to internal stakeholders such as Front Office and Management.
    • Timely response and resolution to queries from internal and external stakeholders.
    • London shift coverage on rotational basis and back up coverage for NY shift.
    The Successful Applicant
      • Good knowledge in Fixed Income Equities or OTC derivatives financial products
      • At least 5 years' of direct operations experience in end-to-end trade lifecycle management in the financial services industry preferably in a large bank hedge fund or fund admin
      • Meticulous and detail-oriented with good problem-solving skills
      • Team player with ability to work independently
      • Able to work under tight timeline and pressure in a fast-paced environment and able to adjust the priority of the assignments on short notice
      • Good verbal and written communication skills in English is a must
    • Strong technical skills such as MS excel skills in VBA is a plus

    What's On Offer

    This is a permanent position offers an attractive package that also provides additional allowances for the incumbent when they are supporting on the various shifts within the team.
    Contact: Michael Seow (Lic No:R1653157)
    Quote job ref: 4144291
    Brand: PP

Bakuun.com is seeking an enthusiastic self-starter to manage and lead our Operations and CRM activities a role that is critical to our company’s success; implementing best practice across the organisation improving productivity and managing our Customer Relationship Management platform.

We’re looking for an experienced individual who will be able to ensure that our business is well-coordinated and productive by managing its procedures and processes.

The area of responsibility is very wide and thus requires strong planning analytical and communication skills to facilitate accelerating development and long-term success.
  • Ensure all operations are carried out in an appropriate cost-effective way.
  • Improve operational management system processes and best practices.
  • Perform quality controls monitor production KPI and increase customer satisfaction.
  • Identify client needs and suggest appropriate products/services.
  • Planning and delivering CRM strategies across the company encouraging customer retention and customer loyalty.
  • Deciding on the CRM platform structure and architecture to ensure it works seamlessly across the organisation and captures all required information at key points in the customer life cycle.
  • Customer Journey Mapping analysing touch points with the organisation and maximising commercial opportunities.
  • Monitor and maximise customer lifetime value strategies ensuring maximum profitability.
  • Developing testing strategies for all aspects of the CRM to ensure the most effective approach for the company and its products.
  • Customize product solutions to increase adoption and engagement.


Requirements
  • Proven work experience as an operations managing or similar role.
  • High Knowledge of HubSpot
  • High Organizational Skills the ability to think on your feet and work without supervision
  • Knowledge of organizational effectiveness and operations management
  • Problem Solving Attitude with Resilience to Overcome challenges.
  • Working closely with all departments to ensure the CRM works effectively for all aspects of the company.
  • ‘Can do’ attitude with Strong Communication Skills who can build long-term trusting relationships with clients.

Secretlab is an international gaming chair brand seating over 500000 users worldwide with our key markets in the United States Europe and Singapore where we are headquartered. 


You will be a valued leader to our Customer Support team trusted to deliver our brand’s commitment to an unparalleled customer experience. You should bring a natural inclination for customer-centric thinking & brand reputation complemented with an astute business mind. To be successful in this role you should have successfully scaled and worked with a dynamic and forward thinking CS team (internal and outsourced) in a rapid-growth environment. 


Our Customer Service team is involved with all Secretlab initiatives including collaborative efforts with world-renowned brands such as Game of Thrones Batman Cloud9 Team Secret as well as international esports organisers such as Riot Games for their League of Legends global tournaments.



Your key responsibilities (but not limited to):

Customer Experience 

  • Collaborate with key business leaders to define and reach Secretlab’s vision of an unparalleled customer experience for our global customers
  • Be chiefly responsible for the Secretlab customer experience across various touch points (acquisition stages through post-sales enquiries)
  • Work cross functionally with internal (Finance Marketing Operations) & external teams (3PL/ CS Vendors etc.) to influence and drive CX improvements
  • Establish and develop strategies to tackle complicated escalations 
  • Identify and communicate key insights (e.g. customer sentiments newly arising circumstances) to the Executive team and relevant departments


CS Strategy

  • Strategize and scale the CS team to meet growing business requirements and unique surges in demand
  • Ensure that all CS-related SOPs technical information directives are consolidated and consistently updated
  • Lead continuous improvement & change projects to optimize efficiency and cost effectiveness


Leadership Engagement Management

  • Implement CS controls and QA initiatives to ensure comprehensive and objective assessments of agents
  • Define key performance metrics/ targets (CSAT Response Time Resolution Time) for the CS department 
  • Collaborate with the CS Manager & Assistant Managers to identify skill gaps and develop the CS team’s competencies 
  • Oversee perpetual coaching and development of existing and new agents
  • Collaborate with the CS Manager & Assistant Managers to manage daily operations including rostering engagement hiring coaching and development. 
  • Regular reporting to the Executive team on the progress and performance of the CS team. 


Requirements:

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Business Mass Communications Marketing or any relevant course of studies
  • At least 8 years’ experience in Customer Service having led the function for a minimum of 2-3 years. 
  • You should have successfully scaled and led a high functioning CS team for a dynamic start-up
  • Experience working with global customer bases (varying languages) in an ecommerce/ direct-to-consumer environment highly preferred
  • Strong understanding of consumer psychology with a natural inclination for customer-centric thinking 
  • You should bring a wealth of knowledge & experience pertaining to all things Customer Service including (but not limited to):
  • CS Softwares & Tools
  • Vendor Management (BPO)
  • Performance Management 
  • Industry Best Practices & SOPs
  • Building & Structuring Teams
  • Astute business mind with strong operational decision-making skills
  • Excellent people skills with the ability to lead motivate and manage teams effectively
  • Adept communicator with a strong command of English 


Bonuses:

  • Passion for and knowledge of the gaming/ esports industry
  • Availability to work with the night shift team on an ad-hoc basis when necessary

About: 

TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok is based in Los Angeles with global offices in New York London Dublin Paris Berlin Dubai Mumbai Singapore Jakarta Seoul and Tokyo. In early 2018 TikTok was one of the most downloaded apps in the world. TikTok is available worldwide for iOS and Android. The Trust & Safety Operations team at TikTok help ensure that our global community is safe and empowered to create and enjoy content across all of our apps while protecting our brand.


As the Trust & Safety Operations Program Manager you will be part of the Strategy & Business Operations Function of the Global Trust & Safety Operations function. This highly visible and influential role will collaborate extensively with leadership business stakeholders internal operations and several cross-functional teams (Finance HR IT etc.). You will demonstrate strong executive presence in representing the organization and effortlessly navigate from strategic to tactical issues. You will be a strong advocate and work relentlessly to ensure the cultural principles of the organization are practiced – a passionate role model that cares about people with a continuous growth learning mindset. This role is based in our rapidly expanding Singapore Trust & Safety hub.


Responsibilities:

Strategy & Planning

  • Lead/co-lead Strategic Planning Initiatives Business Review Sessions Admin Support for Global Operations Management Team involving planning organising and coordinating with business leaders on crafting agenda consolidate content facilitate the meetings and follow up actions items. 
  • Support the scheduling and action plans of Operations Management Strategic Partner QBRs.
  • Coordinate with teams and prepare slide decks for executive and other major presentations/event.
  • Proactively identify issues areas of enhancements which provides value added insights and lead/implement strategic initiatives.

People Initiatives

  • Plan launch and iterate on team wide employee engagement programs such as Communications Global All Hands Employee Survey Action Plans and Reward & Recognition Programs.
  • Own and drive the Global Organisation Culture and associated programs.
  • Support aggressive hiring plans by working with HR to prioritise and track as well as interviewing for several strategic roles.
  • Supporting the on-boarding of new Operations Management Leaders.

Operations Management

  • Support and represent the Head of Global Trust & Safety Operations in cross-functional engagement by creating reports communications decks and by proactively sharing and presenting Ops metrics with the wider business.
  • Manage Operations Management Projects (e.g. Regional office real estate requirements)
  • Host and drives Operation Performance Metrics in Weekly Business Reviews.
  • Advise coordinate and track Global Operations Management team bi-monthly OKRs.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • 3+ years of experience including 3+ in a fast-paced technology company.
  • Bachelor's/Master's degree.
  • Highly organised strong problem solving skills confident and self motivated individual that is equally comfortable supporting junior team members and communicating with c-suite staff.
  • Strategic thinker with experience identifying and leading programs to improve business performance.
  • Experience building relationships with cross-functional teams and delivering impact through communication.
  • Project Management experience in a data driven decision making environment.
  • Respect for and desire to learn from other cultures.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Internet/UGC platform domain expertise.
  • Experience in roles such as Chief of Staff Program Management Business Operations.
  • Experience in building a project from scratch to finish is preferred.
  • Experience in budget management.
  • Ability to remain calm under pressure and navigate a fast paced and ambiguous environment.
  • Exposure to Global/Asian work culture.

About us

Reebelo is one of APAC’s fastest growing startups. Six-digit monthly sales high-growth & well-funded by top VCs and serial entrepreneurs. Join our online marketplace for sustainable electronics and help us to make an impact! Our vision is to reduce e-waste by saving electronics from a premature death - while doing so we enable customers to save up 70% on their favorite brands and flexibly rent devices instead of buying them. Join us if you want to be part of a high-growth disruptive startup with a positive social impact! 


About the role

We are looking for a hands-on Startup / Ecommerce Operations Manager with previous startup experience. Join our small but fast growing team as one of the company’s first team-members and help us to further scale Reebelo: 

  • Become a key team-member in our operations team
  • Work closely together with senior management & decide together with us Reebelo’s Operations Roadmap
  • Monitor and manage end-to-end customer lifecycle.
  • Handle vendor communication and ensure smooth interactions between our merchants and our customers. 
  • Manage a team of Customer Service agents and guide them to best practices and processes. 
  • Optimize existing processes workflows and user journeys to ensure an ideal experience for our users and vendors.
  • Produce weekly reporting and KPIs 
  • Automate processes improve product listings & benchmark prices
  • Create manage and maintain systems to ensure operational excellence across the organisation. 
  • Expansion to APAC (Australia + Malaysia this year many more countries next year)


Your background

You are motivated to make an impact and have a hands-on startup attitude? After several years of experience in Product or Operations you are ready to join a high-growth startup? Great that’s what we are looking for: 

  • Motivated person with startup attitude: hands-on + ambitious
  • Business background with several years of Ecommerce or Operations experience
  • You are ambitious a team-player and ready to make an impact
  • You know how to structure processes and prioritize tasks
  • Based in Singapore business fluent in English


Does that match with your expectations? If yes it would be great to get to know you! Send us your CV your LinkedIn profile and a brief summary on who you are and why you would like to work at Reebelo. :)

Do you love food and convenience put together? Then you would definitely love foodpanda!

foodpanda is the leading on-demand food delivery company in APAC and brings thousands of your best loved restaurants online into your home or office - fast! We’re all about bringing on the smartest folks as we continue to grow with an “all hands on deck” environment and hire those who can thrive in a start-up culture.

We’re looking for a highly-driven and motivated Associate Vendor Operations for our regional team in Singapore. If you are looking for a place where you can gain hands-on exposure and have a direct impact then this may be the place for you!

The ideal candidate will have a track record as a significant individual contributor – comfortable working independently whilst working closely with the management team.

About The Job

This critical role will be in charge of supporting all Foodpanda markets through the Vendor Onboarding process. You will have the opportunity to improve tools and processes used by multiple teams across APAC. We are looking for someone with strong business skills - analytical thinking effective communication and project management.

Responsibilities
  • Plan and execute process changes to boost the pace and quality of onboarding.
  • Review and manage the performance of the vendor activation process.
  • Ensure compliance of regional processes while accommodating localized nuances.
  • Work closely with country POCs to implement product and process improvements.
  • Translate local requirements and feedback into actionable items for regional teams


Requirements
  • 3-4 years of experience in operations project management or similar roles.
  • Strong communicator - Ability to influence decisions of operational teams within a matrix organization.
  • Highly analytical - Your first instinct is to dig deeper into data to make logical decisions.
  • Action-oriented - You can cut through the clutter and get teams focused on outcomes.

Purpose

This role is responsible for the effective development implementation and management of operations in the Singapore office in accordance with the firm’s standards and ensuring they satisfy local statutory requirements. You will also play a crucial role in the success of the Secretarial Services Team in the Singapore office and will have overall responsibility for the team’s delivery.

Direct reports: General Office Front of House Secretarial Services Team

Key Responsibilities And Challenges

  • Office Administration
    • Responsible for the smooth and efficient running and delivery of all Operations functions;
    • Line management responsibility for all staff working in Operations and the Secretarial Services Team
    • Manage all suppliers and third- party relationships for all Operations functions (including commercial negotiations agreement and review of service levels escalation and resolution of problems relating to goods or services supplied relations with public authorities sub-tenant(s) other occupiers etc);
    • Responsible for the Singapore office’s international Operations’ and Environmental obligations including:
      • ensure that the Singapore office implements and complies with the firm’s agreed global and regional Operations’ standards policies and procedures;
      • provide management reports and information such as environmental statistics to regional and global Operations’ management
    • Manage other ad hoc projects and events in the Singapore office
  • Management of Secretarial Services Team
    • Active involvement in management of the Secretarial Services Team to ensure agreed KPIs are met and reassessed as appropriate
    • Develop and implement best practices across the Secretarial Services Team and instill a culture of continuous improvement
    • Be the point of escalation for operational and team issues
    • Work with the Lateral Recruitment Team to drive any resourcing requirements within the Secretarial Services Team
    • Conduct regular discussions and run performance and salary/bonus processes for the team liaising with partners fee-earners and other key stakeholders and collaborating with the HR team for successful implementation
    • Highlight any issues to the HR Manager and COO SEA as required and manage any remedial action
  • Facility Management
    • Act as appointed contact vis-à-vis the building’s landlord and management office and maintain credible tenant/landlord relations;
    • Responsible for office and business insurances;
    • Responsible for office relocations;
    • Acquisition and maintenance of office furniture & fixtures; fitting & refurbishments and equipment;
    • Office space planning
  • Compliance and Risk Management
    • Develop update and review various local office policies and ensure that the office complies with the local regulatory and other requirements;
    • Manage all health & safety and hygiene activities within the office and act as the appointed contact for all related issues;
    • Manage all security and office emergency procedures within the office and act as the appointed contact for all related issues;
    • Responsible for the business continuity plan and its implementation
    • Manage the registration process for lawyers with the Ministry of Law
    • Manage Practising Certificate renewals
    • Assist with regulatory reporting

    Additional Job Description

    Character
    • Professional approachable
    • Strong organizational skills detail-oriented
    • Proactive approach with ability to remain calm and focused under pressure or tight deadlines
    • Strong communication skills both oral and written
    • Committed and determined with a can-do attitude
    • High EQ (Emotional Intelligence)
    • Strong team player
    Education / Qualification
    • Degree (or equivalent)
    Language
    • Fluency in both oral and written English
    • Good presentation skills

    Skills/Practical Experience
    • Minimum 7 years of experience ideally in an Operations role within professional services
    • Experience in supervising teams and working with senior stakeholders
    • Ability to challenge existing procedures and policies
    • Strong MS Office skills and good overall IT literacy
    This list of duties and responsibilities above is not exhaustive. It is intended to describe the general content of and requirements for the performance of this job. As such the role may also include the undertaking of additional tasks as required.

    Job Offer Scams

    Be alert to fictitious job opportunity posts and offers of employment which claim to be in the name of Linklaters. We have been made aware of various recruitment-related scams which ask for upfront payments for example for office equipment and promise start up bonuses and reimbursement in return for such payments. These scams often involve the use of email addresses similar to a genuine domain name. Genuine emails from Linklaters only use the domain of “@linklaters.com”. We will never ask you to make payments for office equipment or otherwise as part of our recruitment process. If you are in doubt about a job opportunity that appears to relate to our firm please get in touch using the contact details on our careers website at www.linklaters.com/careers .

    Pre-joiner screening

    In the event that we make an offer to you and where local legislation permits we will conduct pre-engagement screening checks that may include but are not limited to your professional and academic qualifications your eligibility to work in the relevant jurisdiction any criminal records your financial stability and references from previous employers. ADP Celergo Organization is committed to providing World Class Service to clients by hiring developing and retaining qualified service professionals; by treating each client contact as a service opportunity and by delivering outstanding customer care to client associates. 

Role objective:

  • To solve potential issues that may prevent the satisfactory and timely completion of the global implementation.

  • Participate into business improvement projects support pre- engagement meeting with client and prospect client.

II. Responsibilities:

  • To develop produce and manage a master implementation schedule/project plan to ensure timely achievements of all deliverables.

Description

This role is with our AWS Outposts Operations team – delivering a new way for Infrastructure to be delivered to our customers. AWS Outposts brings native AWS services infrastructure and operating models to virtually any data center co-location space or on-premises facility. Customers can now use the same AWS APIs tools and infrastructure across their on-premises and the AWS cloud to deliver a truly consistent hybrid experience. The provided AWS Outposts infrastructure is fully managed maintained and supported by AWS directly to deliver access to the latest AWS capabilities for our customers.

We are looking for a Customer Operations Lead who is highly autonomous possesses a “can do” attitude and thrives in a fast-paced work environment. The Customer Operations Lead plays a key role in providing an outstanding customer experience by facilitating the overall program management scheduling coordination and supply chain leadership associated with AWS installations and servicing efforts completed onsite at Client premises. The Customer Operations Lead is responsible for developing processes and deploying strategies that ensure required material and supporting teams are at the right place at the right time thereby enabling the achievement of defined service-level targets (SLTs). The Customer Operations Lead continuously seeks out and implements continuous process improvement initiatives that strengthen our end-to-end supply chain operations and logistics efforts by effectively engaging with internal and external partners and customers as well as third-party servicing providers to deliver meaningful results for our clients and teams.

As a Customer Operations Lead You Will Lead Program Management Efforts Associated With Installations Break/fix And Retrieval Activities Thereby Enabling An Optimized Customer Experience Through An Unyielding Focus On The Following Key Activities
  • Serve as the program manager for all orders within the assigned region partnering with leadership teams Operations technicians service support teams and third-party partners to deliver against established service level agreements (SLAs)
  • Lead all scheduling and coordination efforts to include formalizing assignments of technicians and/or third-party technicians coordinating travel schedules to align with customer requirements and navigating supply/materials logistics to ensure all required materials and human capital are prepared for on-schedule servicing
  • Serve as the primary point of contact for customers maintaining accountability for coordinating on-site schedules and logistics and effectively communicating these requirements to all applicable teams and partners
  • Program manage efforts related to transferring assets across state/province and/or country lines partnering with applicable internal and external teams to minimize delays in the delivery of required materials/assets
  • Partner with and/or supporting third-party contractors to enable a seamless client experience while meeting established SLTs
  • Act as point of escalation for contractors technicians and transportation vendors; trouble-shooting issues as they arise
  • Consistently foster a culture of open and effective communication minimizing the learning curve associated with tasks and ensuring all parties and customers are aligned around expectations and next steps at all times
  • Leverage data to track operational efficiencies and develop mechanisms and processes to further enhance operations as appropriate; Partner with leadership and SME teams to implement improvements to internal/external processes
  • Drive cross-functional strategic initiatives to improve supply chain efficiency and overall cost structure
  • Work cross-functionally and across Amazon teams to identify and apply best practices and continuous process improvement efforts
  • Using English to conduct day-to-day business both internally across Amazon and with external customers as appropriate
  • May participate in efforts to train and/or mentor new employees ensuring a consistent focus on best-in-class client servicing
  • May be required to work outside of standard working hours to include nights and/or weekends (on-call rotations and/or on demand escalations) in support of client scheduling and/or time-sensitive escalations
Travel Requirement
  • Frequent travel (20% on average to both domestic and international client locations) required

Basic Qualifications
  • 4+ years working in a program management capacity required
  • 2+ years of experience working in a data center operations environment
  • English language proficiency is required (speaking reading and writing)
Preferred Qualifications
  • Degree in a technical field or 4+ years of relevant work experience in a data center operations environment
  • Experience in a client-facing role with the proven ability to manage and effectively communicate expectations to clients
  • Strong interpersonal written and verbal communication skills with experience communicating at all levels within an organization
  • Ability to operate autonomously and manage to a schedule – excellent prioritization and time management; proven ability to think and act in a high-energy fast-paced business environment
  • Demonstrated ability to manage multiple projects - prioritization planning and task delegation
  • Advanced experience with analysis tools including Microsoft Excel SQL and statistics software
  • Warehousing supply chain inventory management finance and/or vendor management experience
  • Demonstrated fluency in multiple languages applicable to the region

Organization Summary

If you love the pursuit of excellence and are inspired by the challenges that come through driving innovations that impact how the world lives works and plays then we invite you to learn more about Microsoft Business Operations (MBO) - and the value we deliver across Microsoft and to our customers and partners. We offer unique opportunities to work on interesting global projects in an environment that appreciates diversity focuses on talent development recognizes and rewards great work.

Position Description

The Enterprise. Protect Intelligence and Compliance (EPIC) Operations Team are looking for an experienced Operations Program Manager of WW End Customer Investment Funds (ECIF) programs. ECIF is the cost of services delivered to end customers in support of Microsoft products. ECIF is a critical tool in accelerating transformational workloads. ECIF is delivered to our customers through either Internal Microsoft Services (MCS Premiere CSS) or through authorized External Suppliers. In this role you will be responsible for the global ECIF Operating Model execution including standing up and supporting the newly defined Concierge desk to help increase seller efficiency that drive consumption and close business decrease processing cycle times for ECIF projects throughout the lifecycle of the project and execute key controls that protect our customers and Microsoft.

You will have ownership and accountability for ECIF operating model processes including Concierge desk service line execution and management of the controls KPIs and ROI. You will lead vendor teams who are accountable for the on-going transactional support of our field sellers and ensure on-going operational efficiencies and compliance. Compliance is in your DNA. You want to have fun and believe in what you do! If that sounds like a good fit for you keep reading…

The ECIF Program Manager role will be a member of the Microsoft Incentives Operations (MIO) team within MBO. The MIO team supports Microsoft's strategy to leverage our partners as extended sales force to help Microsoft accelerate securing revenue. We are a fast-paced results oriented group within MBO that interacts with the Solution areas Consumer and Device Sales One Commercial Partner Universal Store Regional Operations Centers Finance Customer Service and many more organizations to ensure our incentive and payout programs are operationalized with efficiency. We are responsible for designing launching improving (in market) and executing operational solutions for Global Programs and Process that payout incentives transaction processes to Microsoft Partners and Suppliers.

Here is your profile - You have deep experience in business program management with focus on operations. You have a passion for excellence and quality execution. You love the challenge of solving big bold problems. You see opportunities when others see failures. You are a great communicator able to customize your message to many layers in a large Corporation and you are comfortable delivering difficult messages when required. You are a strategic thinker (big picture) with ability to connect the dots and you have an ability to go immediate to ground level details. You are a meticulous program and capability focused manager knowing the end to end process flow for how your program works and understanding how the business rules need to be executed operationally. You are a rigorous project manager and take pride in delivering solid clean projects. You are tenacious in unearthing risks and mitigate them proactively engaging whoever you need for support to do this.

You will own relationships with various Business Operations Finance and IT groups in understanding existing processes and systems supporting the end to end execution of your program drive improvements to the same and support definition of future state requirements.

Responsibilities

Responsibilities:
  • Accountable for the implementation and operationalization of ECIF Concierge desk
  • Subject matter expert for all aspect of operations for your program regionally or functionally - understanding the end to end flow how the business rules are executed and ensuring compliance is the top priority.
  • Accountable for high quality compliant end to end program optimization and Instrumentation for the operational processes supporting your program - work with your peers to ensure integrity of your end to end process/program and ability to deliver on programmatic goals through operational processes.
  • Primary Point of Contact for the Microsoft GSMO program sponsor(s). Build develop and maintain highly collaborative and effective working relationships with key stakeholders to facilitate proactive planning agreement on cross group delivery plan of record smooth communication and risk/issue tracking and resolution
  • Accountable for the on-going ECIF Concierge desk support and maintenance and ensures on-going operational efficiencies and compliance
  • Reporting & Analytics: Define end-to-end reporting requirements analytics and ROI capabilities within the ECIF Concierge desk. Responsible for BI reporting back to the ECIF stakeholders
  • Collaborates with team and ECIF vendors to monitor program efficacy and compliance
  • Ensure execution to SLA understanding how changes upstream or downstream of programmatic operational processes will impact overall E2E cycle times.
  • Consulting/Coaching and point of escalation for regional ECIF leads field requestors and Solution Area program sponsors.
  • Own the ECIF Concierge desk work instruction documentation
  • Accountable for managing vendor teams
  • Design implement and lead strategic change through simplification and automation for ECIF processes
  • Identify requirements for program change from policy stakeholders assess feasibility to deliver create a working Plan of Record/roadmap items for enhancements/change drive change control proactively identify and manage risks and issues strong focus on escalation management/future mitigation triage cross group coordination and milestone management.
  • Governance - Drive Compliance controls Policy and Procedures

Qualifications

Basic Qualifications:
  • Bachelor’s degree required
  • 5+ years of relevant business experience within Operations IT Sales Incentives Operations or other relevant roles
  • 5+ years of demonstrated Global Program Management Capability or Project Management experience preferably in an Operations environment

Preferred Qualifications
  • Have strong understanding of Microsoft's business product and technical strategies and proven cross-group project leadership and management skills.
  • Proven program management and project management experience
  • Strong written/oral communication skills required along with desire and ability to communicate with business leaders through all levels of the organization.
  • Data analytics and Data Management. Proficient BI reporting including both Excel and Power BI
  • Understanding of Technical Automation requirements
  • Demonstrated ability to motivate self and others
  • Conflict/Negotiation management
  • High energy individual with a “can do” attitude
  • Strong end to end thinking with process orientation; ability to develop enterprise-wide solutions
  • Core Competencies: Problem Solving Planning organizing and coordination Cross-Group Collaboration influence without authority

Our Singapore office need a Head of Customer Support to help us achieve our goals. You will be part of an exciting and dynamic implementation team ensuring we meet our clients’ expectations by creating a culture of service to allow Uncharted to scale and build our support functions globally

 

Job profile skills and experience  

 

This position will have you building and managing our APAC support function to develop a global customer success team for our insurance broker and fintech client base.

 

  • At least 6+ years’ experience leading a team within a support desk function of a global enterprise B2B SAAS organisation
  • Strong experience in responding to ticket support for global MNC clients in highly regulated industries insurance preferred
  • Working with internal teams to build the support function from scratch including: structure processes escalation metrics and workflows
  • Strong team building experience with extensive experience building global support teams and 3rd parties vendors to develop a world class support function
  • Ability to work cross functionally with software engineering operations and product teams both internally and externally
  • Experience directly with support in a B2B SAAS environment facing internal business users and internal technical teams and as support to their platform end users.
  • We work with world class enterprise clients so it goes without saying you’ll come equipped with world class communication skills and a service and customer first mentality

 

Our culture your future

 

Working for Uncharted you will be joining a global team with an exciting future. We are moving fast taking technology to the limits and reshaping the world of insurance. There’s a creative energy and determination about everything we do a collective commitment to transform an industry that is conservative and tradition based. 

 

That is why we need people who can share our vision people with the conviction and qualities to make a real difference. Can you rise above the ordinary and the average? Do you have the drive and ambition to take insurance technology to new levels? 

 

  • You thrive on challenges and are never short of ideas and insights
  • You see problems as opportunities to create something better 
  • You are confident working on your own initiative but are a committed team member who knows that great things can happen when the right people come together 
  • You take pride in your work – and the company you work for – and love being part of an organisation that has bold plans and innovation at its core 
  • You never forget that innovation and customer needs are inseparable

 

Other opportunities

Castlery was founded with one mission in mind: to make designer furniture accessible to everyone. By working directly with designers and manufacturers we cut off the middlemen and bring good designed and high-end furniture to our customers without high street price point.

As an e-commerce tech start-up we move decisively on insightful data and leverage on technological solutions to supercharge our operations. We combine our individual passions and skills to create innovative work that is as exciting and unconventional as the business itself. It’s a place where all ideas are listened to; where brainstorming means job titles get left at the door and where a self-starter can really make their mark.

If you’re eager to make an impact at a fast-growing technology company and you have a passion for moving the needle send us your resume.

Core Responsibilities

Castlery is hiring an Operations Specialist . This person will play a key role in executing inbound and delivery execution improving customer satisfaction and driving repeat business in their region by ensuring best in class customer experiences at every opportunity.

  • Monitor supervise and execute order management system

  • Proficiency in Excel and Microsoft Office is a must - ability to navigate and analyse data.
  • Constantly think of improvement efforts to deliver better internal processes and customer experience.

  • Ability to determine customer needs and provide appropriate solutions setting expectations with customers

Description

The APJ ISV Segment team is looking for a talented driven self-directed Business Analyst to join an organization that is responsible for driving adoption and embedding of the AWS platform by ISVs and end customers around the world. This is a unique opportunity to play a key role in a fast growing business and to provide significant value for customers building lean innovative new companies. Specifically this role will include measuring and monitoring scaling metrics and analytical insights that will measure the success and drive the week-to-week development of the AWS ISV Segment team. You will work closely with members of the Sales Partner Marketing Operations and Services teams to ensure we are capturing and surfacing the best data and information to make optimal business decisions. You’ll collaborate with engineers to build self-service reports and establish automated processes for large scale data analyses. Successful candidates will be analytical with business acumen and detail driven with excellent problem solving skills.

The ideal candidate will have a rock-solid background in report extraction and dashboard management analysis including experience extracting and manipulating data using SQL and producing digestible business intelligence and actionable information. The candidate should also have strong communication and project management skills enabling them to work with key business stakeholders to understand requirements and shape analytical deliverables. He/she should also have a demonstrated ability to work closely with the ISV Segment leadership to drive cross-organizational engagements and work on strategic programs and initiatives for the APJ ISV Segment team. A keen sense of ownership drive and scrappiness is a must.


Basic Qualifications
  • Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field such as Mathematics Statistics Engineering Computer Science Economics Finance or related field
  • 7-10+ years of industry experience in data analysis.
  • Experience in SQL and manipulating large data sets in a database
  • Advanced proficiency in Excel (including VBA Pivot Tables array functions Power Pivots etc.)
Preferred Qualifications
  • Strong planning and teaming skills including multiple project management and scheduling etc.
  • Experience or familiarity with the ISV community including B2B startups accelerators venture firms and more
  • Excellent problem-solving skills
  • Excited to learn new technologies and analytical methodologies relating to business intelligence and data analysis
  • Strong communication (verbal and written) and interpersonal skills to translate ambiguous business requirements into complex analyses and actionable insight

About Doctor Anywhere

Doctor Anywhere is a regional tech-led healthcare company headquartered in Singapore with offices in the region. With a strong network of established healthcare providers and experienced doctors our digital platform and mobile app enable users to manage their health easily where they can consult a licensed local doctor anytime anywhere and get medication delivered to their doorsteps within hours. 


Under the DA Network clinics users also have access to an island-wide panel of general practitioners specialists and allied healthcare providers. Complementing this ecosystem is our DA Marketplace where users can shop for a wide range of health and wellness products and services all in one place. 


We now serve more than one million and growing users and our aim is to increase healthcare accessibility and provide affordable health care for everyone. Join us to help everyone lead happier and healthier lives!

We need a business partner who can balance the need to be strategic along with the ability to demonstrate empathy and roll up your sleeves attitude. You are passionate about providing excellent internal client support and driving HR operational excellence along with the People & Culture team.

  • Promote a culture of feedback and open communication among managers and employees across DA.
  • Have a data driven mindset to provide insights to leaders to drive business outcomes.

  • Comfortable with open communication and giving and receiving open constructive feedback respectfully.
  • Proven ability to work collaboratively to develop and execute programs.
  • Not afraid to roll up their sleeves and get involved in all aspects of the role.
  • Unquestioned integrity and a confident presence to effectively resolve sensitive issues.
  • Experience in driving cultural change in mergers and acquisitions is a plus.

Are you looking to enhance your technical capability by working in a global manufacturing environment that allows you to leverage best in class systems and technologies? If so this Senior Operations Executive role could be an ideal opportunity to explore.

As a Senior Operations Executive you will be the deputy to the Manufacturing Manager supporting him/her to ensure the delivery of production objectives of the building in respect to Supply Quality Cost Safety as well as the people development of the team.

These Responsibilities Include Some Of The Following

This role will provide YOU the opportunity to lead key activities to progress YOUR career.
  • Manage and ensure performance delivery of the team to support production objectives of the building as well as be responsible for talent development and business continuity planning within the team.
  • Deliver cross department improvement targets via participating in key site initiatives and act as main channel to cascade site direction down to shopfloor.
  • Act as key interface of the team to facilitate manage or resolve issues such as deviation equipment maintenance QC sampling/testing trial runs and technology transfer etc.
  • Drive team performance and set high standard of operational excellence.
  • Responsible to ensure business continuity.
  • Ensure smooth handover between shifts.
  • Drive quality mindset and drive the team to improve their quality knowledge and understanding quality decision.
  • Act as deviation/change control owner.
  • Coordinate procedures (LSOP) generation review and training.

Why you?

We are looking for professionals with these required skills to achieve our goals:
  • Bachelor’s degree in any related Science or Engineering discipline
  • At least 8 years of total working experience with 3 years in leading a team. Experience in managing cross-functional teams is a plus
  • Have strong technical writing skills managing CAPA change control and deviation.
  • Have certain exposure or experience in aseptic operations or Sterile environment. Experience in autoclaves SIP is a plus.
  • Knowledge in cGMP environments and safety issue management.
  • Knowledge in biotechnology equipment.
  • Good troubleshooting skills
  • Effective organization and communication skills.
  • People management experience and skills.
  • Continuous improvement mindset.

Why GSK?

GSK’s dedication to the wellbeing of our employees is reflected in the benefits we offer; including healthcare for yourself and dependents performance related bonus long term incentives and a host of other flexible offerings you can tailor to your own preferences. We also offer a range of employee health and wellbeing programs including our truly unique Partnership for Prevention program a global commitment by GSK to provide all employees with up to 40 preventative healthcare services bringing to life our mission to: do more feel better and live longer.

At GSK we value diversity and treat all candidates equally. We aim to create an inclusive workplace where all employees feel engaged supportive of one another and know their work makes an important contribution.

About The Job

We are looking for an Order Management Specialist based in Singapore time zone to join the Sales Operations function as a point of contact for our customers. Being a part of our Sales Operations team you will be highly independent and a good communicator with strong IT skills. This role is directly reporting to our Sales Operations Manager and would be required to interact with Head of Wholesale wholesale customers wholesale account managers demand planners & fulfilment.

Responsibilities
  • Interpret and process Purchase/Sales Orders from Customers
  • Communicate directly with customers regarding:
    • Acknowledgement and Receipt of PO/SO
    • Queries with Deliveries
    • Issues with Fulfilment/Deliveries
    • Tracking and processing pre-orders
    • Following-up on past orders with out-of-stock items
  • Wholesale Order Management:
    • Creating a record within Supernova systems upon receipt of PO
    • Acknowledge receipt of PO to customers
    • Confirm stock quantities & delivery dates with the relevant teams
    • Provide confirmation of order to customer
    • Updating customers on changes to orders and deliveries
    • Updating internal stakeholders on order statuses and any possible issues
    • Monitoring open orders and following up with relevant stakeholders for updates
    • Processing preorders by the requested delivery dates
    • Following up with account managers or customers for out-of-stock items when stock available in the warehouse

It's an exciting time at Netflix as we continue to expand our business globally. We are revolutionizing the way people watch their favorite shows & movies and building our own library of original Netflix content for all to enjoy. Visit our culture memo and long-term view to learn more about our unique Netflix culture as well as the milestones we will achieve in the future.

The Program Manager APAC Benefits position is part of the Netflix Benefits Team team within Employee Services and Talent. We have a unique approach to our benefits philosophy here at Netflix developing and delivering programs that support our freedom and responsibility culture. In a culture that supports creativity and innovation as a key competency this position will have the responsibility of applying the same method of thinking towards the delivery of an innovative benefit offering for our talent.

Your Responsibilities
  • You will work closely with our external and internal stakeholders (HRIS Payroll HR Generalists and benefit consultants) to ensure accurate data exchange and effective operations of our benefit and retirement programs in APAC (7 countries and growing!) including support of our benefits and HR system implementations and upgrades.
  • You will lead annual renewals in our APAC countries benchmark against our peers provide analyses and insight into benefits in APAC and research industry and employment trends. Your job will be to seek information and be curious about the latest movements in benefits so that we can stay ahead of the curve and competition.
  • You will thoroughly understand and execute the compliance landscape that governs APAC benefits. We don’t like to get bogged down in audits reporting and compliance. We would rather focus on innovation and simplicity. That said we are of course mindful and respectful of the fact that in benefits these are necessary to the health of our plans. You will oversee these important functions and ensure we are adhering to all the requirements that keep our plans in check
  • You will work closely with our Employee Services Generalist team to both support them in responding to employee benefit inquiries and draw insights and learnings from their front line communication with employees. You’ll use these employee stories to help inform our decisions and communications.
  • You will work closely with the rest of the Benefits Team to implement benefits that support the business as we expand into new countries in APAC. You will partner closely with the business as we grow in animation content and production.

To be successful
  • You’ve done this before. 7+ years of benefits and/or HR operations experience with knowledge of relevant best practice industry and compliance requirements.
  • You are independent. You will be the first benefits team member located in APAC.
  • You have supported benefit programs at entertainment and/or technology organizations (preferred but not required).
  • Passion. Our employees are our top priority and enabling an amazing employee experience as a consumer of our benefits programs is your main guiding principle.
  • Curiosity. You are able to approach benefits with a deeply analytical and curious mind to take in many data points and provide summaries and actionable recommendations in a clear and concise way using data to inform decisions.
  • Collaborative. You have the ability to work with and influence cross-functional teams understanding there is not one single voice making decisions. You actively seek feedback on our benefits from across the business.
  • Unfazed. You have the ability to thrive in a fast paced environment and effectively communicate with business executives. You are comfortable working in a culture that values candor transparency and courage.
