Job Title: Head of Operations| SEA Project Development Services
Job Description:
Head of Operations South East Asia

Project & Development Services (PDS) Singapore

Reporting into the SEA Hub Managing Director the SEA Hub Head of Operations will accept total responsibility for the effective implementation and management of the PDS APAC regional operations policies procedures and systems. They will be a change agent and active contributor to show continuous improvement. Through the successful operations platform the strategic and financial results for SEA and locations will be met.

Responsibilities-
  • Support in business planning and financial goals for the hub and locations.
  • Support in the calculations of hourly pricing for each location for titles taking into account the locations planned head count and margin targets.
  • Support in the calculations of local and regional allocation costs to ensure they are fair and reasonable and where required negotiate on the reduction of the costs.
  • Support in the strategic goals for the hub and locations to “move the needle”
  • Support in the Individual Performance Measurement Targets for General Managers in each location.
  • Review each location FFS (Fee Forecasting Sheet) monthly and understand the risk and opportunities check for data accuracy and review against plan.
  • Review each location P&L monthly and understand the risk and opportunities check for data accuracy and review against plan.
  • Check on the sales process for each location with respect to use of Oval and compliance with limits of authority provide input into the selling process especially around staffing models scope form of agreements and pricing.
  • Support locations in the hiring of senior roles via maintaining a virtual bench of candidates.
  • Complete regular business and project reviews against plans and policies and issue corrective actions and close out.
  • Adhoc training in locations on specific process policies that need improvement or new systems being implemented.
  • Support each location in setting H&S objectives and targets each year and monitor performance.
  • Support each location if any incidents occur and follow up on flash reports and corrective actions until closure.
  • Monitor each locations performance monthly on H&S reporting via Clarizen and provide feedback/reporting.
  • Monitor each locations performance monthly on risk management reporting via Clarizen and provide feedback/reporting.
  • Monitor each locations resource utilisation and compliance of data entry (time) and budget into Clarizen to show project profitability.
  • Support each location in completing needs analysis for employee training.
  • Monitor each location is recording training hour each month and hitting set targets.
  • Support each location in managing debts and hitting account receivable targets for 28th Feb each year.
  • Actively promote PDS systems at all times and each locations compliance with these systems such as Project Toolkit and provide contributions to regional and global teams on improvements.
  • Organise workshops during the year for SEA including agenda pre-work and logistics.
  • Support hub manager and locations for any escalation raised internally and by clients and be actively involved in providing input to resolve conflict to closure of immediate issues and longer-term improvement.
  • Support manage and close M&A and Collaboration agreements inc Due Diligence legal reviews on agreements and financial models.
  • Plan and implement to obtain and maintain ISO9001 & 45001 for PM and CM across all SEA locations.
Sound like you? To be successful in this role you will need to have-

Business Skills And Competencies-
  • Understand the overall legal environment including licensing requirements for each SEA location.
  • Understand the legal structure and business scope for the entities that PDS operate under.
  • Extensive forecasting skills.
  • Understand the Profit & Loss data and establish where risks and opportunities exist in each location.
  • Extensive negotiation skills.
  • Commercial for PDS and JLL overall to be able to spot opportunities to grow revenue market share and margins.
COMPETENCIES-
  • A high level of competency at the required levels of Project Construction and Business Management.
  • Demonstrated willingness and ability to constantly improve existing competencies.
  • Demonstrated strategic and leadership skills including business development networking marketing and a high level of business skills.
  • Accomplished in profit planning and maximising the company’s profitability whilst maintaining high levels of employee morale and Client satisfaction.

Education/ Work Experience-
  • A degree in a relevant property related discipline or related field and fifteen (15) years’ experience or a combination of formal education and experience more than fifteen (15) years ten (10) of which must be related to aspects of Design/Construction/Project Management in an Operations or Business leadership role.

What We Can Do For You-

At JLL we make sure that you become the best version of yourself by helping you realise your full potential in an entrepreneurial and inclusive work environment. We will empower your ambitions through our dedicated Total Rewards Program competitive pay and benefits package.

Apply today!

Job Title: Distribution Regional Strategy & Project Lead - SEA
Job Description:
About ByteDance

  • ByteDance has gone through explosive growth in 2019 and we're growing faster in 2020! This high speed role requires an individual with supreme critical thinking analytical mindset technical aptitude and project management skills. The role will require alignment across global teams and complex problem-solving across every facet of the ByteDance ecosystem. The ideal candidate is comfortable working across a number of time zones and approaches their contribution to the team through tireless entrepreneurial spirit and a deep desire to learn about our products and our partnerships. You will be leading workflows within the Distribution division of Global Business Development and we expect you to be able to manage strategy research BI process & tools with minimum hand-holding. We are largely unencumbered by red tape but building process is a critical step towards scale - be prepared to build a structure that empowers ongoing sustainable rapid growth.


About the Team

  • Distribution Partnerships are a critical means by which we support various objectives of our company including user growth marketing data infrastructure content and product / tech. The primary focus is on partnerships with telecom operators OEMs connected consumer entertainment devices start-ups forms of payment and other channels with opportunity to engage in other spaces and other verticals. We are looking for an enthusiastic professional interested in strategy & internal consulting to support research analysis and coordination across teams.


Job Description

  • Support the Distribution Partnerships team as required including research analysis creating project documents & presentations;
  • Support the development of partnership strategy and market intelligence in Southeast Asia;
  • Work closely with the SEA Distribution Partnerships team to:
  1. Lead the assessment of potential partnership opportunities;
  2. Assist project document creation & cross-functional coordination;
  3. Assist deal execution and implementation;
  4. Lead the post-deal evaluation and produce case studies/presentations;
  • Assist the global strategy & operations teams as required;
  • Create processes & best practices that can be replicated in other markets globally;
  • Serve as the expert in certain critical technical domains of partnership implementation: develop own and update key technical knowledge and corresponding documents maintain key technical implementation process and cross-functional working mechanism.


Qualifications

  1. Bachelors degree and above preferred;
  2. 3-5 years experience of project management technical solution development strategy or product manager in industries such as internet telecommunication or consumer electronic or leading consulting firm with rich project experiences in internet and technology.


Skills

  1. Strong communication skills and ability to recognize the needs and concern of internal stakeholders and navigate through it;
  2. Strong project management skills and ability to manage projects end-to-end and identify critical milestones and resources in order to mobilise internal team to deliver effectively;
  3. Strong logical and structural thinking;
  4. Strong documentation and storytelling skills and research skills;
  5. Technical appetite and aptitude sensitive - be able to translate business case or partner needs to technical requirement and work with cross-functional teams to realize the idea;
  6. Language: Business proficiency in writing reading and speaking in English. Fluency in Mandarin Thai Vietnamese Bahasa Indonesian or Bahasa Malay may be beneficial;
  7. Computer skills: Mastery of Powerpoint and Excel. SQL and Tableau are preferred.

Customer Success Manager

Join Trustana and be part of the new way businesses will trade across the globe.

Trustana is founded by Temasek an investment company headquartered in Singapore and is being built in collaboration with BCG Digital Ventures.

As the world becomes more connected there are infinitely more opportunities for businesses to work together and trade across borders. The challenge they face today is trust. How do they find a reliable and trusted business partner? How do they trust the business will honor their commitments?

Our vision is to allow seamless discovery and verification of business partners and facilitation of cross-border trades. We are doing this by creating a unique trade reputation mechanism to boost the transparency of global trade - and are hiring a team of exceptional motivated and ambitious team members.

We are developing a ground-breaking network leveraging decentralised technology and the latest thinking in Self-Sovereign Identity. We are radically simplifying the way businesses operate and trade. The focus is on relationships between Chinese SMEs (Small & Medium Enterprises) and Singapore SMEs through a digital B2B marketplace.

This role at Trustana provides a unique opportunity for a high performing individual to have broad impact. You will work with virtual teams across Singapore and China to create an impactful experience for our customers by building valuable relationships with them and achieving maximum customer satisfaction.

You will support the continuous evolution of customer needs and deliver business insights in an environment of rapid growth.

Key Responsibilities

  • Create establish and implement end-to-end process operations and structure for handling incoming customer feedback issues and requests working closely with the GTM and technical team
  • Design and setup from scratch customer feedback collection and feedback resolution process
  • Collaborate with GTM team to support existing new and potential customers with utilising the Trustana product
  • Identify and collaborate with GTM team on all matters pertaining to expansion and additional selling opportunities with existing customers as well as focusing on customer retention
  • Liaise directly with Trustana customers to develop deep understanding of customers’ concerns and thoughts regarding the use of products and maintaining strong relationships with key users and decision makers; keeping them connected/updated with product enhancement
  • Act as the voice of the customer and collect feedback to drive continuous improvement across all areas including product enhancement; provide feedback back to product & GTM teams
  • Collaborate and coordinate with GTM Product and Build team to ensure ongoing customer success
  • Own customer experience and develop data-driven approach to setting and achieving customer success KPIs
  • Improve customer satisfaction by collaborating with stakeholders to improve process productivity efficiency and customer experience
  • Assume ownership to drive any issues related to customers’ account to resolution and troubleshoot as needed
  • Build and maintain a comprehensive database of referenceable customer contacts
Ideal Candidate Requirements

  • Bachelor’s degree in a related field
  • 5+ years B2B experience in an account management and/or customer success role within high-growth technology companies. Experience in E-Commerce/Marketplace will be highly advantageous
  • Excellent track record of increasing customer satisfaction adoption and retention in a customer success capacity
  • Experience tracking sales activities customer data and customer status.
  • Strong passion for working in a start-up environment
  • Empathetic patient and a great listener
  • Experience in working in cross-functional and interdisciplinary teams including Product Engineering Business Development and Operations
  • Exceptional ability to communicate and foster positive business relationships
  • Ability to multi-task across a high number of accounts at any given time.
  • Highly motivated goal-driven outgoing inquisitive and customer-centric
  • Chinese Fluency preferable

Job Title: Business Operations and Revenue Operations Executive
Job Description:
Traineeship (Business Operations and Revenue Operations Executive Cloud 8 months)

Roles & Responsibilities

Singtel is Asia's leading communications technology group providing a portfolio of services from next-generation communication technology services to infotainment to both consumers and businesses.

We are a major communications player in Asia Pacific through our strategic investments in regional mobile operators Telkomsel (Indonesia) Globe Telecom (the Philippines) Advanced Info Service (Thailand) and Bharti Airtel (India) which has significant presence in Bangladesh Sri Lanka and Africa.

This SGUnited Programme provides traineeship and enterprise attachment opportunities to equip you with valuable industry experience.

You will have the opportunity develop your skills professionally and gain an understanding of our business.

Technology continues to reshape how we live and we are proud to be nurturing talents for the digital economy. We are awarding exciting opportunities to Singaporeans with the passion to pursue a career in the Information and Communications technology (ICT) Industry. You can look forward to acquiring invaluable professional and soft skills.

We are looking for people with a passion to create a better future with technology and the potential to influence others to do the same. We have a broad range of opportunities across business corporate functions and ICT.

Job Title: Business Assistant to CEO of Asia
Job Description:
Work Environment:

Louis Dreyfus Company (LDC) is a leading merchant and processor of agricultural goods leveraging our global reach and extensive asset network to deliver for our customers around the world – safely responsibly and reliably. Our diversified activities span the entire value chain from farm to fork across a broad range of business lines.

 

Operating since 1851 we help feed and clothe some 500 million people every year by originating processing and transporting approximately 81 million tons of products. Structured as a matrix organization of 6 geographical regions and 8 platforms LDC is active in over 100 countries and employs some 19 000 people globally.

 

LDC in South & Southeast Asia

LDC first established a presence in Asia more than 100 years ago with an office opening in Melbourne Australia in 1913 trading grains to the international market. Our regional headquarters opened in Singapore in 1993 which now serves as the hub for our origination and merchandizing activities in the South & Southeast Asia Region which spans across 7 platforms - Grains & Oilseeds Rice Freight Global Markets Coffee Cotton and Sugar with offices in 8 countries – Singapore Australia India Indonesia Vietnam Pakistan Malaysia and Thailand.

 

 

Overall Purpose:

This is a supporting role to the CEO of Asia to assist in the daily communication and delivery of presentations and strategic projects/business opportunities. The Business Assistant also acts as the connecting point of internal and external communications consolidating relevant information according to business needs.

 

Main Responsibilities:

·        Independent Research and Analytical work in the area of Business Development Merger & Acquisition and assistance in proposals

·        Assisting in Project and Process Management (PPM)

·        Producing executive summary for business meetings

·        Planning and coordinating follow-up communications with both internal and external stakeholders

·        Ad-hoc work assigned by CEO

 

Knowledge and Experience: 

·        Core requirements:

  • Good understanding of financial models IRR and investment strategies;
  • Acumen for business development strategies and merge/acquisitions opportunities
  • Good knowledge of financial reports and financial reporting standards;
  • For Bachelor’s Degree holders: minimum 3-5 years of work experience in relevant field(s)
  • For Master’s Degree holders: minimum 2-3 years of work experience in relevant field(s)
  • Experienced in managing communications with a variety of internal and external stakeholders

·        Knowledge and experience in the agricultural commodity trading industry preferred

·        Experience as management trainee will be an advantage


Education: 

3+ years’ of college education preferably in business finance economics and/or management

 

Languages:

·        English – Professional Level (required)

·        Mandarin – Fluent (preferred)

·        Other languages also an advantage


Technical/ Functional skills:

Good proficiency in

·        Microsoft Office Suite (particularly PowerPoint and Excel)

·        Financial modelling systems

 

Other skills and competencies:

·        Keen learner and open-minded

·        Good communication and coordination skills with different personalities

·        Meticulous and diligent

·        Time-management skills a must with good organization

·        Personable & well spoken good people-skills willing to speak up

·        Flexible and able to act quickly and appropriately to unexpected changes

·        Willing to travel (expecting frequent business trips internationally)

·        Design skills in presentation slides and methods an advantage


Problem-solving skills:

·        Analyzing and summary skills for information in great volume

·        Consolidation and categorizing of important information from meetings

·        Creative problem-solving skills

·        Able to draw effective conclusions and/or proposals from past experiences

 

 

Interactions/ interface:

·        Mainly CEO of Asia

·        Frequent interactions with internal stakeholders (platform leaders & employees functional units etc) relating to management and daily operations

·        Frequent interactions with external stakeholders (partners customers etc) in regard to business opportunities partnership management and relations maintenance

  • Must develop and execute optimal category strategy pricing promotions range availability and cost prices to expand both sales and margin
  • Ensure TiffinLabs brands has the best selection and prices in the market through product development and leveraging competitive intelligence
  • Work with operations to optimize cost supplier terms improvement secure supplier marketing and advertising spend develop new supplier incentive programs and ensure a reliable and operationally effective flow of goods to our kitchens

Job Title: Senior Associate| Procurement - Supply Chain & Operations| Business Consulting
Job Description:
As new markets open up and technology advances at a dramatic pace the world of supply chain and operations is becoming increasingly complex. At the same time clients understand just how vital effective sustainable operational management is to their global success. As a supply chain and operations professional you’ll use your analytical insight to drive our clients’ global business performance. Working as part of a high-performing team you’ll deliver exceptional client service and help leading organizations improve their planning design procurement sourcing manufacturing fulfillment operations and services processes.

We’ll support you with formal training to develop the skills and knowledge you need to solve some of the most complex business challenges around. And working as part of a truly integrated global network you’ll gain unrivaled experience across different geographies and sectors. So whenever you join however long you stay the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime.

The Opportunity

As a Consultant within the Procurement team for Supply Chain & Operations you'll contribute to one of the fastest-growing regions in the world.

Businesses need to continuously achieve and sustain performance improvement in a rapidly changing environment. As one of our performance improvement consultants you'll help many of the world's leading businesses and governments tackle their most pressing issues in particular about 3rd party relationships with Suppliers and Cost Management of 4rd party spend. Better cost management means that the savings achieved directly impact the bottom line.

At EY we know it's your point of view energy and enthusiasm that make the difference.

Your Key Responsibilities
  • Working together with local/regional teams to supervise implement and deliver solutions like:
    • Procurement Operating Model
    • Procurement Transformation
    • Spend Analysis
    • Sourcing and Savings Delivery
    • Procurement Technology (Ariba SAP Emptoris and etc.)
  • Working in a fast growing and challenging environment with like-minded people across the region
  • Delivering large-scale complex supply chain management and transformation projects with a focus on Procurement and cost savings programs
  • Working with client organisations to enhance Procurement process and performance through the implementation of Procurement Technology
  • Assistance to the Project Manager in delivering proposals and projects
  • Building relationships with external clients and internal peers
  • Working in a collaborative team analysing client issues and developing solutions
  • Prioritizing objectives and contributing to project planning and status reporting
  • Anticipating and identifying risks and raising issues with senior members of the team
  • Working in multi-disciplinary teams in the delivery of high quality services consistently and with proven global methodologies and tools
  • Support the development growth and maintenance of large global accounts and strategic clients across Asia-Pacific

Skills And Attributes For Success
  • Tactical and process oriented problem solving
  • Strong professional experience in Procurement functions

To Qualify For The Role You Must Have
  • Bachelor degree in Supply Chain / Engineering (or equivalent) discipline
  • Added advantage of having experience of using Procurement related technology (Ariba SAP Emptoris Coupa Bravo SAP SRM etc.)
  • Strong analytics computer skills and knowledge of Excel is required
  • Strong communication presentation and powerpoint skills
  • 2+ years of professional experience in the Procurement function such as:
    • Sourcing
    • Contract / Tender Management
    • Category Management
  • Experience in leading and supervising projects/project team members
  • Strong commitment to professional client service excellence
  • Ability to develop present new ideas and conceptualise new approaches and solutions
Ideally you’ll also have
  • Excellent interpersonal relations and demonstrated ability to work with others effectively in teams
  • Superior verbal and written communication skills
What we look for

Highly motivated individuals with excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to prioritize shifting workloads in a rapidly changing industry. An effective communicator you’ll be a confident team player that collaborates with people from various teams while looking to develop your career in a dynamic organization.

What Working At EY Offers

EY offers a competitive remuneration package where you’ll be rewarded for your individual and team performance. We are committed to being an inclusive employer and are happy to consider flexible working arrangements. Plus we offer:
  • Support coaching and feedback from some of the most engaging colleagues around
  • Opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career
  • The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you

About EY

As a global leader in assurance tax strategy and transactions and consulting services we hire and develop the most passionate people in their field to help build a better working world. This starts with a culture that believes in giving you the training opportunities and creative freedom to make things better. So that whenever you join however long you stay the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime. And with a commitment to hiring and developing the most passionate people we’ll make our ambition to be the best employer by 2020 a reality.

If you can confidently demonstrate that you meet the criteria above please contact us as soon as possible.

Join us in building a better working world.

Apply today.

DSO National Laboratories (DSO) is Singapore’s largest defence research and development (R&D) organisation with the critical mission to develop technological solutions to sharpen the cutting edge of Singapore's national security. At DSO you will develop more than just a career. This is where you will make a real impact and shape the future of defence across the spectrum of air land sea space and cyberspace.


The Information Division focuses on capabilities and technologies that enables the SAF to harness and exploit information in the battlefield. Capability areas include cyber security data analytics and fusion artificial intelligence robotics autonomy manned-unmanned system teaming and vulnerabilities assessments and operations research. In the Software Lab we provide expertise in developing software systems for Data Fusion Data Analytics Unmanned Platforms C2 and Simulation. We also provide a knowledge base for software systems development software engineering processes and software methodologies.


People are DSO’s greatest asset. You will get to realise your career aspirations and develop your own niche either as a deep technical expert or a leader in the team. With frequent career dialogues and a robust training and development framework we will provide you with the necessary development tools for you to reach your potential. You will also be recognised and rewarded through competitive remuneration packages and scholarship opportunities.


In this role you will:

  • Conduct operations research and analysis in the area of weapon effectiveness and target vulnerability (WETV) assessment
  • Understand and perform computer simulation modeling of weapon and target to capture their interactions
  • Conduct periodic data collection trials in the field for model validation


Requirements:

  • Masters/Bachelor's Degree in Mathematics and Computer Engineering / Mechanical & Production Engineering / Mechanical Engineering / Operations Research
  • Proficiency in C and/or C++ programming language
  • Experience with Computer Aided Design (CAD) software will be an advantage
  • Ability to apply OR modeling and analysis techniques for the purpose of WETV assessments
  • Good team player

Business & Technical Skills
  • Consistently demonstrates effective written and oral communication skills with a diverse group of associates including external parties and senior business leaders.

  • Demonstrates ability to effectively collaborate with others to meet shared objectives and develops relationships within the team other internal teams generally and with external parties including service providers.

  • Proficiency in Cantonese and/or Mandarin will be advantageous

About Global Precious Metals


Global Precious Metals is a niche player in the wealth management industry. The company services high net worth clients who want to allocate part of their portfolio to alternative assets including physical precious metals (gold silver platinum and palladium) as ‘wealth insurance’. The company has a diverse global clientele ranging from high net worth individual family offices investment funds and precious metals trading companies.


We are looking for a highly driven candidate who will support the Operations Manager in executing precious metals trades. The selected candidate will be part of a fast-growing business lean structured & dynamic team and report directly to the Operations Manager. The overall objective of the Operations team is to execute seamless trades through optimum utilization of business assets and strengthen the company’s reputation as a reliable trading partner.


You will be responsible for supporting the end-to-end trade process and assisting in the assessment and implementation of trading strategies. Your work will also involve securing in-depth knowledge of the financial markets performing trend analysis and assisting in the design of the risk management framework.


Core Responsibilities:


• Support in trade execution and ensure accuracy of trade reconciliation

• Execute trading strategies with precision

• Assess performance of existing trading strategies

• Track market development interpret quantitative research / market reports to improve trading strategies

• Assist in devising hedging strategies and actively seek approaches to limit exposure to safeguard the company’s assets

• Report trades and outstanding unprocessed trades periodically

• Perform trade and position reconciliation

• Liaise with physical trades stakeholders (refiners metals desks vaults and logistics) to facilitate execution of physical trades

• Process inbound-outbound shipments of precious metals


Requirements:


Qualifications and experience:

• Minimum 2 years of experience in business operations; at best within precious metals / commodity trading

• Trading experience is a must; applicants with non-trading professional background but demonstrable personal experience will be considered

• Bachelor’s degree in STEM Economics Finance or Business


Skills and expertise:

﻿

• Expert level with MS Excel and proficient with Bloomberg

• Excellent analytical skills and an affinity for numbers

• Strong business acumen and an affinity for financial markets

• Knowledge of financial instruments in the commodities space

• Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and work well under stress

• High level of reliability professionalism and respect for confidentiality

• Rigorous sense of organization and keen eye for details

• Effective communication skills both with team members outside of the trading space and with senior management

The Operations Manager is responsible for the day to day operations of the company. The position involves working with the Managing Director and Financial Controller on all aspects of the operation to ensure the efficient an effective operation of the Company.

Job Description
  • Manage local business function operations of the company including production logistics.
  • Leading the day-to-day operations of production logistics and laboratory.
  • Work with department heads in China to set implement and monitor objectives and strategies to meet the strategic direction of the company as set by the Managing Director.
  • Work with contractor and implement procurement policies to ensure the company has access to the best rates and quality service providers.
  • Work with Business Units to enhance service offerings for key customers and suppliers to drive volume and establish competitive advantage for our recycling business.
  • Ensure compliance with company standards including proposals costing of proposals operation of programs and day-to-day office operations.
  • Evaluate the production structure and make recommendations to the MD for continual improvement of the efficiency and effectiveness of the production and logistics team.
  • Oversee all large-scale programs in Singapore.
  • Work with MD on suggesting improvements to both short- and long-term planning for the Company.
  • Conduct quarterly reviews for all departments to ensure all targets are being met.
  • Manage the renovation of the new factory.
  • Safety management duties including fire safety and Covid-19.
  • Oversee employee hiring training development and management.


Job Requirements
  • At least Diploma Certification in any related field.
  • Minimum 5 years’ experience in manufacturing environment.
  • Bilingual in English and Fluent Mandarin in writing and speaking to communicate with our Chinese counterparts.
  • Excellent analytical skills for program costing budget development and strategic planning.
  • Proven ability to provide leadership by managing directing and motivating office staff towards their goals.
  • Proven ability to provide leadership for challenge resolution to facilitate timely improvements and improved working relationships.
  • Proficient on computer programs needed for position such as: Word Excel and PowerPoint.
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and within deadlines for programs proposals meetings and employee needs.
  • Ability to prepare reports and business correspondence develop and write proposals.
  • Strong quality orientation and attention to detail.

RESPONSIBILITY AND ACCOUNTABILITY

  • To ensure job planning and execution are efficient and cost effective through proper mobilization of the logistics and resources of the company such as test equipment and manpower. Ensuring the effectiveness of laboratory activities.
  • Manage recruitment training performance appraisal and disciplinary measure to ensure good working environment for all Test Engineers Assistant Test Engineer and Test Technicians.
  • To ensure company’s testing works to be carried in accordance to the procedures and instructions as defined in the quality documents.
  • To observe all safety procedures for the equipment and working team at all times while traveling and at the testing sites.
  • Build good customers relationship by ensuring competent projects delivery managing customers’ queries and feedback.
  • Responsible for controlling maintaining and rectifying all test equipment and accessories to a state of good working order in a timely manner by adhering to the documented procedure.
  • Responsible to ensure all testing equipment tools accessories and vehicles are properly handled by Test Engineers at site and to ensure their cleanliness and proper storage. Working closely with all the Test Engineers Assistant Test Engineers and Test Technicians in equipment control and maintenance.
  • Attend to damaged or malfunctioning equipment and vehicles; ensuring they are restored to good working condition in a timely manner. Responsible to report to the Quality/Human Resource Manager on any damages or loss of equipment/vehicles.
  • Responsible for the verification program of hydraulic jacks and hoses in a timely manner.
  • Assisting in the scope of calibration and ensuring the compliance to equipment calibration program.
  • Accountable for the workshop’s contents and safeguard of company’s assets against misappropriation and misuse.
  • To maintain a master list of all equipment accessories and vehicles in the store for stock checking and auditing.
  • To maintain a proper record of the movements of all testing equipment accessories and vehicles including safety equipment in the store.
  • Ensuring that the store is always tidy and easily accessible whilst enabling all personnel to be able to identify any required equipment whenever needed.

The Consumer Operations Manager (APAC) is responsible for operational leadership service excellence and admin support along the policy admin value chain for the A&H & IPL business segments. The role focuses on:
• Leading / defining the Operational Strategy to improve efficiency/effectiveness - bringing better customer experience and business outcomes via people / process / technology.  Own the end to end customer journey and be a key conduit for defining requirements and provoking change / digitization.
• Drive Service Excellence to ensure our Consumer and Digital channels operate in a cost-effective / resilient manner and that we continually expand our post-acquisition omni-channel offerings to enhance the customer experience.  Improve Persistency and PCI standards.
• Consumer Support activities including but not limited to the reporting of service metrics managing complaints and the set-up of new campaigns. In addition help with business analysis quality assurance audit resolution and the roll-out of COG/regional priorities.
Key Responsibilities:
1. Operational Strategy (~40% focus)
• Develop and own the operational strategy for A&H and IPL – improving efficiency / effectiveness and bringing better customer experience and business outcomes via people / process / technology. 
• Own the end to end process design / customer journey and be a key conduit for defining requirements and provoking change / digitization. Develop the target state flow / North Star model and provide the challenge (and ultimately requirements) around how we get there
o Examples include driving paperless self-service / omni-channel capabilities developing more thoughtful customer touch points and developing the North Star strategy around digitization/STP (via e-App quote processing e-Policy payment MTA’s / Renewals etc).
• Help review change requests (as needed) to ensure clear cost benefit understanding is provided and join/lead governance forums as needed. Recommend Automation / Innovation
• Identify and challenge variations around set-up and ways of working to aid improvement.
2. Service Excellence (~40% focus)
• Oversee all customer service (Analog & Digital) complaint handling and conservation for Consumer Lines and any business referred from digital/market facing systems. 
• Own the delivery of high-quality day-to-day service (aligned to customer expectations + market norms) and the maturing of operational standards insights and quality assurance
• Drive service excellence within country operations teams who provide customer service admin support and payment processing along the Consumer value chain. 
• Champion segment specific Customer Experience and work closely with CX & Metrics colleagues to drive insight and action.  Be a thought leader around customer measurement and feedback management.
• Demonstrate an improving NPS metric and customer satisfaction (external & internal). 
• Improve Persistency and PCI standards.
3. Consumer Segment Support (~20% focus)
• Share operational best practice across the region in terms of operating models process automation/robotics process re-engineering digitization and offshoring. 
• Ensure the foundations of roles & responsibilities plus appropriate measures exist to prompt the desired outcomes / thinking / ways of working.
• Provide convenient and value add insights around service and quality metrics and follow up to resolve issues. Produce regular reporting to stakeholders of achievements versus targets.  Diagnose underperformance and implement remediation plans.
• Supporting the set-up of new campaigns.
• Provide ad-hoc business analysis and project management to support change.
• Work with Application Champion(s) to drive adoption training and process / procedural best practice amongst system users
• Support audit point resolution and remediation as required.
• Lead the roll-out of relevant COG/regional priorities within the Consumer operation.
 Plus other duties projects or functions assigned by the Regional Head of Operations APAC and relevant senior segment stakeholders.
As a leader of people ensure individual team members are coached / developed and that they are equipped with the right skills and resources. Establish an environment that promotes Chubb Values and builds high levels of motivation morale and integrity.

We have the vision of a world where each day is safer and more secure than the one before. These aren’t easy goals to accomplish – but we’re not here for easy. We’re here for better. We are a company built on the foundation of challenging and disrupting the way things are done and we’re looking for innovators who are as committed to shaping the future of cybersecurity as we are.

Job Description

The Manager Cloud Customer Success is focused on ensuring our customers’ success driving growth/adoption of our technology as well as boosting renewals and gleaning strategic insights that improve our product value. This is an exciting opportunity to unequivocally influence our customers and Palo Alto Networks success. Reporting to the Director Customer Success the Manager Cloud Customer Success role will lead a team of CSMs managing strategic and enterprise customers/accounts.
This role requires exceptional customer relationships team building deep management and demonstrated coaching skills a motivational style and analytical skills. We are looking for someone who is truly passionate about customer advocacy and team development and has a proven track record to talk about! Additionally you will have a focus on quality management; foster an environment of innovation and high accountability and demonstrate the ability to drive continuous operational improvement as a way of working and managing. Are you a person by nature that is a conservative risk-taker with a high level of ambition and thrive in an environment of change?

Your Impact
  • Manage your team to develop delivery plans that maximize the customer experience and achieve higher product adoption customer satisfaction and overall health scores
  • Leading a team Customer Success Managers; assisting the team with key escalations and where required the production of best practice blueprints for the portfolio of customers
  • Measure effectiveness of Customer Success Managers ensuring the team delivers on Key Operational metrics including Customer Health - Green/Yellow/Red Adoption (Consumption & Usage) Reference-ability Renewal Likelihood Upsell / Cross-Sell Potential and % Retention / Renewal
  • Create cadence for review within the team to drive premier programmatic Customer Success practice
  • Attracting hiring and retaining a group of Customer Success Managers attract high potential individual contributors into the team ensure rapid onboarding process for new team members foster collaboration within internal teams and across the customer lifecycle
  • Working closely with Sales reps and Renewals managers to identify new opportunities and upsell potential
  • Increase the lifetime value of the Customer through greater advocacy and reference-ability; serving as a customer advocate in the evolution of our products and platform functionality integral to the customer's success
  • Engage broadly across the Customer organization from management through to C-Level/Influencer as required
  • Ensure customer feedback is clearly captured and conveyed internally to enable ongoing improvement of products and services
  • Actively assess the interactions with our top customers (product performance depth and breadth of usage Support experience)

Qualifications
  • Demonstrated trajectory of success with people-management coaching and up-leveling and amplifying team competencies
  • Ability to manage influence through persuasion negotiation and consensus building
  • Deep business operations expertise; has solid experience with SFDC Gainsight and adept with creating reports and dashboards is highly preferred
  • Ideally combined background of post-sales sales consulting services experience
  • Strong empathy for customers AND passion for revenue and growth
  • Deep understanding of value drivers in recurring revenue business models
  • Analytical and process driven mindset
  • Demonstrated desire for continuous learning and improvement
  • An enthusiastic and creative leader with the ability to inspire others
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills
  • Strong leadership skills with validated ability to influence inside and outside of the organization at the highest levels to garner support
  • Demonstrated success at skillful negotiation and strategy implementation
  • Able to balance providing extraordinary service with the need to improve financial performance and increase revenue and profits
The Team
Our technical support team is critical to our success and mission. As part of this team you enable customer success by providing support to clients after they have purchased our products. Our dedication to our customers doesn’t stop once they sign – it just evolves. Our technical team provides behind-the-scenes support to meet our customer’s needs. As threats and technology evolve we stay in step to accomplish our mission. You’ll be involved in implementing new products transitioning from old products to new and will fix integrations and critical issues as they are raised – in fact you’ll seek them out to ensure our clients are safely supported. We fix and identify technical problems with a pointed focus of providing the best customer support in the industry.

We’re a fast-growing immensely successful organization because of our people and products (built and supported by our people). We work the frontlines against cyberthreats and attacks protecting everyday transactions in the digital environment. It means we’re good at scaling quickly to new threats get fulfillment from resolving new problems and think about things just plain different.

Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Job Description

You will assist in developing policies and procedures to ensure smooth and seamless integration of operational services among the departments at SingHealth Radiology. You will direct and assist the RSS Office in service execution based on approved and prescribed policies and procedures.

You will support in strategic planning projects execution and harmonisation of operational functions in Radiology departments to achieve a high level of operational efficiency and service delivery. You will monitor evaluate and report progress outcomes to assess success rate of initiatives/programmes and replicate best practices to other Radiology sites where necessary.

You will work with Radiology departments and Radiological Sciences Academic Clinical Programme (RADSC ACP) on data collection and analysis. You will assist and/or supervise staff in administrative work these include putting up approval papers to SingHealth senior management and/or MOH attending meetings and providing secretariat support when required. You will also assist to put up the workplan and budget for the operational needs in running RSS. You will also set the team’s direction assign tasks to subordinates as well as provide guidance and set work priorities when necessary.

Description

Gigamon’s Partner Success Program Manager will help grow and manage our Services’ Channel partners in providing global coverage in service and support to our mutual customers. They will be instrumental in helping ensure we provide the highest quality customer experience wherever and whenever our customers need us through the successful enablement of our Global Services’ Channel Partners.

The program ensures Gigamon’s global network of channel partners that seek to join the program are assessed and if acceptable authorized to meet the standards of the program. They will then be reviewed on an ongoing basis to ensure they deliver an exceptional level of first- and second-line technical support expert consulting services and incident response security consulting to their end customers. It will also ensure that Gigamon’s partners add value in the end-to-end service delivery chain.

The successful candidate will be well versed in all aspects of delivering high-tech services to global organizations directly or via partners. While the majority of the collaboration will be done remotely the candidate should be prepared for some travel within region/globally as required. This position reports to the VP of Global Services.

Responsibilities
  • Identify and engage key partners with critical technical skills service capabilities customer relationships and geographical coverage.
  • Assessment of new partners service capabilities including;
  • On boarding processes for new customers including documentation and process review
  • Review of a partner’s current systems processes and capabilities.
    • Understanding how the partner will incorporate Gigamon into current infrastructure.
    • Analyzing a partner’s processes and systems and developing improvement plans as needed.
    • Review of partners metrics and financial performance including quality of technical escalations and customer satisfaction.
  • Review of the partner’s service review processes.
    • Understanding what customer satisfaction reviews are delivered as part of the partners’ service offerings.
    • Determine how the partner understands and measures their service performance.
  • Reviews with existing partners at senior management and operational level
  • Point of focus for partner feedback within Gigamon Global Services for partner related questions and issues including gaps relating to case handling implementation issues security consulting challenges and technical competency.
  • Developing service metrics and reporting on overall performance in region using different tools such as Salesforce reporting Domo Power BI etc.
  • Managing individual partner opportunity related queries including:
    • Salesforce and system related issues
    • Program discounting and non-standard opportunity discounts
    • Questions about how to process an individual opportunity
  • Representing the program in the Gigamon community
  • Develop strategic partnerships and align available resources to support a successful sustained relationship that stimulates long-term revenue growth and success for Gigamon.

    • Qualifications
    • 3-5 years knowledge/experience of high-tech service/support industry specifically
    • Technical support & call center operations
    • Professional Services
    • Security Threat Hunting
    • Field service operations
    • Working with channel and service partners
  • Experience in a partner and/or vendor support model and strong understanding of that service relationship
  • Ability to develop and maintain positive working relationships.
  • English and Mandarin required additional languages are a plus.
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills.
  • Ability to develop and evolve programs and processes to support business requirements.
  • Good organizational time management interpersonal and presentation skills.
  • Exceptional problem solving critical thinking and decision-making skills.
  • Understanding of networking security or performance visibility technologies

Job Description

This position is responsible for managing the logistics customer service warehousing and distribution activities for One J&J Singapore across all the business. Singapore market’s annual business is around $150 Million. This position is responsible for ensuring superior customer experience adherence to compliance requirements and operational efficiency while managing the distribution costs. The individual will be responsible for overseeing the implementation of the Supply Chain strategy for Singapore geography to support the new growth models and new customer facing initiatives. The individual will supervise 4-5 direct employees and total team size of ~18 including indirect reportees in the above-mentioned area. He/She will interface with Deliver organization in the SEA and APAC regions for operations and capabilities support.

Duties And Responsibilities
  • Customer Service & Collaboration
    • Lead the Order to Cash Team for Singapore to ensure superior customer experience by ensuring perfect order delivery - Correct order entry On time delivery and place damage free with proper documentation for all sectors
    • Plan organize and direct staff in providing timely responses to customer inquiries and resolve customer issues
    • Proactively find collaboration opportunities along with commercial teams and customers to drive continuous improvement and build capabilities for Order to Cash processes.
    • Liaison with other functions like Marketing Sales Quality Assurance & Regulatory Affairs HCC and Procurement.
    • Initiate analyze and summarize and drive improvement action plans from annual customer survey results for management
  • Warehouse & Distribution
    • Develop implement and administer systems procedures and processes and provide effective warehousing & distribution services to meet customer service levels
    • Oversee all the activities related to physical movement of product - freight customs warehousing order processing and transportation.
    • Manage 3rd Party Logistics providers and distributors.
    • Ensure all logistics operation comply with FCPA HCBI SOX guidelines Trade Compliance and J&J Quality standards.
    • Accountable and Responsible for Inventory Accuracy at all warehouse operations
    • Accountable for value added services performed by the 3rd logistics provider like repackaging promotional banding relabeling kitting etc.
    • Accountable for management of overall Distribution costs and CIP targets.
    • Manage freight spend audits freight bills for overcharge / discrepancies.
    • Develop and monitor key performance measures like Perfect Order Distribution costs etc.
    • Develop and manage relationships with our internal and external customers to ensure we are meeting their expectations
    • Participate in development of GTM strategy and implement the GTM initiatives.
    • Participate in tenders and negotiations with 3PL and distributor
    • Benchmark industry practices and implement improvements as appropriate
  • Ortho Kit Operations
    • Develop implement and administer systems procedures and processes in effective management of Ortho kit operations.
    • Work with commercial team and customer to understand evolving customer requirements and ensure service level is a competitive advantage in the marketplace
    • Ensure efficient and error free operations to ensure reliable customer service
    • Advance technology & innovation in streamlining of operations
    • Work with regional & global counterparts to leverage best practices and ensure robust quality compliance
  • People Development
    • Develop the overall team annual goals & objectives as well as individual direct report goals & objectives
    • Builds talent within the team to ensure growth and build talent pipeline for critical roles
    • Ensure that the team members receive appropriate training and development opportunities to advance their careers

Details of the Division and Team: 

The EPC Service Operations team are responsible for the day to day support of the end users platform for the banks global Email Productivity and Collaboration environment. The main tasks of the SMTP SME / Operations Specialist is the daily operation and maintenance of the SMTP backbone and associated Infrastructure.   • Working with internal Teams and external Vendors

  • Raise and implement changes for both your own tasks and those from Engineering
  • Act as the point of contact for vendor supported Exchange environment for escalations
  • Sanity check any changes to the environments
  • Act as co-ordination point for projects taking ownership were necessary to ensure successful transition into production
  • Implementation of new initiatives handed across from Engineering
  • Troubleshooting in-house developed scripts

Job Title: National Operations and Customer Service Manager
Job Description:
World Courier

Our commitment to People Quality and Innovation means we deliver career opportunities that few others can match. From our beginnings 50 years ago couriering time sensitive high importance documents to today’s cutting edge logistics solutions for Cell & Gene Therapies that save lives we now have over 3000 employees at 140 offices in more than 50 countries worldwide and are part of Fortune 10 corporation AmerisourceBergen.


POSITION SUMMARY:

The incumbent is responsible for managing both the Customer Service and Operations departments overseeing operational activities of each team relating to import export and domestic operations of World Courier Singapore and controlling offices. To plan and ensure operational quality services are provided. And to provide information and advice on operational and customer service matters to relevant business unit to enhance the effectiveness of the organization. He/she will represent World Courier on all internal meetings and on Customers call/meeting as required as subject matter expert for Customer Service and Operations.


PRIMARY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Ensure productivity of teams is maintained and constantly look for areas of improvement to drive efficiently in each department.
  • Structure resource properly and develop his/her teams to adhere to company standards at all times
  • Proactively and consistently monitor activities across teams to  shipping and delivery requirements are being met.
  • Develop and maintain an ethos of continuous improvement
  • To assist Business Development in Project management and implementation
  • Support Sales functions by attending meetings with clients and providing operational information as required.
  • Hold daily/weekly/monthly meeting and reporting of the same as required
  • Ongoing intervention and negotiation with airlines endorsed agents to ensure optimal service. 
  • To develop and to maintain SLA with suppliers contractors and agents (operations).
  • Monitor and review staff Key Performance Indicators (“KPIs”).
  • Conduct performance appraisals for all direct reports.
  • Manager poor performance by training supervising feedback and coaching.
  • Ensure cross training and periodic role-rotation of staff.
  • To develop implement and update SOP.
  • Maintain awareness of all temperature controlled and special shipments.
  • Oversee and ensure the smooth passage of shipments through customs and quarantine.
  • Mentor and develop the operations team to ensure that employees are motivated and have the skills to achieve their potential.


SECONDARY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Prepare and issue detailed and accurate monthly reports to Country Manager/Director on Operations issues and development updates.
  • Support Sales functions by attending meetings with clients and providing operational information as required.
  • Carry out special projects as directed by Country Manager/Director.
  • Provide supplementary telephone support to operational staff when needed.
  • Any other assessments


EXPERIENCE AND EDUCATIONAL REQUIREMENTS:

  • Bachelor degree in related field with 5 - 10 years proven experience in Operational management
  • Good communication and influencing skills
  • Commercial and Customer focus.
  • Ability to manage and develop relationships and to negotiate at levels of management.
  • Good understanding of Supply Chain Management including logistics practices JIT inventory control systems ordering systems information technology etc.
  • Strong English (written and spoken) comprehension and communication is essential.


MINIMUM SKILLS KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITY REQUIREMENTS:

Mandatory

  • Proficient in Operations structure functions
  • Clear communication - English both spoken and written.
  • Must be comfortable in conducting training.


Desirable

  • Familiarity with traditional and modern training methods (e-learning workshops).
  • Ability to plan multi-task and manage time effectively.
  • Project management organization and planning skills.
  • Strong writing and record keeping ability for reports and training manuals.
  • Positive disposition.
  • Ability to work as team player and independently.

Job Profile Summary

One of your critical roles will be to lead the Customer Fulfilment and Retention Teams while managing Customer Service related projects. You are also required to have an oversight to monitor and improve Contact Centre related performance and processes. Ensure Knowledge Management system remains up-to-date and relevant for staff. Constant review of the workflows and processes for effectiveness and efficiency. Through these you are to deliver the company’s strategic objective of improving customer experience.

You will also create and run regular quality assurance audits/trainings for teams while coordinating Risk assessments to ensure customer satisfaction and mitigate risk factors resulting in the company’s financial or reputational loss. You are expected to work closely with internal stakeholders and external vendors to stream-line existing workflows and develop innovative solutions/platform integrations to meet rising customer expectations in an increasingly connected digital world.

Job Description

Customer Fulfilment & Retention Teams
  • Lead the Customer Fulfilment & Retention teams and support them in handling escalated complaints. Follow up with the team on any issues that we are unable to resolve.
  • Work with relevant departments to set clear roles of the Customer Fulfilment and Retention Teams.
  • Create and maintain Operational workflows and documents such as Standard Operational Procedures Training Guides Scripts FAQs periodic reports and adhoc analysis.
  • Run regular quality assurance audits/trainings for the teams to ensure customer satisfaction and mitigate risk factors resulting in the company’s financial or reputational loss.
Oversight of Contact Centre
  • Monitor the Key Performance Indicators delivered by Contact Centre and identify areas that can be improved. This include Operational and Quality performance measures.
  • Coordinate with various departments to ensure updates to various touch-points are delivered in timely manner.
  • Constantly review the processes for effectiveness and efficiency. Work with relevant sections to simplify and improve areas that may overlap in the process flow.

Projects & Initiatives
  • Coordinate and monitor projects initiated for Customer Service related areas.
  • Lead project planning sessions for gathering requirements and charting out timelines.
  • Work closely with internal stakeholders and external vendors to ensure necessary actions are being taken by relevant parties to meet project deadlines.
  • Generate periodic status reports as per agreed template and timeline to keep the appropriate stakeholders informed.
Service Recovery Lead
  • Lead the execution and monitoring of Customer service recovery exercises as and when such incidents occur.
  • Coordinate with various sections/departments to ensure smooth completion of the recovery. This includes but not limited to extraction of relevant data for analysis and tracking preparation of various scripts actual service recovery (calls sms email etc) and processing fulfillments (vouchers etc).
  • Prepare regular summary of the status of Service Recovery as per format and timeline as indicated by the Incident Committee.

Coordinate Reports
  • Coordinate with various sections within CM to ensure their reports are prepared and submitted within timeline.
  • Review and simplify reports across the Customer Interaction Support Service Centre and Contact Centre teams to ensure that trends can be monitored within the deadline. Streamline the format/look and feel to keep it simple and consistent.
  • Validate the accuracy of the reports by monitoring trends and anomalies.
  • Prepare a high-level summary of the performance across the sections in CM as per defined format. Study the trends and perform analysis on the performance and report the findings.
  • Prepare adhoc reports and analysis as and when there is a need.
Risk coordinator for Customer Interaction and Support (CIS)
  • Work closely with Risk and Compliance team to complete the risk registers.
  • Coordinate with relevant departments to ensure the risk/compliance elements are closed.


Who We Are Looking For

  • Able to clearly articulate processes frameworks and new developments
  • Empathetic and customer-centric
  • Adaptable to fast-paced and ever-changing work situations
  • Enjoys developing and growing talent within the team
  • Creative and resourceful to overcome challenges and objections faced in order to reach targets

Job Title: Operations| Regulatory & Control Operations - Position Regulatory Reporting| Analyst/Associate| Singapore
Job Description:
Who We Are

Goldman Sachs is a leading global investment banking securities and investment management firm that provides a wide range of services worldwide to a substantial and diversified client base that includes corporations financial institutions governments and high net-worth individuals. Founded in 1869 it is one of the oldest and largest investment banking firms in the world. The firm is headquartered in New York and maintains offices in London Bangalore Frankfurt Tokyo Hong Kong and other major financial centres around the world. We are committed to growing our distinctive culture and upholding our core values which always place our client's interests first. These values are reflected in our Business Principles which emphasize integrity commitment to excellence innovation and teamwork.

OUR IMPACT
Operations is a multi-faceted division that partners with all areas of the firm to deliver banking sales and trading and asset management capabilities to clients around the world. Alongside this vital service delivery role Operations provides essential risk management and control preserving and enhancing the firm’s assets and its reputation.

The Regulatory Operations Reporting & Monitoring team responsibilities include re-engineering implementing control/risk management improvements as well as partnering with the Business Project Management and IT to ensure that order trade transaction and position reporting to various exchanges and industry related self regulatory organizations is complete and accurate. This role requires an energetic individual that can liaise with various groups supporting our regional businesses to analyze our regulatory reporting and monitoring control infrastructure and the rules and operational/technical processes strategically. This is accomplished by working with the various business partners on project and production responsibilities to improve and maintain the quality of the firms regulatory reporting.

YOUR IMPACT
We’re looking for a professional individual who wants to apply their financial market knowledge and further develop their understanding of a growing sector of the financial markets at the heart of regulatory reform. With the continued high rate of change in the regulatory reporting space Regulatory Operations professionals have the platform to significantly impact their environment and the wider business.

Launcho Ventures is a Singapore-based venture studio and a pioneer of the start-up studio model in South-east Asia. We seek to fund build and scale a portfolio of great consumer companies across the region.


As a venture studio Launcho prototypes new companies and assembles teams to scale the most promising ideas into independent ventures. Our goal is to build consumer companies that directly engage evangelize and enchant customers. It’s our sole focus and abiding passion


Our Launcho Program is at the core of our DNA. It is our team of amazingly focused and talented entrepreneurs that take ideas from 0 to 1. Each launcher plays the vital three-part role of

1) validating the concept to creation

2) generating meaningful traction and

3) building the founding team including ultimately finding a CEO to take the company “all the way.” Once a company is off the ground launchers have the opportunity to stay on as a co-founder and in a leadership role (eg. general manager) or to come back to the drawing board.


Who You Are:

  • You are insanely driven
  • You are no stranger to ambiguity. Actually… you thrive in it
  • You love challenges and solving problems
  • You know when to stop and structure thoughts and you also know when it’s time to take action and get it done.
  • You’re probably not a traditional “big company” person
  • You are a learner not a knower
  • You find workarounds when there is no work around
  • You’ve previously worked in business operations growth and/or been a General Manager


What You'll Get:

  • A peer-group of Launcho’s at our Venture Studio.
  • You’ll learn how to assess ideas grow ideas test concepts and ultimately become intimately familiar with the Launcho ideation/validation/launch process.
  • Ability to work across all areas of the company including product growth and business operations
  • Support from the Launcho platform (legal HR design IT engineering recruiting and more) to help compress the time it takes from awesome idea to meaningful company.
  • Access to the Launcho network of companies and relationships
  • One of the most unique and compelling opportunities to start an awesome company that will scale and create a ton of value in a very de-risked way.


The Catch:

Since this is a highly competitive position we ask that you

1) take a moment to write a cover-letter versus just firing in a blind application and

2) provide a one-page summary about the what area within the consumer space you are most passionate about and would add the most value to. This could include picking your favorite consumer brand and putting together a thesis on what demographic breakdown would be most appropriate for it why and map out a marketing plan for testing out that thesis in South East Asia/Asia (key messaging points demographics channels and how you would measure success)

Job Title: Officer| Operations Management Support| Global Markets Operations
Job Description:
About UOB

United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific Europe and North America. In Asia we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China Indonesia Malaysia and Thailand as well as branches and offices.

Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time we have been guided by our values — Honorable Enterprising United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right build for the future work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work consistently be it towards the company our colleagues or our customers.

About The Department

The Global Market function leverages our in-depth knowledge of markets to provide timely financial advice products and solutions to our clients. Together with our segment managers we manage our clients’ investment liability and risk management needs through a comprehensive suite of treasury products and services across multiple asset classes.

Job Responsibilities

Provide business management support to the Division Head and Global Markets Operations team in the following areas:
  • Preparation of business and functional management forum meeting pack and dashboards.
  • Preparation consolidation and dissemination of various control reports for the hub in Singapore and various locations supported.
  • Management and tracking of division budget headcount billings and other financial related matters.
  • Management and tracking of Service Level Agreements Authorized Signatories Audit activities.
  • Division co-ordinator and representative in various control agendas e.g. Anti-Money Laundering Operational Risk and Business Continuity Planning.
  • Other administration and ad-hoc projects or activities as required.


Job Requirements
  • Degree in Banking / Finance / Business
  • Experience and/or exposure to day to day running of a banking 0perations division
  • Experience and/or exposure to operational and financial aspects of a banking operations division
  • Good knowledge or experience of Global Market products would be preferred
  • Good working expertise in MS Powerpoint MS Excel and MS Word.
  • Strong interpersonal communications analytical and problem solving skills.
  • Ability to work under pressure to deliver results and meet tight timeline.
  • Dedicated self-driven and highly motivated.
  • Need to be versatile and adaptable to new and changing environments.
  • 1 - 2 years working experience in Banking. Global Markets experience or exposure would be preferable.

Finance & Operations Specialist


We’re an early-stage venture capital firm investing across Southeast Asia. Since 2011 the firm has invested in over 45 companies across more than 7 countries in Asia. The firm invests in internet & mobile startups across many sectors including e-commerce payments marketplaces mobile applications and SaaS platforms.

 

We’re going through unprecedented growth at the moment - new funds new portfolio companies new geographies and more folks in the team to help get us there. We are especially proud of our team and our story so far but we want to make sure we double-down on this so we continue to be the pioneers of Venture Capital in the South East Asia region and beyond.


Golden Gate Ventures is looking for a Finance & Operations Specialist that will be an integral support to the team and manage a broad range of responsibilities from financial management and accounting compliance and fund reporting. We’re looking for a highly motivated detail oriented numbers-loving person that can balance multiple priorities and meet deadlines. This position would be great for somebody that wants to grow into a specialist on venture funds. 


There will be lots of items thrown your way and we want somebody that can roll with the punches and learn along the way. We see this as a long term relationship and want this to be a role you can grow with within the firm. You’ll be at the forefront of the venture capital industry in Southeast Asia. 

 

What you’ll be doing


Finance

  • Manage tracking of expenses for the Fund Management company Fund and SPVs and budget reports.
  • Work closely with our fund accountants to reconcile and review the transactions (Management fee reimbursements GST and tax computation) 
  • Be responsible for tracking accounts receivable/payable and intercompany billing
  • Manage signing of documents and courier services required by the company
  • Ensuring documents are mailed out timely and tracking of shipment 
  • Assist with expense recording and reporting to the team
  • Apply creative and critical thinking to identify and implement ways of increasing the efficiency of financial and key operational management processes able to connect the dot between differents vehicles / funds


Fund Administration

  • Administration and organisation of financial and legal documents on hardcopy files and shared drive.
  • Update internal fund administration platform with monthly fund transactions (capital calls new deals valuations expenses etc.)
  • Liaise with fund accountants auditors tax agents and lawyers on all finance and operational matters.
  • Maintain KYC files in the appropriate folders of the company and safeguarding important documents in the company 
  • Perform necessary tax/compliance reporting relating to MAS FATCA CRS and any other regulations applicable to the fund.
  • Liaise with GGV portfolio support team investment team and portfolio companies to update portfolio company valuations on a monthly/quarterly basis
  • Maintain fund budget and cash forecast and assist in planning capital call schedules



Skills and Requirements


  • Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting or equivalent
  • 3-5 years of relevant working experience
  • Any experience with fund accounting and/or compliance a plus. 
  • Adept in navigating online applications and collaborative tools used by the team such as Dropbox Notion Google docs etc.
  • A hungry can-do attitude
  • Meticulous very detail oriented.
  • Willingness to find a solution without being told how to
  • Strong foresight; ability to think ahead and to prepare backup

  • Multi-tasking capabilities
  • Great communication skills both verbal and written
  • Self driven to work with a supportive flat oriented corporate structure
  • Show a personal excitement and enthusiasm for the local startup scene

 

Benefits for you

 

  • Exciting – You’ll get to work with a firm that’s investing in endearing startups in Singapore and South East Asia
