Job Summary

The Procurement Sourcing Specialist is primarily responsible for performing sourcing governance and due diligence review of low value sourcing projects to validate compliance against Singtel’s Group Procurement Policy and Procurement authorization limits.

To apply standard practices and processes in supporting one-off spot buying for goods or services in direct support of internal user. For simple to moderate requirements the person in this role will take the lead in providing fulfilment services for niche and/or client specific needs (i.e. local sourcing supplier diversity etc.). Included in the process are clarification and definition of end-user requirements formal bidding supplier selection contract negotiations and supplier management (tactical). The resource(s) in this role ensures the Company mitigates risk operates in a cost-effective manner delivers bottom line savings/cost avoidance for the firm all while following standard firm approved processes and practices. This resource also provides sourcing support services to Strategic Sourcing/Category Managers.

A working understanding of global sourcing and procurement operations/business challenges and the ability to translate them into solutions is crucial. Knowledge and experience in sourcing for indirect and IT commodities will be an advantage.

Responsibilities

Operational Responsibilities
  • Validate sourcing requests to:
  • ensure compliance against Singtel’s Group Procurement Policy requirements and Procurement authorization limits
  • ascertain that an appropriate level of competition has been achieve in the sourcing projects conducted by business stakeholders
  • Assess if there is opportunity for further cost reductions in sourcing projects. Negotiations may be undertaken directly by the Sourcing Specialist or in certain circumstances by business stakeholders with guidance from the Sourcing Specialist.
  • Guide business users on procurement policy and practices.
  • Review and analysis of user requirements. Determine best procurement strategy to meet the needs of the requirements based on defined practices/procedures
  • Identify and source potential suppliers based on the requirements provided by the Company.
  • Maintain productive working relationships with key users
  • Liaise with Strategic Sourcing/Category Managers to ensure alignment with broader strategy inclusive of establishing supplier agreements with suppliers meeting client requirements.
  • Report cost savings using established cost savings methodologies.
  • Follow client corporate policy on the use of master agreements and approval guidelines.
  • Complete reporting tasks to monitor supplier performance aligning to overall supplier management framework for the category. This includes monitoring and managing supplier deliverables against agreed SOW / milestones and work with end-users to take appropriate action in the event of delay / non-delivery.
  • Provide guidance on drafting statements of work (SOW) which adequately addresses user requirements and expectations of supplier.
  • Participate in continuous improvement projects
  • Report cost savings using established cost savings methodologies.
  • Product monthly portfolio reporting for client category managers


Requirements
  • Degree with at least 4 years of relevant work experience in a sourcing role.
  • Strong understanding of source to pay process.
  • Strong influencing collaboration and negotiation skills.
  • Ability to plan and prioritize work independently.
  • Strong customer facing and relationship building experience.
  • Working knowledge of contractual terms and conditions
  • Knowledge in the use of e-sourcing tools such as Ariba and systems such as SAP will be beneficial

It is also responsible for the implementation of customs and trade enforcement measures including those related to Free Trade Agreements and strategic goods.

You will play a key role in designing and optimising NTP’s process and operations to drive digital transformation in trade. You will collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to develop procedures and IT processes to achieve operational excellence.

Job Title: Operations Associate| Eastern Pacific Accelerator Powered by Techstars
Job Description:
As an Associate you will help build the next amazing batch of startups as they grow from early stage to venture-backed companies. From entrepreneurs to investors to mentors your network is about to explode. You will have the opportunity to sit in on mentor meetings – get to know the best entrepreneurs and investors in the city up close and personally. You will also have access to full involvement in Techstars social events with the founders and local community.

It's basically a chance to get amazing experience broaden your network in ways you could never imagine get exposure to some of the greatest up and coming companies and teams in the country. Historically most associates end up being employed by one of the teams or by someone they met during the span of the three months. Many also go on to build their own companies.

General Job Description

This role is responsible for the administrative duties and operational execution throughout the duration of the accelerator program. Logistics experience as well as familiarity with the early stage venture backed company ecosystem is preferred. A willingness to learn and comfort tackling new problems is a must. This role is a temporary full time position.

Duties And Responsibilities

  • Follow best practices and execute upon outlined content and curriculum of the program

  • Fits the Techstars culture (people-oriented adaptable supportive creative)
  • Bachelor's Degree from an accredited college or university
  • Authorized to work in Singapore.
  • Currently live in Singapore or would be willing to live here for the duration of the program.

Techstars is an investment and innovation group that connects entrepreneurs investors corporations and city governments to solve challenges across industries and geographies. We pioneered the accelerator program model in 2006 working toward our vision of a connected global economy of innovation.

Job Description

High Touch Operations Manager – Service Provider Networks

Ø High touch Operations Manager is a critical customer-facing role ensuring they receive premium-level service and managing customers’ business outcomes across the life cycle of Plan/Build/Manage and maximizing customer loyalty satisfaction through services delivery value proposition.

Overview
  • Understanding customer’s business priorities services delivery requirements identifying customers evolving needs (proactive vs. reactive) and align services portfolio thus driving services penetration opportunities.
  • Identifying customers’ operational challenges pain points best practices adoption inhibitors and connect with the right experts to drive customers' success. Discovering uncovered services support contracts to prevent potential services coverage leakages and minimize the business risk.
  • Building relationships to serve as Customers’ Senior Management focal point of contact in supporting Services value reinforcement and identify up-sell and cross-sell opportunities.
  • Executive Business Reviews (EBRs) meetings with key stakeholders and customer executives with the key performance indicators unique value proposition milestones and major projects business outcomes.
  • Key contribution to ARO (attach renew and overdue) renewal with services support mapping to customers' pain points and business outcomes.


Responsibilities
  • Identify build and maintain relationships with customers’ internal management.
  • Act as the single point of contact for operational issues.
  • Coordinate technical issues and customer needs.
  • Represent customer needs to post-sales support teams and applicable organizations.
  • Monitor incident management and problem management to ensure timely resolution (bi-weekly).
  • Follow up on open action items timely manner and ensure commitments are met.
  • Provide customers with updates on hot or escalated incidents.
  • Coordinate and conduct weekly conference calls to provide status reports to customers and present quarterly reports to customers with an analysis of customers' support needs.
  • Gain a deep understanding of customer operations processes and educate customers on processes and procedures.
  • Provide status reports to management.
  • Quarterly customer site visits to present operational incidents trending activities areas of focus customer satisfaction and gap analysis to the customer and internal personnel.
  • Project manage customer-facing projects and internal advanced service improvements.


Job Requirements
  • Minimum BS/BA degree or equivalent plus 5 - 7 years related customer-facing support experience project management experience or basic business experience.
  • Good presentation skills and comfortable presenting to senior management level at customer CXOs.
  • Thorough understanding of business processes and Service Provider environments.
  • Excellent ability to engage in cross-functional resources to solve customer issues.
  • Understanding of pertinent software applications used for reporting and researching.
  • Attention to detail a must. Ability to manage major incidents and high severity incidents under pressure situations.
  • Strong ability to utilize tools for customer experience and gap analysis and make recommendations to the customer.
  • CCNA or equivalent basic technical/networking knowledge and understanding of Cisco products and solutions.
  • Intermediate level understanding of project management and business acumen.
  • ITIL V3 Foundational or Exert Certification
  • Service Provider experience is highly desirable.

Alongside other members of a culinary management team food and beverage director is responsible for ensuring and maintaining a profitable restaurant with food quality and service that is in line with the company’s vision mission and values. They are responsible for ensuring smooth operational best service standards managing food costs upholding menu standards and controlling inventory. He / she is also responsible to ensure profitability of the restaurants by working with various stakeholders to create revenue generating ideas cost efficient initiatives and demonstrate efficiency in staff planning and management.


In addition to the above the food and beverage director is involved with all of a full-service hospitality establishments' day-to-day functions including staff management guest interactions office administration duties vendor communications and labor costs. They oversee the management of staff and may address issues that lower levels of management are unable to resolve. They are required to ensure that operational standards are met in regard to sanitation requirement and laws food storage and loss prevention.

He / she is required to work with a variety of staff members in a fast-paced environment. They must be excellent communicators with the ability to multitask and think quickly when under pressure. Just like many other positions in the F&B industry the job of food and beverage director may requires working long and perhaps erratic hours which may include nights weekends and holidays. Coupled with long hours there is a great deal of physical exertion expected of a food and beverage director.

About Us

We pride ourselves as the best and largest vertically integrated omni-channel women's fashion brand in the region. Founded in 2010 we have grown to 250 people strong proudly headquartered in Singapore with country offices in Indonesia and Malaysia and an omni-channel presence across these 3 markets. In addition to our retail franchise in Cambodia we ship internationally to 15 markets (Hong Kong China Philippines and Australia New Zealand US Canada Macau Japan Korea Vietnam Thailand Myanmar Cambodia & Brunei).

We are taking our definition of new female retail global with our sights set on becoming the most thoughtful brand for the everyday woman.

The Team

The Love Bonito team is a passionate dynamic innovative and fun-loving family. From fashion-lovers savvy marketers to tech whizzes we have a diverse team of talented individuals with one unified focus - our customer the Love Bonito woman. She is at the heart of everything we do and we pride ourselves in always taking an innovative data-centric yet considerate approach in creating the right experiences products and content for her. With big dreams and a grand mission we’re looking for great like-minded people to join us - people who are as passionate fearless and entrepreneurial.

If you’re looking for a dynamic no corporate-BS environment to learn grow and really make an impact we could be the perfect fit for you!

The Role

As a member of the International Sales team you will be part of the team responsible for the growth of Love Bonito’s long tail markets bringing the Love Bonito brand to new countries via a digital and franchise strategy. Reporting directly into the International Sales Manager you will play a pivotal role in shaping Love Bonito through this exhilarating phase.

You Should Have / Be
  • A good grasp of the Love Bonito brand and unique proposition
  • Self starter with the drive to work in a fast-paced ever changing high-growth organization
  • International exposure with an exceptional ability to create and maintain strategic relationships with partners from different cultures countries industries
  • A track record of extreme ownership and delivering tangible results
  • Solid project manager multi-tasker; ability to handle tight deadlines while being detail-oriented
  • Sales oriented and numbers driven; a strong drive to hit targets
  • The ability to work both independently and collaboratively with various teams
  • An appetite to learn and at ease with uncertainty; open to challenging projects outside your comfort zone


Main Responsibilities
  • Nurture the growth of long tail markets on the International website
    • Drive international e-commerce growth and customer journey by collaborating with Marketing and Product teams to constantly optimize the website with scalable improvements campaigns and localise content for our key markets
    • Set the vision and create alignment for the international website across cross-functional teams (i.e. Product Merchandising Performance Marketing Marketing)
    • Collaborate closely with the Product and Engineering teams to drive and amplify omnichannel sales via the right features
    • Collaborate closely with other cross functional teams (Research Operations Brand) to advise on high potential markets for expansion opportunities
    • Identify trends in the market and business practices to find ways to capitalise on the constant changing landscape
  • Kickstart strategic partnerships with other brands / distribution partners
    • Pitch Love Bonito to complementary brands or services and grow an ecosystem of like-minded brands
    • Grow and manage relationships partners across the region ensuring revenue and profit growth
      • Evaluate and improve the effectiveness and efficiency of the franchises’ day-to-day operation; roll out adoption of HQ systems and processes at franchise; Implement monthly business meetings with franchise partners to review performances and adjust action plans to reach our revenue target.
      • Grow and manage relationships with marketplaces and other distribution partners across the region; negotiate marketing visibilities and ensure the maintenance of our online store on the platforms and systems.
      • Onboard publishers through our Affiliate Network; generate revenue optimize content and review performances of our partners.
    • Collaborate with Data team to determine markets with franchise / other distribution model potential


Requirements
  • 2-3 years in business development strategy consulting investment banking or corporate strategy
  • BA/BS degree from top university in business economics communications or relevant fields
  • Superior communication and storyboarding skills via Google Slides or Powerpoint
  • High analytical numerate and proficient in Excel and other analytics tools (SQL a plus!)
  • Past experience with e-Commerce is a bonus


Benefits
  • Full corporate insurance
  • Staff discounts
  • A dynamic no corporate-BS environment to learn grow and really make an impact

lululemon athletica is seeking a highly capable leader who is passionate about developing others and connecting with the community as our Assistant Store Manager. The key objective of this position is to partner with the Store Manager to develop incredible leaders grow the business and positively impact the surrounding community.

What You Will Do

The role will combine the life-altering potential of wearing stretchy pants to work every day while talking health fitness and yoga to your guests and community. The assistant store manager is responsible for certain aspects of the store operations and the strategy and development of the team and community as determined by the Store Manager. They play a key role in ensuring that all areas of the business are fulfilled and that there is an exceptional level of education on the retail floor by training coaching and developing a team that delivers the lululemon guest experience. The assistant store manager also builds capabilities within the store team to drive strategy and achieve results for the business today and tomorrow. Our assistant store manager emanates the lululemon culture is a lover of fitness and sweaty endeavors and is committed to creating amazing experiences for those around them.

The life of our assistant store manager
  • Passionately leads and educates on our product community and culture on the retail floor and in the community
  • Takes a stand as an advocate for lululemon athletica’s values and guest experience
  • Oversees the execution of certain deliverables on the Manager ‘80/20 Checklist’ as delegated by the Store Manager. For example Inventory Product or Community Events
  • Present on the retail floor as a floor manager and Educator a minimum of 32 hours per week
  • Represents her/his store at all required meetings events and conferences under the direction of the Store Manager
  • Acts as a coach to Educators & Key Leaders and plays a hands-on roll in their development
  • Under the direction of the Store Manager or Regional Manager performs/completes other additional project duties and assignments as required and/or by request
What are the technical skills necessary to perform this role?
  • Minimum one year’s work experience in retail / sales management or an equivalent management role
  • Bachelor’s degree in business marketing retail or related field
  • Working knowledge of MS Office (Word Excel and Outlook)
  • Detail oriented and highly organized
  • Ability to multi-task and coordinate ongoing projects plans and people development
  • Works well under pressure and meeting tight deadlines
  • Love of brainstorming problem-solving being creative and resourceful
  • Positive attitude and contagious enthusiasm for lululemon community and people.
To Apply For This Position

If you are seeking a position in a company which fosters and supports health and fitness personal development growth change responsibility and overall success please submit your resume and cover letter directly to this posting.

NOTE: Only those applicants under consideration will be contacted. Please accept our utmost appreciation for your interest.

Dubbed an "open-source unicorn" by Forbes Confluent is the fastest-growing enterprise subscription company our investors have ever seen. And how are we growing so fast? By pioneering a new technology category with an event streaming platform which enables companies to leverage their data as a continually updating stream of events not as static snapshots. This innovation has led Coatue Management Altimeter Capital and Franklin Templeton to join earlier investors Sequoia Capital Benchmark and Index Ventures in the recent Series E financing of a combined $250 million at a $4.5B valuation. Our product has been adopted by Fortune 100 customers across all industries and we’re being led by the best in the space—our founders were the original creators of Apache Kafka®. We’re looking for talented and amazing team players who want to accelerate our growth while doing some of the best work of their careers. Join us as we build the next transformative technology platform!

The Enterprise Customer Success Manager will play a key role in driving Customer Success renewals and subscription expansion within our Enterprise accounts. You will be a trusted advisor to 10-30 customers where you help them to fully utilise the Confluent platform.

Key Responsibilities
    • Own the ultimate success of our Enterprise customers in your territory ensuring they realize the full value of the Confluent platform.
    • Meet/exceed quarterly renewal targets by proactively managing renewal portfolio and ensuring on-time customer retention.
    • Serve as primary POC for assigned customers in securing renewal - including activities from quotation to close.
    • Submit accurate and timely renewal sales forecast through SalesForce
    • Identify and collaborate with sales team regarding expansion upsell and additional service/support opportunities within accounts.
    • Coordinate the engagement of other Confluent resources (e.g. Customer Operations Sales etc.) to ensure ongoing customer success.
    • Meet and exceed daily and weekly call goals for providing touch points for existing customers to ensure proactive cadence (e.g. every 30-days).
    • Promote the use of Confluent features and technology Communicating ROI throughout the customer lifecycle to stakeholders of all levels
    • Maintain relationships with key users and decision makers at assigned customers keeping them connected to value being added by our products.
    • Analyze your portfolio identify risks and opportunities and prioritize for impact.. Act as the main owner to drive issues to resolution.
    • Champion and advocate for Enterprise customer requirements within Confluent.
    • Proactively identify issues/risks and escalate internally for prompt resolution.
    • Develop and nurture customers to become strong advocates on behalf of Confluent.
    • Champion and advocate for mid-market customer requirements within Confluent.
    • Contribute to continual improvements to our best practices for engagement value-add and renewal to meet long-term customer satisfaction and renewals goals.
    • Act as the voice of the customer and collect feedback to drive continuous improvement across all areas including product.
    • Up to 50% travel across APAC

Key Skills/Attributes
    • Highly motivated goal-driven outgoing inquisitive and customer-centric.
    • Honest and transparent partner to customers winning and keeping their trust.
    • Exceptionally well organized / detail-oriented with outstanding oral and written skills.
    • Technically competent with fundamental understanding of Confluent technology offerings and value proposition.
    • Experience tracking sales activities customer data and customer status.
    • Ability to multi-task across a high number of accounts at any given time.

Requirements
    • Bachelor’s degree
    • 5+ years B2B experience in an account management and/or sales role with proven quota attainment within global high-growth technology companies.
    • Significant experience in a Customer Success capacity with a track record of increasing customer satisfaction adoption and retention
    • Experience working with sophisticated enterprise clients
    • Chinese Fluency preferable
    • Salesforce experience.

Come As You Are

At Confluent equality is a core tenet of our culture. We are committed to building an inclusive global team that represents a variety of backgrounds perspectives beliefs and experiences. The more diverse we are the richer our community and the broader our impact.

About Us

Job description

Murex is a recognized global leader in software development for trading risk management and processing. Every day banks asset managers corporations and utilities across the world rely on Murex people and Murex solutions to support their capital markets activities. Our motto “pioneering again” sums it all up: since its creation Murex has reinvented itself time and again to adapt to capital markets revolutions – each time offering innovative software solutions to the industry.

Over 2300 specialists are located across our 17 offices: Beijing Beirut Dubai Dublin Hong Kong London Luxembourg Moscow New York Paris Sao Paulo Santiago Seoul Singapore Sydney Tokyo and Toronto

Staffing Activities For External Resources
  • Contract management for external resources
  • Manage the recruitment process (collecting job description & liaising with our partners)
  • Help to organize interviews for the partners' candidates
  • Keep track of feedbacks of selected or not selected candidates to maintain a database

JOB Requirements

Country: Central Singapore Community Development Council| Singapore
Job Description:
JOB PURPOSE:

  • Primary focus is to deliver an excellent customer experience by assisting customers with their queries. To assist team lead in handling customer’s issue report any compliant and resolve customer disputes if any.
  • Secondary is to ensure core system maintenance is updated promptly.
  • To carry out any other duties that may be assigned by the superior from time to time.


PRINCIPAL RESPONSIBILITIES:

1.  Customer Service

  • A point of contact to provide end to end (E2E) customer service
  • Handle issues escalated by customers and provide service/solutions.  
  • Tracking and follow up customers’ queries


2.  Provide consultation to customers on bank’s products/services’ specifications and assist customers on banking transactions such as:-


(a)  Account Opening Operation

  • Preparation of various business application form documents
  • Coordinate and work closely with Operation Team to complete customer’s queries
  • Meeting customer with Relationship Manager to provide onsite support.

 

(b)  Account Closure

  • Signature verification arrange closure of accounts and funds remittance.
  • Closure of CIF and archival of documents.

(c)   Pricing related tasks

  • Assist in tracking [approval of preferential interests rate and terms]
  • Assist in application/assessment [transaction preferences and customized operation procedures]
  • Assist [FX rate deals and Fixed Deposit interests rate negotiations]
  • Maintenance of special pricing


(d)  Transaction & Receipt

  • Support and assist business units/support team on:
  • Customer transaction information or notification of exceptions
  • Transaction processing tracking control inquiry advices etc.
  • Monthly statement or transaction advices
  • Fax transaction (Codefax)
  • Mail Handling (Statements MMAS)


(e)  Credit

  • Assist in credit limit and collateral calculation.


(f)    E-Banking Service

  • Applications amendment of and follow-up of e-Services (EB/MMAS/CODE FAX product application etc.)
  • Assist customers on e-Services related matters such as MMAS password reset MMAS resend etc.


Other ad hoc requests

  • Calculate break fund cost (Deposit/Loan)
  • Negotiate interest rate/FX rate on behalf of client


3.   System Maintenance

  • CIF Maintenance (e.g. address contact numbers etc.)
  • Account Maintenance
  • Retagging of RM code due to RM reallocation or staff movement.
  • Maintain and record customer service details and follow up matters in customer service system (I-Call).

4.   Audit Confirmation

  • Assist OMT in  customer’s audit confirmation preparation.


5.   Policy Procedure & Working Manual

  • To update and maintain team’s policy procedure & working manual whenever needed.


6. Report

  • Prepare Code Fax Daily Reconciliation and other Ad-Hoc Reports


KEY COMPETENCIES

  • Diploma / Degree Holder with minimum 8 years of relevant operational banking experience.
  • Understanding of banking products operations systems and procedures.
  • Understanding of regulatory and internal management reporting requirements
  • Strong team spirit
  • Good communication skills and tactful.
  • MS Office skills.

Summary

You will be part of a team setup dedicated to a major healthcare customer. You are responsible to manage an operational team to deliver cost effective operations whilst achieving the expected Key Performance Indicator (KPI) performance. You will also act as  the primary interface with the customer and to constantly strive to improve what we do from both a cost and service perspective.


Job responsibilities

  • Perform daily management of the operations (hands on approach)
  • Possess data driven approach to operational planning and resource deployment conducting labour planning and productivity monitoring to ensure maximized use of workforce
  • Perform Productivity management and tracking
  • Drive to improve operational performance (service and cost) and audit new processes to ensure robustness
  • Conduct analysis of errors made in warehouse operations and identify root causes
  • Review safe work environment aspects in the warehouse
  • Ongoing analysis of the asset usage (MHE and Warehouse Space) to identify ways to improve efficiency


Required skills and experience

  • Minimum 8 years’ managerial experience in forwarding industry (3PL environment)
  • Possess good analytical & consultative skills with an understanding of how to manage operations from a P&L perspective
  • Prior experience in building and leading a team of operational workers
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills
  • Flexible approach to working hours in view of operational requirements


Work location

Singapore Logistics Hub 10 Pioneer Crescent

(Company shuttle bus services available)


Good reasons to join

Logistics is a people business and here at Kuehne + Nagel we believe that genuine lasting success is possible only through valuing our employees the way we value our customers.
We offer the opportunity where you can learn and develop; to grow and perform to your fullest potential within a highly dynamic global work environment.


Our global logistics network cutting-edge IT systems in-house expertise and excellent customer service is proof of our dedication to be the market leader. These attributes have placed us at the forefront of our industry and positioned us to continue increasing the scope of our customer solutions and services.

 

Kuehne + Nagel Singapore is also the proud recipient of HR Asia's Best Companies to Work For in Asia in 2017 and 2019.

Job Title: Associate Partner| AP Supply Chain Management
Job Description:
Introduction
As a Business Sales & Delivery Executive you will support IBM’s consistent growth by bringing to the table your business development sales account management and delivery skills. Picture yourself working with a highly motivated highly successful team with a proven sales record in IBM’s top technologies. If you’re ready to bring insights and experience in areas such as IoT Blockchain and digital transformation we are ready to offer you a best in class career development.

Your Role and Responsibilities
An Associate Partner assigned to this position is expected to have the proven experience and knowledge in the area of Supply Chain Management Services including (Supply and demand management SCM transformation SCM Digital transformation Supply Chain Planning and Execution Sales & Operation’s Planning) needed to ensure the successful delivery of consulting services to an internal or external client leading to high client satisfaction. This requires the capability to oversee the largest and most complex services engagements in their area of expertise and to demonstrate an expert understanding of the appropriate methods and skills to be used. They are expected to contribute to the growth of intellectual capital within their practice area and to support the development of other consultants through participation in mentoring or coaching activities. They are expected to establish trusted long-term relationships with clients through engagement activities. They must also develop strong and trusted relationships with Project Managers and other team members on complex services engagements.

This position requires the skills needed to test hypotheses and conclusions leading to the development of innovative client deliverables in a manner that supports and reinforces effective teaming within the engagement. They are expected to identify new business opportunities and to provide strong assistance to IBM in the winning of that business. Must be familiar with the contractual requirements for their area of practice and be capable of drafting and reviewing responses to Requests for Information (RFI) responses to Requests for Proposal (RFP) IBM contracts and IBM statements of work.

This position is required to be client-facing assigned to client billable engagements more frequently than new business development. When not billing a client is expected to support bid and proposal activities within their area of practice and participate in related Sector Solution Area or Community activities.

Global knowledge sharing and management is key to IBM's success. Individuals will participate in and/or be responsible for the creation harvesting protection and reuse of IBM's intellectual capital in the area of Talent and Change Management. They will participate actively in knowledge sharing activities like communities of practice forums conferences and/or other knowledge exchanges.

Discharges basic management responsibilities and assumes additional responsibilities as assigned.

Drive growth of the Supply Chain and Procurement practice across Asia Pac. Focus in APAC to build IBM Intelligent Logistics offering (incl. WMS/TMS solutions) and drive IBM supply chain offerings in Life science & healthcare sector as well as support launch of B2B market place across APAC

Required Technical and Professional Expertise
As above

Preferred Technical And Professional Expertise

As above

About Business Unit

IBM Services is a team of business strategy and technology consultants that design build and run foundational systems and services that is the backbone of the world's economy. IBM Services partners with the world's leading companies in over 170 countries to build smarter businesses by reimagining and reinventing through technology with its outcome-focused methodologies industry-leading portfolio and world class research and operations expertise leading to results-driven innovation and enduring excellence.

Your Life @ IBM
What matters to you when you’re looking for your next career challenge?

Maybe you want to get involved in work that really changes the world? What about somewhere with incredible and diverse career and development opportunities – where you can truly discover your passion? Are you looking for a culture of openness collaboration and trust – where everyone has a voice? What about all of these? If so then IBM could be your next career challenge. Join us not to do something better but to attempt things you never thought possible.

Impact. Inclusion. Infinite Experiences. Do your best work ever.

About IBM

IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that progress is made through progressive thinking progressive leadership progressive policy and progressive action. IBMers believe that the application of intelligence reason and science can improve business society and the human condition. Restlessly reinventing since 1911 we are the largest technology and consulting employer in the world with more than 380000 IBMers serving clients in 170 countries.

Location Statement
For additional information about location requirements please discuss with the recruiter following submission of your application.

Being You @ IBM
IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race color religion gender gender identity or expression sexual orientation national origin genetics disability age or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

Manager CST (JAPAC)

The JAPAC Customer Success Team (JAPAC CST) is our team-based model for delivering world-class customer success (account management) at scale. As a team of 5 Customer Success Managers (CSMs) based out of APAC hub in Singapore we collectively manage 5000+ customers across the JAPAC region leveraging a mix of reactive and proactive customer programs.

Working directly with regional leadership this Manager will be responsible for managing a team of results-driven CSMs in a rapidly changing environment. This Manager will also be a key contributor to the long-term vision and strategy creating new initiatives to drive sustainable long-term customer value.

Responsibilities
  • Recruit coach and lead a team of Customer Success Managers (CSMs) partnering closely with Recruitment and internal local leaders to find excellent local candidates
  • Learn the ins and outs of of the CSM role at HubSpot
  • Manage day-to-day strategies and campaigns to build lasting relationship with customers meeting regional targets and in turn impacting global customer retention
  • Maintain a high level of team engagement and motivation by building confidence and trust in your direct reports.
  • Manage day-to-day operations goal setting career development performance management and growth of team members
  • Analyze customer and performance data to make informed decisions about strategic and operational changes and identify areas for innovation and improvement within JAPAC CST
  • Collaborate closely with JAPAC and Global CST counterparts to drive global alignment and results
  • Maximize efficiency in a constantly changing and growing environment where the process is fluid and creative and unique solutions are desired


Qualifications
  • 3+ years experience working with customers at a marketing software management and/or consulting company
  • 1+ years experience recruiting coaching and developing team members
  • Proven track record of delivering target in excess of company expectations and executing against bold growth strategies
  • Experience working globally with all levels of management in a transparent and proactive manner
  • Shown leadership ability to influence develop and empower employees to achieve their best
  • Excellent analytical skills to support problem-solving efforts and inform decision-making
  • Excellent verbal and written communications and experience communicating in small and large groups

Confidence can sometimes hold us back from applying for a job. But we'll let you in on a secret: there's no such thing as a 'perfect' candidate. HubSpot is a place where everyone can grow. So however you identify and whatever background you bring with you please apply if this is a role that would make you excited to come into work every day.

About HubSpot

HubSpot helps millions of organizations grow better and we’d love to grow better with you. Our business builds the software and systems that power the world’s small to medium-sized businesses. Our company culture builds connections careers and employee growth. How? By creating a workplace that values flexibility autonomy and transparency. If that sounds like something you’d like to be part of we’d love to hear from you.

You can find out more about our company culture in the HubSpot Culture Code which has more than 4M views and learn about our commitment to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace too. Thanks to the work of every HubSpotter globally who has helped build our remarkable culture HubSpot has been named a top workplace by Glassdoor Fortune Entrepreneur and more.

HubSpot was founded in 2006. We’re headquartered in Cambridge Massachusetts and we have offices in Dublin (Ireland) Sydney (Australia) Portsmouth New Hampshire Singapore Tokyo (Japan) Berlin (Germany) Bogotá (Colombia) and Paris (France) and a global remote community.

Neuron is the fastest growing micromobility operator in Asia Pacific and the leading shared e-scooter company across Australia and New Zealand. We partner with cities to connect people and places in a safe convenient and fun way. We are driven to help the world build a more prosperous and sustainable future through new ways of moving and connecting.

Neuron started the world's first scooter sharing platform in Singapore in 2016. We develop our own industry-leading e-scooters which are purpose built for sharing and safety. We also set the industry standard for technology that manages them. Neuron has launched an impressive range of world firsts particularly when it comes to safety. We currently operate in six cities (Brisbane Adelaide Darwin Auckland Canberra and Townsville) in the ANZ market and have recently also launched in the UK (Slough).


The Role

You will be reporting to the Head of Data. You would have the opportunity to bridge the critical gap between Product City Operations and Users directly impacting strategic business decisions.

What you'll do:

  • Partner with a cross-functional team (Engineering Design Product Customer Service) to ship major features and product improvements to grow the business.
  • Discover growth opportunities in the product from funnel conversion rates and user experience by exploring transaction data customer activity within apps and actual customer insights
  • Drives the prioritization strategy and focus on solutions to solve user problems
  • Work with the local markets and other functional teams (Customer Service Operations Marketing) to help identify and understand key roadblocks and opportunities
  • Surface key insights for product improvement and advise the product team on the feasibility of the features in pipeline
  • Understand the competitive landscape in various markets of play and spearhead the ideas on product differentiation


What you'll need:

  • Relevant 3-6 years of experience as a Data Analyst ideally exposure in two-sided marketplace e.g. ride hailing food delivery e-commerce is a plus
  • Experience working with product and engineering teams is preferred
  • Experience with these is a must:

    Python SQL web crawler Tableau
  • Agility to excel in a constantly changing and rapidly growing workplace
  • Someone with a keen interest in driving growth across cities of operations
  • A keen interest in shared mobility and a growth mindset is essential to this role


Our Values

Make It Happen - We are driven by results make commitments with integrity and consistently make an impact.

Be Proactive - We take ownership of tasks that help us build sustainable growth.

Trust Facts Over Opinions - Whenever possible we make the logical choice based on data and known truths.

Stay Curious - We embrace the habit of asking questions challenging assumptions and revisiting convictions.

Do More With Less - Profit allows us to continue serving our users. We must be efficient and resourceful.

If you are passionate about making a real-time impact and want the opportunity to play an instrumental part in our growth story we want you riding for our team!

Neuron Mobility is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to making all employment decisions including recruitment appointment and promotion decisions on the basis of business needs individual qualifications and merit.

The company prohibits discrimination and harassment of any kind. We are dedicated to the continued personal and professional growth of our employees. We protect all of our employees regardless of race nationality ethnicity politics sex sexual orientation gender identity social origin physical and mental disability religion or belief marital or domestic partnership status family or parental status and any other status recognised and protected by the law and regulations of where we operate.

The Assistant manager are required to assist daily duties in operations of the Reading Centre and support the team of grading staff.   • Track analyze and report performance indicators to senior management and key stakeholders

Scopely’s Singapore office is searching for an experienced strategic thinking creative executive who has a passion for gaming the ability to build and lead a team exceptional communication skills and strong industry contacts. This role will be expected to interact with 3rd party developers publishers and platformers throughout the South East Asia region as well as interface with Scopely Team members around the world.


Location & Reporting Line:


This position will be based in Scopely’s new office in Singapore. The General Manager will report to the Senior Vice President & General Manager for APAC based in Tokyo


What you will do:


This role will be instrumental in establishing and building our presence in South East Asia (defined as Singapore Indonesia Malaysia Thailand The Philippines Vietnam & India) one of the World’s most dynamic diverse and high growth gaming regions. The GM will manage all facets of the business from hiring and talent management to budgeting and financial forecasting. This role will also lead the execution of our core APAC strategic pillars of a) thoughtfully optimizing our global slate to compete in the local markets b) drive new local game development initiatives with best in class developers c) assist in the evaluation of potential investment and M&A opportunities. 


·      Hire and mentor World class talent create a work environment that unlocks their full potential and always lead by example

·      Plan and manage all local financial aspects of the business working closely with regional leadership as well as HQ in Los Angeles

·      Develop and maintain relationships with top SEA based game developers in order to identify new opportunities to create globally competitive innovative consumer experiences

·      Work closely with Scopely product leadership teams (known as ‘Clusters’) to determine which titles to focus on in SEA as well as how best to optimize the titles for local consumers

·      For both local and global produced titles continue to strengthen our marketing & live operations capabilities throughout SEA by leveraging both internal and external resources

·      Working with regional and global leadership drive investment and M&A evaluations from deal sourcing through due diligence and eventually closing



What you will need:


·      10+ years in mobile gaming developer partnerships and/or management

·      Proven ability to forge strong partnerships and drive deals from sourcing through closing

·      Deep knowledge of the local mobile gaming developer ecosystem; having an established network of potential partners is a big plus

·      Excellent communication skills both written and verbal

·      The ability to present to and influence senior leadership; you must be able to drive action and impact in a complex and fast-paced environment

·      Intellectual curiosity creative problem-solving acumen and drive

·      English fluency plus one additional language (i.e. Mandarin Malay Thai Tamil etc.)

·      A high level of integrity candor & humility

·      Respect for others and a collaborative spirit

·      Results driven a desire to win

About the Company:

Our client is a global fintech/blockchain company looking to strengthen Payments Operations team based in Singapore. You will be part of a fast-paced international team and have a unique opportunity to take big career leaps. 


Key Responsibilities:

You will be part of the broader Business Operations team responsible for driving payments and e-commerce initiatives across the group. These initiatives could range from process improvements to to strategic initiatives to system implementation and will enable key stakeholders to comply with the group objectives.


Your role will also assist with identifying business information requirements analyse the data and provide advisory on relevant solutions across various business metrics. In addition you will need to effectively communicate with both internal and external stakeholders of varied seniority to deliver critical business initiatives in a timely manner.


Key Requirements:

  • A university degree at undergraduate level or equivalent

About The Role

This role is for those who enjoy mining insights from the sea of data building data products and designing experiments with the ability to see the real-time impact of your contribution. You will get to work with insanely awesome and smart business leads and fellow analysts. Your work will impact how the senior leaders at Gojek shape strategies around millions of customers across South East Asia!

This is a maternity cover contract role.

What You Will Do
  • Design and analyze experiments
  • Perform exploratory data analysis using SQL and R/Python and present interesting findings to business stakeholders to drive business and strategic decisions
  • Build self-serve data products such as dashboards and tables to reduce time to insights
  • Perform more advanced analytics when needed (such as clustering using k-means or building regression model with R/Python)
What You Will Need
  • Should have at least 2 years of practical experience in SQL and R/Python
  • Prior experience with applied statistics and experimental design
  • Ability to convey a product insight through impactful graphs
  • Proven ability to recognize business needs and ability to communicate with multiple stakeholders including PMs business and operations
  • Balance attention to detail with swift execution
  • Bonus points for prior experience with solving supply/demand problem or causal inference methods for campaign effectiveness etc

About The Team

The Marketplace Analytics team uses experimentation and advanced analytics to help Gojek understand and optimise its supply and demand. The team has been involved in creating the best practices and tools for running experiments at Gojek created the user journey framework that is used company-wide and built machine learning models to help the business teams bring back churned customers and retaining users.

About Us

WeWork began in 2010 with a vision to build the first global physical platform designed to bring people together. About The Role

As Head of Growth for the Pacific region you will lead a successful sales team across eight countries while addressing the evolving needs of the ‘flexible space’ market.

Individuals should have a proven track record of consultative sales and complex enterprise contract negotiations; experience building and leading sales teams; the ability to articulate WeWork’s strategy and vision to a variety of audiences; and a willingness to embrace disruptive fast-paced technology companies.

Responsibilities
  • Manage revenue sales targets and other KPIs for the region working closely with the Pacific MD
  • Successfully hire train and manage the growing sales team in the region
  • Define key sales & marketing strategies for the region budgets required to deliver and drive successful execution to achieve results

  • Personally take the lead on larger sales opportunities in the region successfully collaborating with corporate enterprise sales team
  • Provide innovative scalable solutions including data management and sales processes to achieve team goals (e.g. Salesforce)
  • Actively lead the optimization of the building-level sales process through information sharing training goal setting management of the sales pipeline and key KPIs in partnership with our local Community Managers
  • Work cross-functionally with other departments (physical product/construction and especially legal) to customize offerings and contractual agreements to larger members
  • Maintain regular communication cadence with the global/regional sales organization to communicate best practices and share learning
  • Work closely with the sales and revenue operations to constantly analyze results and identify opportunities to improve systems processes and programs
  • Measurably increase the company’s brand presence and ensure that all sales & marketing activities are “on-brand'

Qualifications
  • 10+ years of leadership experience in sales sales management and marketing in B2B companies
  • Experience working in high-growth and/or early stage company environments
  • Excellent communicator who can influence across levels and cultures. We look for a leader who balances empathy commercial acumen logic and ability to grasp opportunities from data and insights.
  • Experience leading and growing teams and producing exceptional results
  • Comfortable using marketing automation platforms and CRM – Salesforce experience highly desirable
  • Highly adaptable and excited to operate in a fast-paced environment where the rules of the game are often being defined just in time
  • Highly collaborative and great with people; will be a good listener and create relationships quickly with colleagues and partners in the business
  • A sense of humor even when things get tough; at WeWork we “strive to be better together”; a willingness to go above and beyond to support the team and get things done even if it sometimes means helping others with their work

Job Position: Senior Associate - Global Events

Job Location: Singapore (Remote Flexibility)

Reports To: VP of Growth OR Head of People and Operations

 

Who We Are:

Barclay Street Ventures is New York/New Jersey based rapidly growing Venture Capital and Private Equity firm. We are early stage technology investor and primarily focusing on investing in three core areas – AI FinTech and Marketplaces. As we are building growth momentum and adding new companies to our portfolio we are seeking to add a Senior Associate for managing global events.

 

Role:

As a Senior Associate for Global Events you will be responsible for supporting a number of different event programs focused on Entrepreneurs and Executives type of audiences. You are highly motivated with a “can-do” attitude to assist our organisation in hosting global events (Online/Onsite) that enhance our brand and build credibility among targeted audiences. As part of Deals Sourcing program we are taking a number of strategic and tactical initiatives including Operational Wisdom Program Technology Entrepreneurship Program FinTech Event and AI Event. Ideal candidate will play a key role in driving end to end event programs associated with its core objectives.

 

As a Senior Associate you will be tasked with researching and securing venues planning and managing our event’s calendar negotiating quotes and agreement with vendors assisting with event marketing monitoring timeframes budget and networking. Your creativity organizational skills and vision will assist our organization in amplifying successful completion of the event.

 

The ideal candidate for this role should have exceptional organisational abilities excellent interpersonal skills multi-tasking and time management skills. In addition candidate should have managed Online/Onsite events with audiences ranging from 100 to 1500.

 

Responsibilities:

 

  • You will provide the event management and leadership to all assigned programs and will ensure successful delivery of it
  • You will leverage your expertise for developing and maintaining the event project plans and objectives including master timeline and budget
  • An ideal candidate will also support all post event activities to include post event debrief meetings event surveys and final complete reports
  • You will also engage in recruiting event speakers by targeting executives seasoned speakers and domain specific leaders
  • You will handle allocated budget invoicing liaison duties and negotiation aspects with vendors
  • You will coordinate with HR admin digital marketing teams and external audience to drive better outcomes of events
  • Ensure the events are completed smoothly and step up with resolution strategy in case of any difficulties related to the event

 

Requirements:

 

  • Min 3 to 5 years of experience with events program management preferably executive or CxO types of events
  • Proven experience engaging and developing collaborative relationships with a broad range of audience and stakeholders and managing multiple projects simultaneously
  • When travel resumes to normal (Post Covid) and when required you must be comfortable to travel to/within North America Israel Dubai Singapore and India
  • Excellent verbal and written communications skills including the ability to consolidate and articulate multiple concepts into a concise easily understood format
  • It will be helpful if you have managed technology focused events with targeted audience of executives leaders and entrepreneurs
  • Experience with any event management tools is helpful; highly skilled with Microsoft Office tools particularly Excel and PowerPoint and some experience with Salesforce is useful
  • Extremely well organized with an eye for detail combined with the ability to see the bigger picture
  • Bachelor degree in Public Relations Communications or Hospitality is preferred

 

Note: We do not anticipate to run any onsite event until current pandemic ends. All events will be managed virtually for time-being.

 

Pay: Excellent Pay (Above Market Rate) + Bonus Eligibility

 

To learn more about our firm please visit https://www.barclaystreetvc.com

Job Title: Wealth Management| Client Operations Change Management| Associate
Job Description:
Our Team
Established as a market-leading function the Client Operations Organisation’s objective is to help manage the regulatory risks involved in onboarding and servicing our clients with special attention to meeting the regulatory Anti-Money Laundering (AML) and Know Your Client (KYC) requirements.  The team includes onboarding officers quality control account control administration and project managers.
The Role
The project manager will be based in Singapore and will be part of the practice support team (Change Management) within the Client Operations Organisation.  The Change Management team provide assistance with information management and project management.  This role involves frequent interaction with management and other key stakeholders (e.g.: CSS COO etc.) in a fast-paced team environment as well as the opportunity to work on specific strategic projects.  The role will include but is not limited to:
·         Act as a change agent to enable delivery of the Client Operations agenda
·         Build detailed knowledge of the Client Operations systems and organisation
·         Research and resolve data and functionality issues and answer queries from management and other key stakeholders
·         Escalate and/or resolve team issues; track and measure recurring themes for systemic issues and opportunities
·         Coordinate and provide disciplined project management on ad hoc projects across regions
·         Liaise with Legal Risk Compliance Front Office and Tech on certain projects
·         Coordinate materials and agenda for management & other meetings
Requirements
·         Bachelor's degree or professional qualifications
·         Minimum of 3+ years’ working experience within Onboarding KYC Client Onboarding KYC and/or documentation analysis and maintenance
·         Working knowledge of party and account data capture and flow 
·         7+ years’ experience within operations preferably within financial services
·         Strong Microsoft Office skills in particular with Excel and Powerpoint
·         Proactive strategic thinker
·         Strong analytical skills
·         Focused with a tenacity to resolve issues and conflicts
·         Flexible and able to work in a fast-paced environment to effectively meet deadlines
·         Excellent interpersonal and communication skills within an international environment
·         Strong sense of accountability and ownership
·         High energy and enthusiasm required to partner with multiple stakeholders
·         Pro-active self-starter
·         Ability to work effectively in a team environment and ability to adapt to a rapidly changing business and technological environment
·         Affable with a high tolerance for ambiguity
·         Ability to deal with highly confidential information in a professional manner

Job Title: Senior Operations Manager - New Business Growth
Job Description:
Job Description

As the APAC Senior Operations Manager for New Business Growth you will be responsible for ensuring we have the right operating model in place across the region to scale our business. This will involve assigning accountabilities and goals across the Go-To Market (GTM) teams overseeing our pipegen engines and processes across sales marketing partner and owning internal reporting and tools to monitor the health of the business. In addition you will work closely with the EMEA region to drive international consistency in this operating model.

This unique position will report directly to the APAC COO partnering closely with the APAC GTM leadership team and global GTM teams. We are looking for a leader who is highly collaborative and can create alignment across competing priorities and diverse teams. You must be a compelling communicator and problem solver who can derive insights from data influence and drive change.

Responsibilities
  • Drive accountability tracking and improvement of KPIs to measure pipeline generation and provide data driven analysis reports and dashboards to aid in forecasting and to support decision making
  • Design manage and track the end to end process from lead to opportunity
  • Leverage an integrated approach to pipeline generation and revenue growth by working collaboratively with sales marketing partner operations and enablement teams
  • Develop a clear understanding of what conversion rates should be and how to best leverage data-backed insights and A/B testing to improve.
  • Lead the APAC pipeline councils a recurring set of meetings to track challenges and determine actionable recovery plans on gaps
  • Have an understanding of Zendesk’s marketing and sales tech stack and the information that flows through it to be pushed into and pulled out of Outreach and Salesforce
  • Own the Qtrly motion around the planning and execution of integrated pipegen campaigns
  • Assist in troubleshooting operational issues as they surface; propose changes to systems and processes to fix root causes
  • Identify inefficiencies implement solutions and track progress around sales performance pipeline management and sales forecasting
  • Work with EMEA and HQ teams to drive consistency in metrics processes and recurring cadences.

Qualifications
  • 5+ years experience in sales operations enablement marketing operations or similar role
  • Highly skilled in relevant tech stack/sales platforms such as Salesforce.com Outreach.io Yesware Marketo Eloqua
  • Able to quickly learn and adapt to new process and technologies in order to meet business needs and drive business value
  • Willingness to experiment take risks and to learn from your failures
  • Knowledge of sales sales process and sales methodologies
  • Strong presentation facilitation project management and leadership skills
  • Ability to build relationships and work collaboratively across multiple departments
  • Strong organizational skills; ability to manage multiple cross-functional projects simultaneously

Zendesk builds software for better customer relationships. It empowers organizations to improve customer engagement and better understand their customers. Zendesk products are easy to use and implement. They give organizations the flexibility to move quickly focus on innovation and scale with their growth.

More than 150000 paid customer accounts in over 150 countries and territories use Zendesk products. Based in San Francisco Zendesk has operations in the United States Europe Asia Australia and South America.

Interested in knowing what we do in the community? Check out the Zendesk Neighbor Foundation to learn more about how we engage with and provide support to our local communities.

Telenor Group is a leading telecommunications company across the Nordics and Asia with 182 million customers and annual sales of around USD 12 billion (2019). We are committed to responsible business conduct and driven by the ambition of empowering societies. Connectivity has been Telenor’s domain for more than 160 years and our purpose is to connect our customers to what matters most.

We have a leading Nordic position in mobile broadband and TV services as well as substantial activities in subsidiaries and joint venture operations including mobile financial services and online classifieds in the Asia region. Worldwide Telenor Group and our operations’ teams are 19000 people strong.

Telenor Procurement Company (TPC) established in 2017 and headquartered in Singapore operates as a subsidiary of the Telenor Group.  We deliver Global Category Management as a service to the Telenor Business Units taking full responsibility for the end-to-end Sourcing process and performance of global spend categories. We have enabled Telenor’s strategic ambitions by becoming a centre of expertise in the pursuit of efficient operations. TPC seeks qualified procurement professionals that are excited and capable to work in the fast-paced Telecom field.

About the Team

As a Procurement Strategy & Transformation Specialist you will be a part of the Strategy and Development Team. The current responsibilities of the Strategy and Development team is ownership of the strategic transformation agenda end-to-end category management processes operating model maintenance and design digital strategy spend visibility competence development and establishing a global supplier management program. In the role you'll work at the heart of Global Procurement. We will look to you to identify potential areas for improvement linked to the core capabilities and our “way of work”. Our team’s ability to identify and leverage both internal and external capabilities to fuel the transformation journey will be a source of competitive advantage for Telenor.

Main Tasks

  • Lead or support the execution of strategic development projects to drive best practice which act to strengthen our global operating model in procurement
  • Primary duties to include strategy development hypothesis testing articulation of value proposition and executing initiatives working across the Global Procurement community
  • Work cross functionally interacting closely with key stakeholders across procurement and functional departments both globally and per business unit to align requirements and solutions (people process technology)
  • Contribute to Global Procurement’s digitization strategy by contributing to the roadmap development and implementation across Telenor globally
  • Continuously improve existing processes tools and data for insights

We are fast moving and the environment is dynamic thus there are likely to be changes in priorities so we expect you to be flexible adjusting to new activities i.e. it is very similar to working in management consulting or a transformation office.

Profile

We seek a procurement specialist who either has experience in a management consulting setting focused on procurement/category management/strategic sourcing/supply management or supporting procurement transformation in a multinational corporation. The following personal characteristics will be critical to succeed in the role:

  • A problem solver – capable of dissecting a complicated problem and evaluating it systematically
  • Curious and open minded – willing to challenge status quo and develop better ways of work
  • Savvy business acumen – focused on impact and outcomes
  • Human and customer centered – someone with a good understanding of the importance of change management and respectful handling of resistance
  • Excellent communication and facilitation skills – have the ability to persuade others effectively orally or in written

Education and Experience Requirements

  • Minimum 5 years as management consultant or in-house consultant with focus on transformation preferably the majority of time within procurement/category management/supply management
  • Previous experience working in an international environment operating across countries
  • Demonstrable project management skills
  • University degree within Finance Business Management Statistics Engineering Economics Arts and Social Science or equivalent

Additional requirements that would be desirable for applicants:

(+)  Experience from telecommunications or other technical services industry

(+)  Hands-on experience with procurement enabling tools such as spend visibility eSourcing contract management P2P supplier performance management and supplier portal

NB: This position is not for an expert procurement practitioner in a specific sourcing category

Application Requirements

Please send a covering letter outlining your motivation and credentials for this role and your CV if you consider that you meet the requirements for this role. CVs without cover letter will not be considered.

Job Title: Venture Architect - Rainmaking Corporate Venture Studio
Job Description:
Do you want to create new businesses and help build new ventures with corporate partners? Do you have at least 7 years of combined consulting and/or entrepreneurial experience? Do you have a passion for creating investing in and scaling new ventures with corporates and proven founders? Are you genuine honest and capable of building strong working relationships within your team and with c-suite stakeholders? If yes then read on - you could be exactly who we’re looking for.

Rainmaking and our APAC corporate venture build practice

Rainmaking is a global corporate innovation and venture development firm. In APAC we co-create and scale new business with leading corporate partners out of offices in Singapore Australia and Japan.

Since 2010 we have invested in and helped scale over 900 startups via our industry focused accelerator Startupbootcamp. Additionally we've built 27 of our own ventures. These ventures have generated over £250m in revenues raised over £45m in external venture capital and had more than 70% of our venture portfolio returning capital.

Our Model Is The Combination Of Three Core Elements

In Rainmaking's Venture Studio we co-create companies. We unlock the unfair competitive advantage corporates bring to the process of venture building.

  • The scale strengths and deep domain knowledge of large corporations
  • Proven passionate and empowered entrepreneurs
  • The repeatable science of building and funding startups

    • The Role

    This Includes

    As a Venture Architect you will use your skills to identify scope structure and validate opportunity spaces and new venture concepts for a corporate with the aim to launch and help build a new business.

  • creating insights into how macro trends and shifts in the competitive landscape influence the venture opportunities in that space
  • evaluating how new business models can be applied effectively to create new value
  • understanding how we can best leverage the assets of our corporate partners to create competitive advantage
  • examining market size and building the business case of potential ventures
  • engaging with customer segments via qualitative methods to truly understand their needs
  • rapid prototyping and testing potential solutions with the customer segments
  • recruiting and supporting our founder teams (or joining as a founder yourself) and
  • generally doing everything it takes to take an idea from paper to reality

    • You will lead and complete the venture validation process from end to end and engage directly with the client and business units to identify continual support opportunities. You will help strike the balance between clients’ needs and business requirements and ensure all perspectives are appropriately represented. At the same time you will master Rainmaking’s corporate venture building methodology to become an advocate for it internally and externally.

    Working closely with the other Venture Architects and subject matter experts in our team you will proactively drive each project forward and have ownership of the deliverables in each of our three phases: opportunity scoping venture validation and venture building.

    What you will need to demonstrate
    • Minimum 7 years of proven experience in management consulting venture capital startups accelerators and/or venture building
    • Experience with entrepreneurship (through employment being a startup founder being an investor or through work in a venture builder)
    • Data collection and analysis experience including customer interviews surveys market reports industry research and analytical modelling
    • Awareness if not deep practical understanding of Lean Startup methodologies
    • Experience owning a work stream in a project and structuring analysis developing recommendations and presenting results
    • Program or project management experience ensuring that deadlines are met and operations run effectively and efficiently
    • Skilled at navigating large organizations and experience working on multiple projects with cross functional teams while challenging the status quo
    • Exceptional ability to communicate both written and verbal presenting credibly and effectively to senior stakeholders
    • Sensibility for customer centricity - you understand how to creatively translate customer needs into solutions
    • A strong intellectual with a willingness to continue learning
    • Great match with our strong and value driven culture with a hands on and self-starter working style
    • Team player with strong leadership skills - you take ownership of your team and their work and you are willing to help people around you to become even better
    Your Mindset
    • Passionate: you ‘geek out’ on startups technology business models growth engines founder stories venture capital and corporate innovation
    • Startup Aware: you understand and are excited by the highly dynamic startup ecosystem and have experience working directly in a startup an accelerator program as an investor or in a venture builder. You are emotionally part of the entrepreneurial “tribe” and not just someone who wears a pair of Allbirds
    • Team Playing Self-starter: you enjoy and respect the importance of being a part of a small tight-knit team but equally thrives whilst working independently
    • Master Communicator: you love people are empathic and optimistic. You are an expert in interviewing and group/individual presentations
    • Credibility: maturity and a proven track record giving you credibility to present ideas and challenge assumptions in C-level meetings
    • Multi-tasker: able to wear many hats ambitious superb organisation highly motivated and buzzing with energy. Record of successfully managing multiple projects simultaneously
    • Visual Eye: you have an appreciation for aesthetics and good design; able to create concise insightful and beautiful work
    • Perpetual Learner: always intellectually engaged with a thirst for knowledge and continual personal progression
    Our Promise

    It will be an energising environment. It will be challenging entrepreneurial and at times scrappy. You will get to meet and work with passionate people enthused by starting high-value new ventures. You will be valued appreciated and believed in.

    Values & Culture

    Rainmaking has built a strong ethical codex. It encompasses not just what we do but how we do it. Our values can be summarised through; be entrepreneurial be kind be impactful. It’s all about how you engage with people that makes the difference. Just as we hope you are the one to make a difference we want to make sure that our values are aligned.

    Please read the Rainmaking Culture Book here: https://rainmaking.io/RM_culturebook.pdf
