The Project Lead is a strategic professional who stays abreast of developments within own field and contributes to directional strategy by considering their application in own job and the business. Recognized technical authority for an area within the business. Requires basic commercial awareness. There are typically multiple people within the business that provide the same level of subject matter expertise. Developed communication and diplomacy skills are required in order to guide influence and convince others in particular colleagues in other areas and occasional external customers. Significant impact on the area through complex deliverables. Provides advice and counsel related to the technology or operations of the business. Work impacts an entire area which eventually affects the overall performance and effectiveness of the sub-function/job family.

Responsibilities

Manages a large multi-faceted project/account/campaign or multiple projects at the same time.

Owns project goals leveraging expertise to inspire a sense of shared purpose within the project team.

Organizes new challenges and drive business results.

Uses best practice PMO methodology to create a project plan to fit the stakeholders/customers’ needs and deliver within budget on desired outcomes.

Drives end results of the project as a representative of the business.

Works closely with the Customer Sales Team Engineering and Manufacturing to define a project scope and objectives for project members.

Prepares maintains and submits clear and concise activity/progress reports and time recording/management reports.

Assesses project risk potentials and discover potential problems before they occur.

Applies a proactive approach in routinely tracking the project participant progress against project goals.

Defines teaches and enforces the use of good project management practices such as techniques in resolving complex interdependent activities into tasks and sub-tasks that are documented monitored and controlled.

Identifies and where required amends the approach to the context and constraints of each project.

Constantly improving their own and their teams' skills through lessons-learned reviews at project completion.

Possess the knowledge skills and experience to be able to recognize when problems surface or potential problems are looming.

Articulates problems bring the right people together to solve problems and know when the problem has been properly addressed and closed.

Promotes partner involvement through effectively communicating project status upward and to the Client.

Applies lessons learned from recent projects to future projects.

Communicates to all concerned parties project milestones status updates as well as any existing or potential customer escalation issues.

Proactively follows escalation and change control processes.

Owns all management reports on a given engagement.

Promotes good working relationships across a project cultivating the people skills needed to develop trust and communication among all of a project's stakeholders: its sponsors those who will make use of the project's results those who command the resources needed and the project team members.

Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup its clients and assets by driving compliance with applicable laws rules and regulations adhering to Policy applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior conduct and business practices and escalating managing and reporting control issues with transparency.

Qualifications

6-10 years of project management experience – preferably from a mortgage or financial services environment

PMP certification strongly preferred Six Sigma a plus.

Ability to develop project plans manage individual deadlines and goals.

Knowledge of project metrics including gathering reporting trend analysis creation and metrics.

Ability to identify issues and problems generate solutions and choose appropriate alternatives using basic root cause analysis.

Manage project scope by assessing requirements changes determining and conveying impact on budget time and risk.

Manage client expectations anticipates operational and tactical risks and tracks them; clarify identify and track requirements and issues remove barriers resolve minor project issues and escalate to immediate manager where required.

Proficient in MS Office applications MS Project VISIO Adobe Acrobat Professional.

Stays abreast of current industry trends and new technology through professional associations trade journals networking and associated training and seminars.

Education

Bachelor’s/University degree Master’s degree preferred

We are looking for a Business Analyst who is interested in using data to help HDB design solutions that address its business problems and stay close to the needs of our citizens. Your responsibilities include working with various stakeholders within HDB and with external agencies to identify business problems develop plans and engage relevant parties to execute both data analytics and digital services projects to drive desired and sustainable solutions for stakeholders to adopt in future.

As a Business Analyst You Will Be Required To
  • Build strong relationships with stakeholders to understand business challenges and opportunities scope the problem and turn data into critical information and knowledge that can be used for policy making streamlining operations or developing comprehensive solutions for citizens;
  • Manage end-to-end data projects; identify issues gather information from various sources analyse data interpret patterns and trends build models give recommendations and create insightful data visualisation for monitoring outcomes; and
  • Review day-to-day operation processes; identify areas of improvement and make actionable recommendations based on underlying analysis.
Requirements

You should possess background in Business Analytics. You should possess knowledge of how various data are gathered stored and retrieved. You should have the ability to transform and interpret the data accurately to generate necessary insights as well as be able to present complex information in a friendly manner for end-users to understand.

You should be experienced in data modelling mining statistics and data analysis algorithm and able to use statistical software like Python/R Tableau/SAS Visual Analytics IBM SPSS modeller and EViews independently.

You should have excellent communication presentation and writing skills in order to pitch ideas and influence stakeholders. You should possess analytical/logical thinking and enjoy problem solving. You should also be a good team player able to collaborate with different teams and manage timeline and priorities effectively.

Only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

For projects related more to data analytics you will be required to articulate and present analytics concepts; research and adopt new algorithms and analytics techniques to improve insight quality; perform model assessment and proper evaluation to identify and execute the appropriate techniques for different problem statements.

Job Title: Senior Associate / Associate / Senior Analyst / Analyst
Job Description:
Insignia Ventures Partners is an early stage technology venture fund focusing on Southeast Asia started in 2017 and manages capital from premier institutional investors including sovereign wealth funds foundations university endowments and renowned family offices from Asia Europe and North America. Insignia Ventures Partners is the recipient of two back-to-back “VC Deal of Year” awards for Payfazz (2019) and Carro (2018) from the Singapore Venture Capital and Private Equity Association and its portfolio include many other technology leaders in Southeast Asia.


About the Position


- Conduct market and industry research and investment theses on specific sectors

- Manage deal-level workflow and support VP/Principals on daily basis

- Source/identify startups in target sectors

- Meet founders assess investment opportunities and perform initial due diligence

- Perform financial and business analysis and modelling and interpret company and financial data

- Develop document and present investment recommendations to the investment committee

- Take part in in the due diligence process and support transaction closing

- Support portfolio startups and work directly with the founders on an ad-hoc basis

- Organise events that help build Insignia’s ecosystem for diverse entrepreneurs in technology

- Support Analyst training and career development

- Assist with administrative and project-based responsibilities on ad-hoc basis


What we are looking for


- Bachelor’s degree in a STEM field from a top-tier institution

- At least 3 to 5 years of experience in management consulting investment bank private equity or venture capital at a reputable firm with exposure to Southeast Asia is a must

- Fluency in Bahasa Indonesia/Bahasa Melayu & Vietnamese is a plus

- Management (Founding Team) Business operations strategy or finance experience at a leading venture-backed startup in Southeast Asia is a plus


What We Value


- ‘Hands-on' approach demonstrating tenacity and resourcefulness

- Strong interpersonal and communication skills with the confidence and gravitas to influence internal & external stakeholders

- High energy and unflinching work ethic

- Entrepreneurial empathy and respect for early stage start-up founders

- Ability to grasp and filter new ideas quickly and must have demonstrated great interest in the latest technology trends

- Ability to manage multiple projects and execute on processes while working with diverse and/or remote stakeholders


Location can be in Singapore Indonesia or in Vietnam.

Help us improve access to life-changing therapies that can transform human health
We are Cytiva a global provider of technologies and services that advance and accelerate the development and manufacture of therapeutics. Formerly part of GE Healthcare we have a rich heritage tracing back hundreds of years and a fresh beginning since 2020.
Our customers undertake life-saving activities. These range from fundamental biological research to developing innovative vaccines biologic drugs and novel cell and gene therapies. Our job is to supply the tools and services - the pots pans soups and sauces - they need to work better faster and safer leading to better patient outcomes.

What you’ll do

Key Responsibilities Include

Manage a world class organization with enhanced capability to manage all aspects of our logistics network from our mfg./suppliers to our warehouse centers to our customers
Design optimal organization structure to support the successful execution of logistics across the business portfolios in Asia
Develop a strong relationship with business and cross functional operations teams to partner in driving key logistics and business metrics
Aligns closely and strategically with cross functional teams & cross regional teams to improve quality drive deflation and reduce logistics risk
Trains and mentors the team: Operations Leader must know and understand the operational processes in the fulfilment centers
Drive 100% compliance with relevant policies procedures and export control regulations
Lead Asia warehouse service by leveraging world class logistics partner to drive standardization and fulfillment
Drive the Asia Distribution warehouses to become a trusted operation units close to the customers which provide differential services
Develops and implements plans to ensure successful fulfilment of customer orders on-time.
Implement continuous improvement activities in all areas of responsibility with a focus on improving processes to help the logistics team focus more on value-add items and improve operating performance
Provides proactive and responsive employee relations for employees and work with HR teams to provide appropriate technical and leadership training and career development
Prepare and present executive presentations to business & functional leadership teams
Superior analytical skills with demonstrated ability to synthesize large quantities of data into key messages & actions
Drive continuous productivity & compliance improvements and create a best practice sharing platform.

Who you are

Qualifications

Bachelor’s Degree from an accredited university or college and/or equivalent knowledge experience

Minimum 10 Years Of Progressive Leadership Experience

Progressive leadership experience in logistics or supply chain functions

Desired Characteristics

Strong leadership skills and proven track record of building successful teams to high levels of performance
Excellent understanding of Incoterms
Working knowledge of commercial contracts
Proven track record of collaborating across a global matrix of senior leaders
Strong knowledge of international logistics procedures practices and norms
Strong oral and written communication skills
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Ability to coordinate and lead in a global matrix environment
Ability to cope with multiple complex situations daily
Excellent interpersonal skills
Six Sigma Green Belt or Black Belt Certified

Who we are
Whatever your role we bring purpose and challenge into our everyday work. If you are driven to make the world a better place thanks to science and medicine you’ll feel right at home here. If you’re flexible curious and relentless you’ll belong. If you are excited about a global culture this can be the place to further your career.

Want to know more? Experience life at Cytiva on our Careers website Instagram channel and LinkedIn page!

Cytiva is a 3.3 billion USD global life sciences leader with nearly 7000 associates across 40 countries who are dedicated to our mission to advance and accelerate therapeutics. As a trusted partner to customers that range in scale and scope Cytiva brings efficiencies to research and manufacturing workflows ensuring the development manufacture and delivery of transformative medicines to patients.

Cytiva is part of the Danaher family of companies a global science and technology innovator committed to helping customers solve complex challenges and improving quality of life around the world.

As a Junior Revenue Project Manager (part of Revenue PMO) you will work on highly impactful projects that will directly impact Zalora’s top and bottom lines. This role is very challenging and requires a strong combination of analytical as well project management skills. You will need to analyse the impact of business decisions and projects as well bring those projects to completion. You will work across multiple departments: from Buying to Marketing from Legal to IT and be exposed to the different facets of a fashion e-commerce company. There will be a steep learning curve and you will be given a lot of responsibility and expected to deliver.

The Revenue department is a newly formed department within Zalora led by the Chief Revenue Officer and comprises four teams - PMO Pricing Merchandising and Analytics. The goal of this department is to work on high impact projects that are very close to revenue generation with a wide scope that includes the optimization of onsite banners prices discounts and search results among others. Big campaigns like 11.11 and 12.12 are handled by the Merchandising team with active support from pricing the pricing team is responsible for pricing and discounts of the onsite assortment across 6 countries. The analytics team will be working on tech improvements to enable success of the entire department. Finally the newly formed PMO will work closely with all the other teams (as well as marketing and customer experience) on planning and executing new initiatives that will enhance the success of Zalora. You will report to the Head of Revenue PMO and will have the opportunity of frequent interactions with the Chief Revenue Officer.

Responsibilities:

  • Build business models and analyse the impact of new projects.
  • Plan and execute projects and see them to completion.
  • Work across different departments/functions (tech commercial pricing finance operations marketing customer experience) and local ventures (Malaysia Indonesia Philippines) on high impact projects.
  • Be the business counterpart and work together with tech product managers to execute changes onsite and in the backend.
  • Manage communication on your projects with the key stakeholders as well senior management
  • Present your findings and recommendations to senior management (as required by the project).
Requirements:

  • Exceptional analytical skills
  • Be comfortable working with numbers. All the analysis and recommendations need to be data driven
  • 1-3 years of experience in a startup or consulting firm
  • Bachelors/ Masters degree from a top university
  • Degree in Engineering Computer Science Finance or related quant fields preferred.
  • Excel proficiency. Tableau is a plus
  • Effective project and time management skills
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
  • Entrepreneurial spirit and hunger for success
  • Leadership and the ability to drive results
  • Capable of handling multiple tasks working under pressure and meeting short deadlines

The ZALORA Story

ZALORA exists for the millions of fashion consumers in Asia seeking a shopping experience focused on their unique styles trends and fit. As Asia’s leading online fashion destination ZALORA was founded in 2012 and has a presence in Singapore Indonesia Malaysia & Brunei the Philippines Hong Kong and Taiwan. ZALORA’s localised sites offer an extensive collection of top international and local brands as well as our own in-house labels across apparel shoes and accessories for men and women. ZALORA is part of Global Fashion Group the world & leader in online fashion for emerging markets.

Note: “ZALORA is not obligated to accept resumes from any third parties on behalf of potential candidates for any position (advertised or otherwise) by any means unless ZALORA has executed a written agreement with such third party and has expressly requested such third party for candidate referrals. Third parties who provide unsolicited resumes of candidate(s) shall waive and forfeit all rights to claim for any placement fees or referral fees in the event that such candidate is eventually engaged or employed by ZALORA or Global Fashion Group.”

With offices in Singapore and around the world our growth strategy is to build upon attracting the best talent and creating an amazing work atmosphere that balances the energy of a start-up with the resources of a global innovation leader. The Demand Planner Emerging Asia & Korea plays a highly visible and essential role within the Supply Chain and Commercial Operations in Cardinal Health. Levering on analytics marketing and sales data the Senior Demand Planner is expected to effective estimate future product demands across the Cardinal Health Medical Segment portfolio for Emerging Asia (SEA Hong Kong Taiwan India) and Korea.

 

This position is based in Singapore and reports to the Supply Chain Director for Emerging Asia Korea and APAC Network Optimisation and will work closely with the global supply chain and regional teams for Medical Segment

 

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES & ACCOUNTABILITES

 

  • Lead the forecasting process to ensure that forecasts are facts based and are provided on time.
  • Review historical sales trends demand drivers prepare forecast data develop statistical forecast models and evaluate forecast results.
  • Improve forecasting and analysis techniques such as providing leadership on forecasting techniques to continuously improve forecasting methods and accuracy.
  • Provide adhoc analytics and operational expertise to drive fact-based inputs into forecasting like- price elasticity analysis cannibalisations studies activity planning and gap management
  • Work closely across cross-functional teams and external distributors on driving improvements on statistical/baseline & forecasting KPIs like Forecast Accuracy Bias.
  • Single point of contact for all demand planning related activities.
  • Lead & manage monthly Sales & Operations Planning (S&OP) process as per Cardinal Health global standards.
  • Support S&OP initiatives; i.e. Initiate Plan Execute Communicate & Drive forecast accuracy improvement projects within agreed timeframe.
  • Manage product roll overs and end of life planning to appropriately balance availability and inventory risks.
  • Manage allocation products execution with global supply planning.
  • Work closely with Supply Planners to manage availability and maintain customer fill rates.
  • Manage monthly forecast submission in IBP.

 

KEY EXPERIENCES / QUALIFICATIONS

  • Bachelor’s Degree in related field or Advanced Degree in related field preferred.
  • 5+ years’ experience in forecasting data analysis and running S&OP.
  • Strong analytical skills meticulous with strong eye for business and consumer focus.
  • Able to remain focused and work efficiently under pressure while handling multiple tasks.
  • Demonstrate initiative adaptability and problem-solving skills in an ambiguous and dynamic environment.
  • Strong interpersonal facilitation and presentation skills.
  • Ability to work with cross-functional partners both at much higher level and peer level.
  • Ability to both think strategically and execute tactically.
  • Strong sense of urgency to resolve issues.
  • Strong knowledge of excel (advanced level) preferred.
  • Knowledge of SAP IBP Tableau preferred.
  • Ability to speak Korean will be an added advantage.

ROLE PURPOSE

Dentsu Aegis Network (DAN) is seeking to hire a CXM Line of Business Chief Operating Officer to drive and support the delivery of profitable growth in APAC while overseeing all activities relating to business transformation and operational excellence working across the Sales Solutions & Account Management Brand and Business Function teams.


The business transformation includes the design and implementation of a new business model as well as the underlying operating model that clarifies the accountability and responsibility of each part of the organization as well as the primary metrics that define performance and will service as the basis of performance assessment as defined in the new business model. As the overall business strategy and brand strategy are refined evolving this model will require on-going evolutions in the day-to-day operations of the business. Additionally the brand strategy will result in significant brand consolidation and simplification of the corporate legal entity structure in each market. 


Another major accountability of the role is supporting the LoB CEO in the annual planning and day-to-day management of the business lifecycle activity across the full business lifecycle – strategy & planning marketing sales account management service delivery and the integrated support of the lifecycle activities by Finance HR Technology and Legal. Additionally the LoB COO will participate in the monthly business review of the market performance against budget and quarterly forecasts determining root cause tracking actions items and following up between reporting periods ensuring that root causes are being mitigated and recovery plans are in place.


Another major accountability of the role is ensuring that the Brands are achieving Gross Margin % by effectively managing cost-to-serve in alignment with revenue forecast when increasing or decreasing. To do this requires facilitating the annual planning process with each Market Brand lead in accordance with the Global COO and the annual plan for cost-to-serve and then delivering on the cost-to-serve budget. The cost-to-serve is the planned average hourly resource costs in accordance with every planned hour of revenue per resource which will be different by Brand Service and Sub-Service for that market. The cost-to-serve will be planned to improve quarter-over-quarter and year-over-year and the primary drives are client utilization pyramid (span-of-control) compensation management and the placement of work in cost-effective location based on the overall Line of Business delivery strategy.


As a member of the DAN CXM LoB Executive Leadership Team this position will report directly to the LoB CEO and have a dual reporting line to the Global Chief Operating Officer. This role will collaborate and proactively work with the CXM LoB Leadership team and their direct reports to implement and drive excellence in every area of business operation. This role will support the Global Chief Operating Officer in ensuring the effective execution of our business strategy and that we have the required plans metrics and targets in place to achieve our expected results.



KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES

Critical Role Priorities:

  • Lead in deploying the new business model operating model and organisation blueprint
  • Manage the delivery of annual budget ensuring that gross margin and operating profit % are achieved with a heavy focus on achieving cost-to-serve by achieving planned client utilization pyramid improvements effectively managing compensation and achieving planned mix of cost-effective work locations
  • Accountable for realisation of all tactical and strategic gross margin related initiatives at a LoB level as defined within the market or globally working closely with stakeholders across Operations Finance HR as well as the local executive leadership
  • Ensure all investments into Product are channelled for approval according to policy through the Global Product Investment Council
  • Implement the new business framework including the use of Salesforce for both new logo and existing client opportunities and govern the new business process in the market
  • Implement the corporate time reporting process and enforce time reporting compliance by all employees starting with client service delivery resources
  • Establish consistent repeatable and world-class services and integrated solutions that are data-driven tech-enabled and ideas-led
  • Define and rollout standard methods and estimating tools to speed time to delivery and enable dramatic productivity and quality improvement of services and integrated solutions
  • Establish world-class delivery capabilities in cost-effective “centres of excellence” strategically located ensuring consistent high quality services and integrated solutions
  • Enabling resourcing utilization management and increasing client utilization as well as implementing initial release of client profitability reporting and management to drive profit improvement on clients underperforming expectations
  • Ensure resources are mapped to the common career framework and enable basic compensation management leveraging the newly defined merit management process and guidelines
  • Improving financial forecasting using existing processes and tools as well as enabling an automated algorithm-based process as the opportunities are fully loaded and managed in Salesforce
  • Enabling resource demand and supply management and resource balance based on forecast variance to achieve gross margin %.
  • Managing line of business cost-to-serve to increasing client utilization pyramid compensation management and use of cost-effective delivery locations
  • Improving client satisfaction and retention
  • Reducing unmanaged attrition
  • Drive operational efficiencies in collaboration with the G&A function leads with a focus on identifying opportunities to improve processes eliminate redundant across the business functions imbedded in brands
  • Drive awareness and transformation change programmes using proactive communications engagement education and enablement of our people
  • Implementation of Global Contract Compliance program delivering strong governance compliance resourcing processes and tools. Harmonising and integrating all process and systems across market; this will ensure both Market Executive leadership and the Operations community is held accountable in delivering the necessary change initiatives.
  • Define and run regular governance forum for New Business Model Transformation representing all operating companies and report progress issues and risks to the CXM LoB CEO
  • Lead the definition and implementation of stronger policies for operational excellence in the market reflecting external and industry best practice and accommodating special circumstances in each market
  • Define standards for and provide input to due diligence activities during M&A transactions within the market



PERSON SPECIFICATION

Preferred Leadership Characteristics:

  • High Learning Agility - unbridled curiosity and the ability to discover trends ahead of time (“look around corners”) and glean valuable insights; not merely an effective executor of initiatives anticipatory in her / his approach and provokes senior level conversation
  • Making Complex Decisions - can solve even the toughest and most complex of problems; great at gleaning meaning from whatever data is available; is a quick study of the new and different; adds personal wisdom and experience to come to the best conclusion and solution given the situation; uses multiple problem-solving tools and techniques
  • Getting Organized - is well organized and resourceful; effective and efficient at marshalling multiple resources to get things done; lays out tasks in sufficient detail to mark the trail; is able to get things done with less and in less time; can work on multiple tasks at once without losing track; foresees and plans around obstacles
  • Dealing with Trouble - fearlessly takes on all issues challenges and people; comfortably confronts and works through conflict; delivers negative feedback and messages without hesitation; deals promptly and fairly with problem performers; lets everyone know where they stand; thrives in crises and is energized by tough challenges; not afraid to make negative decisions and take tough action; challenges the status quo
  • Focusing on Action and Outcomes - attacks everything with drive and energy with an eye on the bottom line; not afraid to initiate action before all the facts are known; drives to finish everything he/she starts
  • Inspiring Others - skilled at getting individuals teams and an entire organization to perform at a higher level and to embrace change; negotiates with skill to achieve a fair outcome or promote a common cause; communicates in a compelling vision and is committed to what needs to be done; inspires others; builds motivated high-performing teams; understands what motivates different people
  • Acting with Ethics Honour and Character - Is a person of high character; is consistent and acts in line with a clear and visible set of values and beliefs; deals and talks straight; walks his/her talk; is direct and truthful but at the same time can keep confidences
  • Being Open and Receptive - at ease and relaxed; easy to talk to and get to know; listens attentively; is an open book; has a positive sense of humour; deals calmly with stress and gives people a chance to catch up


The Person:

  • Practical pragmatic driven and resilient with high emotional intelligence
  • Confident ambitious highly professional and visible able to interact easily at all levels
  • Positive dynamic enthusiastic; capable of maintaining a high level of energy and team spirit high learning agility
  • Will live the DAN values at all times: Collaborative Responsible Agile Ambitious Pioneering

Apply Now

Qualifications
  • University degree with a technical or business specialization
  • 2 - 5 years of professional experience in an area of operations (capital productivity manufacturing product development purchasing service operations or supply chain management
  • Solid knowledge based on practical experience of all areas of Lean Manufacturing e.g. the Toyota Production System kaizen methods TPM JIT SMED
  • Passionate about operational excellence
  • Demonstrated aptitude for analytics
  • Proven record of leadership in a work setting and/or through extracurricular activities
  • Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and effectively with people at all levels in an organization
  • Authorization to work in Singapore

Who You'll Work With
You’ll be working with McKinsey’s Operations practice in Singapore. Our Operations practice assists our clients in solving complex operational challenges. Blending strategic thinking with hands-on practicality our teams of consultants and experts work to develop and implement operational strategies that solve our clients' most critical problems.

You will be part of the Operations Excellence Program (OEP) a two-year training program that develops our consultants as specialists in operations excellence. The OEP combines a rigorous theoretical foundation taught by some of the most experienced practitioners in the world with intense hands-on work on real client transformation projects. Consultants work closely with clients at all levels and in many different industries. Our curriculum is designed around four themes learning sharing transforming and sustaining. The result is a cohesive learning experience that is closely connected to the way we serve clients and develop our people.

What You'll Do
You will work in teams of consultants providing expertise in engineering and manufacturing helping clients to achieve new performance highs.

You will make an important contribution to the analysis design and implementation of Lean Manufacturing and Management approaches developing tailor-made solutions and working closely with clients to ensure positive impact and sustainable results. In addition to working directly with clients you will also share your experience and insights with colleagues internationally thereby expanding our knowledge and refining our approaches in the field of Lean Management.

Along with other members of the OEP community you will dedicate one day a week to functional training and knowledge development under the leadership of our operations experts. You will follow a curriculum based on operations excellence themes and advanced training in one of six specific areas of operations capital productivity manufacturing product development purchasing service operations or supply chain management. Upon completion of the program successful consultants will join our global group of leading experts in operational excellence.

You will be the lead point of contact for all internal and external stakeholders and communication for all major projects.

Your primary duties are the coordination and planning for all ongoing projects through their development lifecycle.

Roles And Responsibilities
  • Establish and maintain relationships with all clients and internal business partners
  • Co-ordinate with both internal stakeholders to project manage the end-to-end implementation of projects
  • Manages project initiation activities including identifying contractual obligations client needs and goals existing situation necessary contacts and access to existing information as needed.
  • Plan the programs and workstreams from start to completion involving deadlines milestones and processes
  • Manage and monitor overall progress including resolving issues managing budget initiating corrective action and escalating where appropriate
  • Keep senior management and steering committee informed with detailed progress updates
  • Engage inform negotiate and influence all stakeholders particularly the technology sponsor and service delivery teams to ensure key business stakeholders remain engaged and committed throughout the project
  • Manage risks to the project’s successful outcome including risk identification impact assessment and reporting. Apply change risk and resource management principles when needed
  • Ensure program operations and activities adhere to legal guidelines and internal policies
  • Ensures accurate development and traceability of program requirements through the lifecycle
  • Assess & implement cost efficiency improvements on projects and ensure that the projects operate within the approved budget
  • To perform other duties as and when required.
Skills Requirements
  • Bachelor’s degree in IT related or experience in IT related project / programme management.
  • PMP/CITPM and project management experience managing multiple projects.
  • Programme Management Professional (PgMP) an advantage.
  • Experience in leading and achieving results from complex large and ambiguous programs of work
  • Strong project and programme management skills and experience in influencing stakeholders at all levels of seniority
  • Knowledge of the current digital markets and tools.
  • Supply Chain domain knowledge; an advantage but not required.
  • Singaporean Candidates preferred.

GovTech’s Moments of Life product aims to offer a simplified citizen-centric experience to help users navigate across the multitude of government services and websites. Personalization and anticipating the user’s need is key so that we build meaningful solutions for users especially during this time of economic uncertainty.

You will be working on one of the strategic national products. Join us in working together to support Singapore’s vision of a Smart Nation.

What To Expect
  • Set up and lead a team to help LifeSG achieve high service standards and offer quality content ultimately delivering on a great user experience
  • Establish standards and guidelines and design and implement SOPs across product operations and content operations as well as other teams in order to achieve those standards
  • Product operations
○ Manage our help center to respond to citizens/members of public in a timely manner (via email app store reviews etc.) and support the rollout of major features that may drive citizen queries
○ Communications is key: Develop talking points to address concerns liaising with other teams to ensure consistency of messaging across communications channels. Escalating when necessary to bring in management or other agencies is crucial in order to resolve the citizen/user’s pain point in the best way possible.
  • Content operations
○ Curate content on the product balancing what is engaging for users and what is important for agencies to communicate
○ Drive a content roadmap and schedule ensuring this syncs up with the product team and our engagement across agencies
○ Set up processes to track content standards working with agencies and other content providers to continuously improve on content quality
  • Oversee day-to-day operations and issues that come up
  • Develop effective stakeholder relationships across GovTech and other agencies. Communicate and present to senior decision makers on project progress and resolve issues efficiently
  • Partner closely with the product and tech team and other stakeholders in an agile environment and continually improve ways of working.
  • Train and mentor team members to ensure SOPs are implemented well and the user/citizen gets a good overall experience
  • Able to track budgets and handle admin processes understand tech management policy quality management policy and security guidelines to ensure processes are designed to comply with these guidelines
How To Succeed
  • This is a new role. We are looking for someone with experience in either operations and/or content and with the energy to build a team and start something new. Building an experience that citizens love is hard work where tenacity perseverance and willingness to debate and learn is important.
  • Excellent written and verbal communications skill. You must be able to communicate succinctly and clearly
  • Experience in operations and/or content (ideally at least 5 years). Be able to handle tricky situations thoughtfully and swiftly
  • Proven record of successfully delivering projects that require frequent interfacing with customers (not necessarily the citizen/member of public)
  • Management experience is a plus
  • Project management experience can be helpful. This is a new team and priorities can change a flexible mindset is helpful whilst keeping the team organized
  • Strong initiative to identify new problems and drive solutions to completion
  • Demonstrated ability to be a key influencer in the team’s strategy

Overview

Reporting to the Director Digital Operations and Monitoring the Senior Manager will be responsible for leading an application support operations team providing 24x7 eCommerce and omnichannel retail support. This role partners directly with our business stakeholders and marketing teams to provide a seamless interface into engineering and ensure our technology solutions are driving success.

Our global house-of-brands inspires and empowers youth culture. Relentlessly committed to fuel a shared passion for self-expression we create unrivaled experiences at the heart of the sport and sneaker communities through the power of our people. If you want to be a part of something bigger than you can imagine you’ve come to the right place. To learn more about the incredible impact we’re making on both our local and global communities Click Here!

Responsibilities

Core Responsibilities:
  • Manage a team of business operations and application support engineers to ensure incidents are addressed within service level objectives (SLOs) and with appropriate urgency.
  • Enforce industry-standard best practices for handling major incidents including call management scribing/documenting actions and communicating with stakeholders.
  • Implement and enhance monitoring capabilities focusing on exception-based predictive analytics and early warning triggers to prevent downtime and reduce business impact.

  • Support major business initiatives with special attention given to high-profile product launches.

Qualifications

Keys to Success:

  • Proven ability to communicate across all levels of the organization up to and including C-level.

  • Analytical mindset holistic vision and strong business acumen. The ability to narrow in on minute details at the lowest levels and how they affect the business at the highest levels.
  • Passion for the work you do but the ability to make objective data-driven decisions.
  • Strong technical background with experience using a vast array of products. Examples: Splunk Big Panda New Relic Adobe Analytics Business Objects Firebug JSONView Postman Jenkins Gitlab Github Docker

Core Competencies Accomplishments & Requirements

  • Minimum 3 years leading a team of technical support engineers at a Manager or Supervisor level. eCommerce support preferred; Help Desk NOC IT Command Center or similar also considered
  • 3-5 years directly supporting business initiatives in an operational capacity
  • 5+ years providing hands-on support of eCommerce platforms (Websphere Hybris ATG Magento etc.) in on-premise cloud and hybrid environments

Job Description

At Xilinx we are leading the industry transformation to build an adaptable intelligent world. ARE YOU bold collaborative and creative? At Xilinx we hire and develop leaders and innovators who want to revolutionize the world of technology. We believe that by embracing diverse ideas pushing boundaries and working together as ONEXILINX anything is possible.

Our culture of innovation began with the invention of the Field Programmable Gate Array (FPGA) and with the 2018 introduction of our Adaptive Compute Acceleration Platform (ACAP) has made a quantum leap in capability solidifying our role as the adaptable platform supplier of choice. From the start we have always believed in providing inventors with products and platforms that are infinitely adaptable. From self-driving cars to world-record genome processing to AI and big data to the world's first 5G networks we empower the world's builders and visionaries whose ideas solve every day problems and enhance people's lives.

If you are PASSIONATE ADAPTABLE and INNOVATIVE Xilinx is the right place for you! At Xilinx we care deeply about creating meaningful development experiences while building a strong sense of belonging and connection. We foster an environment of empowered learning wellness community engagement and recognition so you can focus on work that matters - world class technology that improves the way we live and work. We are ONEXILINX.

We are looking for an agile self-motivated and detail oriented person to work as Operations Product Planner in Xilinx Supply Chain Organization.

The Operations Product Planner will be required to manage the order fulfilment roles with flawless execution.

The successful applicant is required to perform the following key activities:
  • Ensure delivery of product to customer within the current committed lead time avoiding delinquencies while maintaining inventory goals
  • Assign original order schedule dates and perform reschedules based on materials availability
  • Engaging in expedite management for critical customer requirements
  • Make production start requests with vendors for assembly mark and rework
  • Manage inventory excess and obsolescence (E&O) including quarterly scrap and overall inventory reporting
  • Assess and report on on-time delivery and develop proactive measures to improve delivery
  • Perform adhoc analysis and maintenance of Supply Chain metrics
  • Maintain lead-times yield and supply chain system parameters
  • Involve in cross functional team to drive continuous improvement
  • Administrative support to Operations Product Planning team
  • Strong communication and analytical skills
  • Highly organized and precise
  • Strong problem solving skills including ability to identify root causes with corrective and preventive actions
  • Proficient in Microsoft office applications including Excel Word and PowerPoint
  • Strong business acumen and judgment capabilities
  • Superior organizational priority setting and time management skills
  • Desired: Bachelor’s degree in Engineering or Business

TD Bank Group


Headquartered in Toronto Canada with more than 85000 employees in offices around the world The Toronto-Dominion Bank and its subsidiaries are collectively known as TD Bank Group ("TD"). TD offers a full range of financial products and services to more than 25 million customers worldwide through three key business lines:


  • Canadian Retail including TD Canada Trust Business Banking TD Auto Finance TD Wealth TD Direct Investing and TD Insurance
  • U.S. Retail including TD Bank America’s Most Convenient Bank TD Auto Finance TD Wealth and TD’s investment in TD Ameritrade
  • Wholesale Banking through TD Securities


TD had C$1.7 trillion in assets as at April 30 2020. TD also ranks among the world’s leading online financial services firms with more than 13 million active online and mobile customers. The Toronto-Dominion Bank trades on the Toronto and New York stock exchanges under the symbol "TD".


In Singapore TD operates as The Toronto-Dominion Bank Singapore Branch and Toronto Dominion (South East Asia) Limited which are collectively known as “TD Singapore” since 1979. The key business in Singapore is TD Securities which is part of Wholesale Banking.


Position Summary:


The Data Services team supports all business divisions located in Singapore (Foreign Exchange International Fixed Income Funding Global Precious Metals Trade Finance and Equity Derivatives) on a cross functional basis by performing the setting up and handling of client data credit lines settlement instructions (SSI's) inventories and security data and also the uploading and managing of market data. They play a key role in ensuring that the Global Data Control team operate effectively under a Global Delivery Model (GDM).


Responsibilities:


Market Data


  • Responsible for the daily cleansing analysis and maintenance of MVP data in the Asset Control system and for the accuracy of the same data within the source systems.
  • Effectively lead all accountabilities and objectives related to Market Data Initiatives and Asset Control projects.
  • Ensure that all late or missing market data uploads and related process metrics are recorded documented and explained appropriately.
  • Contribute to the broader Global Operations and Business Services group as a subject matter authority on market data


Client & Credit Reference Data:


  • Complete counterparty set up for new TD Securities customers in source systems
  • Handle the maintenance of reference data in source systems for new and existing clients
  • Input and maintain authorized treasury credit limits in source systems
  • Ensure that client accounts are mapped correctly in all relevant source systems


Security Reference Data:


  • Ensure instruments are set up accurately on TD Securities source systems in a timely manner
  • Assist in the implementation and ongoing maintenance of systems related to the security static data maintenance.


Standard Settlement Instructions:


  • Responsible for quick and accurate responses to requests for the set-up and maintenance of cash and securities settlement instructions
  • Serve clients according to service level agreements and internal service delivery standards


General


  • Review current processes and pro-actively make changes or propose initiatives to improve efficiencies in order to provide more effective business support.
  • Work in partnership with other Operations teams to ensure any audit or regulatory findings are handled and cleared within the committed timelines.
  • Ensure internal control processes are adequate and documented appropriately
  • Liaise closely with the Bank’s front office traders Market Risk Control audit technology groups and other partners to assist in meeting the Bank’s objectives.
  • May be assigned to participate in various initiatives and ad hoc requests that impact the Singapore region Global Operations and Business Services. This applies to initiatives governed by head office those that originate in Singapore. The individual is expected to utilize their relationships to help drive these initiatives to completion.


Requirements:


  • Prior experience in Market Data and/or Client State Reference Data experience in a middle or back office function with reporting responsibilities and exposure to various traded securities and derivative products
  • Market knowledge and a general understanding of the fundamentals of valuation
  • Exposure to operational metrics and emerging regulations would be an asset
  • Self-motivated well organized and positive attitude
  • Ability to prioritize multiple tasks and deliver results in a fast-paced environment.
  • Bloomberg and Reuters knowledge would be an asset
  • Ability to work individually as well as part of a team
  • Excellent analytical skills
  • Excellent interpersonal skills both verbally and written
  • Ability to adhere to strict deadlines and handle high volumes of work in a demanding environment
  • Strong knowledge of Microsoft Excel



Inclusiveness


At TD we are committed to fostering an inclusive accessible environment where all employees and customers feel valued respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve and creating an environment where every employee has the opportunity to reach their potential.

Infrastructure Group

The Infrastructure strategy focuses on investing in infrastructure assets primarily through direct unlisted equity investments complemented with select investments in infrastructure funds.

We are looking for a suitable Associate to join our Infrastructure team on a 2-year fixed-term contract (full employment terms & benefits). Preferred candidates are likely to be pre-MBA or pre-postgraduate and intend to pursue other opportunities after two years. As a member of the Singapore-based Infrastructure team you will primarily cover infrastructure investment opportunities and existing portfolio companies in Asia and Australia. You will also be a member of a global team and occasionally be staffed on projects involving our global operations.

Responsibilities
  • Evaluating and executing new Infrastructure investments.
  • Preparing financial analysis such as DCF models.
  • Preparing and presenting quantitative and qualitative analysis to the investment committee.
  • Establishing developing and maintaining relationships with counterparties and potential investee companies.
  • Managing and reporting on assigned investments for example supporting GIC representative at investor and board meetings interacting with management and other investors on a regular basis and working on various strategic initiatives with investee companies.
  • Be part of special projects as assigned from time to time (for example developing new analytical systems or market mapping of industries).

Requirements

  • Ideally at least 2 years’ experience with emphasis on cash flow modelling gained either in an Investment Bank or Private Equity company.
  • Strong academic background from reputable institutions.
  • Preference for candidates with an infrastructure background (utilities ports roads etc.)
  • Strong working knowledge and experience of financial modelling (DCF LBO) and comparative analysis.
  • Transactional due diligence experience and strong report writing skills.
  • Project management and co-ordination experience.
  • Advanced skills in MS word excel and PowerPoint.
  • Ability to work independently and in teams.

Our PRIME Values
GIC is a values driven organization. GIC’s PRIME Values act as our compass enabling us to fulfil our fundamental purpose and objectives. It is the foundational bedrock which governs our behaviors our decision making and our focus. It informs both our long-term strategy as a firm and the way we relate to our Client business partners and employees. PRIME stands for Prudence Respect Integrity Merit and Excellence.

RESPONSIBILITIES

SKILLS & EXPERIENCE

• Experience on being a spokesperson in the media. Having exposure to public policy or social development is a plus

"Story-telling with numbers will achieve strong client's satisfaction"

Position Overview

The vision for this role would be to establish Wallem’s brand as the market leader in seafarers learning and development. The incumbent will ensure the delivery of all added value training necessary to ensure competent and safe operations by our crew full compliance with all relevant regulations and enhance the skills needed for career growth both on board and for transitioning to shore-based roles within the Group. He/she will ensure training is designed and delivered in an effective efficient and interactive manner with proper supervision and administration.

Key Responsibilities & Accountabilities

  • Ensures a comprehensive understanding of Wallem Group’s strategy and objectives and aligns seafarers learning and development strategy accordingly
  • Capitalizes on opportunities to grow our Training Functions as a business offering to external seafarers and derive competitive advantage from such initiatives

  • Establish high quality unified standards if training and delivery across ranks and training venues that meets all regulation requirements and Company needs.
  • Innovates and champions training solutions which are tailored economic effective efficient and synergistic
  • Monitors value for money spent on training of seafarers through collaborative work with targeted training institutes in different regions. Supervisees and administrates the collection and disbursement of the training funds.

Job Description

The Senior Manager Logistics will have a comprehensive oversight over the Singapore Warehouse operations and the logistics operations in Asia South. The Senior Manager will oversee all activities and ensure a safe efficient and compliant warehouse operations. The Senior Manager will develop an effective partnership with other DFS departments provide clear targets for seamless logistics service and create a strong alignment with DFS’ goals and objectives.

Key Responsibilities

Warehouse Management
  • Optimizes merchandise flow by increasing the speed and accuracy of merchandise handling once received at the warehouse and replenishment all the way to the shop floor
  • Ensures all warehouse transactions are properly and accurately processed. Data in systems and manually if systems are not available are updated timely and accordingly per established policy and procedures.
  • Creates metrics to measure the performance of the receiving warehousing and distribution operations.
  • Optimizes storage through design utilization and capacity management. Ensures that storage areas are organized for efficient picking and putaway.
  • Reduces operating cost through the reduction and/or elimination of exceptions and errors; and the improvement in overall processes through simplification or improved alignment.
  • Takes measures to reduce the cycle time from port to available-for-sale.
  • Aligns the warehouse’s service commitment with the needs of the Sales and Merchandising teams. Collaborate with internal and external customers to improve handling and resolve issues.
  • Ensures inventory accuracy. Performs physical counts and cycle counts to ensure accuracy between physical inventory and the system counts.
  • Addresses Stock reconciliation reports and ensure the DFS systems are aligned
  • Ensures that quality objectives and service commitments are met.
  • Implements safety and security measures in the warehouse to eliminate/reduce risk to people product equipment information and facilities.
  • Demonstrates continuous improvement in output and in exception and error reduction.
  • Develops maintains and updates the warehouse SOPs on a regular basis.
  • Proactively identifies and resolves discrepancies issues and disputes.
  • Maintains a clean and organized warehouse environment. Controls
  • Creates and meets/exceeds budgets forecasts and other financial goals.
  • Prepares submits reports and updates status on operating metrics as needed. Includes improvement plans.
  • Well-versed and compliant with Customs regulations and other governmental laws and regulations affecting DFS’s operation in the location.
  • Ensures proper security and safety controls are in place to reduce risk to people and the business. Controls include but are not limited to access in and out of the warehouse CCTV coverage alarm systems screening of individuals information security computer security supply-chain security key security locks and locking security seals employee background checks theft prevention fire prevention etc. A documented set of procedures in an SOP must be maintained and be current.
  • Maintains a Business Continuity Plan
  • Maintains appropriate levels of confidentiality Develops and leads the Logistics team
  • Recruit and build effective teams
  • Motivate and federate his team
  • Provide development opportunities to your team
  • Conduct annual appraisal meetings set individual/collective objectives give feedbacks
  • Provide day-to-day direction concerning work assignments overtime requirements and priorities
Key Requirements
  • Bachelor’s Degree in Logistics or Supply Chain Management preferred. Bachelor’s degree in a relevant academic area such as Engineering Accounting etc. may be substituted.
  • 7 years of experience in warehouse management experience with a Divisional or Global retailer.
  • Fluency in English
  • Strong competencies in management of teams in logistic flows stock control security and safety.
  • Knowledge and experience with applying Quality Improvement Techniques. Six Sigma certification APICs Supply Chain Certification and/or other professional certifications are a plus.
  • Proficient in MS computer applications (Excel Word Powerpoint) required.

Job Title: Regional Operations Excellence Engineer #SGUnited Mid-Career Pathways Programme
Job Description:
About Zuellig Pharma

 

Zuellig Pharma (ZP) is one of the largest healthcare services groups in Asia and our purpose is to make healthcare more accessible. We provide world-class distribution digital and commercial services to support the growing healthcare needs in this region. With operations in 13 countries ZP has strong market positions critical mass broad geographic coverage and significant potential for continuing growth.



Regional Operations Excellence Engineer #SGUnited Mid-Career Pathways Programme

Job Purpose

This role will report to Head of Engineering working as part of the Corporate Operations Team the jobholder is responsible for Operational Excellence programs and Operation Efficiency projects within the distribution operations across Asia Pacific.

The jobholder will be required to apply Industrial Engineering methodologies to analyse current operating methods develop better alternatives where appropriate establish and document best practice and gain buy-in from regional and country stakeholders and manage projects to time and budget.

The job holder will also have a key role in assessing and implementing new technology to deliver cost quality or service improvements. The Regional Operations/OE & Engineering works in a matrix structure with country operations and uses influence idea generation and project delivery to facilitate change working with Operations Excellence Managers as support structure from the countries.


Responsibilities

Job Responsibilities

  • The Operations Excellence Engineer is responsible for the identification and implementation of continuous improvement initiatives that are aimed at moving our organization toward Operational Excellence.
  • Act as a key resource with in the Operations Team and support ZOE Programs as 5S TOP – Team Optimization Projects and Operations Efficiency Projects and Innovation Projects.
  • Initiate and implement continuous and process Improvement initiatives relative to space process and resources that must deliver quantifiable quality service level or cost outcomes for the business.
  • Support and maintain KPIs as indicators from the operations dashboards balanced scorecard where all the BU has opportunities for improvement and identify lead or project manage initiatives to close the performance gap.
  • Able to undertake operational processes data analysis and modelling as productivity and time analysis slotting analysis volume and shift patterns analysis to identify areas for improvement and opportunities.
  • To be able to identify the value proposition for various projects and work with procurement colleagues to populate operational initiatives for the Pipeline of Value (POV).
  • Lead the implementation and maintenance of the 5S Program. Train operation teams on basic lean concepts and problem-solving tools (5 Why’s Fishbone Diagram Pareto Analysis).
  • Document and share best practice within the BU and amongst another BU’s.

Main Tasks

  • Drive Regional programs and projects across countries in delivering operational excellence efficiency and productivity improvement cost reduction capacity towards achieving an improved OPEX Quality and Service Level.
  • Review and implement operations improvement projects with the country operations. Conduct Lean Value Stream Mapping Methods Analysis Works Sampling Time & Motion Study Operation Research Modelling and other techniques to facilitate in identifying key productivity improvement in the warehouse operations.
  • Lead ZOE – Zuellig Operational Excellence program conduct Lean Tools training and roll-out of any continuous improvement framework as 5S TOP – Team Optimization Program (methodology such as Kaizen Lean Six Sigma) Operational Efficiency Programs as required at a Country Level.
  • Support the development of regional and country dashboards that will measure productivity across the various processes in our operations and support the implementation of effective monitoring systems. Support the benchmarking of performance between the different BUs and against leading service providers (where required and possible).

Roles & Responsibilities
  • Monitoring of Company activities to ensure compliance with MAS requirements and procedures
  • Training of employees on all compliance matters
  • Maintain and update company Compliance Manual
  • Compliance officer and liaison with MAS
  • Identify and address compliance gaps in the business process
  • Act as Data Protection Officer
  • Organise and monitor CPD training
  • This position will also assist on
  • MAS 502 forms
  • Background checks on new employees
  • Core system for notification of new financial advisors
  • MASnet fees
  • MAS Surveys
  • MAS Liaison officer
  • Other duties as assigned


Requirements
  • Candidate must possess at least Diploma/Advanced/Higher/Graduate Diploma in any field.
  • At least 2 Year(s) of working experience in a brokerage firm is required for this position.
  • Preferably Junior Executive specialized in General Insurance products or equivalent
  • Compliance officer would report to Finance Manager & Operations Manager and ultimately to CEO

    • Applicants who are interested in this role are invited to apply with their comprehensive resume with full details via "Apply Now" button.

    You can visit our website at www.pacificprime.sg

Who Are We Looking For

As part of the Business Development team you will be a key driving force behind the fastest-growing tech startup in the construction industry. Work closely with the CEO and be put in charge of your own projects. At Hubble we aim to revolutionise the entire construction industry and you will be at the very front lines of this expansion as you identify strategic areas for growth and create new opportunities.

What Hubble Will Give You

Hubble is built by a team of talented driven and ambitious individuals. We do not subscribe to conventions. We do not let history and traditions dictate and limit our dreams to shape the world. We adopt the same mindset with our hiring. We are looking for the best and we want to bet on you. In this position we want to groom you to take on a leadership position. Join only if you want to take on the challenge of leading and growing your own team. We will give you all the exposure and resources you need to grow into the role of Business Development Manager.

Who Will You Be Working With

If you connect with any of the description below please apply immediately:
  • Purpose driven
  • Hungry ambitions and self-motivated
  • Meritocratic results/performance > age/bureaucracy
  • Resourceful independent chart our own destiny
  • Determined perseverance and hard working
  • Creative innovative out of the box
Yes the above is everyone of us at Hubble.

What You Will Be Doing
  • Work closely with our clients proposing innovative solutions to improve their operations and empower data-driven management decisions through strategic use of technology
  • Take charge of client acquisition and create new business opportunities to maintain the company’s relevance and competitive edge
  • Further Hubble’s growth by exploring potential prospects pursuing new leads and taking charge of deal-making repeat-sales and partnerships
  • Conduct market share analysis to develop revenue growth strategies
  • Develop a comprehensive understanding of client pain points and communicate user requirements to improve our product offerings
  • Collaborate with the engineering team to define product scopes and deliver game-changing products
  • Ensure high levels of customer satisfaction and gather user feedback to inform product development
  • Conduct market research to better understand the industry and client operations
  • Contribute to defining and establishing Hubble as a leading regional company

What We Need From You
  • Singaporeans preferred
  • Bachelor's degree with good academic results
  • Minimum 5 years relevant experience (Preferably software sales tech or construction)
  • Ability to generate leads and identify strategic areas for growth
  • Independent focused and driven
  • Excellent written and communication skills
  • Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to take the initiative to forward team goals
  • Enjoy solving complex problems with technology
  • Strong business acumen team player results-oriented

Who Are We

Hubble is a leading technology company focusing on the construction and engineering industry. We are on a mission to build the world’s first autonomous construction sites by automating and trading the 4M (Man Machine Material Money) resources.

Our solutions help digitise all your work processes and connect all key project stakeholders - developers consultants fabricators contractors and facility managers - onto an all-in-one platform - The Hubble Platform.

Build faster and cheaper and with the highest quality and safety standards with Hubble’s impactful technologies. Let’s transform the way we build our cities for a better tomorrow. Today. Together. For generations to come.

Visit us at to learn more for #bettercitiesoftomorrow

Job Title: Programme Admin Officer / Senior Programme Admin Officer

ABOUT SGINNOVATE:

Our mission is to enable ambitious and capable individuals and teams imagine start build and scale globally-relevant technologies. SGInnovate’s priority is to work with startup founders who have research-originated IP at the core of their company. We back these entrepreneurs through equity-based investments access to talent and support in building customer traction. SGInnovate is a private-limited venture capital wholly owned by the Singapore Government.


Introduction of Talent Networking Team (TNT):

The Talent Networking Team (TNT) bridges talent to Deep Tech startups. We are building a talent pool and connecting these individuals to Deep Tech founders. We have a range of engagement activities which we drive to build meaningful connections with these individuals they can be intellectually stimulating inspiring and most of all fun to be at. These can include apprenticeships development workshops networking sessions career fairs etc. We want to leave a lasting impression with the attendees and encourage them to join our deep tech founders’ missions.


With the expansion of Talent Networking Team we are looking for a motivated and meticulous individual to support day-to-day operations of our various talent initiatives.

 SGUnited Traineeships Programme

Traineeship Description

This position reports to the General Manager and interfaces with various stakeholders of the business. Dashmesh is committed to a continuous improvement culture that invests in next generation leaders on-going development of a supportive workplace and technological advancements.

The management trainee role provides the best opportunity for fresh graduates to undergo cross-functional rotations to gain optimum exposure to different facets of the business in one year. The deserving management trainee can look forward to an accelerated career track to a middle management permanent role and Dashmesh will be keen to sponsor the accelerated high-performer for further studies or professional qualifications after one year of traineeship.

Specific Responsibilities

Trainee To Be Involved In
  • Dashmesh sales fulfilment activities - Accurately capturing customer orders; executing order creation packing and delivery processes at back-office; invoicing customers and addressing their queries; performing incident or crisis management for gaps arising from order fulfilments
  • Dashmesh e-Commerce activities - identifying customer needs and market trends; analyzing performance of e-Commerce platforms for improvements; executing e-Logistics delivery
  • Dashmesh SCM operations - executing established and small scale supply chain operations for customers; supporting sales operations and accounting for suppliers; learning and applying operational policies standards and procedures; assisting with contracts and documentations for trade transactions
  • Dashmesh warehouse operations - learning and supporting operations according to different warehousing situations and contingencies; performing stock-take stock control arrangement rotation and housekeeping of warehouse items
  • Dashmesh business IT projects - contributing to key activities and milestones in technology implementation projects for enhancing logistics and SCM processes
Competencies
  • How to execute supply chain solutioning modelling planning and strategizing
  • Gain experience with order fulfilment administration delivery management import and export documentation administration and inventory control
  • Gain experience with operations risk management as well as vendor supplier and contract management
  • Active participation in e-Logistics IT solutioning and e-Commerce campaign management
  • Gain experience with warehouse administration inventory control audit maintenance housekeeping and management
  • How to engage colleagues customers suppliers and other stakeholders professionally
  • Active participation in technology integration projects in a real business environment
Education Qualifications Required For The Traineeship Role

Polytechnic Diploma

Duration of Traineeship Offered

1 year

Eligibility Criteria for SGUnitedTraineeships
  • Singapore Citizen or Permanent Resident; and
  • Graduated or graduating in calendar year 2019 or 2020 from ITEs polytechnics universities or other educational institutions (e.g. private universities and overseas institutions); or
  • Graduated earlier from above institutions and completed National Service in 2019 or 2020.

Job Title: Graduate Talent Program 2021| Group Operations| Singapore
Job Description:
Job Reference #

216610BR

City

Singapore Singapore

Your role

"Are you a great innovator? Do you know how to solve problems and increase efficiencies? We’re looking for someone like that who can
  • acquire product and front-to-back process knowledge quickly and apply it to support highly structured or non-standard transactions
  • understand risks and apply this knowledge to risk metrics
  • support new or emerging business areas by indentifying limitations including systems risk and operational feasibility
  • stay aware of current economic and market activity keeping an eye on how this affects risks
  • identify and propose potential solutions for addressing control gaps.

Your team

You'll be working within Group Operations the backbone of our organization. We manage processes for performance control and efficiency. Our role is to deliver best-in-class post trade services across Investment Bank Global Wealth Management and Asset Management. We do this by enhancing our front-to-back delivery while standardizing and simplifying processes and infrastructure.

Your expertise

"You need to be graduating in 2021 or with less than two years of work experience. It doesn’t matter what you’re studying. (Really it doesn’t.) But we’d like to see evidence that you can
  • analyze a problem take a view and come to a decision
  • plan organize and communicate well
  • make things happen
  • stick with a task
  • work in a team
  • come up with ideas
Perhaps you’ve organized a fundraising event or taken part in team sports? Or persevered and passed an exam in a subject you found challenging? Think about how things you’ve achieved match the skills we’re after.

About Us

"Expert advice. Wealth management. Investment banking. Asset management. Retail banking in Switzerland. And all the support functions. That's what we do. And we do it for private and institutional clients as well as corporations around the world.

We are about 60000 employees in all major financial centers in almost 900 offices and more than 50 countries. Do you want to be one of us?

Join us

Together. That’s how we do things. We offer people around the world a supportive challenging and diverse working environment. We value your passion and commitment and reward your performance.

Disclaimer / Policy Statements

UBS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures perspectives skills and experiences within our workforce.
