About the Role

The Great Room seeks an energetic Centre Manager (CM) who is the leader of the Office and will be looked upon to create a community amongst our members and to manage and guide the Member Relations team.  

 

You will report directly to the Country General Manager and will be managing the Office as per company standards and expectations. The CM plays a critical role in maintaining a full occupancy of the Office and ensures member’s satisfaction for the Office under your care. You will ensure that the Office is efficiently managed and operated while driving growth and promoting the brand.  

 

This position requires a high level of intellectual rigour and integrity of the highest and a passion for structure and details. A proven track record in managing operations and leading a team are key. The CM enjoys being part of a fast-moving and dynamic team. 


What will you do

Build our Brand Presence and Growth 

  • Open the office with high occupancy and ensure the offices are fully occupied thereafter 
  • Managing Office performance – occupancy revenue profit budget member’s satisfaction & growth etc. 
  • Work closely with Marketing to convert leads to business for the Office 
  • Work with Country GM to manage the Office’s P&L performance. Analyse financial performance and produce relevant reports to present to relevant stakeholders.  
  • Implement attentive cost control when necessary 

 

Enforce Operational Rigour 

  • Implement and monitor systems to ensure smooth daily operations for the Office. Work with the corporate Operations team to ensure this.   
  • Become the brain trust and driver of all things related to your Office including (1) Sales (2) Operations (3) Strategy and (4) Analytics. 
  • To manage and oversee all aspects of the Office’s operations including member relations finance sales marketing and events 

 

Direct with Charisma 

  • Hire manage and motivate the team on the ground. Serve as both a coach and a team player to the member relations teams; assist to create and implement robust policy and procedures. 
  • Be a force of nature that pushes boundaries possibilities quality and deadlines by always being warm but demanding in a professional manner. Maintain a calm disposition even (and especially) during stressful situations. Be optimistic and help other stakeholders and team members do so as well.  

 

Be the Pillar 

  • Work with corporate’s Operations team to design and implement process and procedures to optimize member experience and increase operation efficiency 
  • Support the GM and other team members in sales activities tours and developing strategies to increase occupancy enhance members engagement and team members satisfaction 
  • Be the local expert responsible for The Great Room’s compliance with local regulation and practices  

 

Lead the Team 

  • Maintain The Great Room brand standard in the local market 
  • Ensure utmost security and safety for our members and team 
  • Represent The Great Room when the right occasion turns up. Be able to effectively communicate the rationale behind our business decisions through strong oral and written communication skills to internal and external parties. 

 

Who you are

  • Able to work under pressure in a fast-paced environment 
  • Someone who is ready to get their hands dirty and understands that devil is in the details  
  • Have prior experience in a sales or business development related role (preferably in co-working) 
  • Gets excited about working with numerous people across cultures day to day  
  • Impeccable and concise communication and presentation skills verbal and written  
  • Demonstrate integrity responsibility and good work ethics  
  • Proficient in basic computer skills including Microsoft Word Excel and PowerPoint 
  • Strong organisational skills including the ability to prioritise multi-task delegate and work effectively with minimal supervision. 
  • Demonstrated ability to consistently meet deadlines  
  • Strong time management skills and experience managing multiple projects simultaneously  
  • Self-directed with a high level of initiative and a ‘can do’ attitude  
  • Finds it easy to bridge corporate and start-up culture  

 

What you’ll receive

  • Competitive remuneration
  • 5 day work week (though there may be occasions where you will be required to work on weekends due to Events etc.)
  • Annual Leaves & Public Holidays
  • Birthday Leave
  • Monthly Mobile Allowance
  • Reimbursements for business related trips
  • Flexible Benefit (for medical and other approved wellness healthcare activities etc.)

 

 

Does this sound like you?

Job Title: Editions Site Operations Associate - Expression of Interest
Job Description:
Operations Associate - Editions Site

If you are interested in speculatively submitting an application please do so via the 'apply now' button. As we grow and develop our Editions team we will get in touch with you to discuss opportunities.

Why Deliveroo?

When you first think about Deliveroo you probably think of getting great food to your house in less than half an hour. Awesome right? But behind the scenes is the real story. This story is one of high growth huge challenges and an enormous opportunity ahead of us.

We want to be the definitive food company - the app you go to any time you have a hunger pang. We are transforming the way people think about food. We’re a technology driven company at the forefront of the most rapidly expanding industry in the world so come and join us for the ride.

What You'll Be Doing

Deliveroo Editions are our solution to ensure that our customers have access to the best of the food scene no matter where they live. We operate these bespoke delivery only kitchens designed to host a locally curated selection of restaurants across the globe and have big plans for more of the same.

As the Operations Associate you will manage the whole site when on shift. From maintaining the kitchens to ensuring the smooth running of all the delivery operations working alongside our Restaurant Partners to improve their day to day business.

You'll be always looking to improve kitchen efficiencies overall from prep time and service time to Food Safety & Hygiene standards you will have a huge influence on maximising the profitability of the restaurant brands through using your expert knowledge to suggest labour control and stock control amongst other innovative suggestions.

You Will

You will be working alongside the Site Manager & Assistant Manager whilst working closely with up to 10 Head Chefs and their kitchen staff.
  • Manage the day-to-day running of a Deliveroo Editions site; meeting health & safety standards managing stock deliveries site cleanliness etc.
  • Improve our restaurant partners kitchen operational efficiency
  • Improve site efficiency and reducing site operational costs
  • Liaise with our restaurant account management and rider operations teams to improve our overall site performance


Skills You'll Need
  • Minimum of 1 year experience in a fast paced hospitality environment whether this be contract catering operations events or restaurants.
  • Deliveroo is a weekend and late night company in the hospitality industry it is essential for you to work shift work including week nights and weekends. Typically 2 out of 3 weekend nights you will be required on shift and Sunday evenings are our busiest time of the week.
  • Ensure all deliveries are ready for pick-up by our riders involving coordinating with multiple kitchens
  • Comfortable in a guest-facing context we operate several dine-in areas within our Editions sites so being comfortable in a Front Of House environment with a smile on your face and a willingness to help is absolutely crucial.
  • Can do never give up attitude and the desire to grow and succeed with one of the worlds fastest growing food-tech companies.


Benefits
  • Become one of the key employees of an exciting startup changing the food delivery landscape
  • Versatile development opportunities
  • Flat hierarchies and a dynamic start-up atmosphere
  • Open respectful and fun company culture
  • Have a real impact on the company’s growth and evolution
  • Work with people who love what they do every day


Life At Deliveroo

We are a growing team with very large impact seeking to answer some of the most interesting questions out there. We move fast we’re always looking for new ideas and we’re very transparent about the decisions we make and why we make them. There are so many questions we need to answer and plenty more we haven’t even encountered. How do data and technology help restaurants to grow as consumer habits change? How can we predict what someone wants to order for dinner long before the idea has even crossed their mind? At Deliveroo these are just some of the tough problems we are solving - and there is no challenge that cannot be yours. No solution is owned by a particular team which means the scope for growth and personal impact is enormous.

Benefits And Diversity

At Deliveroo we know that people are the heart of the business and we prioritise their welfare. In 2018 we announced our decision to give every employee equity in the company. We did this because we wanted all of our employees regardless of location level or role to be owners and because we believe that this is the right thing to do. We believe this helps build a culture where everyone is committed and able to share in the company’s success. We believe a great workplace is one that represents the world we live in and how beautifully diverse it can be. That means we have no judgement when it comes to any one of the things that make you who you are. All you need is a passion for (most) food and a desire to be part of one of the fastest growing start-up’s around.

The ideal person for this role will have an understanding of demand generation advertising and analytics on top of technical and business-facing marketing operations experience.

Responsibilities
  • Drive for process efficiencies for these groups while keeping marketing operations business goals scalability and automation/system limitations in mind
  • Serve as a ‘bridge’ between marketing operations/systems and the business end-users
  • Identify solutions for process improvements.
  • Triage technical tasks like platform/tool requests and integration requests from business end-users.
    • Gather a business requirements document that lays out the business objectives and ‘why’ these things are necessary (not just tactics being requested)
    • Temper expectations of business and communicate what may or may not be operationally possible before bringing the request to the automation expert
    • Present the business case for new platforms to the MOPS team along with the expected improvements it would cause.
  • Document and maintain documentation of how to work with MOPS for business end-users.
  • Enable business end-users on platform and process changes and enforce process adherence.
  • Monitor the JIRA queue of requests coming in from the business end-users from the APAC region and identify anything that might need further discussion.
  • Serve as an expert in the respective group’s data sets/dashboards. Assist the business end-users with data interpretation and modeling.

Experience
  • Direct hands-on experience at a production level with Marketo Eloqua or Pardot. Experience with multiple platforms preferred.
  • Deep understanding and expertise of Salesforce
  • Experience with building analyzing and communicating data and reports to business end-users
  • Experience with building and adjusting integrations into third-party business end-user software (e.g. ON24 SplashThat Zoom Webex etc.)
  • Comfortable with having technical conversations and presenting the information to non-technical business users
  • Strong communication and presentation skills
  • Experience with SQL (Preferred)
  • Business level english required

Job Title: Senior Manager| e-Commerce Programs| Global Customer Operations
Job Description:
Would you like to be part of the most international company in the world? A company operating in more than 220 countries worldwide and has been pioneering cross-border express shipping since 1969. Would you like to be part of a business that connects people across the globe? And the more we connect the better life on Earth becomes. Do you want to make a difference? If you have answered Yes! to the above join our Insanely Customer-Centric team now! For more information on DHL Express please visit workingatdhl.com.

 

 

DHL Express Global Head Office has an opening for Senior Manager e-Commerce Programs Global Customer Operations. This role is intended to support the DHL Express FOCUS 2025 strategy including SEED Compliance and e-Commerce Innovation Agenda projects:

  • Deliver world-class e-Commerce customer new or enhanced solutions and services.
  • Oversee and drive network development preparation extensive UAT and beta pilot testing of new e-Commerce services across Operations Retail Customers and facilitate any cross-functional touchpoint needed.

 


This role joins the Global e-Commerce Customer Programs team in developing new e-Commerce capability. The work is intense dynamic fun and involves network-wide preparation UAT and beta testing follow-up with countries/regional business leads and driving customer readiness activities followed by further country deployment activities in the next phases.

 

Specifically the areas of support will include the following:

  • Global retail network – new DHL Express first mile drop-off capability system based set-up and country readiness.
  • E-Commerce customer onboarding preparation support.
  • Pre-deployment operations and other activity to drive network readiness for go-live in Q3 2021.

 

The role is responsible for overseeing and driving:

Pre-Deployment UAT beta testing and business deployment preparation for New e-Commerce service capability set-up across:

 

A] Execution towards full deployment of new e-Commerce service globally

  1. New capability global Retail point technical readiness progress tracking and follow-up.
  2. New capability global Retail DHL owned and Partner Service Points Process and training materials distribution.
  3. New capability global ground operations/standard operating processes update and training communications for couriers and operational first mile outbound facilities.
  4. Pre-deployment micro supplies global distribution set-up.
  5. UAT test case creation all testing follow up and pilot country rollout planning.

 

B] Customer online returns model transition – readiness for new capability

What’s In It For Me (WIIFM) e-Commerce Customer presentations towards transition

  • Follow-up internal preparation tracking with DHL customer lead teams [Sales/ Customer Operations Group/ customer facing technical team).
  • Support sales in positioning addressing customer feedback back into the project and network wide communications needed.

 

 

YOUR TASKS

 

Customer

 

  • Represent DHL Express to present the solution concept objectives and benefits to customers as required. Provide insights and inputs at these sessions to reassure customers or take responsibility for follow up actions required.
  • Ability to support the development of a solution to the customer’s situation at hand.
  • Ability to translate Customer requirements into actionable plans vs program development stage.
  • Manage and negotiate with DHL Express global consultants/vendors to ensure viable business changes/solutions.
  • Ability to support the development of a solution to the customer’s situation at hand
  • Respond to and provide counsel to cross-functional stakeholders as maybe needed on upcoming new service.
  • Ensure timely and detailed communications and actions are shared with the right parties till resolution.

 

Process

 

  • Ensure onboarding customer process is outlined and understood. Deal with incoming queries from customer teams.
  • Coordination of the customer deployment and execution of program new service.
  • Communication: Ensure all programs and initiatives direction and progress is communicated to all stakeholders.
  • Continuous Retail Operations Performance Improvement: Review Retail Point KPIs and drive the areas of improvement forward. Identify and highlight best practice and non-compliance fields and areas via a Retail OPS scorecard.
  • Customer Reporting – facilitate creation of automated dashboards as needed.
  • Conduct deep dives to assemble the data and diagnose the problem.
  • Identify the right root causes and engage the Network to review agree and commit to a plan of action.
  • Hold responsible Network party accountable for action and follow up.
  • Closing the Service Quality Loop: Ensure recurring issues are raised to the right management function and level for review and analysis followed by a plan of action for resolution. Communicate unresolved escalations to relevant Operations or Retail attention for further actions.

 


WHAT WE NEED FROM YOU

 

University Degree in Logistics Business management Economics Technology/User Experience design E-Commerce or equivalent industry experience in a related field.

 

  • Minimum of 8-10 years of relevant working experience (preferably at least 4-5 years of experience in team management across either network operations Sales/business development e-Commerce or Agile/UX projects).
  • Regional or global experience are advantageous.
  • Background/passion around e-Commerce Logistics.
  • Customer Experience Obsession: Start with the customer and work backwards. Whilst maintaining balance vs DHL Express landscape and Strategic Focus priorities.
  • Digitalization exposure – training/knowledge/agile or lean projects would be helpful.
  • Proven experience with small medium or large scale projects or program planning or management experience.
  • Proven experience with working closely with stakeholders to understand requirements and propose solutions.
  • Technical skillsets in the following would be beneficial:
  • Proficient with Data Visualization tools (eg.Tableau).
  • Develop functional data visualizations / dashboards.

 


Competency segment ‘Business’:

 

Analysis: 

  • Analyses written and numerical/statistical information accurately.
  • Considers all relevant information before drawing conclusions.
  • Assesses feasibility identifies patterns and trends in data. Makes rational decisions and recommendations.
  • Always find ways to simplify.

 

Dive Deep:

  • Stay connected to the details audit frequently and skeptical when metrics and anecdote differ.

 

Planning & Organizing:

  • Attend to all Customer requirements/requests at the right time sets clear and realistic goals and objectives. Establishes a course of action and a sequence of steps to ensure that activities and objectives are efficiently achieved. Is structured with good personal organization. Schedules time effectively and use efficient work methods and tools.

 

Decision Making:

  • Makes timely and appropriate choices based on accurate analysis and experience.
  • Uses sound judgment even in conditions of uncertainty and consults actively as necessary without making any assumptions.
  • Anticipates impact of decisions and plans how to manage risk.

 


Competency segment ‘Leadership’:

 

Maximising Individual Performance:

  • Give clear directions and ensures all details are provided by stakeholders in time to execute on deliverables. Enforces quality standards and agreed upon commitments.

 

Teamwork:

  • Works cooperatively with others to achieve target and objectives. Accomplishes own tasks in support of team goals and actively offers to help colleagues. Supports group decisions.

 


Competency segment ‘Personal’:


Ability to Influence:

  • Persuades others to own point of view based on analytics. Defends position assertively. Wins co-operation from others

 

Communication:

  • Communicates clear and concise written summaries of analysis provided. Strong ability to quickly isolate and articulate areas of improvement and opportunity. Establishes information by asking clarifying and probing. Listens attentively.
  • Always find ways to simplify.

 

Commitment to Excel:

  • Challenges self and others to exceed standards and achieve extraordinary results. Is not easily deterred when obstacles or   delays are encountered.

 

Drive and Resilience:

  • Demonstrate energy and enthusiasm.
  • Shows a high level of commitment to objectives and results.
  • Is resilient recovers quickly from setbacks. Maintains performance under pressure.

Description

Job Duties/Responsibilities may include but are not limited to:
  • Develop Lead and Coordinate Logistics OPACC Improvement portfolio projects across multiple cross functional work teams delivering end-to-end value chain improvements
  • Provide analysis and recommendations to Excavation Division (EXD) related to Transportation or Logistics practices and procedures to ensure timely and accurate movement of shipments.
  • Identify implement and monitor process improvements that will enable operations to improve the transportation/logistics network reduce risk and enhance the ability to become a more high-velocity and optimal cost organization
  • Support HEX facility efforts to improve Logistics performance
  • Stay abreast of new Logistics service providers entering the industry that may offer service advantages and value-added services to Excavation
  • Global Liaison with PSLD (Product Support & Logistics Division) Logistics to ensure EXD has an efficient network to manage Inbound components to HEX Facilities machines to End Customer or Dealer Location and Quality Velocity Cost improvements for HEX product at Global EPC’s (Equipment Processing Centers) and work with PSLD to create EXD specific logistics strategy
  • Ensure GTOC (Ground Transportation Operations) GMM (Global Materials Management) TLM (Trade Lane Management) EPC (Equipment Processing Centers) Last Mile Capacity Management while ensuring Cost / Velocity Trade Off Optimization
  • Champion continuous improvement projects to reduce the freight cost per machine


Qualifications

BACKGROUND/EXPERIENCE:
  • College or university degree related to Supply Chain / Logistics or Transportation or equivalent experience
  • Should have demonstrated project management skills team leadership skills and very good communication skills
  • Capable of leading projects and presenting to stakeholders at all levels
  • Must be a results-oriented change agent who is an effective business systems thinker.
  • Must be able to manage risk and ambiguity on a project.
  • Good analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Able to collaborate effectively across the matrix organization and keep an enterprise mindset
  • Minimum of six to ten years of progressively responsible supply chain / logistics or transportation job experience
  • Must be willing to travel up to 20% upon business needs.

Agilent inspires and supports discoveries that advance the quality of life. We provide life science diagnostic and applied market laboratories worldwide with instruments services consumables applications and expertise. Agilent enables customers to gain the answers and insights they seek -- so they can do what they do best: improve the world around us. Information about Agilent is available at www.agilent.com.

To strengthen our team in Singapore we are looking for an experienced Business Solutions and Process Expert (manufacturing) based out of Singapore. As a Business Solutions and Process Expert you are the critical link between Agilent IT and our Order Fulfilment Supply Chain and Manufacturing groups. You will be a pivotal team member for our global Business Solutions Manufacturing team. Your creative application of past MES and SAP experiences will be the key to success. You will get involved in strategic activities and help develop architecture solutions for our internal customers by being a Manufacturing Execution Systems(MES) Subject Matter Expert for Asia Pacific region. You will be a key resource in supporting expansion and scaling of MES footprint across multiple sites globally.

A Day in the Life

Responsibilities Include But Are Not Limited To

The Business Process Expert will work under limited supervision and will be expected to play dual active role in working with Operations and Engineering users.
  • Lead project planning resourcing staffing progress reporting issue resolution and delivery of results with effective communication across teams/functions for MES implementation at assigned manufacturing sites
  • Collaborate with MES experts to bring best practices for manufacturing global solutions alignment and help to support in positioning the manufacturing sites as world-class leading manufacturing operations within Agilent.
  • Work with Operations and engineering users to gather and identify business requirements and use-cases
  • Propose optimal inputs/recommendations for process and system-level solutions to support business needs
  • Be a partner to the manufacturing sites in process optimization and harmonization
  • Actively participate in digitalization initiatives and champion innovations through best practice discipline.
  • Project management and process management champion
  • Expert in process and discrete manufacturing business processes using process modeler and applications such as SAP ECC.

Bachelors or Master's Degree or University Degree in Engineering software applications

8+ years relevant experience in consulting IT and/or business process role

Able to understand business requirements and convert into business process models

Project management and project execution skills in the manufacturing area

Knowledgeable in SAP ECC and MES to consult in integration of SAP ECC (Quality Management Planning Production Batch Management Bill of material route definition execution consumption) as well as SAP ECC-MES interfaces topics

Global implementation of Manufacturing execution and SAP implementation end--to-end experience -- focused in the manufacturing plan-to-make processes.

Able to work and communicate quickly and effectively and have time flexibility as part of a cross-geographic and cross-culture team.

Required personality traits: Business Process-centric Self-driven Structured Systematic Diligence & Follow-through Quality-minded.

Must be fluent in English and Mandarin -- verbal and written communication skills.

Willingness to travel globally on need basis US Visa preferred.

SAP MES Application Suite Knowledge Preferred But Not Required.

Agilent Technologies Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race color religion sex sexual orientation gender identity national origin protected veteran status disability or any other protected categories under all applicable laws.

Traineeship Description: This position reports to the Deputy General Manager of Commercial and Marketing.

Specific Responsibilities Trainee To Be Involved In
  • Drafting of trading and chartering contracts;
  • Assist in application and negotiating of letters of credits;
  • Assist in the management of accounts receivables and voyage documents;
  • Liaison with external parties such as suppliers surveyors bank officers customers to ensure the vessels' shortest possible turnaround time;
  • Assist in the calculation of lay-time and demurrages;
  • Assist in the scheduling and planning for cargo and shipments;
  • Assist in chartering in/out of vessels;
  • Other ad-hoc assignment assigned by supervisor

Technical Skills and Competencies Trainee will learn during SGUnited Traineeship Programme:
  • Active participation in strategic planning process including developing goals objectives and processes
  • How to liaise with external parties and communicate internally in professional manner
  • Gain experience in commercial operations such as drafting and chartering contracts LC negotiations calculation of lay-time and demurrages and etc

Duration of Traineeship Offered: 6 months

Eligibility Criteria For SGUnited Traineeships
  • Singapore Citizen or Permanent Residents; and
  • Graduated or graduating in calendar year 2019 or 2020 from universities or other higher educational institutions; or
  • Graduated earlier from above institutions and completed National Service in 2019 or 2020.

Interested candidates may send in your latest CVs.

We regret that only shortlisted candidates that will be notified.

Summary

Contribution to the overall effectiveness of the bus operating business by providing and facilitating quality training programmes focused on Safety Service Reliability and Customer Service for Bus Captains and other positions.

Principal Responsibilities And Authorities
  • Facilitate Classroom and Practical Learning to Bus Captains and other Operational Staff where required by delivering soft skills/technical/operations training.
  • Ensure that all training delivered is consistent with Tower Transit Singapore’s Vision and Values.
  • Assist and support in the development of curriculum and training materials.
  • Proactive in supporting other areas of the Company particularly in projects that will require training assessment and operational support services to improve staff performance.
  • Carry out regular assessment of Bus Captains driving performance and deliver ongoing training as required.
  • Mentoring of all Bus Captains by providing continuous guidance and coaching.
  • Take on ad-hoc projects and duties as assigned.


Requirements
  • A team player with good interpersonal and communication skills and can adapt and work independently in a fast-paced multi-tasking environment.
  • Computer literate in the use of MS Words Excel and PowerPoint.
  • Attention to details and the ability to organise tasks in a structured and logical way.
  • Experience in delivering training to a multi-racial and multi-cultural workforce.
  • Relevant qualifications or experience in training & development.
  • Heavy Vehicle Licence (Class 4 and/or 4A) with Heavy Vehicle driving experience especially in driving omnibus or equivalent.
  • WSQ Advanced Certificate in Training and Assessment (ACTA) or WSQ Advanced Certificate in Learning and Performance (ACLP) required.
  • WSQ Diploma in Adult and Continuing Education (DACE) with experience in curriculum development would be an added advantage.

  • Applicants with industry experience will be considered for a senior position.

    Safety And Company Responsibilities
    • Adhere to all Tower Transit policies and procedures;
    • To report to your line manager any injury collision or dangerous occurrence that has taken place or concerns regarding health safety and security issues;
    • Provide leadership policy advice and guidance in identifying and managing health and safety issues as they apply to the workplace and workplace activities of trainees and other stakeholders;
    • Accountable and responsible for ensuring that the working or training environment is safe and that trainees are protected from hazards and comply with Company policies and procedures;
    • Ensure trainees comply with company policy procedures and rules;
    • Report hazards which cannot be corrected within the delegated authority of the position;
    • Active involvement in all safety and health programs and activities;and
    • Promote safety and health awareness generally.

Company Name: Singapore University of Technology and Design (SUTD)
Country: Central Singapore Community Development Council| Singapore
Job Description:
Job Description


SUTD Academy is the professional and continuing education arm of SUTD. We started up with a strong belief in lifelong education that goes beyond formal learning and that is self-driven self-planned and self-initiated. Our courses are designed to develop the skills and knowledge of individuals to help them stay relevant in the knowledge-intensive and technology-driven economy overcome the numerous challenges of tomorrow and excel in their career.


The advent of rapid digitalisation and the impact of COVID-19 have greatly influenced and transformed the way we work and learn today.


We are looking for a team member with a passion in lifelong learning and technology to be part of our team to support the operations and management of course delivery.

 

Your success will help our prospective learners enjoy and stay engaged with the learning experience at SUTD Academy.


The job scope of Programme Manager is as follows:

 

Programme Operations


  • Provide administrative service and support to prospective learners from enquiries onboarding to completion of their learning journey with SUTD Academy.
  • Collaborate and coordinate with internal support teams and external vendors to provide administrative and logistics support to SUTD Academy fellows with the goal of ensuring a smooth setup and delivery of all courses which will enhance both trainers’ teaching and learners’ learning experience.
  • Collaborate and coordinate with SUTD Academy fellows on their scheduling for the delivery of courses and programmes.
  • Manage and ensure that teaching aids training materials and IT assets are available and in their best condition.
  • Administer registration site and ensure timely update on course pages.
  • Work with relevant agencies to ensure timely reporting.


Finance Administration


  • Work with relevant stakeholders to ensure good finance and procurement practices.
  • Track and ensure timely collection and payment.


Strategy and Planning


  • Work with SUTD Academy team to develop strategies and plans for enhancing the participants’ journey with SUTD Academy.
  • Strive for continuous improvement to enhance productivity in the work flow and processes.


This is the right role for you if you:


  • Believe in lifelong learning and like to help people. Helping someone successful makes you feel warm and a sense of satisfaction.
  • Like to take challenge with a positive perspective discover and define the real problems ideate and develop innovative solutions.
  • Enjoy finding the way and co-creating empathetically together with stakeholders and keep the conversations going till you get there with the stakeholders.
  • Enjoy working with people and technologies.


And you should have:


  • At least a Diploma.
  • At least 5 years of experience in operations customer service and basic finance work.
  • Good communication skills (written and presentation) as well as interpersonal skill

Overview

LeadIQ is a Series A funded startup with operations in both United States and Singapore founded on a world class company culture to enable sales intelligence productivity and insights with cutting edge technologies and innovation - just look at our stack!


We are looking for an Associate Product Manager to work alongside our Lead PM to learn and execute on new product launches end-to-end. We are at the inflection point for growth and we need strong product people to carry us forward. You should be comfortable in a hands-on collaborative and flexible environment with the ability to manage multiple product projects simultaneously while driving towards aggressive goals.


You will establish a close relationship with your Lead PM engineering CS Design and the rest of the product team members to execute high quality delivery of all elements required for our product launches iterations and long-term metric achievement. You will be a guiding force for some of the highest-profile initiatives in the company's history driving significant growth and you'll be held to understandably high standards.


Responsibilities:


This associate PM role will be the "CEO” of up to 1-2 product releases per quarter executing on our outlined product strategy for key product initiatives under the active mentorship from your Lead PM providing you a place to develop your execution skills on lean product strategy.


• Understand the ultimate user experience that we want to deliver to our customers and generate solutions to enhance their experience across the product lines you manage


• Own product metrics analyzing data and reporting regarding the products you launch. Product discovery is a huge part of our process here with not only metrics but also a deep collection of customer interviews to dive into learning with clear observation and validation of your target persona’s pain points.


• You should have a knack for both front end UX and some limited engineering concepts though you will also work with world-class engineering resources to supplement your feasibility requirements and limited experience.


• Ability to communicate and manage team members along with collaboration of shared resources across the department including Designers Data Scientists System Architects and sales / CS reps who can all help you execute and unravel mysteries.


• Along with mentorship opportunities via your Lead PM you need to be a constant learner and someone who can quickly pickup how to structure product initiatives like Beta tests and segmented roll-outs to maximize your learnings.


• We expect you to have (at least) a little context about B2B sales enterprise software CRM integrations or a clear path to achieve it rapidly before you go into the interview.


Qualifications:


• 1-2 years Product Management experience in SaaS digital B2B or data related products though we’re open to candidates with alternative experience if you can prove outstanding success in related areas.


• Impeccable written verbal and presentation skills (English)


• Ability to think strategically and execute tactically


• Excellent problem-solving organizational and analytical skills


• Prior work experience and/or education in a Computer Science or engineering capacity would be ideal


• Technical understanding. (A plus!) You won't write code and we don't expect you to but you do need to understand the implications of the features you're prioritizing and be able to communicate both ways with the engineers.


Perks:

• We offer an attractive startup environment to lead and launch with cutting-edge technologies and world-class engineers.

• A culture that thrives on creativity and individuality and opportunities for career development and learning including product and engineering mentorship.

• A comprehensive health and benefit package

• Flexible work from home policy and working hours

• 15 days vacation leave

• Additionally a conveniently located Singapore office in Tanjong Pagar surrounded by great eateries such as Shake Shack!


About Us:

LeadIQ is a sales enablement startup with offices in SF Bay Area New Hampshire and Singapore. We offer our team members a unique culture including flexibility trust and independence and are backed by Draper Associates Jason Calacanis Fresco Capital and Eight Roads.


Our team is diverse friendly and welcoming with experienced engineers you can learn a lot from and key technologies like Scala Play Kafka GraphQL Vue.js and Kubernetes to name a few. Plus an attractive upbeat culture and supportive amazing customers such as MuleSoft AppDyanmics WalkMe Gainsight and many more.

Job Title: #SGUnitedJobs Contract Assistant Manager to Manager| Team Lead for Air/Land/Sea Operations & Incidents Management
Job Description:
Purpose of job: To assist Dir SHN Ops and DD SHN Ops to ensure the smooth running of operations relating to people entering Singapore who need to serve their Stay Home Notice (SHN) in SHN-Designated Facilities (SDFs).

Main Responsibilities

To manage a team of officers to oversee operations for Stay Home Notice (SHN) in SHN-Designated Facilities (SDFs) in two major functions:
  • Air Land and Sea management
  • Incidence Management and Reporting
  • Air Land and Sea Management (ALS)
Responsibilities
  • Coordinate with relevant government agencies to track movement and manage smooth transfers from all checkpoints (airport terminals ferry terminals and land checkpoints) to SHN-Designated Facilities (SDFs) such as hotels
  • Track and monitor room stock assigned to PSHN+s
  • Liaise with relevant government agencies and STB Incidence Reporting team on SDF allocation movement of PSHN+s and resolving issues faced by PSHNs+ in the transfer to the SDFs from the checkpoints
  • Incidence Management and Reporting
Responsibilities
  • Manage a wide range of issues related to PSHN+s' stay at SDFs such as special dietary requirements medical and health-related issues and room-related requests
  • Liaise with fellow government agencies to manage the requests
  • Advise SDFs on SOPs and give guidance where needed
  • Monitor and respond to requests and issues across various operational channels
Requirements

You should possess experience in supervising and motivating small teams. You should be able to think on your feet problem solve and work under pressure. You should also be meticulous and organised and a good team player. Being able to write concisely and communicate clearly are essential for the role. Proficiency in MS Excel is required. Candidates with experience in operations work especially in the tourism sector will have an advantage.

This role generally allows officers to work-from-home. However officers may be required to work from Tourism Court if and when directed due to exigencies of service.

This is a 11-month contract position

Hummingbird Bioscience builds revolutionary biotherapeutics through the application of proprietary biological insights and technologies. We are on a mission to unravel the complexities of human disease. Using systems biology we find new and elusive drug targets and engineer breakthrough biotherapeutics to precisely intercept them giving people hope for new treatments when all others have failed. This is a bold new way of finding the right drugs for the right people.

Hummingbird Bioscience has built a pipeline of promising drugs expected to enter clinical trials in 2020. With locations in Singapore Houston Texas and South San Francisco California Hummingbird is well funded by venture capital and has established strategic collaborations with Cancer Research UK and Amgen. To learn more about our science pipeline assets and team please visit: www.hummingbirdbioscience.com

JOB DESCRIPTION

Join Hummingbird Bioscience on our journey as we transition from an early stage drug discovery company to a global leader in cancer drug development.  We are looking for someone who wants to be involved in cutting edge science yet is interested in the entrepreneurial and commercial aspects of drug development.  You will be working closely with the senior management team especially CEO and CFO/COO to provide them leverage across a varied range of business issues.


Key responsibilities will include (but not limited to):

Strategy

Work with the leadership team to develop a clear multi-year strategy for the company

Prepare materials for and support internal and external meetings including management board and scientific advisory board meetings

Operations

Identify develop and drive initiatives to support and improve the day-to-day operations and management of the company

Coordinate with the finance team for strong performance management and reporting

Project Management

Manage RFP processes and external contractors

Co-ordinate the preparation of reports and updates on projects with external partners

Develop and maintain relationships with partners to ensure successful delivery of collaborative initiatives



QUALIFICATIONS

Background in biological sciences preferred

Demonstrated experience of business; background in management consulting preferred

Excellent analytical and problem-solving skill with a solution-oriented mindset as well as entrepreneurial spirit and hands-on mentality

Strong organizational ability and ability to multi-task is essential

Must be a strong communicator with excellent presentation written and verbal skills

The ideal candidate will be a vital member of the Operations Team responsible for planning coordinating and implementing projects within the decided-upon budget timeline and scope. They will also effectively monitor and present project updates to relevant stakeholders clients or project team members. 

 

The candidate should be proficient in Marine Engineering Technology and past experience in IOT managed projects is considered as an added advantage. 


Responsibilities

  • Carry out audits on vessels to plan and specify installation projects.
  • Design and draw system components and fittings for each installation based on the audit.
  • Specify hardware and software packages for each vessel installation.
  • Carry out quality assessment on the material procurement for the system.
  • Manage field operations team ensuring high quality and on-time deliveries.
  • Take initiative to improve solutions by providing input and suggestions.
  • Follow and conform to the HSSE plan as per Maritime industry standards.
  • Responsible for documenting and reporting project deliverables.
  • Execute in-field testing and troubleshooting of software and hardware systems.
  • Schedule plan and assess each installation according to the vessel schedules including arranging personnel transport to and out of the vessel.
  • Be able to design and fabricate fittings onboard as demanded by vessel-specifics.
  • Commission software server and hardware package on board vessels. 
  • Verify signals and data input from own and third-party signal sources.
  • Ability to document and record various operational documents pre and post-installation.


Qualifications

  • Degree /Advanced Diploma in Marine/ Mechanical Engineering or the equivalent from an accredited educational institution or relevant experience.  
  • Must have excellent communication skills
  • Basic training and understanding of Machine Learning or AI and IoT.


Experience

  • 8-10 years of experience working with engineering in Oil/Gas Marine/offshore industry
  • Sailing experience as Engineer or control system design is an advantage.
  • Involved in digital products.
  • Experience and strong understanding of shipping or supply chain management solutions.
  • Strong passion for working in a start-up environment.
  • Build customer relations and ensure customer satisfaction
  • Have a solid track record of innovation and problem-solving. 
  • Ability to manage time and schedules to meet aggressive deadlines and influence through persuasive written and verbal communication.
  • Good IT proficiency including CAD drawing and basic programming skills.
  • Experience and understanding of Electrical/Electronics/Mechanical drawings.
  • Proficient in Marine engineering technology and troubleshooting.
  • Willing to share ideas and experience to further improve the team’s performance.
  • Out of box thinker and ability to see and understand the bigger picture associated with the Company’s product Company’s vision mission and objective.

Shangri-La Hotel Singapore

Key Responsibilities
  • To accord personalized and prompt service to VIP guests prior to arrival and after departure.
  • To ensure the overall well-being of all other guests requests are efficiently and effectively fulfilled in accordance with the policy established by Shangri-La Hotels and Resorts in order to increase customer satisfaction and maintain the warm and welcoming atmosphere of the Resort.
  • Be responsible to obtain feedback proactively at all times in readiness to address any guest concerns and to disseminate the relevant information pertinent to all respective departments.


Requirements
  • Candidate must possess at least a Certificate in Hotel Operations or equivalent qualification
  • Good interpersonal and communication skills
  • Enjoy meeting and interacting with people
  • Able to work shift hours weekends and public holidays
  • The successful candidate will be required to wear company issued uniforms in adherence to Resort’s grooming and uniform guidelines

• 4+ years relevant Business Analysis experience across Investment Banking Wealth Management or Asset Management

• Domain Working experience in support back office operations in the Finance Asset Management industry i.e. asset managers custodians fund administration etc.

• Working knowledge with back office processes such as trade confirmation settlement reconciliation corporate actions cash management portfolio accounting valuation and reporting. • Working knowledge with the financial instrument and processing characteristics of products such as Equities; Fixed Income; FX products such as FX NDF; Derivatives – Rates and Credits CFD.

• Exposure to investment operations and portfolio performance & attribution is an advantage.

• Working system knowledge of systems such as Simcorp Dimension (Preferred) Portia Hi-portfolio SWIFT Eagle PACE Sungard Intellimatch BlackRock Aladdin

• Excellent exposure to Agile methodology SAFe

Job Summary

GLG is seeking a Panel Associate to support and grow GLG’s online Survey business. This position is part of the globally centralized Panel Management department supporting a growing global Surveys business and help recruit update and maintain the conversion of GLG’s Council of Professional Experts into a structured Online Quantitative Research Survey Panel. The position will require a passion for collaborative thinking and a flexible workstyle. The Panel Associate will collaborate closely with the Panel Manager and the Director of Sample & Panel Management Operations on this endeavor. This role will support and collaborate with Survey Project Managers in dedicated regions and business units by providing accurate feasibility quotes scoping populations and field monitoring on a project to project basis.

The GLG Global Surveys Team facilitates the execution of hundreds of surveys per month across various industry verticals population geographies and client types. This position requires meticulous attention to detail the ability to prioritize and multi-task excellent written and verbal communication skills as well as a passion for creative problem solving and proactive project management.

The Panel Associate will report to the Panel Manager who will provide a close mentoring environment to rapidly accelerate development.

Specific Responsibilities Include (but Are Not Limited To)

Sample and Compliance leadership
  • Stringent management of reliable external panel partners holding them accountable to our cost timing and deliverable quality standards for Bids and Execution/Delivery
  • Collaborate with Project Managers and Compliance Teams to ensure only authentic accurately targeted and quality sample is collected for all projects
  • Responsibility for Oversight question compliance steps due to client-specific servicing rules


Thought Leadership
  • Consistent updating of panel data/monitoring of active panelists
    • Continually identifying innovative and efficient methods to collect and refresh profile questions data from GLG Council Members
  • Identify and implement efficiencies for Inviting and recruiting Council Members to survey projects
  • Adopt clear understanding of strongest panel partners for specific regions industries and business units
  • Contribute to new more efficient and scalable solutions to grow update and maintain the panel tool including but not limited to:
    • Development and enhancement of panel tool usage
    • Integration of other GLG Council Member data and strategic partnership databases


Commercial Leadership
  • Responsible for quick and accurate turnaround on project bids to produce best possible revenue margins with successful project recruitment
  • Maintain healthy survey rate metrics including invite completion and failed rates
  • Timely field management of competitive bids for panel partners
  • Contribute to the Team effort of driving sample costs down and enact this initiative on a project to project basis
  • Provide input to managers and collaborate with council management to build tools that support accurate and increased feasibility scoping and recruitment of sample targets


People Leadership
  • Develop a reputation as a can-do reliable resource and collaborator with Survey Project Managers
    • PMs will know you can provide cost field time and feasibility counts in a timely fashion to confirm with clients and win the project
  • Take feedback and direction from managers to improve processes and execution
  • Uphold and propagate best practices in internal and external panel management recruitment and recommending design/screening execution that will support Project Managers identifying and weeding out bad actors during data review


An Ideal Candidate Will Possess The Following
  • BA/BS or equivalent
  • 1-2 years of respondent panel management experience at a reputable market research or panel firm including experience with online survey platforms
  • External vendor relationship and individual project management experience
  • Coordinating/collecting and tracking bid project and performance metrics data
  • Invoice/payment coordination skills
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills


About GLG / Gerson Lehrman Group

GLG is the world’s knowledge marketplace. Our clients rely on GLG’s global team to connect with powerful insight across fields from our network of 700000+ experts (and the hundreds of new experts we recruit every day).

We serve thousands of the world’s best businesses from Fortune 500 corporations to leading technology companies to professional services firms and financial institutions. We connect our clients to the world’s largest and most varied source of first-hand expertise including executives scientists academics former public-sector leaders and the foremost subject matter specialists.

GLG’s industry-leading compliance framework allows clients to learn in a structured auditable and transparent way consistent with their own internal compliance obligations and the highest professional ethical standards. Our compliance standards are a major competitive differentiator and key component of the company’s culture.

To learn more visit www.GLG.it.

About the RoleSWIFT is a member-owned cooperative through which the financial world conducts its business operations with speed certainty and confidence. More than 11000 financial institutions and corporations in over 200 countries trust us every day to exchange millions of standardized financial messages. SWIFT is headquartered in Belgium with around 35 offices worldwide.
SWIFT Professional Services division of around 100 people delivers over 30 different types of services and support offerings to our end customers in Asia Pacific.
SWIFT has a unique corporate mindset where diversity personal development and networking are actively encouraged. Our employees are the foundation of this success.
We are now looking for an experienced manager to lead & Increase the delivery expertise and efficiency and accelerate talent on boarding by creating transparency on all development options available to Professional Services in APAC.
If you want to be part of our dynamic multi-cultural institution with over 2400 employees of 75 nationalities then explore the vast opportunities rewards and internationally competitive packages that we are waiting for you here at SWIFT.

The Function Includes The Following Tasks

Training and Skills Enablement
  • Establish development tracks geared towards specific products functions and business domains with a proper governance.
  • Identify organise enable and administer internal and external classroom trainings and certifications towards business and technical domains
  • Identify evaluate engage and manage external training vendor partners
  • Interact with Team managers and HR Business Partner to understand the development needs for staff and align on priorities and approaches
  • Identify experts trainers and mentors for each of the products functions and domains
  • Support the design and execution of training tracks for new and existing staff for technical and business related functional streams covering SWIFT Products and Soft skills

  • Interact with Team Managers and Subject Matter Experts to build specialise training tracks as required
  • Maintain multiple platforms to host all training artefacts on SWIFT products and services
People Development Strategy
  • Liaise with Global Teams to align on global training and people development strategy
  • Identify interact and plan with Team Managers on future training and upskilling needs in line with SWIFT’s future focus and strategy to prepare staff for new challenges of services
  • Continuous mind-set evolution – including emotional intelligence risk management culture and customer experience in line with SWIFT’s DNA
Partnerships Management
  • Assist the team to manage all services related commercial activities including defining and finalizing work orders issuing purchase requests managing partner related P&L and finance-related activities
  • Assist the team to manage all services and commercial contracts for APAC region including full responsibility of end-to-end contract for the region
  • Assist the team to handle all partner-related operational matters including monthly project cost and progress tracking procurement of laptops for specific partner resources
Education
University degree in Business Statistics or Information Technology or equivalent relevant experience

Experience
  • Minimum 5 years of experience in the financial services industry with customer interaction vendor management or similar capacity
  • Experience in engaging business partners and stakeholders and driving to alignment and action; along with experience in planning and managing large cross-functional efforts.
Professional knowledge and expertise

  • Influencing skills smart with assertive ability to take position towards strong personalities
  • Analytical and strong reporting skills with an inclination for problem-solving and attention to detail

  • Knowledge in SWIFT products services and solutions will be an asset

About Antler

Antler (www.antler.co) is an early-stage VC that enables the world’s most brilliant and determined people to build global businesses from the ground up. We support entrepreneurs to find a co-founder seek advice on validation and provide initial funding to build their businesses.


Responsibilities

The job offers an opportunity to gain an understanding of early-stage VC operations and knowledge of different industries by working closely with founders as well as to gain first-hand experience with how to assess business models start-up teams and market opportunities. You work along with the Program team and are involved in the following areas but not limited to:

  • Assist with planning and managing operations for our programs using Antler’s playbook and best practices
  • Work closely with the Program team to develop content for the program
  • Capture analyze and present data to assess business models start-up teams and market opportunities.
  • Follow up with portfolio companies wherever applicable to help support their growth and continued success after graduation - including administrative matters such as fundraising
  • Other administrative tasks to be specified that are associated with the varied nature of this role

We work Monday to Fridays but you may be expected to work on some weekends (You may take a day off during the week in lieu of that)


Education qualification:

Bachelor’s degree in a business or engineering or science or related field


What we are looking for:

  • Good understanding of Venture Capital & Financial Services
  • Independent and proactive with a can-do attitude
  • Results-oriented and outstanding personal commitment
  • Comfortable with quick changes tight deadlines and ambiguity
  • Excellent communications skills
  • Passion for entrepreneurship and believe the world needs more change-makers and innovators


Duration:

1 year


Eligibility criteria:

  • Singapore Citizen or Permanent Resident; and
  • Graduated or graduating in the calendar year 2019 or 2020 from universities or other educational institutions (e.g. private universities and overseas institutions); or
  • Graduated earlier from the above institutions and completed National Service in 2019 or 2020.


What we offer

  • Work in a fast-growing global organisation with a lot of responsibilities from day one
  • Great learning opportunities both in programs and beyond (especially how companies are formed how VCs validate ideas invest and coach start-ups)
  • A fun and global team all dedicated to making Antler and our portfolio companies a huge success
  • Opportunity to create a legacy and have a large impact: be part of building thousands of disruptive companies and support exceptional entrepreneurs from around the world
  • Be part of a world-class team!

Zion Global Marketing (ZGM) is a regional digital marketing agency that offers proprietary enhanced lead acquisition services that will generate highly qualified leads allowing clients to focus on the selling process for high conversion.


Our company also organizes high impact education events and seminars and workshops with world-renown speakers and trainers to bring world-class expertise to its clients. We conduct in excess of 200+ events a year and has run successful events in cities across the world including Singapore Hong Kong Thailand Taiwan Malaysia etc. 


JOB PURPOSE


Do you have management aspirations?


Or do you want to join an exciting career and fast-track your way to become an innovator problem solver and business leader?


Welcome to the Zion Global Marketing Management Trainee Program where we groom future leaders!

 

As part of the program you will undergo 1-year of intensive training designed to impart you with the skills to:


1. Take on multiple roles within the Marketing Operations Sales Finance & Human Resource departments to develop a deep understanding of how a fast-growing business is run


2.Develop your own style of leadership for you to effectively build motivate and manage a team under your care


3. Innovate strategize & create new systems that will enhance the performance of the business as a whole further driving sales & profitability


4. Strengthen and further develop the culture of the team to cultivate a perfect working environment that is inclusive productive and cheerful


5.  Thrive in an international work environment where you’ll be expected to meet & communicate with people from different countries - and also get the opportunity to travel


This once-in-a-lifetime opportunity isn’t for everyone.


We look for the highest standards especially in our future leaders. We look beyond top grades and book-smarts - instead we’re on the lookout for these qualities:


·        You Must Be Naturally Curious - “Why don’t we try it this way?” - that’s the type of pioneering spirit that we want. Be bold and willing to try new things and don’t be afraid of questioning the norm - because businesses thrive on experimentation.


·        You Must Enjoy Learning About Different Facets Of Business -  We’re not just looking for a “jack of all trades” - rather you should be passionate about integrating into all core facets of our company and you should develop a keen understanding of each.


·        You Don't Back Down From Challenges - The ZGM Management Trainee Program will NOT be a walk in the park. In ZGM we love challenges that push boundaries and spark innovation. Likewise you will be constantly challenged to prepare you as a future leader.


Only The Curious Ambitious And Serious Need Apply!


QUALIFICATIONS SKILLS & EXPERIENCE REQUIRED


  •  Less than 3 years of full-time working experience
  •  Strong interest in marketing and sales will be an advantage
  •  You should possess outstanding leadership and interpersonal skills
  •  You should be resourceful tough and resilient - qualities needed to excel in our fast-paced industry
  •  Flexibility and willingness to work both in and out of the office as travel may be required
  • Fresh graudates are welcomed to apply


To find out more about the position you can go to this link: http://www.zionglobalmarketing.com/zgmmt

Job Description:

Get to know our Team:
Grab Rentals is Grab's strategic vehicle supply provider. Our vision is to become the leading mobility solutions provider for every generation of Grab users. Join a dynamic and evolving team that uses data and technology to improve our transportation solutions.

Get to know the Role:

Grab Rentals (GR) Operations is a dynamic and evolving team which is the engine room of Grab Rentals. GR Ops is responsible on ensuring all GR vehicles are serviced to the highest standards to ensure quality safety and high utilization.

This role offers an opportunity to drive and manage all GR authorized workshops related activities Responsible for managing daily operations and executing strategies to enhance the health & lifespan of each and every Grab Rentals vehicles by:

  • Develop and establish metrics to monitor analyse and provide strategic insights to drive the performance and productivity of GR's authorised workshop.
  • Identify opportunities to reduce wastage minimise costs while continuing to deliver a delighftul customer experience.
  • Work with vendors and partners to improve customer experience and set priorities to improve them.
  • Collaborate with business and cross functional teams to identify process and system improvement opportunities.
  • Constantly reviewing SOPs with cross functional teams to develop and optimized plan for operations

The day-to-day activities:

  • Ability to effectively communicate with customers/ partner regarding services recommended and performed.
  • Ensure all planned / schedule maintenance (servicing) are performed and deliver as per maintenance contract requirements.
  • Manage multiple priorities simultaneously and ability to react on unplanned issues.
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment where continuous innovation is desired.
  • Able to verify work done by all authorize workshop & keep track of fulfilment of servicing schedule and repairs
  • Identify and prevent non-conformity relating to all maintenance and quality processes.
  • Report and update of GR's fleet management system in a timely and accurate manner.
  • Responsible for continuous improvement activities and projects to improve efficiency quality and cost.
  • Identify any maintenance & quality issues between internal and external parties.
  • Relentless desire to exceed company and customer expectations in delivering our services.

The must haves:

  • You have preferably at least 2 years of experience in the Fleet maintenance / automotive industry.
  • ITE / Diploma holders
  • Fluent written and spoken English
  • You are self-motivated individual who can get things done on time.
  • You are hands-on as needed and proactively assume responsibilities.
  • You can work independently and effectively in a complex changing and ambiguous environment.
  • You can initiate and maintain strong relationships with customers partners and vendors
  • You have good proficiency knowledge of MS Office and fleet management systems.
  • Technical vehicle knowledge preferred but not mandatory.

About Us

We pride ourselves as the best and largest vertically integrated omni-channel women's fashion brand in the region. Founded in 2010 we have grown to 250 people strong proudly headquartered in Singapore with country offices in Indonesia and Malaysia and an omni-channel presence across these 3 markets. In addition to our retail franchise in Cambodia we ship internationally to 15 markets (Hong Kong China Philippines and Australia New Zealand US Canada Macau Japan Korea Vietnam Thailand Myanmar Cambodia & Brunei).

We are taking our definition of new female retail global with our sights set on becoming the most thoughtful brand for the everyday woman.

The team

The Love Bonito team is a passionate dynamic innovative and fun-loving family. From fashion-lovers savvy marketers to tech whizzes we have a diverse team of talented individuals with one unified focus - our customer the Love Bonito woman. She is at the heart of everything we do and we pride ourselves in always taking an innovative data-centric yet considerate approach in creating the right experiences products and content for her. With big dreams and a grand mission we’re looking for great like-minded people to join us - people who are as passionate fearless and entrepreneurial.

If you’re looking for a dynamic no corporate-BS environment to learn grow and really make an impact we could be the perfect fit for you!

Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world gives them ways to share what matters most to them and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating solving problems and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.
Business Integrity's mission is to ensure safe and trusted connections between people businesses and Facebook. Our team works together to anticipate and predict potential threats to our platform design and build tools to protect against these threats and then implement and enforce these systems at scale. We leverage data analysis machine learning and a robust infrastructure to review the quality of promoted content on our platform. We partner closely with several cross-functional teams including product engineering and data science to ensure high quality and safe experiences for both people and businesses across the Facebook family of apps. Successful candidates for this team are adaptable creative have a bias toward action aren't afraid of being wrong and can successfully work across various teams & countries.

What Build the future is?

 

Build the future is the Prysmian Group Graduate Program. The 2021 edition of the program will be the edition number 10!  

Our Graduate Program provides an immersive experience in our company from day 1.

The program starts with a two-week Global Induction with trainings and activities led by the Prysmian Group Academy in collaboration with a Top-Ranking Business School. During the first weeks of your journey you also to connect and learn from your mentor.

Following your induction you will be part of a 1-year job rotation in 3 different departments: Research and Development Operations in one of our production sites and Commercial. After the first year of rotation you will start your international assignment for a duration of 3 years.  

The international assignment is a great experience to learn new ways of working acquiring new knowledge meeting new colleagues and embracing a new culture. At the end of your assignment abroad returning to the country you’ve been hired in you will be ready to take a new responsibility in the technical or business areas continuing your career in Prysmian Group.  

 

Who are you?

 

  • You are keen on joining a career in our industry and you are ready to embrace a new challenge.  

  • You have graduated in the last 18 months or you are completing a degree in the Engineering Technical or Business and Economics fields.  

  • We are a global company. Being fluent in English is key.

  • You have worked or studied abroad and you are willing to join another international experience with Prysmian Group.

  • We have global teams and we are present in 50+ countries. Having excellent communication and presentation skills is key.

  • You’d love learning and working with other colleagues.

 

Everyone at Prysmian Group has the potential to make their mark; because whatever you do wherever you are based you will be part of a company that is helping transform the world around us.  Ready to start a new journey?

Role Description

Homage is seeking an Operations Associate who enjoys working with the people at the heart of Homage: our Care Professionals. In the operations team we’re focused on building a community of dedicated caregivers nurses and doctors who are fully equipped to provide the best quality care to those who need it.

 

We have Associate roles available in both the Engagement and Support teams:

 

As an Engagement Associate you would be responsible for all of our proactive communications to Care Professionals as well as organising events sending surveys and  creating high-quality content to help them with their work. We’re looking for someone who is:

  • confident with people
  • has excellent writing skills
  • a lot of energy enthusiasm and initiative to get things done
  • able to produce high quality communications and content (email SMS website app)
  • comfortable working with numbers and data
  • minimum of 1-2 years of relevant experience with experience working in fast-paced and high-growth environments preferred

 

As a Support Associate you would be responsible for providing top-quality assistance to Care Professionals when they have a question or problem. This would mostly be through email but would also involve some telephone and in-person support too. We’re looking for someone who is:

  • empathetic and good with people
  • great at problem solving
  • has excellent writing skills and is able to produce high-quality written content
  • able to communicate effectively within the organisation to get the help and answers you need
  • comfortable working with numbers and data
  • minimum of 1-2 years of relevant experience with experience working in hospitality customer service or a similar environment preferred

 

Every candidate should have a passion for social enterprises and causes. You’re driven by Homage’s core mission and motivated by the impact of our services and platform. In other words you are highly-motivated and want to create a huge impact in a fast-growing start-up.

 

About Homage

Homage is a care platform that combines qualified and trained caregivers nurses doctors and health care organisations and funders with technology enabling care wellness and recovery wherever you are. The work that we do and technology we build transforms lives every hour every day. We’re looking for people who are talented driven and motivated by our social mission.

At Deloitte we offer a unique and exceptional career experience to inspire and empower talents like you to make an impact that matters for our clients people and community. Deloitte offers you a highly inclusive collaborative workplace and unrivalled opportunities to realize your full potential. We are always looking for people with the relentless energy to push themselves further and to find new avenues and unique ways to reach our shared goals.

When it’s time to reinvent how the wheels turn in your organization—to react innovate and reconfigure your business our Operations Transformation professionals’ deep sector knowledge coupled with our operational and technical expertise bring your strategy to life in delivering lower-cost more effective and fit-for-the-future operations that underpin profitable growth. We plan and deploy game-changing cognitive and digital technology to reduce costs maximize efficiency transform payments and revenue processes and benefit from innovative and emerging business models.

You will work alongside our clients to help them make decisions and implement solutions based on "Heart of the Business" transformation strategies to drive business value. You will also assist in determining the requirements of clients’ projects and programs by defining analyzing and managing requirements to help fulfill their needs. You will have the opportunity to exercise strong analytical and critical thinking skills with the chance to solve complex problems and communicate your findings.   • Assessing restructuring operating models organizational structures and business processes to streamline core operations’ service delivery.
  • Assist in proposal development as requested.
  • Actively expand consulting skills and professional development through training courses mentoring and daily interaction with clients.

Your role

In Addition To Living Our Purpose Consultants Across Our Firm Are Expected To

At Deloitte we believe in the importance of empowering our people to be leaders at all levels. You Are Someone With

 Enough about us let's talk about you:
