About The Team

Revolut does Operations differently. The team sits at the core of Revolut working with departments across the business to help solve issues and create effective scalable solutions.

Operations has been responsible for major milestones like launching Premium and building our banking infrastructure as well as saving millions of pounds for the business.

Working in Operations at Revolut will give you exposure to a range of different verticals where you will deep dive into the fundamentals of each business area you work on. This gives you breadth and depth of experience unrivalled in almost any other job and offers you the chance to have a huge impact on Revolut’s success.

About The Role

You'll be responsible for:

  • Building and optimising processes to prepare Revolut Singapore for hyper growth
  • Executing and scaling Singapore operations and work with the local Operations Team and London HQ on devising detailed playbooks product integrations and air-tight execution of Revolut products
  • Strategy: Exploring and defining which projects the team should prioritize and setting a timeline to reach goals quickly
  • Product improvement: Proactively searching for new features to providing a seamless customer experience
  • Managing critical vendor relationships and build performance tracking systems
  • Developing strategic supply chain partnerships and negotiate commercial terms

What Skills You'll Need

  • You have a minimum of 3 years of experience in a similar position
  • You have a solid track record of achievement
  • You have worked in a top tech company and/or startup have quickly assumed responsibilities
  • You can break complex problems into smaller ones and enjoy working with data to facilitate your work using such tools as SQL Python and Excel
  • You are curious by nature and interested in making an impact.
  • You can demonstrate this through various projects you have been involved in
  • You can make a good business case and convince people to help you execute

A Little About Us

When Revolut was founded in 2015 we had a vision to build a sustainable digital alternative to traditional big banks. Our mission now is to help our customers improve their financial health empower them to have more control and promote financial cohesion across the communities in which we operate. Launching into 2020 with 12 million Personal customers and over a quarter of a million Business customers only reinforced our belief in the vast need across the world for better financial services. As our customer base has boomed in the last year we’ve expanded our team to match that growth. We started 2019 with several hundred employees; we closed it out with 2000.

What We're Looking For

Revolut is being scaled up by people all around the world who share our vision. We’re looking for people who align with our five core values: we build a Dream Team we Never Settle we Get It Done because we Think Deeper and we Deliver WOW. You’re the kind of person who wants to join a community of forward-thinking people all personally and professionally invested in Revolut’s mission. You thrive in a collaborative space where everyone’s learning from each other and learning fast. We believe in empowering our Revoluters in their work giving them autonomy and ownership of what they do. We want everyone at Revolut to own their story and their successes - working with us means you’re not just another cog in the machine.

The Benefits

  • Competitive salary
  • Biannual equity bonuses
  • All the latest tech you need
  • Free Revolut Metal Subscription

Are you looking to make a difference in a patient’s life?  At AmerisourceBergen you will find an innovative culture that is patient focused and dedicated to making a difference.  As an organization we are united in our responsibility to create healthier futures.


What you will be doing

POSITION SUMMARY:

 

Provide the fastest on-time door-to-door service coordinating collections & deliveries processing shipments for exports and imports. Pro-actively clear shipments with Customs and other government agencies where possible. Liaise with airlines international agents and other overseas offices in our network ensuring our shipments are handled appropriately. Rectify operational issues minimising delays to agreed delivery times. Handle time critical shipments dangerous goods temperature sensitive products using special packaging (including refrigerants and temperature monitors).

 

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Imports:-



  • Monitor World Star screens applicable to inbound shipments (1 – 1 12 17 52 53 68) according to SOP 600 and operations email.


  • Respond to “ok to send” requests from origin offices.
  • Provide origin offices with sending instructions when necessary.

  • Verify job details against the shipping document to ensure job details are correct e.g. Drive away service code flight details etc.



  • Contact consignee to obtain relevant import licenses and confirm payment method for duty & taxes when required.



  • Clear shipments with all applicable government agencies in a timely manner to ensure the fastest possible delivery time. 



  • Ensure shipments are stored at the correct temperature condition on arrival until delivery.


  • Follow special instructions for each shipment.
  • Prepare delivery manifest for the Courier’s
  • Send inbound advise and POD confirmation to key customers as required.
  • Check and replenish refrigerants for shipments when necessary.

  • Submit import permits using Tradenet for controlled articles & substances and or high value items when appropriate.


  • Submit CMD within 7 days of the shipment being imported. 


 

      Exports:-



  • Monitor World Star screens applicable to outbound shipments (1 – 1 12 17 51 53 62 68) according to SOP 600 and operations email.



  • Arrange flight bookings



  • Prepare packaging and or refrigerants for each shipment when necessary



  • Mark and label shipments in accordance with local regulations and the IATA DGR.



  • Follow destination office sending instructions.



  • Enter all applicable extra charges for each job.



  • Update and manifest jobs including attaching documents to Optiview.



  • Submit FHL & FWB data through airline interface



  • Obtain necessary endorsements / clearance with applicable government agencies when appropriate.



  • Confirm uplift (postflight) for all outbound shipments including agent locations & airline transfers.



  • Perform station transfer for shipments transiting Singapore.



  • Check and replenish refrigerants when necessary for all outbound shipments including shipments transiting Singapore.



  • Submit export permits using Tradenet for controlled articles & substances and or high value items when appropriate.



  • Submit CMD within 7 days of the shipment being exported. 




 


What your background should look like (minimum qualifications)

 

EXPERIENCE AND EDUCATIONAL REQUIREMENTS:

   

  • Driving License

  • Minimum ‘O’ level with a pass in English and or above Polytechnic Diploma or equivalent.

     

    REPORTS DIRECTLY TO:

  • National Manager Client Services Duty Operations Managers Lead Operations Executive

     

    MINIMUM SKILLS KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITY REQUIREMENTS:

  • Keep calm in pressure situations

  • Attention to detail

  • Solution oriented

  • Multi tasking

  • Practical thinking

 

 

 

 

World CourierOur commitment to People Quality and Innovation means we deliver career opportunities that few others can match. From our beginnings 50 years ago couriering time sensitive high importance documents to today’s cutting edge logistics solutions for Cell & Gene Therapies that save lives we now have over 3000 employees at 140 offices in more than 50 countries worldwide and are part of Fortune 10 corporation AmerisourceBergen.

What AmerisourceBergen offers

We offer competitive total rewards compensation. Our commitment to our associates includes benefit programs that are comprehensive diverse and designed to meet the various needs across our associate population.

• Healthcare for associates and eligible dependents same-sex and domestic partners• Paid time off including vacations and holidays• Paid volunteer time off• Life insurance and disability protection• Pet insurance• Employee Stock Purchase Program• Retirement benefits and more…

Throughout our global footprint and various business units we take a balanced approach to the benefits we offer. Many benefits are company-paid while others are available through associate contributions. Specific benefit offerings may vary by location position and/or business unit.

About AmerisourceBergen

AmerisourceBergen is a publicly traded Fortune 10 global healthcare solutions company and is one of the world's largest pharmaceutical services companies. Powered by our associates around the world we provide pharmaceutical products and business solutions that improve access to care.  We operate the backbone of the healthcare supply chain. We drive the future of local care delivery.  We guide medical innovations to market.  We create healthier futures.

Company Description

The IKEA vision is to create a better everyday life for the many people. We do this by offering a wide range of well-designed functional home furnishing products at prices so low that as many people as possible can afford them. We operate in Singapore Malaysia and Thailand – and have an ambitious expansion plan to bring a little bit of Sweden to new markets in the region. We are part of the Ikano Group of companies and the only IKEA franchisee owned by the Kamprad family that founded IKEA.

We also develop own and operate Shopping Centres that are anchored by IKEA and create walkable communities by including residential office and other types of real estate in our development plans.

We work towards making sustainability a natural part of our everyday work. We are active in our communities driving and supporting social initiatives that benefit children women and the environment.

Job Description

About the job

IKEA Jurong is a unique city centre store in a popular shopping mall. It is a smaller store with a big turnover and with 3 million visitors. It will be led by an ambitious team consisting of the Store Commercial Operations IKEA Food and a Retail Foundation Manager.
  • Support Operations Manager in Business plan budget and forecast process by translating the store’s strategy and goals in Profit & Loss (P&L) scenarios using financial analysis and benchmarking;
  • Lead the store’s monthly financial reporting together with the regional and store’s accounting team by timely efficient accurate and compliant invoice management;
  • Monitor the store’s budget through close follow up of the P&L and provide regular updates to the store management on the store’s financial position and recommend improvement measures in case of deviation and potentials;
  • Provide relevant and user-friendly business information on the store’s performance KPIs;
  • Support the sales team in converting performance insights into actions towards maximising business opportunities in the most efficient and effective way;
  • Supporting correct procurement of indirect material by requesting and comparing supplier quotations by periodic reviews on contracts management administering purchase tool user management.
Qualifications

Your profile
  • Highly developed analytical and numerical skills; Result oriented;
  • Strong management and leadership experience;
  • Self-reliant and motivated with proven ability to work as part of a team as well as independently;
  • Ability to influence;
  • Flexible approach to work and open to change;
  • Being able to communicate clearly and succinctly both verbally and in writing;
  • Good working knowledge of all areas of IKEA business;
  • Experience in setting and implementing long-term strategic plans setting budgets and following up on goals.
Additional Information

Please apply by 15 November 2020

Ninja Van is a tech-enabled logistics company on a mission to provide hassle-free delivery services for businesses of all sizes across Southeast Asia. Launched in 2014 we started operations in Singapore and have become the region's largest and fastest growing last-mile logistics company partnering with over 35000 merchants and delivering more than 1000 parcels every minute across six countries.

At our core we are a technology company that is disrupting a massive industry with cutting-edge software and operational concepts. Powered by algorithm-based optimisation dynamic routing end-to-end tracking and a data-driven approach we provide best-of-class delivery services that delight both the shippers and end customers. But we are just getting started! We have much room for improvement and many ideas that will further shape the industry.

The Regional Operations team is looking for a results-driven individual with a bias for action to handle operations within Singapore and the region. You will support the Department’s objectives to help develop organisation structure for scale and execute on providing operational excellence. The ideal candidate for this role should have exceptional analytical skills a marked taste for operational challenges and the ability to present information clearly.

Responsibilities
    • Put together dashboards to monitor performance across the region and to flag potential issues before they become problems
    • Develop and execute analytical tools to measure operational excellence and be expected to concisely explain both what the numbers are saying and what we should be doing to senior leadership
    • Develop and share best practices to scale operations of cities
    • Execute on plans for major strategic initiatives and new project launches
    • Document finalised initiatives into standardised operating procedures expeditiously

Requirements
    • Bachelor's Degree in any field from a recognised university
    • Up to 2 years of relevant working experience
    • Applicants with minimal work experience but possess strong extra-curricular and internship records are welcomed to apply
    • Willingness to travel for up to 3 days per week
    • Absolute team player with strong communication and organisational skills - you are able to interact with people at all levels of the organisation
    • Balance attention to detail with swift execution - we need to do things quickly and we need to do them well. Balancing those can be challenging and this should be a strength
    • Can-do attitude - we are a lean team and many times responsibilities may fall out of one’s exact job description; we are looking for folks that are willing to roll up their sleeves to get the job done
    • Explorer - the ability to self-serve investigate and get the date we require will make you much more effective in this role. Self-starter attitude is a must!

Preferred
    • Demonstrated work exposure in process improvement work preferably in a supply chain capacity
    • Experience using SQL for reporting
    • Hands-on experience using Excel or data-management skills - many say they are great in Excel fewer truly are. The ideal candidates brings some impressive know-how (and the understanding that there's always more to learn)

Submit a job application

We at Yara are part of a global network collaborating to profitably and responsibly solve some of the world's key challenges - resource scarcity food insecurity and environmental change.

About The Unit

There are more than 500 million smallholder farms globally. 2.5 billion people depend on Smallholder Communities for their food and livelihoods. Smallholder regions are characterized by low living standards high rates of illiteracy and low agricultural productivity. Yara's mission is "Responsibly Feed the World and Protect the Planet". Key to achieving this is enabling thriving Smallholder Communities. At Yara the Smallholders Digital Team is part of the Crop and Digital Solutions Unit.

About Crop And Digital Solutions

Yara aims to be the crop nutrition company for the future and is leading the development of sustainable agriculture and digital tools to contribute to solving global agricultural challenges. We have a worldwide presence with sales teams in ~150 countries and around 17000 employees. Yara Farming Solutions will lead the transformation towards more sustainable and efficient food production by innovating our offerings and the way we work. Crop and Digital Solutions is responsible developing and scaling new “on-farm” digital and integrated tools and solutions for an efficient and transparent food system.

Responsibilities

The team works as a business facilitator looking across all of the digital product lines of the organisation and proactively looking for ways to help people move faster. This involves handling various projects across functions.

Main Tasks Include
  • Support the Program Manager in improving workflows and streamlining processes for Smallholders business line.
  • Assist with day-to-day decisions of process documentation business automation and internal systems. Align decisions with key stakeholders globally.
  • Assist with project progress facilitation knowledge building and documentation.
  • Work with the team to manage schedules and resources.

Profile
  • Strong personal/professional interest in the LSM segments (developing countries low-income markets etc) and agriculture in general.
  • Personal interest in making things work better finding holes in processes streamlining and optimizing for excellent user/personal experiences.
  • Background/Education related to program/project management compliance or operations related functions.

Additional Information

We strive to reflect the diversity in society and encourage all qualified applicants from all background to apply. We are committed to creating a work environment that fits gender equality and allows combining career progress with the needs of a family or other personal circumstances

Why us?
  • Evolving tech development division of an established agricultural products and services company.
  • Explore and develop digital software hardware products which provide value to farmers smallholder communities and the value chain.
  • Be part of our mission to build sustainable solutions that benefit humanity and the environment.
  • Full-time permanent and freelance contract options available with competitive remuneration + benefits.
  • Support for personal development training and continuous learning.
  • Commitment to using new technologies and frameworks meetups and knowledge sharing.

Apply no later than

Job Title: Strategy Operations Lead| Payments and Next Billion Users
Job Description:
Due to the current health crisis related to COVID-19 and the escalating visa/travel restrictions in place we're currently unable to extend offers to anyone who cannot work from Singapore due to lockdown visa/travel restrictions or other restrictive measures until further notice. Consequently we will be prioritizing candidates who can start in this location by set date as expected. We're keeping the situation under review and would adjust our position should the restrictive measures be removed later on.

Minimum Qualifications
  • MBA degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 5 years of relevant work experience.


Preferred Qualifications
  • Ability to deal with ambiguity and work independently across multiple functions and product areas to drive alignment and deliverables.
  • Demonstrated business acumen combined with problem solving project management and analytical skills.
  • Excellent executive-level written and verbal communication skills with ability to influence and collaborate with leaders across the organization.


About The Job

As a Strategy and Operations Lead you will demonstrate project management skills executive communications and business judgment to support strategic decisions and drive growth initiatives across the full suite of Next Billion Users (NBU) and Payments products. Your focus will be to enable an externally facing Business Development team and effectively program manage and align internal teams and functions. You will work in a rapidly changing industry tolerate ambiguity pick up tasks even when they are beyond your scope and demonstrate problem-solving leadership with limited oversight.

Google’s Global Partnerships team powers extraordinary user experiences through partnerships that solve users’ needs advance our partners’ goals and further Google’s mission. Our team provides meaningful solutions — from helping publishers and developers grow their businesses through monetization solutions to helping our long-term partners anticipate and navigate change in a way that delivers economic and reputational value. We build and distribute products through partnerships across a multitude of product areas including Ads Search & Assistant Geo Platforms & Ecosystems Devices & Services Health Retail Payments Next Billion Users and more. We collaborate across Google ensuring a coordinated approach when engaging with our most complex and strategic partners.

Responsibilities
  • Leverage strategic insights and operational rigor to enable externally facing Business Development team to achieve exponential growth goals.
  • Program manage multiple global initiatives concurrently interfacing with multiple internal stakeholders.
  • Direct and conduct complex analyses solve strategic and operational problems and identify key insights.
  • Communicate results and insights with cross-functional leaders through presentations and ongoing analysis/reports.

Job Title: Manager| Event Operations [Partners and Operations Division]
Job Description:
Responsibilities
  • Provide implementation support such as pre-event planning event day and post-event support to increase adoption of programme for job seekers and employers through career events (career fairs networking sessions and workshops)
  • Undertake community engagement to share WSG’s initiatives and leverage grassroots partnerships to reach out to and understand residents’ needs in order to curate suitable employment assistance to local communities.
  • Consult with internal or external stakeholders to determine event objectives and requirements
  • Conceptualise career events’ format and pilot new initiatives to enhance job matching efficacy and proactively encourage employers to hire suitable career events participants
  • Advocate jobseekers’ requirements and skills competencies to employers through curated showcase and/or activities to minimise mismatch
  • Provide targeted outreach to the database of jobseekers registered with Workforce Singapore to proactively get them to participate in relevant career events and workshops
  • Appoint and manage vendor to provide logistics support including pre-registration day of event and post event tracking
  • Prepare budget requirements for career events manage utilisation verify billing and ensure proper governance in the course of organising these events
  • Monitor career events' performance manage information and analyse trends
  • Organise after-action review to evaluate participants' turnout identify gaps gather feedback from internal and external stakeholders and propose areas of improvement


Requirements
  • Tertiary qualifications
  • Minimum 2 years relevant experience in planning implementation and management of events (physical and virtual)
  • Candidates without the required qualifications but with relevant experience are welcome to apply

Knowledge
  • Workforce segment needs and challenges
  • Sectoral Manpower skills and trends
  • Employer needs and challenges in hiring
  • HR hiring process
  • National employment policies
  • Knowledge of WSG programmes will be an added advantage


Skills
  • Budget Management - Effective utilisation of allocated budget based on best value for money
  • Communication - Effective business writing & presentation skills with different stakeholders
  • Creativity - Ability to conceptualise and propose different career matching activities or workshops to enhance jobseekers' employability
  • Critical Thinking - Use logic and reasoning to identify alternative solutions or approaches to problems
  • Customer Service - Effective interpersonal skills
  • Data Analytics - Analyse effectiveness of career events and continuous review to enhance the event outcome
  • Event Management - Conceptualise event format to minimise mismatch
  • InfoComm Technology - Savvy in using Microsoft Office and a quick learner for other software programmes
  • Networking - Network with employers to find out their hiring process
  • Negotiation - Negotiate and manage vendors for the event logistics requirements
  • People Management - Work with internal and external stakeholders to execute different career matching activities

Abilities/Aptitudes
  • Responsible team player who takes ownership and will see through tasks
  • Adaptable and flexible to meet with last minute or unexpected changes
  • Able to analyse information and make decision or solve problems
  • Strong desire to always complete tasks at hand and is able to follow through and prioritise to achieve these
  • Able to analyse information and make decision or solve problems
  • Team player who can rally resources to ensure the success of each event

Other Characteristics
  • Established network of industry partners or associations
  • Had prior working relationship with Self-Help Groups and/or Community Partners

ROLE PURPOSE
- Manage and implement specific Network Operations programs and projects to ensure they are completed on time within budget and to the agreed specification resulting in a positive impact on operations performance.

- Be the regional process owner and subject matter expert providing support training and guidance to countries on key business processes.

- Play a key role to identify champion develop and coordinate change requests on Operations process and operations toolkit service quality operational efficiency and operational cost improvement ensuring that performance meets Customer (internal and External) and Network expectations.




MAIN ACCOUNTABILITIES
 
1. External Customers
- Interface with External Customers where required for the objectives of the program or project

2. Network Operations Management Functional Management Regions Countries Global Network Operations Steering Group  Global Operations Programs Steering Group
- Participate in Global workgroups and Program Boards in support of the achievement of the Program’s goals

- Gather and Define business requirements including changes to current processes and applications to ensure business needs are met and enhanced.

- Lead and manage the development of solutions that meet the Program goals and/or change requirements. This will include multiple work-streams and projects

- Stand-in for Head of Ops Programs on meetings and Programme Steering meetings when requested

- Provide specialist Ops process and Ops toolkit support and leadership to regional operations in the resolution of process systems and service performance issues including the introduction of improved work practices

- Contribute in the development implementation of solutions ensuring appropriate operational process review and training 

- Develop and drive the change management process with country teams to move from legacy to target operations business processes

- Communicate interface and work with the respective groups to achieve the defined goals.

3. External Stakeholders/ Suppliers – Mgmt Groups

4. Internal Stakeholders/ Suppliers – Mgmt Groups
- Develop and communicate road maps to manage the overall direction of the domains’ Ops toolkit and strategy

- Ensure program direction and progress is communicated to all stakeholders

- Provide the overall direction and strategy for the projects being delivered by the Programs portfolio

- Work with functional experts and workgroups in designing appropriate solutions for programs.        


5. Process 
- Set up the project and relevant project organisation with the project manager. Provide steering direction and motivation for effective project management

- Plan the development implementation and execution of the programs upon approval to proceed

- Recommend to recruit or outsource staff/ consultants when necessary with agreement from manager

- Manage business and project risks including the development of contingency plans according to the needs of the projects being managed

- Act as a trouble shooter to provide advice and support to ensure programs/projects are completed on time within budget and to the agreed specifications.

- Participate where necessary in centrally delivered user training to ensure users are fully capable of using the new processes and systems to the optimum level

- Conduct/ facilitate (where necessary) reviews to assess the success of the programs

- Report regularly on programs handled (via regular reports or the web/internet) to create a learning and information sharing environment so that programs services solutions and particularly best demonstrated business practices can be shared and reused across the region.

6. Finance & Projects
- Present and gain agreement for programs and multiple projects approval and concept buy-in.

- Oversee/assist with the implementation of the programs

- Develop a culture of quality service excellence (for internal customers) flexibility and cost consciousness.

- Develop team spirit and multitasking capabilities within the team.

- Plan organise and lead an efficient and effective program.

- Manage the allocation of appropriate resources and commitment of staff to the achievement of program objectives and targets.

About the Opportunity
Our paid 12-week internship program from May to July 2021 provides an excellent platform for you to explore your career aspirations while delivering tangible benefits throughout our trading business. You'll get involved in real projects and have a role of significant value getting exposure to markets deal making and stretched opportunities. As a penultimate year student our interns will be considered as potential candidates for our 2022 graduate programmes.

Offers for Summer Internship 2021:
Analytics
The analytics team use information flows and act as a subject matter expert for oil market fundamentals (such as refining margin and oil product yield drivers supply outages trade flows) that affect the refining & trading sectors. Learning how to drive common view product demands across commodity benches projects would involve supporting insightful analysis work for short to longer term market fundamentals for business origination and works closely with bench analysts and traders.

Commercial
Trading operations
This commercial function is responsible for providing deal management post-trader execution ensuring all contractual and operational requirements are fully met. Sitting alongside traders the team handles the physical movements of oil & product cargos associated with trades directly contributes to the financial performance while maintaining commercial relationships with terminals surveyors and charterers across the region ensuring product quality optimization and quantity control. Interns can look forward to work on continuous improvement projects that would expose them to the daily dynamic activities of the team.

Origination and Strategy
An internship within these areas involves understanding the market related to a specific or group of commodities through financial analysis & commercial research. Learn about trade flows market entry and exit points review existing and future developments in key geographies in order to develop market strategies that would maximise commercial opportunities. Internship projects could involve structured products marketing fuels marketing or with environmental products team.

Finance & risk
Commodity Risk
A critical control & reporting function it supports the effective management of trading profit & loss and our exposure related to a specific or group of commodities. The team collaborates with the trading benches and management to deliver financial discipline value-added reporting and risk frameworks. Interns can learn more on how trading exposure and risk management works in our industry.

Credit Risk
The function provides independent risk oversight of counterparty risks inherent in trading activities risk analytics and advice on deal structuring & risk mitigation to support the business. Quantitative tools & techniques are deployed to assess measure credit risks and the team works closely with internal and external stakeholders to deliver commercial goals. Interns can learn to perform risk quantification analysis/review monitoring & reporting and work on global projects.

What we look for:
Penultimate year university student with well-rounded life experiences strong academic results and commercial acumen. With the agility to learn adaptive mindset digital fluency you possess the energy and innovative thinking to make the most of this fantastic opportunity in a collaborative workspace.

Application process:
Online application
Online tests
Video interview
Assessment centre
Offer & feedback

About the benefits:
bp offers you a collaborative work culture and a company that lives and breathes our core values. You'll also have the opportunity to be considered for our 2022 graduate program at the completion of your internship.

Application closes 31 October 2020

Job Title: Head of SMB User Operations APAC
Job Description:
Help Stripe’s users grow the GDP of the internet.

Stripe’s infrastructure and suite of APIs powers hundreds of thousands of businesses—from startups to Fortune 500s—in almost every country around the world. From developers and product managers to founders and CFOs a broad audience interacts with Stripe’s products and uses them to start run and scale their companies.

The SMB Operations team is responsible for the end-to-end user experience of small and medium sized businesses that run on Stripe. This responsibility includes working with product teams to fix product issues build the self help experience and provide support to SMBs across the markets in which Stripe operates. We’re looking for a leader to help build expand and grow the regional SMB Operations team. The Head of SMB Operations leads a high performing management team distributed across our APAC offices. They cultivate the happiness of their teams while guiding them through feedback mentoring and advocacy within the organization. This means helping to set team goals and using metrics to efficiently measure and guide team performance in pursuit of those goals. The SMB Operations team is also responsible for managing large operational projects.

You Will
  • Guide the organization to design and deliver the user experience for SMBs at a massive scale.
  • Ensure team members are happy effective and growing in their career and new work experiences.
  • Set clear goals and directions and provide regular feedback on team members’ performance.
  • Maintain metrics and analysis of team performance and provide regular reporting on team performance in the form of written analysis and performance reports.
  • Transmit and foster our values serving as a beacon of Stripe’s user-centric philosophy and culture of transparency empathy inclusion and empowerment.
  • Help build the organization through management projects such as recruiting training writing team policies defining team processes or other organizational improvements.


We’re Looking For Someone With
  • At least 6 years of direct people management experience and multiple years of experience managing managers.
  • Experience leading operational teams (preferably in high-growth technology companies).
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Strong operational background and a track-record of making data driven decisions.
  • Skill and credibility doing the core work of a user facing team with a high bar for quality and a willingness to lead by example.
  • An ability to execute on and deliver complex operational projects involving multiple stakeholders.


PMA-LI-1

Your Primary Role Includes (but Not Limited To)

  • Proficient in Microsoft Office
  • Able to work on rotating shifts weekends and Public Holidays


Personal Attributes

  • Good communication & interpersonal skills
  • Independent resourceful and service oriented

Job Title: Regional Product Policy Lead| Southeast Asia & Oceania
Job Description:
TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices in Los Angeles Dublin New York London Paris Berlin Dubai Mumbai Singapore Jakarta Seoul and Tokyo.


Building a world where people can safely discover create and connect:

The Trust & Safety team at TikTok helps ensure that our global community is safe and empowered to create and enjoy content across all of our applications. Within Trust & Safety the Regional Policy team provides clear and consistent guidance on the appropriate standards for content and interactions across the company's priority markets and product offering.


As the Regional Product Policy Lead you are part of team leadership driving the development of scalable policy solutions to ensure platform health while applying your deep in-market expertise to guide policy decisions. You are passionate about user safety wake up excited to make an impact in millions of people's lives and switch readily from thinking strategically about policy development and iteration to managing tactical enforcement decisions. Your background and professional expertise are grounded in areas related to internet policy user safety or platform management and you have demonstrated this through a track record of achievements in the policy space. You also have experience with bringing out the best in a team and fostering a collaborative working style in a fast paced environment.


What will I be doing?

  • Build and lead a high performing team to craft content policies for a set of APAC markets balancing local insights and consistency with global Trust and Safety policies;
  • Articulate interpret and implement content policies externally and internally for a specific market and mentor others as they do the same across a set of markets;
  • Guide the improvement of our platform policies and processes around how they are enforced;
  • Manage cross-team relationships in particular with senior regional stakeholders - collaborate with Product Operations Legal Public Policy and Public Relations teams to build consensus on and improve content policies;
  • Act as the escalation point of contact for a specific market (and support high priority escalations as needed across the region) rapidly aligning stakeholders to respond on emergency cases related to content safety.


What should I bring with me?

Minimum qualifications:

  • 8+ years in policy development policy enforcement public policy or Trust & Safety with significant experience in handling technology social media or online content;
  • Prior people management experience;
  • A deep interest in content policy management and online content ecosystems；
  • Excellent cross-functional project management and stakeholder management skills;


Preferred qualifications:

  • Advanced degree in a related field;
  • Experience in working with international partners across different cultures and time zones.


Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok is an inclusive platform built upon the foundation of creative expression. We encourage our employees and users to celebrate what makes them unique while finding a community that does the same. 


TikTok is committed to being an equal opportunities employer where everyone can bring their authentic self to work. We believe that diversity is a strength and that the best ideas are born in environments where everyone is seen and heard.

Job Description & Summary

A career at PwC is more than “just” a job. It’s about being part of a purpose-led firm that builds trust in society and solve important problems. We help our clients to make informed decisions and operate effectively within them. At PwC we are committed to making a difference for each other our clients and our community — by empowering you to be the best version of yourself and investing in your growth. You’ll be able to develop as a leader be well-connected work in a great environment explore our benefits and make a positive contribution.

With PwC you’ll ignite a meaningful career while being supported by a strong coaching and people-oriented culture our Flex policies (Flex Space Flex Dress and Flex Time) innovative learning and development programs (training programs digital upscaling) as well as mobility opportunities. If you would like to be connected to like-minded individuals outside of work we highly encourage you to be part of our people clubs and committees such as the Sports and Recreational Club Toastmasters Club and more!

How will you value-add?

PwC’s Academy Singapore is the external training arm of PwC Singapore and one of the fastest growing units at the firm.

We leverage upon PwC’s core competencies and conduct specialised training across Digital Finance & Accounting Tax Governance Risks & Compliance Advisory/Consulting and Organisational Leadership & Strategy for our clients as well as professionals from both the public and private sectors.

At PwC’s Academy Singapore we put our learners at the heart of all we do: all of our training are practitioner-led rich content featuring real case-studies and as practical-oriented as possible - meaning our learners get ample opportunities to “practice” which in turn ensures effective learning. Together we can build trust in society and solve important problems.

Responsiblities

In line with the growth at PwC’s Academy Singapore we are now looking to hire an experienced Operations Manager to be responsible for the following
  • Build lead and manage a high-performing team of Operations and Administrative executives.
  • Review current Standard Operating Procedures (SOP) across Training Logistics Customer Service & Care and Billing & Invoicing and make suitable recommendations for changes as part of the drive towards Digital Innovation and Continuous Improvement.
  • Manage Training Logistics: secure training venue perform set-up work with catering and perform post-event evaluations.
  • Manage digital Invoicing and Billing processes/functions in partnership with the Finance department.
  • Implement great Customer Service Care & Hospitality.
  • Prepare Monthly Reports: Course v Enrolment Performance Revenue Performance Margins v Efficiency Performance etc.
  • Manage Learning Management System Website content as well as related digital & non-digital marketing

About You
  • A result-oriented professional with a minimum of 5 years relevant experience.
  • Proven leadership qualities and track record for building and managing a team towards achieving operational KPIs.
  • Excellent organisation skills; project management skills will be advantageous.
  • Good communications skills.
  • Experienced with Invoicing Billing and Customer Care/Service; a finance background will be advantageous.
  • Proficient with MS Word Excel and Powerpoint.

About us

Reebelo is one of APAC’s fastest growing startups. Six-digit monthly sales high-growth & well-funded by top VCs and serial entrepreneurs. Join our online marketplace for sustainable electronics and help us to make an impact! Our vision is to reduce e-waste by saving electronics from a premature death - while doing so we enable customers to save up 70% on their favorite brands and flexibly rent devices instead of buying them. Join us if you want to be part of a high-growth disruptive startup with a positive social impact! 


About the role

We are looking for a hands-on Ecommerce Operations Manager with previous startup experience. Join our small but fast growing team as one of the company’s first team-members and help us to further scale Reebelo: 

  • Become a key team-member in our operations team
  • Work closely together with senior management & decide together with us Reebelo’s Operations Roadmap
  • Monitor and manage end-to-end customer lifecycle.
  • Handle vendor communication and ensure smooth interactions between our merchants and our customers. 
  • Manage a team of Customer Service agents and guide them to best practices and processes. 
  • Optimize existing processes workflows and user journeys to ensure an ideal experience for our users and vendors.
  • Produce weekly reporting and KPIs 
  • Automate processes improve product listings & benchmark prices
  • Create manage and maintain systems to ensure operational excellence across the organisation. 
  • Expansion to APAC (Australia + Malaysia this year many more countries next year)


Your background

You are motivated to make an impact and have a hands-on startup attitude? After several years of experience in Product or Operations you are ready to join a high-growth startup? Great that’s what we are looking for: 

  • Motivated person with startup attitude: hands-on + ambitious
  • Business background with several years of Ecommerce or Operations experience
  • You are ambitious a team-player and ready to make an impact
  • You know how to structure processes and prioritize tasks
  • Based in Singapore business fluent in English


Does that match with your expectations? If yes it would be great to get to know you! Send us your CV your LinkedIn profile and a brief summary on who you are and why you would like to work at Reebelo. :)

Job Description:
The popularity of applications of ByteDance attributed to the usage of cutting-edge technologies including a majority of mainstream fields such as NLP ML CV Data MiningSpeech&Audio etc. 


The technologies come from ByteDance gathering hundreds of top scientists globally. That is the "soul and blood" of the innovative company who is operating dozens of different content platforms serving hundreds of millions of users on the planet.


From our perspective the  power generated from internal organization holds the key to a more prosperous and efficient business in future. We'd like to provide the technologies and solutions to outsiders to empower and accelerate the growth of their businesses. 


What You'll Do


We are looking for a Sales Operations Manager who manages sales operation conduct business analytics and attainment planning and direct sales force enablement. You will be joining our highly efficient ByteDance Enterprise Partnerships&solutions team to support the whole sales&marketing team for their business development.


These are thing you might take charge of in ByteDance


  1. Planning. Based on realistic business projection coming up with a challenging sales plan.
  2. Design and formulate sales management system including sales line customer division rules and the selection of management tools and platforms.
  3. Business process design interact and align with internal teams (legal finance&accounting risk control operation system etc.)

  5. Day to day sales operations management including quota alignment incentive plans draft promotion program approval business process diagnosis sales training sales territory/clients conflict management. Optimize sales processes for priority customers reduce friction and provide professional advice to sales leaders. 




Requirments:

  • Excellent communication skills and ability to lead a team under pressure.
  • English fluency. Professional-level fluency in Mandarin is a plus.

Job Description

About Us


We are a leading asset management Group headquartered in Singapore managing funds and investment vehicles across multiple asset classes investing primarily in South Asia and South East Asia.


Job Description


We are looking for an Analyst – Private Equity who will engage across various functions within the Group and gain exposure to the entire investment process from origination and due diligence through deal structuring post-investment portfolio management financing and exits.


The role requires a balance between financial analysis business acumen and sharp execution skills.


Role


Key responsibilities would include:


•        Interfacing with senior team members providing analytical and monitoring support

•        Supporting on research and monitoring of select sectors identification of potential investment opportunities and benchmarking analysis

•        Extensive financial modelling including sensitivity analysis to support potential investment opportunities ongoing monitoring financing and exits

•        Providing support on due diligence

•        Providing support on investment/ financing/ divestment case preparation

•        Providing support in the development and review of transaction documentation

•        Helping develop and implement strategies for specific portfolio companies to increase revenue improve operations strengthen financial controls and increase shareholder value

•        Providing support on the ongoing monitoring of specific portfolio companies and project management of key initiatives

•        Developing presentations and reports as required

•        Providing support on the interface with external service providers


Qualifications


•        Ability to be legally employed in Singapore.

•        This opportunity is open to fresh graduates. Preference will be accorded to candidates having relevant internship experience with leading investment or management consulting firms.  Prior private equity internships are a strong differentiator but not a must

•        Strong academic background from reputed educational institutions with strong understanding of finance and accounting

•        Pursuit of a CFA and IMC Certification is preferred

•        First-rate financial modelling skills with a strong grasp of fundamental accounting and valuation concepts

•        Strong report writing and presentation skills

•        Highly motivated self-starter with a strong work ethic excellent organizational skills and attention to detail conscientious and flexible good interpersonal and communication skills. 

•        Ability to handle multiple tasks plan time and meet deadlines collaborative mentality along with the gravitas to work closely with various stakeholders.

Job Title: Assistant Manager| Ecommerce Buying & Planning| SEA

This incumbent is expected to provide buying analysis for Ecom SEA and drive fact-based decision making.

Functional

Job Title: Employee Success Operations Specialist - China (Based in Singapore)
Job Description:
To get the best candidate experience please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.
Job Category
Employee Success Group

Job Details

Summary

The Employee (ES) Success Operations Specialist is responsible for providing ES support for our China team. This role will require someone who is able to oversee the full employee lifecycle. The role works with the broader ES team (e.g. Total Rewards Recruiting ES Compliance Employee Comms etc.) and cross functional partners (e.g. Deloitte China Data Privacy SOX Employment Legal BT Finance etc.)

Primary Responsibilities
  • Partner with Deloitte China to help manage all elements of employee data changes including new hires internal transfers compensation role changes benefits personal information terminations etc. Ensure China employee records are accurately updated in Workday (as needed) and Deloitte BDH
  • Facilitate employee change process including; ensuring proper approvals per request have been obtained creation of final change form and sending employee change communications as appropriate
  • Manage benefit enrollment process in conjunction with our local partner Deloitte
  • Act as main point of contact for employee queries using our case management tool
  • Coordinate and ensure compliance with Global Work Authorization for new employee and internal transfers coordinate new employee orientations; responsible for new employee paperwork and first day training coordinate with new employee managers IT Help Desk and Facilities teams to ensure an organized on-boarding experience for each new employee as needed
  • Work with external vendors (e.g. Deloitte China Mercer AON) as required
  • Creation of Verification of Employment Letters for China employees and any other required assistance

Additional Responsibilities
  • Act as the point of contact for the SOX and Security Compliance teams. Provide support for the design execution and monitoring of any controls.
  • Partner with HR Compliance Employment Legal and Employee Success team to operationalize and implement any country specific compliance requirements.
  • Provide support and work in partnership with the wider Employee Success Team

Knowledge And Skill Requirements
  • High level of accuracy and attention to detail
  • Demonstrated organizational skills attention to detail and ability to work independently and as a member of a team
  • Possesses strong planning execution and multitasking skills and has demonstrated ability to reprioritize on the fly. Must be able to manage quickly changing priorities while meeting deadlines
  • Must be able to maintain the confidentiality of sensitive information issues and events
  • Effective communication skills in Mandarin (required) including reading writing and speaking
  • Provide exceptional customer service
  • Ability to partner influence and work effectively with all levels of an organization
  • Demonstrated ability to work with ambiguity possessing a passion for collaboration and is solutions driven
  • Knowledge in labor laws across GCR (China HK and TW) legislation

Education/Experience
  • Diploma or Bachelor’s degree in related field or equivalent experience required
  • Preferably someone with more than 2-5 years of relevant experience
  • Demonstrated experience and passion for ES Shared Services
  • Market experience across GCR

Description

You will play a meaningful role in the core operational planning of the whole supply chain in P&G. With our dedication to constantly improving our supply chain processes you will be the key driver in SIP Performance metrics to drive supply network improvements in cash cost and customer service through digitization. You will be in charge of developing and communicating valid daily production schedules for finished products and material requirements consistent with the operating strategies of the Categories/Sites using Standard Work Processes.

Your team
You will report to the SIP Operations Leader who is based in Singapore. You will be in the Planning Service Center (PSC) which is one of the key disciplines in Product Supply function in delivering customer service cost and cash for the company.

What success looks like

After 1st Month
  • Understand plant/supplier operating strategy and standard work process and planning parameter.
  • Be able to perform planning according to strategy in simple situation with some mentoring.
  • Understand existing tool and solution available to perform work following standard work process efficiently
After 1st quarter:
  • Have a better understanding in E2E supply chain integration
  • Basic knowledge partial experience and may need mentoring to deliver high quality results in more complex situations
  • Be able to apply existing solution to perform work efficiently
After 1st year:
  • Able to coach others and drive business result independently
  • Has complete knowledge of E2E supply chain substantial experience and operates independently to consistently deliver high quality results
  • Demonstrate ability to drive continuous improvement identify loss and lead loss elimination through digitization

Job Responsibilities
  • Maintains master data in SAP
  • Communicates material requirement plans to suppliers and resolves conflicts
  • Maintains valid production and supplier schedules in SAP
  • Communicates the Master Production Schedule with Site Operations and resolves conflicting priorities
  • Manages run-out discontinued and obsolete materials
  • Measures and drives continuous improvement in Standard Work Processes via digitization
  • Participates in developing and renewing supplier Site-Level Execution Agreements (SLEAs)
  • Identifies critical supply constraints and develops action plans to avoid service impacts

Qualifications
  • Minimum Diploma or Degree with background/skills in Engineering/Logistics or Information Technology/Computer Science
  • 2 - 4 years of relevant supply chain or analysis experience we also welcome fresh graduates to apply
  • Strong analytical and data management skills
  • Strong problem-solving and priority-setting skills
  • High proficiency in PC skills (specifically MS Excel)
  • Strong aptitude for computers and technology
  • Able to work independently as well as in a team.
  • Able to interact comfortably with all levels/types of people
  • Operational excellence
About us
We produce globally recognized brands and we grow the best business leaders in the industry. With a portfolio of trusted brands as diverse as ours it is paramount our leaders are able to lead with courage the vast array of brands categories and functions. We serve consumers around the world with one of the strongest portfolios of trusted quality leadership brands including Always® Ariel® Gillette® Head & Shoulders® Herbal Essences® Oral-B® Pampers® Pantene® Tampax® and more. Our community includes operations in approximately 70 countries worldwide.

Visit http://www.pg.com to know more.

An Assistant Operations Manager is the subordinate of operations manager and works under his overall supervision. He is responsible for taking care of various functions performed in the organization. Assistant operations manager manages trains and increases the efficiency of the systems of support such as the human resource working for the organization IT department etc. He also takes care of the recruitment he along with the recruitment staff makes sure that the people appointed for the job of operations are well qualified for the job and should be enthusiastic and not lethargic.

Responsibilities

  • The assistant operations manager is responsible for preparing the annual budget of the organization so that it can be assessed at the end of the financial year if the expenses exceeded the budget or not
    • The responsibility of an assistant operations manager also comprise of accessing whether the company is making profits or incurring losses. This is one of the major responsibilities of the assistant operations manager
    • Assistant operations manager responsibilities comprise of recruiting people who can carry out the operations work properly. He makes sure that all the new recruiters know their work responsibilities properly the assistant operations manager supervises the new employees so that they do not make any mistakes while working
    • He is also responsible for overseeing all the financial matters planning and making long term strategies for the growth and progress of the company


    • Minimum Qualifications

  • Proven work experience as Assistant Operations Manager.

  • Working knowledge of budgets forecasting and metrics.
  • Basic IT skills (databases MS Office etc).
  • Ability to effectively communicate with all levels of the organization.
  • Leadership and organizational skills.

Description

At Amazon our mission is to be the earth’s most customer-centric company. To achieve this we need exceptionally talented bright and driven people. Amazon is continuously evolving and is a place where motivated employees thrive and where employee ownership and accountability lead to meaningful results.

AWS APJ Strategy Associate Role
As a full-time strategy associate you will lead and manage strategic projects to uncover new business opportunities or solve our biggest challenges for Asia-Pacific and Japan (APJ). You will have the exciting opportunity to work cross-functionally and cross-geographically to identify problems and gaps collect and analyze data generate insights come up with solutions and implement them. You will execute on your proposed business strategies to solve difficult problems and remove blockers for our customers and our business. You will independently manage projects and run programs to deliver value for our business. To do so you will need to collaborate effectively with internal stakeholders such as sales operations and marketing teams. Through leading initiatives across Asia-Pacific you will gain a unique insight into the internal workings of the world’s fastest growing billion dollar IT organization.
Who are we looking for?
We hire builders and are looking for people who enjoy problem solving and driving initiatives that can create huge impact for our customers and business.

The Ideal Candidate
  • Has strong project management and stakeholder engagement skills with the ability to lead and drive initiatives
  • Is creative and able to innovate and simplify process
  • Is curious to learn and comfortable with ambiguity
  • Has good communications skills
  • Is analytical and has strong financial/business acumen
  • Has a “can-do” spirit with a strong sense of ownership to execute end-to-end projects
  • Has outstanding interpersonal skills and is able to earn trust and influence others
  • Is independent and comfortable with navigating ambiguity
  • Is highly organized and can multi-task and prioritize competing stakeholder requests
  • Uses a customer-centric approach to solve problems
  • Thrives in a lean fast-paced entrepreneurial multi-cultural environment
  • Has a passion for AWS and driving cloud computing adoption across Asia-Pacific

Basic Qualifications

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
  • A stellar academic and/or professional record
  • Analytical and quantitative skills and ability to utilize Excel and/or other software to provide data to support your analysis
  • Excellent English written and oral communication skills
  • Program or project management experience

Preferred Qualifications

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
  • A master’s degree or equivalent experience
  • Understanding of sales strategy and operations
  • Experience managing strategic projects from end to end (idea conception to implementation)
  • Experience working within a high-growth technology company

Job Title: Strategy| planning and operations Lead – Pre-sales (SE)- APJ
Job Description:
VMware software powers the world’s complex digital infrastructure. The company’s cloud networking and security and digital workspace offerings provide a dynamic and efficient digital foundation to more than 500000 customers globally aided by an extensive ecosystem of partners. A proven leader VMware allows customers to build run manage connect and protect applications across clouds and devices in a common operating environment.

VMware is committed to being a force for good from its breakthrough innovations to its global impact. Our team of 30000+ people working in 50+ locations worldwide is committed to building a community where great people want to work long term by living our values of passion innovation execution teamwork active learning and giving back. If you are ready to accelerate innovate and lead join us as we challenge constraints and problem solve for tomorrow today.

Job Role And Responsibilities

VMware is looking for a talented business partner to our CTO (and SE-leadership team) and the ultimate collaborator to fill this strategic role within our Strategy Planning and operations Organization. This individual will drive an executive level cadence and integration across the organization while managing execution of strategic initiatives to accelerate sales. As a candidate for this role you will have a proven track record of building consensus across a diverse and complex environment developing and implementing strategies to improve business outcomes and identifying areas to optimize resources processes and programs. This role requires a strong understanding of complex field organizations across sales Solutions Engineering & Architecture customer success and ecosystem partners as well as proven analytical and operational skills and outstanding cross-group collaboration.

The successful candidate will be a ‘Strategic Doer’ with great energy initiative and leadership qualities that inspire teaming and trust to influence cross functional teams.

Role Summary
The role will support Asia Pacific and Japan (APJ) Solutions Engineer & (SE) Pre-sales teams and Strategy planning and operations leadership in developing and executing sustainable business strategies supporting semi-annual fiscal planning and manage business cadence and reporting. The person will be a Business Partner to the VP for the Presales (SE) organization in APJ ensuring the continued success of this business unit. The core responsibility of the individual will be to provide analytic and business insight to support the decision making of the business.

Duties & Responsibilities
The main task is to take full operational responsibility for the APJ SE organization.
  • Measure the business performance and create clear Performance Indicators that enable the Business leaders to successfully grow the business
  • Be a trusted strategic advisor/partner to the team providing valuable insights to ensure the continued success of the business
  • Drive strategy and implementation of best practices
  • Have an in-depth understanding of resource and capacity planning modelling
  • Contribute in the Business Planning Process
  • Assists Pre-Sales (SE) management with specific and ad-hoc report and dashboards requests to support strategic and tactical initiatives.
  • Key member of the global pre-sales (SE) leadership team responsible for helping in to develop and execute our strategy in APJ.
  • Assess effectiveness of current programs processes and resource alignment in critical areas refine and optimize accordingly
  • Engage with finance and operation partners to drive P&L and business data analysis to prepare executive level reviews and make and execute strategic decisions to optimize the business
  • Drive alignment and best practices application across regions and shared functions to implement our multi-cloud vision
  • Develop frameworks to help structure the team’s thinking drive visibility facilitate alignment and establish an operating rhythm of the initiatives to ensure the programs are running effectively and efficiently to meet goals and objectives manage risks and issues and improve team communication and collaboration.
  • Triangulate leads pipe bookings by solution & competencies to support ad hoc reporting needs with data-driven insights to support business decisions.
  • Publish real-time reporting using business intelligence tools.
  • Manage Pre-sales operations including business cadence process effective pipeline management by respective routes to ensure business accountability & predictability as and when needed.
  • Actively work with cross functional teams such as Regional Partner Business Core Sales Professional Services Business Units Shared services/Centre of Excellence Enterprise Data Analytics teams.
  • Manage & present business performance in periodic business review meetings to key internal stakeholders and drive implementation of consistent processes and best practices across APJ.

Requirements & Experience
  • Proven experience in Business Operations or Finance gained within a fast-paced high-tech organization
  • Comfortable working with Senior executives at all levels to ensure the successful execution of strategy through informed decision making
  • Experience in architecting organizational engagement models
  • Exceptional analytical skills & confident working with an onsite and remote analyst team
  • Excellent communications skills with the ability to synthesize simplify and explain complex problems to different types of audience including executives
  • Proven analytical ability of designing organizing into useful business metrics & dashboards to drive business cadence and make operational decisions.
  • Experience in various Business intelligence tools such as Power BI Tableau SAP HANA preferred and with a variety of Enterprise tools including Salesforce
  • Highly motivated analytical thinker keen eye for details results-oriented with a “can-do” attitude.
  • Excellent and proven ability to manage multiple cross-functional projects with competing priorities.
  • Ability to deal with stress ambiguity and navigate through a high-paced fast-changing and sometimes unpredictable work environment and accommodate with flexibility.
  • 7+ years of experience in sales/pre-sales (SE) strategy or GTM roles enterprise software or cloud company.
  • Great business acumen and exceptional strategic thinking skills balanced with operational execution capabilities
  • Creative with strong problem-solving skills analytical and process mindset and attention to detail
  • Demonstrated ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment
  • C-suite relationship engagement and management
  • High performer with track record of exceeding performance expectations and metrics

Director People Operations -APAC
 What will you be responsible for?
As Director People your primary focus will be creating a world class employee experience at App Annie and being a trusted advisor to the business. You’ll be a champion of culture and values partnering with your global People Team and business leaders to strategize solve challenges and implement solutions. Reporting to the SVP People based in our San Francisco headquarters office the Director People will provide strong people partnership with our Sales Marketing & Engineering teams located in Singapore Beijing Tokyo Shenzhen and Seoul.
What can you tell your friends when they ask you what you do?
"I’m responsible for creating a world class employee experience at App Annie and be a trusted advisor to the business in regards to people strategy"
How will you be doing this?
  • Manage end-to-end People Operations for APAC region
  • Lead manage and grow your team (3 FTE) while fostering a collaborative team-oriented work environment
  • Partner with executives and managers to develop a culture of learning and continuous feedback by creating experiences that engage our team at all levels
  • Build trust with employees across all layers of the organization and be an active listener and effective problem solver of people issues while aligning with expected business outcomes
  • Utilize a data driven approach to identify trends and recommend proactive solutions for improving the employee experience
  • Build out and execute the regional people operations strategy incorporating the global business and people strategy
  • Take responsibility for a centre of excellence (e.g. recognition performance management) and rollout and implement program globally (with help of peers in the regions)
  • Partner with Recruiting team to ensure we are attracting top talent and have a streamlined onboarding process across multiple sites and teams
What should you bring to the party?
  • You're smart and are able to prove it
  • Independent self-starter with the ability to effectively work collaboratively across disciplines is essential
  • 10+ years experience in People Operations role (including minimal of 5 years managing high performing team)
  • Strong integrity approachable heart and deep willingness to understand our business
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills with strong proficiency in English
  • You are a natural coach and mentor who relates well with others listens effectively and can build rapport with a diverse workforce
  • Excellent project and program management skills with a proven ability to design and implement people strategy that drives business results
  • Solid understanding of employment law in APAC region compensation benefits organizational development employee relations and training
  • Strong capability in change management in multiple scenarios such as M&A(Mergers and Acquisitions ) organization and leadership changes
What do we offer?
  • Lots of responsibility + room for you to experiment and grow with the company.
  • An international team of super-talented people from different cultural backgrounds (San Francisco Beijing Utrecht London and more).
  • 16 days of paid leave so long as you promise to come back!
  • Competitive salary & stock options.
  • And finally an office in the heart of the city so there's plenty to do when you're not at work.
COVID-19
During the Covid-19 Pandemic we’ve adapted how we support our employees in a number of ways:

  • Donut Dates - connecting you with someone else in your region once every 2 weeks so you can get to know each other
  • WFH Equipment Allowance - To ensure you have the best set up in your home office
  • Productivity Allowance - To keep your home office running
  • Wellness Sessions - To keep everyone happy and healthy
  • Virtual Happy Hours and Trivia to keep you connected with your colleagues
  • Generous PTO that we encourage you to use for your wellbeing to go offline recharge and reflect
  • You will also be taken through a fully digital onboarding process!

Why choose App Annie?

App Annie is the industry’s most trusted mobile data and analytics platform. App Annie’s mission to help customers create winning mobile experiences and achieve excellence. The company created the mobile app data market and is committed to delivering the industry’s most complete mobile performance offering. More than 1200 enterprise clients and 1 million registered users across the globe and spanning all industries rely on App Annie as the standard to revolutionize their mobile business. The company is headquartered in San Francisco with 12 offices worldwide.

Business Function Overview

Microsoft’s Cloud Infrastructure and Operations (MCIO) is the engine that powers our cloud services. As a Critical Environment Operations Manager you will perform a key role in delivering the core infrastructure and foundational technologies for Microsoft's over 200 online businesses including Bing Office 365 Xbox OneDrive and the Microsoft Azure platform.

Empower Billions!

Our infrastructure is comprised of a large global portfolio of more than 100 datacenters and 1 million servers. Our foundation is built upon and managed by a team of subject matter experts working to support services for more than 1 billion customers and 20 million businesses in over 90 countries worldwide.

With environmental sustainability and datacenter optimization at the forefront of our datacenter design and operations we continue to grow and evolve as we meet the ever-changing business demands that hold Microsoft as a world-class Cloud provider.

Be at the forefront of the action in MCIO as part of our Global Datacenter Operations Group!

In alignment with our Microsoft values we are committed to cultivating an inclusive work environment for all employees to positively impact our culture every day.

#COICareers

Responsibilities

As a successful Critical Environments Operations Manager (CEOM) your performance objectives will be to:
  • Empower a culture of safety security and compliance in all aspects of our Datacenter operations 
  • Lead a team of Mechanical Electrical and Control System professionals supporting Microsoft's online services
  • Oversee the day-to-day operations and maintenance of mechanical and electrical equipment in our Datacenters
  • Maximize Critical Environment (CE) availability to ensure optimal operational efficiency
  • Reduce high-impact and human-error Critical Environment (CE) incidents year over year
  • Deliver on cost/energy efficiency initiatives
  • Ensure routine reporting to effectively manage and analyze our Power/Temperature/Relative Humidity and SLA monitoring
  • Establish and enhance strong working relationships and engagement with our Engineering Groups (EGs) and business partners
  • Work with regional and global peers to share and build best practices across the entire datacenter portfolio

Qualifications

Required Skills and Experience:
  • At least 5 years of relevant work experience in a Datacenter or other critical environment facility working with the operation of building cooling electrical mechanical and life safety systems Electrical Power Monitoring Systems (EPMS) Branch Circuit Monitoring (BCM) Building Automation Systems (BAS) and Battery Monitoring Systems (BMS)
  • At least three years’ experience leading and motivating a diverse technical workforce

Preferred Skills And Experience
  • Bachelor’s Degree or Technical College certification in mechanical or electrical engineering and/or services
  • Experience working on large scale CE projects
  • Experience with the operation of IT infrastructure (Servers SANs Networking etc.)

Background Check Requirements

Ability to meet Microsoft customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role. These requirements include but are not limited to the following specialized security screenings:
  • Microsoft Cloud Background Check: This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud background check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age ancestry color family or medical care leave gender identity or expression genetic information marital status medical condition national origin physical or mental disability political affiliation protected veteran status race religion sex (including pregnancy) sexual orientation or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories consistent with legal requirements.
