Job Title: Entry Level Production Planner (Fresh Poly Grad)
Job Description:
We are looking for the right people — people who want to innovate achieve grow and lead. We attract and retain the best talent by investing in our employees and empowering them to develop themselves and their careers. Experience the challenges rewards and opportunity of working for one of the world’s largest providers of products and services to the global energy industry.

Under direct supervision the Production Planner is responsible for production order management and daily execution on the shop floor. This job is the first level in the Manufacturing Scheduling job family. At this level the Production Planner has limited autonomy to deviate from established processes but is expected to develop their understanding of the principles necessary to exercise such judgment at the upper levels of the Manufacturing Scheduling job family. The Production Planner receives training to be able to plan and schedule routine orders for their assigned product lines and to resolve related problems affecting delivery for short-term (<30 days) planning horizons. Performs release of production orders within acceptable guidelines uses dispatch report to coordinate schedule execution and performs inventory management functions to optimize material flow. The Production Planner will have a basic understanding and knowledge of: Forecasting FP MRP Excel Theory of Constraints Master Data Engineering Change Management and Inventory Turns. Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) experience is preferred. Requires a high school diploma or equivalent and a minimum of two years working in manufacturing procurement or customer service.

The Role

In this role you will be responsible for leading the recruitment training development and overall management of a dynamic store team that will help Tesla accelerate the world’s transition to sustainable transportation.

You will be challenged to support your team through training coaching motivating and analyzing sales performance. You will be tasked with identifying events in the local market that will maximize Tesla’s brand exposure and create more Tesla owners. You will be measured and rewarded by your ability to achieve targets drive optimal team performance and maintain store operations.

To succeed at Tesla you must be energetic highly organized and hard working. You should have a passion for sustainable energy and the ability to create exceptional customer experiences. While individual contributions will be recognized teamwork is essential to achieve the highest level of success. We will reward team players who help others succeed and empower the team around them.

BUSINESS HEALTH

Customer Experience

  • Empower and guide employees through challenging customer concerns to make decisions in the customers’ best interest while also supporting Tesla’s mission.
EMPLOYEE ENGAGMENT

BRAND STANDARDS
  • Ensure facility maintenance and showroom presentation adhere to the brand standard

  • Ensure all employees align with Tesla’s Dress Code and Grooming Guidelines

Job Title: Securities Division Operations| Equities Operations| Equities Execution Services| Analyst| Singapore
Job Description:
YOUR IMPACT

Are you looking to join a dynamic and fast paced team applying your analytical and problem solving skills for maximum impact whilst deepening your knowledge of Cash Equities? Equities Execution Client Ops is seeking a professional who is looking to partner with our business and other internal and external stakeholders to provide market leading business enablement and risk and control services.

OUR IMPACT

Our team of critical thinkers partners with groups in all areas of the firm to perform financial analytics reporting data analytics and engineering. Our division also provides critical operations design and handles capital markets operations to ensure business flows smoothly across our global offices. From day one team members play a vital role in upholding the three Operations principles of client focus process innovation and risk management.

Equities Execution Client Ops front to back post-execution support to all equity based activity in Asia. The Middle Office team has critical focus on front office day to day risk and trading surveillance new issuance's client service corporate actions processing and strategic firm and business infrastructure projects.

Middle Office acts as first point of contact for the various Equities Trading desks assisting in the execution of both new client and existing client activity. It is Middle Office’s responsibility to ensure positions are booked and maintained correctly in our risk systems. There is a strong emphasis on knowledge and expertise which requires that all team members are fully versed in products and systems used as well as the processes and procedures that must be followed when performing day to day tasks.

How You Will Fulfill Your Potential
  • Prepare to gain a comprehensive understanding of the operational process life-cycle by interacting with internal and external stakeholders including clients trading desks brokers Sales Structuring and other federation teams in order to work toward the shared goal of business enablement and risk mitigation
  • Partner with a team of product experts to review all operational aspects of the trade flow while gaining strong technical knowledge risk control and commercial awareness
  • Use your inquisitive mind set to identify efficiency opportunities with respect to process flow methodology as well as enhance scalability
  • Leverage your quantitative skills to decompose complex regulatory and operational process requirement and propose creative robust solutions
  • Oversight & ownership of the full front to back operational flow ensuring that seamless execution of trades new business and flow enhancements

Skills & Experience We’re Looking For
  • Ability to demonstrate a sound of understanding of Equity products as well as Cash Securities. Strong Team-working skills - for working with both internal departments in and globally
  • Track record in the development of client relationships and key stakeholders both internally and externally
  • Ability to gain a strong understanding of the business and work with Prime Brokerage Marketing Structuring Trading and Sales desks
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
  • Fluent in both written and spoken Japanese
  • Ability to thrive under pressure
  • Strong leadership skills essential - this role will require a self-starter who can manage competing deadlines and can prioritize appropriately

  • Additional language skills relevant to ASEAN highly desirable.

  • Capitalizes on opportunities to grow our Training Functions as a business offering to external seafarers and derive competitive advantage from such initiatives

  • Monitors value for money spent on training of seafarers through collaborative work with targeted training institutes in different regions. Supervisees and administrates the collection and disbursement of the training funds.

UrbanFox a subsidiary of Keppel Logistics is looking for a Permanent Operations Executive for the Transport Department.

Responsibilities
  • Managing daily warehousing operations.
  • Ensure compliance and processes of service level are adhered to high quality.
  • Executing transportation service requirements and orders fulfillment.
  • To plan & assign daily transport job schedule to all drivers and ensure efficient fleet management.
  • Motivate and educate fellow team members.
  • Updating of records information and organizing of paperwork
  • Liaise with customers and colleagues to arrange customers’ transportation needs.
  • Such other duties and responsibilities as may be reasonably requested by your immediate supervisor / the head of department from time to time.

Requirements
  • Minimum polytechnic diploma in any discipline; those without a discipline but with relevant experience and expertise may also apply.
  • Dynamic and motivated individual with good organizing abilities interpersonal and communication skills.
  • Ability to multi-tasks with drivers customers and colleagues.
  • Enjoy working in a high pace environment and ensure tasks are executed on schedule as planned.
  • Possessing 1-2 years of relevant experience is a MUST.
  • 5.5 days work week.
  • Able to perform shift duties (Monday - Friday: 8AM - 5PM/ 2PM - 11PM) (Saturdays: 8AM - 12PM / 12PM - 4PM) and commit to OT.
  • Comfortable to commute to 27 Greenwich Drive Singapore 533912 (Tampines Logistics Hub).

About UrbanFox Asia

UrbanFox was unveiled on 24th October 2017 but is not new to the industry. Formerly known as Courex she was founded in 2009 mainly operating as a Courier service company. Over the years Courex has evolved into an end-to-end urban logistics expert that provides reliable and economical solutions to help businesses maximize its sales potential. We offer warehousing multi-channel commerce and delivery solutions.UrbanFox has come a long way since its early days and is now a subsidiary of Keppel Logistics and works closely with its parent company to leverage on mutual strengths. With Keppel's extensive regional network and UrbanFox’s nimbleness we are excited about its regional prospects and the growth potential it is able to provide to its customers.We have built a strong foundation of technical know-how and we are constantly exploring new ideas with the aim of adding value to our customers’ businesses. Our team stays up to date on industry’s challenges to help realize customers’ growth ambitions so as to offer solutions that are relevant for different markets around the region.UrbanFox is passionate about building sustainable and innovative solutions that are suitable for businesses of all sizes. We aim to establish long-term partnerships with our customers by providing them with the best experience and value to their business. Accelerate your growth with us.

About Doctor Anywhere

Doctor Anywhere is a regional tech-enabled omni channel healthcare service company headquartered in Singapore. With a strong network of established healthcare providers and experienced doctors our digital platform and mobile app enable users to manage their health easily and effectively where they can consult a licensed local doctor anytime anywhere and get medication delivered to their doorsteps within hours. 


Under the DA Network clinics users also have access to a panel of general practitioners specialists and allied healthcare providers. Complementing this ecosystem is the DA Marketplace where users can shop for a wide range of health and wellness products and services all in one place. 


We now serve more than one million and growing users and our aim is to increase healthcare accessibility and provide affordable health care for everyone. Join us to help everyone lead happier and healthier lives!


Our team and the role we are hiring for

We are seeking a Talent Acquisition Business Partner (Tech) who will partner closely with the Senior Talent Acquisition Business Partner in hiring the best tech talents for Doctor Anywhere.. You will have an eye for detail and unwavering commitment to improve and streamline processes with the aim of improving our internal stakeholder and candidate experience. As our Talent Acquisition Business Partner (Tech) you will be part of our People & Culture Team collaborating closely with our Tech teams and providing TA support for our managers and employees.


You are a rising recruiting  star with an appreciation and understanding for technology. The ideal candidate will have a mindset of continuous improvement and change and will demonstrate curiosity collaboration and the ability to deal with ambiguity especially in a start-up environment.


Prior experiences in a tech recruitment function supporting Singapore and preferably other countries such as Malaysia Thailand Vietnam Philippines and India will be helpful. You are passionate about sourcing and hiring the best tech talents and providing excellent internal client support across the entire organization. 


This role reports directly to the Senior Talent Acquisition Business Partner. 


Responsibilities

  • You will be working closely with hiring managers across the region throughout the recruiting process.
  • Partner with hiring managers independently to drive a consultative approach for market research and mapping sourcing assessment selection and offer management in order to recruit top diverse candidates in a cost-effective manner.
  • Execute end-to-end hiring activities across Technology functions in our Singapore and regional offices.
  • Maintain and audit data entered in our TA system during the recruitment lifecycle and run reports where necessary.
  • Be a trusted advisor and coach to Technology business leaders on recruitment talent strategies; including but not limited to equip hiring managers with effective selection and interviewing techniques.
  • Build a robust talent pipeline through engagement with universities companies interest and network groups in the Technology/Engineering space.



Requirements

  • Minimum 3 years’ experience in corporate/in-house and/or search firms technical recruiting experience including sourcing and full life cycle recruiting
  • Proven track record with closing Technical roles (including but not limited to Software Engineers Product Managers UI/UX Frontend Developers Solutions Architects etc) in Singapore and India
  • Ability to deliver results with little supervision in a start-up environment with capacity to effectively manage multiple requests and candidates simultaneously
  • Unquestioned integrity and confidentiality.
  • Genuine curiosity and strong desire to continuously learn and grow.
  • Demonstrated client-service orientation with a clear approachable and friendly communication style with a positive customer service and solutions-focused attitude.
  • Tech savvy and comfortable with any recruiting software and GSuite especially Excel skills.
  • Technical curiosity and interest in evolving trends in recruiting products and services.
  • Experience of working within a tech startup and hyper growth environment
  • Comfortable with fast paced operations and not be afraid to "roll up your sleeves" to get things done.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills

Job Title: Manager| Strategy & Planning - Uber Eats APAC
Job Description:
At Uber we ignite opportunity by setting the world in motion. We take on big problems to help drivers riders delivery partners and eaters get moving in more than 10000 cities around the world.

We welcome people from all backgrounds who seek the opportunity to help build a future where everyone and everything can move independently. If you have the curiosity passion and collaborative spirit work with us and let’s move the world forward together.

About The Team

Uber Eats APAC Strategy & Planning (S&P) team is a tight-knit impactful team that plays a meaningful role across APAC business. We partner closely with senior leadership (both within the region and globally) cross-functional leadership and our teams on the ground in each market and we enjoy strong relationships and rapport with the APAC region. Our team drives four key pillars to drive the business:
  • Competitive Strategy
  • Business Planning
  • New Verticals and
  • Organizational Effectiveness. This role will involve projects across all four verticals.

About The Role

This role plays a key part of the Strategy & Planning team working closely with S&P teammates and senior regional leadership based in Singapore. There will be close partnerships with business operations marketing sales finance and strategy in each of our countries in Asia Pacific.

We are looking for someone with a strong set of fundamental business skills - having the business sense analytical ability strong communication and project management - with the curiosity flexibility and desire to work on a wide range of projects in a highly dynamic environment!

What You'll Do
  • Thought leadership: Work with Country and Regional leadership teams to set strategic priorities align the vision and share good practices
  • Develop business insights: Close working relationship with operations marketing team sales team finance team to identify important trends problems and opportunities across Uber Eats in APAC.
  • Improve Processes: Identify operational and structural weaknesses and help improve existing or develop new processes to keep our local and regional teams as efficient as possible.
  • Project Management: Be a resourceful multi-tasker supporting teams across the region - the go to person for many key organizational initiatives.
  • Cultivate relationships: Collaborate with other functional areas (Business Development People Operations Product Legal Finance etc.) to ensure we are bringing all available tools to bear on our toughest problems
  • Synthesize and communicate market trends: Work with the S&P team leadership and other partners to communicate your findings and use them to help develop a strong pulse on market trends competition and opportunities.
  • Drive Communication: Communicate the region’s priorities through a variety of internal and external communications
  • Lead by example: Be exceptionally truth-seeking with data set a high bar for the team to think boldly and be innovative communicate frequently and with high quality; then funnel that energy into concrete processes and execution plans

Basic Qualifications
  • At least 6-8 years of investment banking / consulting / business intelligence / strategy or related experience; some high-growth operations experience is highly preferred
  • Problem solving skills: Ability to identify a business operational or organizational challenge frame the problem and decide on an appropriate course of action.
  • Strategic and business sense: Strong ability to analyze data to identify operational deficiencies financial opportunities and industry trends.
  • Communication: Clear and concise communication with an eye towards takeaways and next steps whether in writing decks or live meetings.
  • Project management: Proactive communication punctuality clear timelines

Great To Have
  • Speed and balancing priorities: Many tasks from tiny to huge come to this role and you could execute quickly and while frequently re-prioritizing.
  • Grit and positivity: APAC is a challenging market and S&P is given both the visibility to know and the mandate to fix many of our biggest challenges.
  • Bias towards action. This is one of the key roles that determines whether initiatives get acted on and have impact or fall behind in the “idea dustbin”.
  • Self-starter attitude - the ability to self-serve investigate and get the data we require will make you much more effective in this role
You are someone who enjoys teamwork across time zones to develop strategies and foster a cohesive and innovative work environment or have exceptional Excel / SQL / data management skills and would like to use it to improve on a fast growing business. Sounds like yourself? We encourage you to apply now!

Responsibilities
  • Involved in campaign management including planning of product promotion product launches product listing campaign follow up etc
  • Assist to develop and implement demand generation plans to grow site revenue
  • Liaise with Designer Team on artwork requirements and monitor deadlines for completion
  • Responsible for stock inventory accuracy and to address any discrepancy
  • Assist Customer Relations department on product knowledge
  • Generate analysis and sales reports on regular basis
  • Logistic coordination when required
  • Prepare and generate purchase orders invoices and coordinate logistics for B2B operations
  • Other duties as assigned


Requirements
  • O level or above
  • At least 1 year of experience in managing E-commerce platforms or relevant experience
  • Effective interpersonal and communications skills (verbal and written)
  • Proficient in Excel PowerPoint
  • Strong analytical skill
  • Identify with company's corporate culture and obey the company's arrangements;

The Government Technology Agency (GovTech) aims to transform the delivery of Government digital services by taking an "outside-in" view putting citizens and businesses at the heart of everything we do. We also develop the Smart Nation infrastructure and applications and facilitate collaboration with citizens and businesses to co-develop technologies.

Join us as we support Singapore’s vision of building a Smart Nation - a nation of possibilities empowered through info-communications technology and related engineering.

Responsible for the day-to-day operations of Smart Nations Sensor Platform as well as the management of its 24x7 command centre facility.

What to Expect
  • Manage Command Centre facility such as call infrastructure server/LAN room video walls key management system PC assets
  • Oversee and guide contractors in the day-to-day running of Smart Nation Sensor Platform operations
  • Instil operational discipline
  • Perform procurement of ICT products and services
  • Formulate efficient procedures and processes according to objectives and apply improvements
  • Combine analytical skill with creativity to lead the organization towards achieving greater operational efficiency and growth
  • Perform metrics configuration collection analysis and reporting
  • Drive insights from data collected to recommend project/organization improvement
  • Create customized reports and analyses as needed

How to Succeed
  • Experienced in overseeing operational systems processes and infrastructure while looking for opportunities of improvement or revision.
  • Proactive as well as able to anticipate and tracks operational and tactical risks and providing strategic solutions.
  • Strong operational and technical skills and able to liaise with various capability cenres to onboard and offboard services in the Command Centre.
  • Able to work closely with various stakeholder to perform regular reporting and provide recommendation on improvements.
  • Able to identify trends and assess opportunities to improve operational processes.
  • Strong people skills and can collaborate with transitions and onboarding team as needed.
  • Good contract and procurement management skills
  • Good understanding of both IT and business processes and the relationship between them
  • Able to work with cross-functional multi-disciplined team to formulate institute and monitor security policies and procedures
  • Strong foundation in ITIL
  • Adapted to work in the fast pace and mult-tasking environment

Preferred
  • Qualification in Computer Engineering Computer Science or equivalent
  • At least 3 years of project management experience
  • At least 3 years of experience related to ICT operations policies and procedures
  • Strong interpersonal and stakeholder management skills
  • ITIL certified would be an advantage
  • Project Management Professional (PMP) would be an advantage

Help us improve access to life-changing therapies that can transform human health

We are Cytiva a global provider of technologies and services that advance and accelerate the development and manufacture of therapeutics. Formerly part of GE Healthcare we have a rich heritage tracing back hundreds of years and a fresh beginning since 2020.

Our customers undertake life-saving activities. These range from fundamental biological research to developing innovative vaccines biologic drugs and novel cell and gene therapies. Our job is to supply the tools and services - the pots pans soups and sauces - they need to work better faster and safer leading to better patient outcomes.

What You’ll Do
  • This position is responsible for providing strategy project leadership and driving cross-functional teams to execute our global logistics strategy enable growth and improve productivity. This role will partner and coordinate across a team of business functional experts.
  • The primary responsibility of this role is to lead coordinate and manage mutiple projects to ensure ontime completion of projects and initiatives with high impact to the business. These projects are expected to drive new supply chain business models and offerings to support business growth enhance customer experience digitalize core operations and build a robust internal digital foundation.
  • In addition this role will develop and implement new strategies and procedures where required to ensure visibility productivity and delivery of the strategy execution plan.
  • Leading and developing a team of 3 associates
  • Partnering cross-functional project managers / leads to define scope goals develop project plans and facilitate execution of the plan to meet business objectives
  • Leading cross-team projects to drive standard process methodology stability and simplification in processes. Recommend improvements and apply LEAN and Problem-Solving Principles across assigned critical business initiatives
  • Presenting ideas thoughts and projects to senior management to get buy-in on projects; serving as a recognized expert and resource leader for functional focus areas
  • Developing rigorous control plans; working closely with process owners project champions and business teams to provide leadership and direction on the implementation of strategies and processes; ensuring improvement gains are sustained on a long-term basis in a significant wing-to-wing (W2W) process.
  • Implementing the strategic W2W road map through the manufacturing plants distributions centers and vendors globally
  • Drive continuous improvement digitalization productivity & compliance

Who You Are
  • Bachelor’s Degree in Logistics Materials or Supply Chain Management Strong project management and supply chain execution experience.
  • Demonstrated ability to work effectively in a cross-functional global team environment.
  • Solid communication and analytical skills including experience with communicating with others from different counties and cultures Thorough with attention to details and have a process driven mindset
  • Data related skillsets such as data visualization and analytics are highly desirable Fluency in English both verbal and written
  • Ability to energize develop and build rapport at all levels within the organization Proven ability to execute multi-task and deliver on commitments Experience working in a compliant supply chain using Six Sigma or LEAN or other continuous improvement tools
  • Good export regulations knowledge and experience Familiarity with ERP systems (Oracle)

Who We Are

Whatever your role we bring purpose and challenge into our everyday work. If you are driven to make the world a better place thanks to science and medicine you’ll feel right at home here. If you’re flexible curious and relentless you’ll belong. If you are excited about a global culture this can be the place to further your career.

Want to know more? Experience life at Cytiva on our Careers website Instagram channel and LinkedIn page!

Cytiva is global life sciences leader with over 7000 associates across 40 countries who are dedicated to our mission to advance and accelerate therapeutics. As a trusted partner to customers that range in scale and scope Cytiva brings efficiencies to research and manufacturing workflows ensuring the development manufacture and delivery of transformative medicines to patients.

Cytiva is part of the Danaher family of companies a global science and technology innovator committed to helping customers solve complex challenges and improving quality of life around the world.

Job Description:
JOB PURPOSE:

 

To provide administrative services to Private Banking clients and Team Leader (TL) / Relationship Manager (RM) in relation to client on boarding investments and transactions by coordinating between the relevant support and operations functions.

 

PRINCIPAL ACCOUNTABILITIES:


· Handle and liaise with support partners to resolve administrative and operational matters for TL/RMs. Handle clients’ enquiries/needs and assist in servicing their requirement. Establish good rapport with clients and service their needs effectively and on a timely basis.

· Assist TL/RMs in executing investment transactions.

· Assist TL/RMs in monitoring clients’ position.

· Handle new account opening account maintenance credit application. Ensure completeness of documents per the internal requirements.

· Handle any periodic reviews such as credit KYC and Client Risk Questionnaire.

· Highlight suspicious activities/behavior of clients and staff e.g. account irregularities to Team Leader/Management/Compliance.

· Attend all Private Banking Compliance and other mandatory training.

· Understand the Bank’s KYC/AML/CDD framework.

· To input the deal into the systems or raise appropriate deal tickets and complete the task at high efficiency high accuracy fast speed and minimal errors.

 

KEY COMPETENCIES:

 

·    Experience in Client Servicing

·    Knowledge in KYC/AML/CDD process

·    Knowledge in investment products is preferred

·    Good interpersonal skill and team player

·    Good communication skills

·    Organized and meticulous

Key Responsibilities Include
  • Market research through various channels including cold calling and internet to create and validate conference content with senior executives
  • Invitation confirmation and management of ongoing relations with senior speakers
  • Identification and Acquisition of potential conference sponsors and exhibitors
  • Managing events (both onsite and live online events) networking with senior executives and developing business relationships
  • Project manage and work together with sales marketing and operations teams to achieve project objectives
  • Budgetary control of individual event costs and revenue goals
  • Creation of sales copy & content for the event brochure interview pieces marketing emailers website copies and promotional pieces


Requirements
  • Driven Positive & Hardworking Individual who wants to succeed in a fast-paced business environment
  • Goal getters who takes ownership and will constantly go the extra mile for projects
  • Commercial-minded candidates without relevant experience are welcomed to apply
  • Ability to work independently and under pressure
  • Ability to meet tight deadlines and targets
  • Strong Written & Oral Communication Skills

Netflix is the world's leading internet entertainment service with 195 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series documentaries and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want anytime anywhere on any internet-connected screen. Members can play pause and resume watching all without commercials or commitments.

We offer great TV series documentaries and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages that push the boundaries of storytelling and delight members of all ages and tastes around the world. As we grow our business and teams we seek talent from a wide range of backgrounds that reflect the global nature of our members. It takes diversity of thought culture background and perspective to create a truly global business.

The Netflix culture is unique and attracts daredevils who exhibit good judgment innovation selflessness courage impact candid communication passion and intellectual curiosity. Read our culture memo to learn what it’s like working for Netflix. To excel in this environment you must be independently minded have impeccable creative taste and a strong instinct for stories that will get consumers talking about Netflix and our shows more passionately and frequently than ever before.

It's an amazing time to be joining Netflix. The Asia region is a critical piece of our international expansion. People are discovering Netflix every day across Asia and we want our content to be relevant and irresistible. Finding the perfect strategic and creative mix of entertainment brand messaging and product experience is key to unlocking waves of new consumer for us in Asia.

The Integrated Marketing function at Netflix is responsible for bridging our Content and our Marketing within Asia and globally.

Working closely with the APAC Marcomm teams this role will be responsible for understanding Content Strategy and leading Campaign Management. You will help vet analyze and prioritize which series and films will grow our business in the APAC region and you will also support the strategy and creative campaign development of our Global and APAC Originals.

You will be critical in leading cross-functional collaboration with our Regional partners such as Marketing Editorial & Publishing Publicity Partner Marketing Marketing Strategy & Operations Content Planning & Analysis and Consumer Insights.

Who are you?
  • You are a natural leader with an ability to build strategic foundations conceptualize campaign approaches and articulate the needs for the region.
  • You thrive in a fast-paced and collaborative environment and demonstrate strong judgment and solution-driven skills.
  • You are passionate and curious and are open to receive candid feedback about your performance and see it as a way of growth.
  • You love TV and film content and have some knowledge of the entertainment landscape and media trends.
  • You thrive in a fast-paced and collaborative environment and demonstrate strong judgment and a solution-driven mindset. Multi-tasker but with clear time management and prioritization skills.
  • You are passionate curious and open to candid feedback about your performance and seek any constructive real-time points as a great way to grow.
  • A doer an entrepreneurial and self-motivated collaborator in a fast paced and multifaceted environment who is capable of being impactful without the support of a large team of direct reports. This person is able to work both independently and in close collaboration with a wide array of stakeholders.
  • A selfless collaborative Marketing professional who will naturally go beyond roles and titles to get great work done.

In this role
  • Long-Term Planning - you will assess opportunities for APAC markets and identify the titles that would resonate in the markets through partnering with Content and Consumer Insights and use data analysis and other available information sources.
  • A natural team captain you can lead cross-functional discussions articulate Regional needs and drive marketing campaign alignment.
  • You will be responsible for providing the APAC regional perspective and needs during global campaign planning collecting the local team’s POV and channeling back to teammates on the ground in LA and in other offices.
  • Campaign Development & Project Management - support the local campaign development workflow mobilizing the local cross-functional teams to meet campaign goals and planning benchmarks.
  • Marketing Strategy - you will partner with the local Marketing and Editorial & Publishing teams to define the strategies for the launch of Netflix Original series and films in Asia as well as key local licensed titles.
  • Communication Tools - you will build maintain and evolve key communication and strategy tools necessary for our cross functional teams to stay informed on title and campaign planning.
  • You will be deeply embedded in local market and consumer insights as well as the local entertainment industry.

Qualifications
  • At least 7 years of experience in building strategic and creative consumer marketing campaigns preferably with a background in entertainment (TV and/or film) or worked at a top innovative brand advertising or media agency with an emphasis on Content Marketing.
  • A strong sense of analytical strategic problem-solving and organizational skills -- always biased to action with a high level of social EQ.
  • A proactive entrepreneurial state of mind who works fast collaboratively and effectively with a highly-aligned and loosely coupled team.
  • A mastery of verbal and written communication as well as presentation skills to lead meetings manage workflow and provide cultural or region-specific insights.
  • An ability to manage 20+ projects simultaneously and adapt in a dynamic environment.
  • A working understanding of digital advertising (mobile paid social display VOD) with a strong grasp of traditional (OOH TV press) and social media platforms.
  • Experience working with Asia and other international markets.
  • Fluency/proficiency in English required and fluency/proficiency in Korean preferred.
  • Proficiency in Google and MS Office including Gmail Google Calendar Google Meet Google Docs Google Groups MS Word/Excel is a plus.

Job Title: Head of Operations & Technology| Citi Private Bank Asia Pacific
Job Description:
Head of CPB O&T Asia is responsible for leading over 700 Citi employees across locations in Hong Kong Singapore and India. The position has direct management oversight of the delivery of O&T for Citi Private Bank (CPB) across Asia Pacific and partners with the global teams to align priorities.

Responsible for managing an annual expense budget of about USD 60MM.

The position reports directly to Global Head of O&T for Citi Private bank with a matrix responsible to the Asia Pacific O&T Head.

Key Performance Objectives

Engage with regional CPB businesses and functions to provide strategic direction and support from an O&T perspective and ensure execution priorities are aligned with O&T’s global strategies.

Work with the global O&T team to understand global priorities and ensure Asia priorities are included in the global priorities

Ensure the organization meets and exceeds financial goals. Work in partnership with regional GMMs products and functions to identify opportunities to optimize expenses.

Take a leadership role in identifying key themes within O&T such as re-engineering through LEAN simplification digitization straight-through-processing and outsourcing and leveraging organizational resources within and outside O&T to drive and implement these initiatives.

Prioritizing technology deliveries for the region and maintaining a strong focus on the delivery of high quality customer services through O&T processes people and the platforms.

Lead the management oversights of the global development centers in Pune and global operations hubs for NAM and Asia in Chennai & Pune.

Maintain a culture of transformation for operations to continue to improve automation opportunities to scale the business sustainably.

Actively work to address and prevent issues incidences and outages related to IT.

Also deliver on key programs in the areas of infrastructure upgrades (EOL/EOVS) data localization data quality information security cyber security and data protection for the franchise working with the respective regional functional and country O&T heads.

Maintain a strong control and compliance environment throughout the O&T organization that can rapidly adapt to the continually changing regulatory and compliance environment.

Addressing business operations and Technology risks in the spaces of 3rd party management continuity of business and non-employees by focusing on right-placement and risk mitigation.

Continue to foster an environment of proactive escalation and prompt resolution of all O&T issues including the timely closure of relevant Corrective Action Plans.

Focus on talent development with priorities around building a strong pipeline diversity and leverage the breadth of opportunities to develop future leaders.

Create and drive a culture of inclusion diversity and meritocracy across the Bank with high ethical and leadership standards.

Lead a diverse management team focusing on their individual development and empowering them to build strong relationships with their regional and in-country partners.

Qualifications

The candidate would be expected to have 15+ years of work experience. Of which at least 5 years are in senior leadership role(s)

Proven record of enterprise level change management

A thorough understanding of O&T risk and control management and regulatory expectations. Ability to drive execution in this space as well as the perceptiveness to identify early warning signals.

Strong influencing and negotiation skills. Ability to explore alternatives and positions to reach outcomes that are supported and accepted by stakeholders.

Superior people leadership skills including being able to connect inspire and motivate large teams.

Heightened focus on client experience and demonstrated track record of showing empathy to arrive at the best solutions to drive this experience.

Strategic and innovative thinker with demonstrated ability to define strategy and provide direction and support with the skills to switch quickly from strategic to tactical.

Demonstrated ability to build and promote diverse talent and an inclusive culture within the organization and ensure succession planning.

Prior Experience In Managing Across Different Cultures Strongly Preferred.

Ability to partner on global initiatives

Our client is a global leader in transportation and supply chain management.

Neuron is the fastest growing micro-mobility operator in Asia Pacific and the leading shared e-scooter company across Australia and New Zealand. We partner with cities to connect people and places in a safe convenient and fun way. We are driven to help the world build a more prosperous and sustainable future through new ways of moving and connecting.

Neuron started the world's first scooter sharing platform in Singapore in 2016. We develop our own industry-leading e-scooters which are purpose built for sharing and safety. We also set the industry standard for technology that manages them. Neuron has launched an impressive range of world firsts particularly when it comes to safety. We currently operate in eight locations including Adelaide Brisbane Darwin Canberra Townsville and Auckland and will soon be expanding to the United Kingdom.

These are Neuron's Values:

Make it happen

We are driven by results make commitments with integrity and consistently make an impact.

Be proactive

We take ownership of tasks that help us build sustainable growth.

Trust facts over opinions

Whenever possible we make the logical choice based on data and known truths.

Stay curious

We embrace the habit of asking questions challenging assumptions and revisiting convictions.

Do more with less

Profit allows us to continue serving our users. We must be efficient and resourceful.

Job Role

NVPC operates a national trusted platform for matching donors and volunteers to registered charities in Singapore. The Digital Innovation team is now expanding and we are looking for a passionate driven individual possessing the right purpose and aptitude to create impact to serve community and societal needs at a national level.


As a Business Analyst with the Digital Innovation team you will determine business requirements and translate them into user-centric stories for stakeholder alignment and development.


You will be working in a multi-stakeholder environment and must be comfortable working independently or collaboratively with analysts designers developers and various stakeholders to coordinate conceptualise plan execute track product releases and contribute actively to team goals.


Being able to communicate complex business insights in a clear and concise manner is a must.


Job Responsibilities

  • Work with both internal and external stakeholders to identify gather and verify user requirements as user stories for user alignment and development.
  • Work with development team and stakeholders and development team to establish delivery timeline key milestones resource needs monitor delivery progress including acceptance of UAT.
  • Analyse and support the design of technical solutions to enable integration with other systems
  • Work closely with the Product Owner and development team to ensure UI/UX designs conform to usability goals.
  • Provide support for existing operations including support and maintenance for existing systems incident management service requests and fulfillment of change requests.


Job Requirements

  • Possess at least a Bachelor’s Degree Post Graduate Diploma or Professional Degree in Computer Science / Information Technology Engineering or equivalent.
  • Minimum 5 years relevant working experience as a Business Analyst.
  • Experience in managing mobile and web applications and implementing business process systems.
  • Good understanding of UI/UX concepts
  • Experience in HTML CSS and Javascript for rapid prototyping is a plus.
  • Highly motivated in problem-solving with strong investigative skills.
  • Effective self-starter who excels in a fast-paced multi-vendor environment

  • Exhibits critical thinking and problem-solving skills. Strong ability to step into details yet possessing full visibility of end to end view of the product development roadmaps.
  • Passion to transform Singapore into a giving nation.
  • Detail-oriented hands-on comfortable working in high-energy and dynamic environment.
  • Pro-active self-starter with an analytical and creative mind and a team player.
  • Results- and customer-oriented with multi-tasking capabilities.

What you will do:
EHS
  • Plan organize and take lead to drive safety awareness/initiatives and promote safety culture within the company and contractors.
  • Establishment communication deployment and maintenance of company EHS related policies manuals and procedures.
  • Ensure compliance to EHS related legal legislations and organizational requirements.
  • Manage all EHS incident near misses and non-conformance investigations and track corrective and preventive actions to closure.
  • Lead all essential EHS audits and inspections internally and/or by third party or client as and when required.
  • Establish proper risk assessment by identifying hazards and to recommend suitable control measures to mitigate these risks.
  • Develop effective communication materials and collaterals (include but not limited to safety messages advisories campaigns posters trainings etc.) for group outreach and learning.
  • Assume the role of Fire Safety Manager (FSM).
  • Prepare the budget for EHS activities and educational/ awareness programs.
  • Setup and lead EHS Committee.

Supply Chain System
  • Track and report the status of the Supply Chain System related Continuous Improvement and Operation Excellence action items.
  • Conduct regular and structured review sessions with PPC (Plant Principle Champion) to provide timely support for action items closure.
  • Be the PPC for EHS related principles.
  • Establish lead and coach the HPT (High Performance Team) in accordance to JCMS (Johnson Controls Manufacturing System).
  • Track and publish the Supply Chain System KPI and scorecards.
  • Ensure all documents related to Supply Chain System (SOP SII WI Control Plan and Inspection Checklist) are up-to-date.
  • Introduce and guide the team on 8D Methodology.

Warehouse Operations Support
  • Ensure the inbound and outbound shipping documentation accuracy with proper filing for audit retrieval.
  • Communicate and work closely with internal & external stakeholders in ensuring the overall warehouse operation performance is achieved at all times.
  • Ensure Goods Receiving & Outbound transactions in ERP system are performed on the real time basis in accordance to the physical transaction performed.
  • Review and evaluate work processes material cost utilization of manpower and resources to improve overall productivity.
  • Perform Investigation if any complaints raised – quality & quantity aspects for both Inbound & Outbound.

IMS Certification & Audit
  • Acting as MR and working with external ISO Regulatory Consultants towards establishing implementing maintaining and certification of Integrated Management System (OHSAS18001 & ISO14001 standard).
  • Maintain the full control of document per Integrated Management System.
  • Ensure timely completion of IMS audit and submission of audit reports.
  • Conduct internal assessment in line with Accreditation and certification requirements.

What we look for:
  • Degree or Diploma in Business Administration Logistics Transportation Supply Chain Management Engineering or equivalent with at least 4-5 years of experience in related roles & job scopes.
  • Possess EHS knowledge and hands on experience.
  • Relevant knowledge in ISO14001/OHSAS18001 certification.
  • Certified ISM/ISO auditor qualification will be an advantage
  • Knowledge in NEA SPF SCDF and MOM licensing is an added advantage.
  • Proficient in Microsoft Excel/Word/Outlook
  • Strong attention to detail organized meticulous analytical strong organizational skills ability to prioritize and multitask
  • Able to work independently with minimal supervision.

Job Description

As the APAC Sales Operations Manager on the Go To Market Operations team at Zendesk you will work cross-functionally with Sales Marketing and IT stakeholders in all regions to streamline our Lead-To-Cash process. This role is a mix of market intelligence market analysis strategy and business operational support. This role requires a strong analytical mindset with the ability to provide sound strategic advice and practical operational insight to stakeholders. You will gain experience in key functional areas such as strategy sales finance and analytics. This person will report to the Director GTM Sales Operations APAC and will collaborate with finance field marketing sales pre-sales and customer success. You will be expected to manage develop and lead a team of Senior Analysts.

The successful candidate will have a relentless curiosity and possess a passion for creating innovative analysis to identify growth opportunities. Moreover he or she will excel at developing recommendations that transcend the numbers. Ideally this person will be ambitious and results-oriented – an analytical whiz with outstanding communication skills high initiative and strong drive to lead change. The role will be expected to lead by example and have the ability to roll up their sleeves to get the job done.

Zendesk is a rapidly growing company with an amazing culture. You will be working with smart and driven individuals focused on delivering high impact projects. Zendesk builds software for better customer relationships. It empowers organizations to improve customer engagement and better understand their customers. Zendesk products are easy to use and implement. They give organizations the flexibility to move quickly focus on innovation and scale with their growth. Based in San Francisco Zendesk has operations in the United States Europe Asia Australia and South America. Learn more at www.zendesk.com.
  • Work with internal teams cross-functionally to manage assets for Outreach ensuring global cohesion and efficiency across sales tiers and regions. Oversee the asset database to ensure accuracy and up-to-date content.
  • Develop a clear understanding of what conversion rates should be and how to leverage copy variations and other experiments to hit those metrics
  • Interact regularly with sales to understand the language they use to best sell the product then adopt and evolve this language for use in welcome messages bots and emails
  • Have an understanding of Zendesk’s marketing and sales tech stack and the information that flows through it to be pushed into and pulled out of Outreach and Salesforce
  • Ensure that we are connecting with relevant prospects and that our process to do so improves each month.
  • Own our sales playbooks and development toward globally consistent methodology and processes
  • Become the subject matter experts on sales rep processes across various sales tools including Salesforce.com Outreach.io Clari and Tableau.
  • Collaborate with our Sales Enablement team to create training decks videos and learning modules for our go-to-market roles with the goal of improving sales productivity and field communication
  • Assist in troubleshooting operational issues as they surface; propose changes to systems and processes to fix root causes
  • Identify inefficiencies implement solutions and track progress around sales performance pipeline management and sales forecasting
  • Prepare analysis and recommendations for strategic decision making.
  • Lead ongoing analysis of business performance and present recommendations to GTM leadership for strategic decision making and investment.
  • Identify opportunities to improve business processes and generate a functional requirements document.
  • Create and drive adoption of new business and system processes for operational efficiency.
  • Monitor data and performance of sales and marketing activities to identify trends or issues with data quality.
  • Create and manage dashboards and reports for the sales teams.
  • Resolve miscellaneous issues from sales and marketing.
  • Manage ad hoc projects that will drive sales efficiency and enablement.
  • Manage a team of Senior Analysts

Qualifications
  • 5+ years experience in sales operations enablement or marketing operations role
  • Team management experience
  • Highly skilled in relevant tech stack/sales platforms including:
    • Marketing and Sales Automation such as Outreach.io Yesware Marketo or Eloqua
    • Salesforce.com
    • Data enrichment tools such as Zoominfo Datanyze Datafox and 6sense
  • Able to quickly learn and adapt to new process and technologies in order to meet business needs and drive business value
  • Experience managing A/B testing and willingness to experiment - ability to learn from your failures
  • Knowledge of sales sales process and sales methodologies
  • Strong presentation facilitation project management and leadership skills
  • Ability to build relationships and work collaboratively across multiple departments
  • Strong organizational skills; ability to manage multiple cross-functional projects simultaneously
  • Problem-solving/analytical mindset organized and able to manage multiple initiatives at once
  • Proactive not reactive mindset
  • Ability to work across teams including marketing sales IT and operations

Zendesk builds software for better customer relationships. It empowers organizations to improve customer engagement and better understand their customers. Zendesk products are easy to use and implement. They give organizations the flexibility to move quickly focus on innovation and scale with their growth.

More than 150000 paid customer accounts in over 150 countries and territories use Zendesk products. Based in San Francisco Zendesk has operations in the United States Europe Asia Australia and South America.

Rainmaking Ventures is a venture development company. We create accelerate and scale new businesses with world leading corporations and entrepreneurs. Our model allows us to combine scale strengths and deep domain knowledge of corporates with the entrepreneurial execution of startups.

We are building a new spin-out venture for the shipping industry that is backed by a global maritime industry group.

The spin-out is created around an IoT product with state-of-the-art technology that has been tested with 20+ customers and has revenue and soon ready to be scaled in the industry through existing global distribution channels.

We are now looking for a strong CEO who will work with our venture team and our industry partner to champion to scale and lead this venture.

The ideal candidate will have a successful track record of growing teams in either a tech startup or a business unit in the maritime industry.

The candidate should have a strong commercial background within B2B sales and Digital products.

Vision & Strategy
  • Help set the vision of the overall strategy from launch to scale; including defining long-term goals and go to market strategies
  • Drive growth profitability and business value
  • Manage burn rate while growing the business
  • Serve as external spokesperson and public champion for the business
Execution
  • Drive day-to-day execution and operations
  • Own P&L and cash flow
  • Mitigate business and operational risks
Team & Culture
  • Attract retain & develop the team
  • Cultivate a high-performing innovative one-team culture
Stakeholders
  • Build strategic partnerships & relationships to drive growth
  • Regularly report updates to Board of Directors and corporate stakeholders regarding progress on strategic priorities
Desired Expertise and Experience
  • 5+ years of experience leading and scaling startups or business units
  • Experience in the maritime industry is a plus
  • Startup/entrepreneurial experience within IoT/digital products/technology
  • Commercial profile with experience of technical/digital B2B sales
  • Experience managing corporate stakeholders to keep regular updates on business performance and progress
  • (Be open to re-locate yourself and the company to Singapore)
What we offer
  • Opportunity to work with some of the most experienced venture builders strategists engineers designers and growth experts around.
  • Attractive combination of salary + equity package (hint; you should be in it for equity)
  • High degree of responsibility and freedom
  • Be on the forefront of maritime innovation and technology
If you see yourself as the perfect match or you have any questions regarding the position we would love to hear from you.

Learn more about us at rainmaking.io

What's up? We're VaynerMedia APAC! A full-service agency built for the now. Day in and day out we propel some of the biggest brands in the world to the intersection of attention and culture. Headquartered in New York City we're also in 7 offices across the globe and now at +1000. VM APAC is proudly in the +80 regionally servicing a diverse clientele all around the APAC region.

Culture is our key and Empathy is how we build it. VaynerMedia APAC is strong with a world-class combination of diverse backgrounds collaborating to put forward innovative creative and strategic solutions to the one advantage that stands the test of time --- PEOPLE.

We are seeking awesome interns who want to experience working in a dynamic fast-paced and high-energy environment. YOU must be someone who's constantly in the loop of everything trendy - from media content to brands to products. This is definitely not for the faint-hearted as this internship will get your heart pumping on a daily basis.

At the same time you'll be able to learn from a culture of entrepreneurial ideation and collaborative spirit where we strongly encourage you to get your hands dirty and ramp up your hands-on experience. We will definitely provide the necessary guidance to eventually see you spread your wings when you graduate from our internship!

If you're looking for an INTERNSHIP opportunity for the following roles you're welcome to join the fastest growing full service agency in town!
  • Media Analytics
  • SEO Analytics
  • Creative Design
  • Copywriter
  • Social Media and Community Management
  • Finance
  • People & Experience


MEDIA ANALYTICS
  • Setup and daily management of advertising campaigns across various digital platforms.
  • Ongoing real-time optimization of live media to ensure client goals are met and/or exceeded
  • Provide media planning assistance for upcoming campaigns helping determine platforms to run on audiences to target creative strategies to implement and more including the setup implementation and measurement of various controlled A/B tests
  • Assist with client-facing campaign reporting and write-ups to ensure relevant metrics and insights are shown
  • Constantly work to improve campaign performance insights collection and takeaways and generally strive to "over-deliver" to clients.


SEO ANALYTICS
  • You will plan develop and implement SEO strategies for our clients.
  • You will work towards organic search optimization and ROI maximization.
  • You act as the client's partner in representing their point of view internally and when reviewing work and leverage this perspective when providing feedback to the team and presenting to the client.
  • You strategize optimization to shoot up clients' search engine result rankings.
  • You master metrics and monitor performance redirects click rate bounce rate and other KPIs to evaluate SEO strategies.
  • You ensure website content which includes blog posts and page descriptions are written in superb quality.
  • You manage effectively the webs links and contents to maximize optimization and rankings in search engines.
  • You prepare and present reports regularly both internally and to external clients.
  • You identify buyer personas to better target identified audiences.
  • You manage client expectations regularly ensuring clear communication across updates timelines recommending adjustments creating presentations etc.


CREATIVE DESIGN
  • You'll be asked to do a range of creative work for a range of clients as well as VaynerMedia-wide projects
  • You'll work within a dynamic team structure with several creative leads helping to support and deliver on our core community and brand specific campaigns
  • You'll have a mastery of industry best practices and the platforms we love as well as be willing to learn and articulate the unique VaynerMedia POV on each
  • You'll care about concepting designing developing and putting the team in the best position to present our ideas way more than you do about getting credit for the work
  • You'll gain strong typography skills a love and mastery of photoshop and be comfortable in all adobe creative suite programs


SOCIAL MEDIA & COMMUNITY MANAGEMENT
  • Setup and daily management of advertising campaigns across various digital platforms
  • Responding to queries and engaging the community on social media
  • Providing suggestions and recommendations for new types of content
  • Keeping up to date with current cultural trends and trends in social media
  • Helping determine platforms to run on audiences to target creative strategies to implement and more
  • Including the setup implementation and measurement of various controlled A/B tests
  • Assist with client-facing campaign reporting and write-ups to ensure relevant metrics and insights are shown
  • Constantly working to improve campaign performance insights collection and takeaways and generally strive to "over-deliver" to clients
  • Ensuring client goals are met and/or exceeded


COPYWRITER
  • Own a range of creative work from content calendars to campaigns.
  • Work with a designer within a dynamic team structure with several creative leads helping to support and deliver on our core product and brand-specific campaigns.
  • Organize and assist in directing content photoshoots with our in house studio.
  • Care more about concepting writing developing and putting the team in the best position to present our ideas than you do about getting credit for the work.


FINANCE
  • Verify transactions to comply with Financial policies and procedures.
  • Data entry of documents such as vendor invoices contract of service utility bills corporate cards prepayments etc.
  • Perform 2-way matching with PO.
  • Prepare payment proposals generate a scheduled payment and execute payment runs on regular monthly cycles.
  • Point of contact for payment related matters.
  • Processing of staff claims thru finance system
  • AR duties that include generating invoices customer's statement of account and processing receipts.
  • Maintain proper filing of invoices receipts payment vouchers and suppliers' invoices.


People & Experience
  • Support our local HR Operations team as we scale operate and move quickly. No task is too small for you to tackle and you take a team approach to anything thrown at you.
  • Cultivate and nurture relationships with stakeholders other internal teams (both local and global) and most importantly within HR to become a trusted member of our Singapore team.
  • Live and breathe the talent acquisition and management process from spotting unicorns to hiring and on-boarding.
  • Employee growth wellness engagement and benefits are what we do BEST with our ever-growing list of programs activities and learning opportunities -- and this should be your cup of tea. We find this essential to the motivation and happiness of our employees and so we always want to put our best foot forward.
  • Handle HR administrative tasks with 101% database accuracy within our HR systems such as HiBob ADP Payroll LinkedIn Recruiter and excel spreadsheets. In fact you have an eye for perfection in this area.


What You Should Know About Our Team...

We're collaborative and come from diverse backgrounds. We value creativity in research and an outside-in perspective when it comes to inspiration strategic frameworks and problem-solving. Technology has fundamentally changed the way we interact with others and the world around us and we geek out about understanding behaviors in context instead of probing humans in a petri dish.

What You Should Know About VaynerMedia...

Think "lab" and not "agency". We get excited about solving business problems not creating advertising for the sake of making advertising. Our entrepreneurship DNA runs deep. We're willing to break rules try new things and test hypotheses if it means better understanding our craft. It's fun!

Here in Singapore we're just starting out but growing exponentially...
We've grown quickly since opening in Apr '19 running full-service digital creative and media across the Asia Pacific region.

Our environment (and pace) feels much more like a start-up than most agencies you might be used to. Hopefully that and the opportunity to collaborate with the talented and enthusiastic crew work with big brands excites you as it does us. We can't wait to meet you.

Job Title: Online Operations Leader| JAPAC| Apple Retail Online
Job Description:
Summary
Be a key player in our e-commerce revolution. Get ready for your perfect job one that encourages you to think strategically yet stay connected to our customers. Work with the JAPAC Retail Online and Stores teams to help share the Apple experience with millions of online shoppers. Be part of the world’s most globalized online retailer and help architect our future.


The JAPAC Online Operations Leader is responsible for the overall operations of the Online Stores in JAPAC aligning people process and technologies to ensure a frictionless e-commerce experience for Apple’s customers. The role provides the opportunity to facilitate and lead the operational functions while innovating to ensure the best possible customer experience.


Key Qualifications
15+ years proven experience in a face-paced environment with deep exposure to e-commerce and order fulfillment operations.


Exceptional written and verbal communication skills. Presenting to peers and senior executives/management is critical to success.


Track record of organizing and driving projects in a fast-paced environment.


Experience managing and influencing a diverse group of people.


Thrives in an ambiguous environment where there is quite a bit of accountability without authority.


Significant project management and operational experience within an eCommerce Internet or multi-channel environment.


A fast learner who can quickly apply and adapt knowledge in varying fast paced situations.


International work experience with knowledge of cultural/regional differences and proficiency in Mandarin is a plus.


Description
Operational:


- Flawlessly manage and lead regional launch execution and post-launch support for Apple Online and partner platforms including Tmall and WeChat.


- Coordinate regional post launch fixes and drive regional hindsight exercises contributing to improvements for future releases.


- Provide operational management and leadership for promotional programs such as Black Friday Back to School etc.


- Provide regional input and feedback on new online features and operations projects. Understand and vet operational changes to ensure quality readiness prior to go-live.


- Represent the JAPAC customer in all critical capital plans & strategic programs.


Strategic:


- Develop evangelize and drive strategic programs to ensure global scalability quality and effectiveness of Online Operations.


Commercial:


- Drive commercial operational decisions that impact customers.


- i.e supply chain order admin and day to day exception management that require customer communications and/or store merchandising changes.


- Provide 360 view on business bridging the gap between commercial and operational functions.


- Make connections between teams concepts programs and ideas to ensure we stay ahead of trends.


- Influence key business partners to understand demonstrate and advocate for the online business.


Leadership & Management:


- Directly handle the regional Online Operations team and lead a broader matrixed regional Online Operations organization providing vision setting direction & expectations and motivating the team.


- Act as an escalation point for the region for operational issues. Liaise closely with partners including IS&T Operations Product Management RCCR RCC Finance Legal GA and PR.


- Effectively lead a remote workforce with team members geographically distributed across China Japan and Singapore.


- Act as a thought leader and partner to partner teams bringing operational expertise and customer oriented solutions to problems issues and opportunities.


- Influence worldwide teams to ensure regional needs and preferences are represented in key operational and commercial decisions.


- Track and lead regional Online Operations expenses in close association with regional and WW functional leads and Finance partners.

COMPETENCIES:


- This leader wears many hats and must effectively juggle competing priorities through keen perspective around what is important whilst not letting anything urgent get missed.


- Excellent problem solver who maintains composure even through stressful and challenging situations that may arise.


- Ability to make quick quality decisions with the supporting ability to create contingency plans.


- Motivate both direct and indirect team members through the simple articulation of the vision and direction of the team.


Education & Experience
Degree in Business management or related field preferred

About The Job

Google Cloud teams work with schools companies and government agencies to make them more productive mobile and collaborative. You help fellow sales Googlers by performing budgeting planning and analysis activities — and through your passion for the magic of Google products like Google Workspace and Chrome. Not only do you provide invaluable financial and budgeting input but you also devise new ways for us to communicate with potential leads and bring them into the Google fold. Your insight means you excel at customer segmentation acquisition and retention. You combine clean communication with strong analytical skills and a solid commitment to providing customers with a Googley customer experience. You also peer into the future for us; you examine and analyze statistical data to forecast marketing trends and to identify potential new markets for Google Cloud.

The Go-to-Market Strategy & Operations organization partners with our Cloud sales organization in developing go-to-market strategies providing business critical insights using analytics ensuring cross-functional alignment of goals and execution and helping teams drive strategic partnerships and new initiatives forward.

As a Business Performance Associate you'll be a critical member on the Cloud Go To Market Operations team. You will work in a team focused around improving our reporting and help us scale for the future. You will work independently in a fast-paced constantly evolving global executive environment.

Google Cloud provides organizations with leading infrastructure platform capabilities and industry solutions. We deliver enterprise-grade cloud solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology to help companies operate more efficiently and adapt to changing needs giving customers a foundation for the future. Customers in more than 150 countries turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to solve their most critical business problems.

Responsibilities
  • Develop and scale creative solutions to surface the right performance data and insights to Cloud sales teams.
  • Proactively identify structure and lead initiatives and business programs that ensure data quality is maintained throughout the sales lifecycle.
  • Develop insights on Cloud business performance and present actions and programs to improve our performance for short and long-term.
  • Work with Sales and cross-functional teams to become their trusted partner for all things data and share best practices with other regional and global Google Sales Operations teams.
  • Support Cloud leadership on regular business performance reviews and drive competitive insights within region to influence our strategies.

“There is no love sincerer than the love of food” - George Bernard Shaw

Do you love food and convenience put together? Then you will definitely love foodpanda!

foodpanda (small ‘f’) is the world’s favourite way to order food online from the comfort of your home or office. Whether it’s getting your hands on your favourite pasta kebab or pizza we believe that no one should have to suffer from hunger attacks ever again.

However this doesn’t happen without some really awesome people. We are looking for an Senior Operations Analyst APAC to support our growing Regional Logisitcs team here in Singapore.You will be responsible to help us improve our restaurant operations across the region. The role will have a holistic view and ownership over key metrics in our business such as fail rate customer product operations and cooking time.

Main Responsibilities
  • Identify and solve problems by analyzing and deriving insights from large complex sets of data
  • Work alongside the commercial and the logistics teams to reduce fail rate and restaurant’s cooking time
  • Work closely with local operations commercial and product teams to optimize customers ordering experience

Requirements
  • You have successfully completed a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Economics or any STEM field
  • You gained 2 to 3 years of work experience in high growth start ups tech companies or financial services
  • Strong excel and data management skills
  • SQL is a must
  • You are a doer and a free thinker. You accept and adapt constantly to change
  • Willing to question the status quo when needed
  • Team player. We are looking for someone who fits the team and the company culture

What We Offer
  • A dynamic and challenging working environment
  • You will be valued by your output not your input

  • Responsibility from day one in a fast growing and global company
  • A vibrant and international team with diverse backgrounds

Company Description

The IKEA vision is to create a better everyday life for the many people. We do this by offering a wide range of well-designed functional home furnishing products at prices so low that as many people as possible can afford them. We operate in Singapore Malaysia and Thailand – and have an ambitious expansion plan to bring a little bit of Sweden to new markets in the region. We are part of the Ikano Group of companies and the only IKEA franchisee owned by the Kamprad family that founded IKEA.

We also develop own and operate Shopping Centres that are anchored by IKEA and create walkable communities by including residential office and other types of real estate in our development plans.

We work towards making sustainability a natural part of our everyday work. We are active in our communities driving and supporting social initiatives that benefit children women and the environment.

About The Job

Job Description

IKEA Jurong is a unique city centre store in a popular shopping mall. It is a smaller store with a big turnover and with 3 milion visitors. It will be lead by an ambitious team consisting of the Store Commercial Operations IKEA Food and a Retail Foundation Manager.

Your responsibilities include forecasting and creating schedules monitoring the execution of the schedule and ensuring scheduled hours include planned absences. You will act as a true business-partner when guiding managers in maximising resource availability and appropriate skill-bases across all departments.

Your assignment
  • Develop a store action plan that secures the best use of available resources
  • Ensure that global principles and guidelines are implemented in the staff planning process and that they are reflected in the co-workers schedules and advise human resources on recruitment and the store staffing structure in accordance with the People Strategy.

  • Responsible for following up the entire store staffing optimisation process including commercial influences possible improvements as well as ensuring work schedules comply with labour rules.
  • Contribute to the delivery of objectives in the store staffing approach identifying improvements in staff planning processes by securing a close follow up of staff planning and related KPI’s.
Qualifications

Your profile
  • Good personal disciplines and have strong proven experience in resource planning working well within set deadlines;
  • Self-reliant motivated and resilient with proven ability to work as part of a team and independently; with
excellent communication skills;
  • Intermediate to advance MS Excel knowledge;
  • You are able to analyse complex data and make it simple and understandable for the decision makers;
  • Strong attention to details demonstrate ability to coordinate people and tasks follow up and good sense of urgency.
