Please apply by 5 November 2020

Job Title: Senior Manager/Manager| Workshops and Events [Partners and Operations Division]
Job Description:
Responsibilities

Workshops and Events Curation to Enhance Employability of Jobseekers
  • Work with internal and external stakeholders to determine skills gap learning objectives and requirements for effective job search
  • Work with training providers to curate content and activities to align jobseekers' requirements and skills competencies to employers' requirements in order to improve job match
  • Conceputalise and implement workshop format and pilot new initiatives to enhance learning efficacy to support the individuals in their job search activities
  • Provide implementation support such as pre-event planning event day and post-event support for career activities (workshops career fairs and networking sessions) to enhance employability of jobseekers
  • Prepare budget requirements for workshops manage utilisation verify billing and ensure proper governance in the course of managing the workshops and events

Partners and Vendors Management
  • Identify and appoint training providers to develop and deliver content to enable jobseekers to return to the workforce or enhance their employability
  • Manage day to day operations with training providers and vendors on workshop planning logistics support including pre-registration day of event and post event tracking
  • Monitor and report workshop's performance manage data and analyse trends
  • Review and enhance content and delivery of workshops
  • Organise after-action review to evaluate participants' turnout identify gaps gather feedback from internal and external stakeholders and propose areas of improvement


Requirements
  • Tertiary qualifications
  • Up to 3 years (Manager) or 4-7 years (Senior Manager) relevant experience in the curation of training or employment-related activities implementation and management of new programmes initiatives
  • Candidates without the required qualifications but with relevant experience are welcome to apply

Knowledge
  • Workforce segment needs and challenges
  • Sectoral Manpower skills and trends
  • Employer needs and challenges in hiring
  • HR hiring process
  • National employment policies
  • Knowledge of WSG programmes will be an added advantage


Skills
  • Communication - Effective interpersonal business writing & presentation skills and understand body language when communicating with different stakeholders
  • Creativity - Ability to propose or pilot learning concepts with a primary focus of enhancing jobseekers employability to employers' hiring needs
  • Critical Thinking - Use logic and reasoning to identify alternative solutions or approaches to problems
  • Data Analytics - Analyse trends and effectiveness of programmes adoption
  • InfoComm Technology - Savvy in using Microsoft Office and a quick learner for other software programmes
  • People Management - Work with internal and external stakeholders to execute different career matching activities
  • Relationship Management - Ability to deepen relationship with training providers to explore employment opportunities for job seekers

Abilities/Aptitudes
  • Responsible team player who takes ownership and will see through tasks
  • Adaptable and flexible to meet with last minute or unexpected changes
  • Able to analyse information and make decision or solve problems
  • Strong desire to always complete tasks at hand and is able to follow through and prioritise to achieve these

Other Characteristics
  • Established network of training providers/adult educators

Job Title: Head of Regional Operations| Asia Pacific
Job Description:
Date Posted

2019-10-01-07:00

Country

Singapore
Location:
UE Square 83 Clemenceau Ave #11-05/08 Singapore 239920
Raytheon Technologies (NYSE: RTX) is an aerospace and defense company that provides advanced systems and services for commercial military and government customers worldwide. The company was formed in 2020 through the combination of Raytheon Company and the United Technologies Corporation aerospace businesses and is headquartered in Waltham Massachusetts.

Collins Aerospace a unit of United Technologies Corp. (NYSE: UTX) is a leader in technologically advanced and intelligent solutions for the global aerospace and defense industry. Created in 2018 by bringing together UTC Aerospace Systems and Rockwell Collins Collins Aerospace has the capabilities comprehensive portfolio and expertise to solve customers’ toughest challenges and to meet the demands of a rapidly evolving global market.

We are currently hiring a Head of Regional Operations Airport Systemsbased out of Singapore to join our Avionics division specifically our Information Management Services (IMS) Asia Pacific team. Collins Aerospace has a global presence at more than 150 airports including half of the 20 largest in the world. As a leading provider of self-serve solutions and with a reputation as a master communication network integrator we understand that the flow of an airport is the flow of an industry.

Join us as we REDEFINE AEROSPACE!

Job Summary

As the Head of Regional Operations for Asia Pacific this leadership position functions in a shared service environment and is responsible for overseeing business technical and maintenance service operations. This person will be responsible for managing teams tasked with delivery and support of all projects on time within budget and in a manner that enhances Collins’ technical leadership and reputation and encourages additional business from customers.

Job Responsibilities
  • Oversee the overall operations within the region of responsibility;
  • Provide management and direction of the Project Management Systems Delivery and Managed Services teams;
  • Provide guidance for development of project schedule and budget and monitor project execution for compliance with defined strategic and financial targets and objectives;
  • Enforce standards of operations using project management tools and techniques such as MS Project critical path analysis time recording systems and other systems to manage projects;
  • Support regional business growth and development activities by maintaining and expanding current customer relationships and developing opportunities with potential customers;
  • Nurture existing customer relationships by coordinating with assigned Sales management representatives to deliver timely responses to requests for support or add-on business;
  • Ensure quality of product and services delivery by developing and continually improving policies and procedures and maintaining project documentation in accordance with ISO guidelines;
  • Deliver projects on time and within defined scope and budget;
  • Coordinate responsibilities with other functional areas within other Collins Business Units and regions to insure synergy between the different operations team;
  • Participate in bid reviews and provide subject matter advice on bid or no-bid decisions for identified opportunities;
  • Organize and lead Project Status Review meetings and cost analysis with all stakeholders;
  • Accurate management of project planning and Estimated At Completion (EACs) vigilance over expenditure invoicing and revenue recognition forecasts to meet/exceed the Annual Operating Plan goals of the business;
  • Ensure client engagements and obligations are fulfilled and delivered in a manner which meets/exceeds customer expectations;
  • Serve as escalation point for project delivery issues and operational support to the customer and/or internal stakeholders and address issues in a timely manner and/or escalate internally to ensure resolution;
  • Regular review of work processes systems and human resources to improve any inefficiencies and streamline business operations while ensuring consistency of procedures across all regions;
  • Assisting with the negotiation of terms and conditions for customer and sub-contractor contracts;
  • Contribute to sales/marketing effort by being alert to new business opportunities and assisting with related proposals customer-facing presentations and other support of the sales process;
  • Administrative and personnel management duties for a team of direct reports;
  • Up to 70% business travel.

Qualifications

Technical/Professional:
  • BS/BA degree in a Project Management discipline or equivalent.
  • Proven experience as a People Leader/Project Leader/Program Manager with a minimum of 15 years relevant work experience in an Airline/Airport environment
  • Advanced Microsoft Project and MS Office skills (Excel Word PowerPoint etc.)
  • Experience in an operational environment
  • Experience in Financial Management
  • Adaptable to work in an ever-changing and demanding operational environment including coordination with the overall global team
  • PMP or Prince2 qualification preferred
  • Proven track record of successful project delivery

People Management
  • Possess demonstrated leadership of functional and project teams
  • Ability to meet cost schedule budget and operational goals
  • Excellent customer-oriented attitude
  • Strong organizational communication (written and verbal) and administrative skills
  • Strong interpersonal skills

Location:
  • Singapore

Sales Operations & Strategy Senior Associate APAC Sales Development  

LinkedIn was built to help professionals achieve more in their careers and every day millions of people use our products to make connections discover opportunities and gain insights. As an Area Manager you will have the opportunity to lead and develop your own team of Amazon Associates; one of your main focuses will be motivating mentoring and coaching your team. You will be responsible for engaging your team during a shift to maintain the highest levels of safety quality attendance performance and engagement are maintained. To achieve this managers are expected to provide their associates with the tools needed for success as well as keenly drive productivity and efficiency through data-driven decisions and analytical problem-solving. This role is located in Singapore.

Key Responsibilities
  • Supporting all safety programs and compliance to ensure a safe work environment for all Associates
  • Developing performance goals and objectives to achieve customer promise expectations and ensure accuracy and quality
  • Partnering with the management team to establish and maintain quality control standards
  • Proactively identifying and leading process improvement initiatives and Lean tools
  • Building and executing productivity plans by reviewing work forecasts determining productivity requirements and partnering with other Area Managers to balance labor
  • Leading and developing a team of Amazon associates
  • Communicating policies to associates and act as the primary information source for the team maintaining compliance and consistency and taking corrective action when needed
  • Ensuring procedures are followed for building security and product loss prevention
  • Creating managing and supporting recognition and communication programs

Amazon is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer - Minority / Age / Female / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation / Age

  • You are leader and exhibit that in you every day work. You not only have experience in managing a team of 30+ employees you also lead process improvements though Lean process Kaizen and Six Sigma.

  • You see value in long term thinking and large scale impact to a company. You have interest in developing a long-term career through assignments in multiple operational buildings across the nation.

About Supernova

We are the fastest growing lifestyle & beauty omni-channel ecommerce company. We build iconic beauty and lifestyle brands for a new generation of women worldwide. Independently owned with a global marketing reach we connect with over 15 million women on social media every week. Headquartered in Singapore we currently have offices in Melbourne London LA and New Delhi. Our brands include Sand & Sky and Coco & Eve.

About Supernova’s Internal Engine

Together we create Superstars! Our three company pillars are guided by this motto: Our product and brands are of the highest quality and within the top five in their category; our customers are the focus of our actions and their lives improve with our products; our talent and employees grow and develop within Supernova.

This means that investing in hiring developing and retaining the brightest minds in the world is a top priority. Living our core values of #MakeAnImpact #TalkAboutIt #SeekNewOpportunities #DelightAndSurprise and #MoveForwardTogether creates a unique culture across five different time zones and allows us to realise the enormous potential of this exciting industry. If you’re an ambitious smart natural collaborator who likes taking risks influencing and innovating in a challenging hyper-growth environment we’d love to talk to you about joining our team.

Located out of Singapore this role provides tremendous opportunity for the right candidate: to capture the energy and rapid pace of a fast growing start up while being responsible for a sizeable and growing part of our global footprint.

About The Job

The Demand Planner at Supernova is an integral part of a cross-functional Operations team charged with enabling Supernova’s growth objectives by planning and managing inventory across multiple sales channels and warehouses within the business. This role will work closely with multiple departments including purchasing sales and logistics There will also be daily involvement with our Fulfilment team to understand inventory fluctuations and movements. The ideal candidate will have a complete obsession for quality continuous improvements and customer satisfaction. You thirst for a fast paced entrepreneurial environment and maintain high energy levels in a constantly changing environment as you share our core values.

Responsibilities
  • Extreme ownership of inventory planning and maintaining stock levels across all sales channels in all countries
  • Analysis of inventory inbound outbound and forecasts to propose recommended purchase quantities and required freight modes based on lead times.
  • Monitor inventory levels across all Supernova products and communicate to the business on re-stock and potential OOS dates
  • Coordinate on inventory requirements for marketing campaigns
  • Coordinate the launch of new SKUs with relevant partners
  • Work closely on monthly S&OP forecasting process across all channels
  • Review sales forecasts and plan finished product purchases and inventory transfers accordingly
  • Work closely with production to ensure supply is timely
  • Monitor the status of all live shipments closely in alignment with inventory planning requirements and following up and escalating issues when necessary
  • Monitor the ageing of inventory and low volume / slow moving products
  • Create inventory and shipment reports
  • Raise POs and interco transactions

Key Relationships
  • Brand Directors
  • Demand Planning Manager
  • Head of Supply Chain
  • Head of Logistics
  • Fulfilment
  • Production
  • Product Development
  • Global Operations Director


Requirements
  • Bachelor’s degree or ability to demonstrate equivalent
  • 1-3 years proven experience with e-commerce supply chain inventory and freight management
  • An analytical mind - with strong experience in excel / google sheets.
  • Experience in a fast-growing startup is a plus
  • These characteristics describe you: independent yet a team player punctual reliable upbeat organized and a strong communicator “can do” attitude – no job is too big or too small
  • Proactive with a strong attention to detail
  • Excellent organization project management skills and time management skills with the ability to multitask and prioritize work
  • Positive attitude – always willing to go the extra mile


In Return You Will Get
  • Flat hierarchy and co-operative working atmosphere
  • Freedom to execute own ideas
  • Competitive package
  • Flexible Spending Account
  • Health Insurance program

This position is available immediately. All applications will be treated confidentially.

Please note that we can only contact successful applicants.

Supernova is an equal opportunity employer. Our values define the working culture and environment we strive to create – fair diverse respectful and welcoming of different views. We promote harmonious working relationships and encourage a learning and development culture. We welcome applications from talented people coming from all cultures countries races genders sexual orientations disabilities beliefs and generations and are committed to providing a working environment free from harassment discrimination and retaliation.

Purpose & Overall Relevance For The Organization
  • Drive Long and short-term strategic planning for country Operations (ops) team in supporting the local business growth
  • Directing and controlling all aspect of warehouse operations and logistics distribution function
  • Provide guidance to country Ops team and proactively develop lead and implement continuous process improvement (CPI)
  • Oversee the availability of goods in both inbound and outbound process to meet the business timeline in the most process efficient and cost effective manner


Key Responsibilities
  • Implement short & long term Operations strategy. Lead operations processes including budgeting and forecasting activity. Deliver enhanced services with process and cost efficiency.
  • Plan and improve inbound & outbound product flow to meet business requirements
  • Support Distribution long / short term capacity planning
  • Improve overall inventory management (inventory profile visibility and tracking of inventory availability at different points in the pipeline)
  • Drive and implement World Class Supply Chain models
  • Support country Continuous process improvement of inbound & outbound processes to achieve the best Practice and standardization
  • Perform Supply Chain Management (SCM) budgeting set targets and achieve supply chain productivity KPI including SCM cost as well as productivity KPI monitoring
  • Drive operation related projects and manage contract negotiation and extension
  • Perform any other roles or duties assigned by the superior which is deemed reasonable practical and logical
  • Keep abreast of new development in total supply chain and operational areas inside and outside the sporting goods industry and make recommendations to Management Team & Area SEA Management Team for future capacity and capability enhancement.


Key Relationships
  • Country SCM Teams
  • Customs authority
  • Government authority
  • Forwarder
  • 3PL
  • Transporter


Knowledge Skills And Abilities
  • Strong understanding in SCM – logistic planning distribution center management as well as warehous operations w/ experience in SAP/WMS/eCom system
  • Solid hands-on experience on managing operational performance (provide KPI framework) continuous process improvement & project implementation
  • A strong communicator; able to build a collaborative working relationship with all stakeholders and influence them
  • Fluent in English – excellent written and verbal communication skills


Requisite Education And Experience / Minimum Qualifications
  • Bachelor’s degree; at least 8 years of relevant working experience in FMCG/ Retail/ Sporting goods industry

Position Summary

To manage in a matrix relationship the team supporting customer order execution within the BioProduction Division (BPD) across multiple Asia Pacific country locations (APAC) and intercompany transactions supporting a highly responsive customization process and delivering a superior customer experience. Optimize processes and systems to manage the business and improve productivity and customer service levels. Build strong client relationships and create client loyalty through well-managed experiences with customer support team members and processes. Manage daily weekly monthly and quarterly reporting including but not limited to sales pipeline reporting open sales order reporting backorder reporting sales revenue reporting and order entry metrics.

Responsibilities Include

Leading and Developing Teams
  • Manages by matrix relationship global cross functional teams in management of bioproduction custom and catalog orders.
  • Leads by example and sets standards for professional behavior.
  • Ensures that the customer support team provides timely delivery of custom and catalog products for all customers.
  • Promotes professional development and builds team’s capability
  • Creates an inspiring team environment with an open communication culture
  • Empowers employees to get involved with continuous improvement initiatives
Delivering Strategic Analytical Support
  • Defines clear metrics for success monitor performance against those metrics and report out with root cause and corrective actions (metrics KPI’s RCCA etc.)
  • Manages CAS analytics and implement customer experience improvements based on feedback.
  • Provide analytical support for daily weekly monthly and quarterly sales reporting reports Bioproduction custom/catalog finished goods inventory levels and open sales order status
  • Assembles analyzes and reports metrics around service quality and communication levels.
Driving the Superior Customer Experience
  • Introduces new and innovative ways to improve the customer experience and win market share.
  • Drives client satisfaction and improve internal custom processes and systems to increase productivity without jeopardizing service levels.
  • Manages of all aspects of order execution in global customer support team process and start to finish of Inquiry to set up.
  • Supports proposed pricing models based on margins growth projections and cross product line sales
  • Supports commercial team in acceptable pricing strategies
  • Collaborates cross functionally to ensure custom product obsolete and excess policies and procedures are followed.
  • Drives local response and manages escalated customer questions/complaints as well as cover for the team as needed.
  • Participates in weekly/monthly/quarterly status update meetings with the BPD commercial team.
  • Manages development of customer presentations for business review including key customer data metrics.
  • Aligns with the commercial team and present business reviews to customers.

Required Qualifications
  • Passion to drive customer success and focus on creating value for the customer
  • Excellent analytical organizational and communication skills.
  • Exceptional project management abilities independent problem-solving skills attention to detail flexibility and ability to collaborate with others and to work in a fast-pace environment. Continuous improvement mind-set with ability to influence others and lead change
  • Must have proven leadership experience in customer relations and problem-solving customer issues.
  • Ability to work effectively across multiple facilities and reporting lines.
  • Demonstrated role model leadership capability
  • BS/BA degree in an analytical field (operations management engineering sciences business finance).
  • Proven WebEx and MS Office experience in Outlook Windows Excel PowerPoint Teams and Word.
  • Proven experience with Oracle or other ERP system.
  • Demonstrated experience developing and leading cross-functional teams (4+ years)
  • Fluent in written and spoken English and another Asian language to be able to effectively communicate with across the region
  • Ability to travel up to 25%.

Desired Qualifications
  • 6+ years of experience with customer experience management
  • Experience with Salesforce.com CRM system.
  • MBA or Masters Degree in analytical field (operations management engineering sciences business finance).
  • Project Management or Six Sigma certification

Do you have the business savvy and problem-solving skills necessary to thrive in a start-up environment? Are you looking to hit the ground running and have an immediate impact in a highly visible role?

As our Customer Experience Specialist you will work with the team to ensure customers are satisfied with their experience with us during the before and after-sales process. You and the sales team will spearhead our efforts to position Castlery as a major player in the regional design landscape.

Core Responsibilities
  • Service customers seeking assistance with post-order issues such as returns replacements refunds delivery status and back order inquiries problem resolution and any other issues that may arise from the order fulfillment process.

  • Uphold high customer service standards.

Requirements

  • At least 2 Year(s) of working experience in the related field is required for this position.
  • A successful track record working in a high-volume environment.
  • Able to solve problems by thinking analytically and creatively.
  • Familiar with the latest e-commerce trends.
  • Regular and reliable attendance is an essential function of this position.
  • High flexibility during Castlery’s busiest periods
  • Ability to empathize with and prioritize customer needs
  • Exude patience and ownership with each customer

Job Title: Campaign Operations Specialist - 6 month renewable contract

In this role the successful contractor will own the operational excellence including execution stakeholder management and success of Training and Certification(T&C) Mass Scale Event (MSE) Campaign throughout APJ. Job Description & Summary

PwC Consulting is a regional practice within South East Asia which helps organizations work smarter and grow faster. We are looking for self-driven individuals who will have an opportunity to join us for a rewarding career in client service upon graduation.

The Management Consulting team assists clients in strategizing designing and implementing key functional and operational initiatives. These include the assessment transformation or optimisation of Finance functions across the areas of process people and systems. Our services include defining target operating models (including organisation structure and IT architecture for Finance) process optimisation change management and project management.

Responsibilities

You will be delivering complex solutions which can include but are not limited to:
  • Finance function business analysis and business processes review redesign and optimisation
  • Transformational change across the organisation (solution implementation technology / digital integration cost optimisation)
  • Establishment of Shared Services Centre and outsourcing function
  • Enabling technology / digital implementations like RPA and FinTech related solutions
  • Work closely with the engagement team manager and client representative to deliver the projects
  • Act as the daily contact point for the clients

Requirements
  • Good understanding of key Financial Services operations trends and FinTech (including but not limited to BlockChain RPA Machine Learning IOT)
  • Strong analytical interpersonal written and verbal skills
  • A proven ability to translate client objectives into deliverable design and develop deliverables that address complex situations
  • Knowledge of the key strategic business drivers regulatory constraints and finance processes
  • The ability to define a strategy develop business cases and define the target operating model (organisation design processes governance)
  • Strong MS Office skills: MS PowerPoint MS Excel MS Project MS Visio
  • Strong presentation skills and group facilitation
  • Demonstrated management skills including the ability to train and develop staff manage project budgets and develop strong client relationships
  • It will be an added advantage if you have basic competency in the following:
  • Experience in operations excellence roles such as digital process optimisation
  • Internship experience working in Big 4 Consulting firms and/or Financial Services firms (Retail Banks Corporate / Institutional Banks Insurance Asset Management Capital Markets)
  • Knowledge in Finance Function and Project Management office
  • Prior project management experience

Are you looking to make a difference in a patient’s life?  At AmerisourceBergen you will find an innovative culture that is patient focused and dedicated to making a difference.  As an organization we are united in our responsibility to create healthier futures.


What you will be doing

POSITION SUMMARY:

The incumbent is responsible for managing both the Customer Service and Operations departments overseeing operational activities of each team relating to import export and domestic operations of World Courier Singapore and controlling offices. To plan and ensure operational quality services are provided. And to provide information and advice on operational and customer service matters to relevant business unit to enhance the effectiveness of the organization. He/she will represent World Courier on all internal meetings and on Customers call/meeting as required as subject matter expert for Customer Service and Operations.

PRIMARY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Ensure productivity of teams is maintained and constantly look for areas of improvement to drive efficiently in each department.
  • Structure resource properly and develop his/her teams to adhere to company standards at all times
  • Proactively and consistently monitor activities across teams to  shipping and delivery requirements are being met.
  • Develop and maintain an ethos of continuous improvement
  • To assist Business Development in Project management and implementation
  • Support Sales functions by attending meetings with clients and providing operational information as required.
  • Hold daily/weekly/monthly meeting and reporting of the same as required
  • Ongoing intervention and negotiation with airlines endorsed agents to ensure optimal service. 
  • To develop and to maintain SLA with suppliers contractors and agents (operations).
  • Monitor and review staff Key Performance Indicators (“KPIs”).
  • Conduct performance appraisals for all direct reports.
  • Manager poor performance by training supervising feedback and coaching.
  • Ensure cross training and periodic role-rotation of staff.
  • To develop implement and update SOP.
  • Maintain awareness of all temperature controlled and special shipments.
  • Oversee and ensure the smooth passage of shipments through customs and quarantine.
  • Mentor and develop the operations team to ensure that employees are motivated and have the skills to achieve their potential.       

SECONDARY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

 

  • Prepare and issue detailed and accurate monthly reports to Country Manager/Director on Operations issues and development updates.
  • Support Sales functions by attending meetings with clients and providing operational information as required.
  • Carry out special projects as directed by Country Manager/Director.
  • Provide supplementary telephone support to operational staff when needed.



  • Any
    other assessments


     

 


What your background should look like (minimum qualifications)

  • Bachelor degree in related field  with 5 - 10 years proven experience in Operational management
  • Good communication and influencing skills

  • Commercial and Customer focus.

  • Ability to manage and develop relationships and to negotiate at levels of management.

  • Good understanding of Supply Chain Management including logistics practices JIT inventory control systems ordering systems information technology etc.

  • Strong English (written and spoken) comprehension and communication is essential.

Country Manager

From our beginnings 50 years ago couriering time sensitive high importance documents to today’s cutting edge logistics solutions for Cell & Gene Therapies that save lives we now have over 3000 employees at 140 offices in more than 50 countries worldwide and are part of Fortune 10 corporation AmerisourceBergen.

ROLE DESCRIPTION 

Homage is looking for an Expansion Lead strongly aligned with its mission to transform the way people access and get personal care. You will drive our international expansion plans with the goal of  successfully launching Homage in multiple new markets and very importantly set them up for scale. This role reports to the Head of Expansion. You will be responsible for recruiting motivating & coaching Expansion Associates in HQ and the initial launch team in each new market. 


RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Launch Homage in multiple new markets and set them up for scale.
  • Define GTM strategy: Research and develop a deep understanding of the differentiated value proposition of Homage’s services in the context of potential markets including addressable size readiness and competitiveness landscape.
  • Manage operations: Drive day-to-day execution to successfully launch and grow in new markets. This involves being hands-on with end-to-end care delivery including recruitment of Care Professionals qualifying assignments and upholding perfect fulfilment rates and care quality.
  • Business alignment: Independently articulate and champion the state of play of the markets we expand into. Define market-level OKRs and seek support and alignment from leadership and operational teams. 
  • Cross-functional coordination: Coordinate across Operations Product and Marketing among various other teams to scope prioritize and roll out playbooks for every phase of a market’s growth
  • Build and set local teams up for success: Attract and motivate local team members across Operations Sales & Marketing to execute against key business and tactical goals. Ensure that teams have the direction tools and knowledge they require to be successful and has a shared understanding across our offices
  • Flawless execution towards market growth: Responsible for growth targets aligned with HQ. Intrinsically understand the growth and cost drivers and execute against them. Be the local pacemaker and maintain regular cadence of reporting. Make impact-driven decisions to optimise towards growth targets and operational efficiency
  • Inspire with the Homage mission: Represent the brand and mission of Homage internally with local team members and externally with PR and events
  • Hiring of country leadership: Assess maturity of markets and drive recruitment of country leadership at the right stage of time in close collaboration with business leadership.


 SKILLS & EXPERIENCE

  • Minimum of 2-5 years relevant work experience in strategy operations and/or growth with 1-2 years of managerial experience.
  • Proven track record of excelling in a rapidly growing global organization.
  • Entrepreneurial: Proven ability to build from scratch. Ability and desire to operate resourcefully independently and with urgency. 
  • Impact-driven and persistent: Motivated by moving the needle meaningfully especially during times when it requires persistence and courage.
  • Analytical: Ability to closely examine and identify relevant information and earn the respect of both leaders and operational teams by translating insights into clear sizable operational plans.
  • Operational excellence: You have a keen eye for detail and an exceptionally high bar for accuracy and quality. Similarly you hold your team to that level of standards.
  • Strong opinions loosely held: Ability to articulate POV with clarity humility and a willingness to question one’s own assumptions / desire to constantly improve. 
  • People leadership: Ability to lead with influence and build strong productive relationships with various working styles and characteristics.
  • Integrity and trustworthiness
  • Excellent written and verbal skills in English
  • A passion for caregiving while leading with empathy is a plus
  • Experience and understanding of the healthcare industry is a major plus


About Homage

Homage is a care platform that combines qualified and trained caregivers nurses doctors and health care organisations and funders with technology enabling care wellness and recovery wherever you are. The work that we do and technology we build transforms lives every hour every day. We’re looking for people who are talented driven and motivated by our social mission.

Pandemic Response Operations Manager oversees the Pandemic Response Operations as part of the safe blood collection effort during COVID-19 period. He/she develop and implement pandemic response plans train and manage a team that consist of pre-screeners and Pandemic Response Operations Executive that support the blood collection sites enforce safe distancing in blood collection sites (include preparing suitable notices and posters) assist in crowd control during centre booking and peak periods prepare reports for regular updates to Blood Services Group management procurement of stores and equipment related its operations attend to public enquiries and feedback and represent Blood Resources in Safe Management Meetings and discussions.

Job Responsibilities
  • Monitor COVID-19 situation and ensure Blood Resources pandemic responses plans are up to date with the latest guidelines from Public Service Division (PSD) Ministry of Manpower (MOM) and Ministry of Health (MOH).
  • Work closely with various stakeholders to review and finetune plans.
  • Communicate plans to Blood Resources and Singapore Red Cross colleagues which also includes the pre-screeners.
  • Assist clinical team to update and distribute pre-screening questionnaire forms.
  • Conduct briefings to update management and Blood Resources colleagues
  • Attend to public enquiries and feedback relating to its operations
  • Monitor and provide feedback and guidance to improve performance.
  • Train pre-screeners to ensure that they can effectively support the blood collection sites.
  • Ensure all communications related to its operations are share with the team members and are documented.
  • Prepare and distribute suitable notices and posters relating to safe distancing to blood collection sites.
  • Supervise pre-screeners to do crowd control during centre bookings and peak hours using crowd control forms.
  • Enforce safe distancing practise in blood collection sites.
  • Check staff temperature taking records and highlight to staff supervisor for follow up if required.
  • Co-ordinate and work closely with Chief Safe Management Officer (CSMO-BSG) and all Safe Management Officers (SMO) from BR. May take on the role of SMO when needed.
  • Attend Safe Management Meetings and discussions
  • Prepare reports and provide updates to management
  • Support Blood Resources in investigation related to its operations
  • Procurement and ordering of stores and equipment related its operations
  • Manage and track usage of PPE
  • Involved in projects relating to improve the efficiency of its operations e.g. automate checking of temperature log etc.
  • Follow up diligently on tasks assigned by Head (Information and Support).


Requirements
  • At least 3 years of working experiences in the related fields
  • Good leadership skills and able to supervise staff effectively
  • Good organization and coordination skills
  • Able to exercise initiative manage pressure and multi-task in a fast-paced environment with minimal supervision.
  • Meticulous driven passionate and service-minded.

Microsoft’s HIT team enables and protects e-Commerce capabilities for all of Microsoft’s consumer and business online services such as Microsoft Store XBOX
Office 365 Azure and Bing. As Microsoft’s Human Intelligence team rapidly grows you have an opportunity to work on products that impact everyone on the planet.

We are an energetic fast paced and exciting team. We analyse optimize and implement operational models for a diverse range of problems for customers’ online experience ranging from customer purchase conversion to fraud anomaly detection and chargeback selection management.

The primary role of the Fraud Operations Analyst is to protect our clients and our company from ecommerce fraud. Core activities include evaluating global events analyzing fraud patterns vetting consumer and commercial customers assisting clients training teammates and all other tasks where HIT can add value for Microsoft.

In this role it is imperative the person demonstrates the ability to perform these duties in a scientific and analytical way for timeliness accuracy and scalability supported by a strong commitment to provide best-in-class deliverables.

The Fraud Operations Analyst will also contribute to the strategic development of the broader team through her or his insights and ad hoc investigations.

This role requires rotating shifts with weekend and public holiday work.

Responsibilities
  • Handling sensitive customer data while adhering to strict security and privacy rules
  • Identifying analysing fraudulent patterns and using platform tools to make accept/reject decisions on consumer and commercial transactions
  • Adhering to platform KPIs related to accuracy decision time and productivity
  • Using platform tools to prevent subsequent bad behaviour
  • Understanding complex Risk workflows in an ecommerce transaction system
  • Using advanced statistical methods to unravel deep insights from substantial amounts of transaction and usage data
  • Developing documentation coordinating and implementing guidelines training and helping colleagues with new tools onboarding
  • Proposing preventative measures process enhancements and improved tool functionality
  • Raising team awareness on process changes quality improvement fraud trends and other matters of concern with clear communication
  • Actively working with business owners and engineering teams to deploy new features and predictive models into production
  • Providing root cause analysis and participate in meetings with senior team members from other operational divisions as well as engineering and data science
    teams
  • Working with Customer Support to resolve escalations and implement elements of the escalation program strategy

Behaviour and characteristics
  • Must have the highest regard for the privacy and security of the data our customers have entrusted to us and the promises Microsoft has made to them
  • Ability to comfortably perform recurring tasks
  • Exceptional team player with strong communication and interpersonal skills
  • Adept at working with multiple stakeholders to drive desired outcomes
  • Meticulous with an eye for detail and analytical mindset
  • Must be resilient to stress and versatile enough to transition between competing tasks and priorities with high frequency
  • Insatiable curiosity to find the truth with a desire to proactively uncover new fraud patterns
  • Willingness to raise awareness of patterns including presentations
  • Obsession with making things right for customers

Job Title: Key Leader | Singapore Takashimaya Ngee Ann City
Job Description:
Description & Requirements

lululemon athletica is seeking a highly capable leader who is passionate about developing others and connecting with the community as a Key Leader on our team. The key objective of this position is to lead our retail floor and maintain amazing guest experience in stores.

What You Will Do

The role will combine the life-altering potential of wearing stretchy pants to work every day while talking health fitness and yoga to your guests and community. The key leader plays a key role in ensuring an exceptional level of education on the retail floor by training coaching and developing a team of Educators that delivers the lululemon guest experience. Key leaders build capabilities within the store team to drive strategy and achieve results for the business today and tomorrow. Under the supervision of the Store Manager and Assistant Store Manager the position supports in day-to-day leadership and key areas of store operations. Our Key Leader emanates the lululemon culture is a lover of fitness and sweaty endeavors and is committed to creating amazing experiences for those around them.

The life of our Key Leader

  • Represents her/his store at all required meetings events and conferences under the direction of the Store Manager and Assistant Store Manager
  • Acts as a coach to Educators and plays a hands-on roll in their development
What are the technical skills necessary to perform this role?
  • Minimum one year’s work experience in retail / sales leadership or an equivalent role
  • Bachelor’s degree in business marketing retail or related field (preferred)
  • Working knowledge of MS Office (Word Excel and Outlook)
  • Detail oriented and highly organized with strong time management skills

  • Love of brainstorming problem-solving being creative and resourceful
  • Positive attitude and contagious enthusiasm for lululemon community and people
  • Passion knowledge and involvement in yoga and/or athletics
  • Strong sense of personal style and athletically minded
  • Excellent decision making and problem resolution skills
  • Entrepreneurial proactive and solution-oriented
To Apply For This Position

If you are seeking a position in a company which fosters and supports health and fitness personal development growth change responsibility and overall success please submit your resume and cover letter directly to this posting.

Job Title: Operations| CIMD Operations| PWM Ops - PWM Ops Trade & Trx Mgmt| Analyst| Singapore
Job Description:
OUR IMPACT

Operations is a dynamic multi-faceted division that partners with all areas of the firm to deliver banking sales and trading and asset management capabilities to clients around the globe. Alongside this integral service delivery role Operations provides essential risk management and control preserving and enhancing the firm’s assets and its reputation. Behind every trade executed every new product launched every market entered and every transaction completed is an Operations team that develops the foundational processes and controls that make our business flow.

PWM Margin Lending sits within the Consumer Investment Management Division (CIMD) and manages PWM clients’ margin relationships for the firm. The team’s primary responsibility is to monitor clients’ margin loans and ensure there is sufficient collateral within the portfolio to collateralize their margin debit. The team also owns and manages a variety of processes that focus on mitigating risks and creating commercial impact including leading key enhancement initiatives to further automate manual processes and build offerings that will drive increased revenue for the division.

YOUR IMPACT

Our PWM Margin Lending team is seeking a professional who is looking to create impact by analyzing our client margin portfolios and issuing calls across a variety of PWM client accounts. In addition we are looking for a strong performer who can leverage existing technical skills to grow and develop a robust understanding of complex margin methodologies and workflows to further enhance our existing infrastructure.

Responsibilities And Qualifications

The PWM Margin Lending team supports a broad array of margin functions within the PWM business. The team is responsible for monitoring that clients remain within exposure limits and ensuring that actions are taken to bring the client’s account back within their limit (i.e. issuance of margin calls monitoring of client activity to meet any issued margin calls general impact of client trading activity etc). The primary job responsibility is validating and ensuring all margin calls are issued on a timely basis and working closely with Business Partners to ensure all calls are met in a timely manner. There are also regulatory reporting obligations that are performed by the team daily across businesses. The team also manages several manual processes that provide client’s bespoke margin treatment on structured products guarantee/guarantor set-ups and override coding approved by GCF/Risk/Credit.

Basic Qualifications
  • 2 - 3 years of professional experience (financial markets) preferably across equities fixed income and OTC derivative products.
  • Proven ability to effectively manage competing priorities and to work well under pressure in a team environment High level of discretion and awareness of accountability
  • Analytical skills and interest in developing problem-solving capabilities
  • Work experience in financial services also required
Preferred Qualifications

Positive attitude and eagerness to learn

About Goldman Sachs

At Goldman Sachs we commit our people capital and ideas to help our clients shareholders and the communities we serve to grow. Founded in 1869 we are a leading global investment banking securities and investment management firm. Headquartered in New York we maintain offices around the world.

We believe who you are makes you better at what you do. We're committed to fostering and advancing diversity and inclusion in our own workplace and beyond by ensuring every individual within our firm has a number of opportunities to grow professionally and personally from our training and development opportunities and firmwide networks to benefits wellness and personal finance offerings and mindfulness programs. Learn more about our culture benefits and people at GS.com/careers.

We’re committed to finding reasonable accommodations for candidates with special needs or disabilities during our recruiting process. Learn more https//www.goldmansachs.com/careers/footer/disability-statement.html

© The Goldman Sachs Group Inc. 2020. All rights reserved.
Goldman Sachs is an equal employment/affirmative action employer Female/Minority/Disability/Veteran/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity

This role provides you with the opportunity to be part of a dynamic team that delivers Enterprise Data Warehouse Operational Data Store (ODS) and Business Intelligence capabilities for Singtel Group IT.

 

 

What We Offer

You will have a chance to work with the latest technologies in EDW ODS and BI areas.

 

About The Role

The Operations Manager is accountable for the day to day operations application support and maintenance capacity management data availability and data integrity performance and stability of Enterprise Reporting Business Intelligence Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW) and Operational Data Store (ODS).

 

The incumbent will work closely with the internal teams and managing vendors' SLA and performance supporting the applications running on various technology platforms ensuring system health and availability.

 

 

Responsibilities

 

  • Track and monitor vendor performance in root cause analysis and problem rectification including system changes required to prevent a recurrence of the incident
  • Track and monitor vendor performance against specified service level on incident resolution and system restoration
  • Monitor and drive closure of incident tickets
  • Coordinate and support in major incidents including proper resolution closure and post incident review
  • Produce regular report for effective Incident management and resolution
  • Manage and handle user escalation
  • Monitor the effectiveness of the operation support processes and make recommendations on how to improve the process
  • Ensure that operation support procedures are documented accurately and regularly updated
  • Define review and improve standards and guidelines for change management and release management process
  • Review projects and change requests to ensure quality solutions are delivered/tested before deploying into production environment to ensure that systems remain operationally optimal and relevant to business.
  • Work closely with the vendor for proactive maintenance activities and ensure the vendor conducts and monitors the maintenance activities.
  • Identify triggers of change in Business volumes and usage pattern and ensure the corresponding capacity is actioned by the vendor.
  • Provide business requirements for appropriate backup and disaster recovery processes to ensure business continuity
  • Manage service providers to perform according to contracted service scope and requirements
  • Identify tools and ensure automation are implemented for the relevant processes
  • Plan and manage annual budget for operating expenses (OPEX) for application maintenance and license (or subscription) management
  • Cost controlling and report monthly operating expenses
  • Manage contracts agreements and other service providers-related issues
  • Build maintain and improve relationship with business leaders Group IT domains (departments) and IT service providers to deliver value via data
  • Conduct periodic audit on service quality management on application maintenance services
  • Drive Group IT initiatives to the team
  • Work with the IT teams and business users to maintain the Service Level Agreement

 

 

 

The ideal candidate should possess

 

  • Bachelor’s degree in Business Management IT Computer Science Computer Engineering or equivalent.
  • At least 8 years of experience in the area of data warehouse BI & reporting and / or data management
  • At least 5 years of experience in vendor management
  • Hands-on experience in handling Incident Management Problem Management Service Level Management Configuration Management Capacity Management and Availability Management
  • Experience in managing and driving outsourced service providers to delivery and operations objectives
  • Experience in stakeholder management skills
  • Experience in procurement process and commercial negotiations with IT vendors
  • IT financial management and budgeting skills
  • Knowledge of BI technologies such as Cognos Tableau Power BI Informatica or DataStage
  • Knowledge of Data Warehouse such as Oracle Exadata or Teradata
  • Highly organized self-motivated pro-active and ability to manage time and resources
  • Ability to communicate clearly and effectively both verbally and in writing
  • Quality oriented with a commitment to continuous improvement
  • Understand business needs and able to relate technical incidents to business impact

Stripe’s mission is to increase the GDP of the internet. We build economic infrastructure for internet businesses of every size in pursuit of this mission. The Partnerships team is responsible for developing executing and managing partnerships that enable Stripe’s product and payments ecosystem. Today Stripe is live in 40 markets and the Partnerships team is situated across multiple global offices to support Stripe’s growth around the world.

The APAC Partnerships team creates and manages relationships with Stripe’s partners worldwide in order to launch new or optimize existing products for Stripe users. This team drives strategies with financial institutions that will scale and differentiate Stripe’s financial infrastructure.

We are looking for a Partner Manager that will deepen our most strategic relationships and execute on high-impact initiatives with one or more banking partners. These partnerships form the basis of Stripe’s product and as part of these efforts this person will build internal business cases and identify product requirements leading cross-functional teams and ensuring internal alignment. This will fit into a multi-year global strategic plan for Stripe with our banking partners upon which this person will be instrumental in developing and executing.

You Will;
  • Manage day to day partnerships and operations related to one or more regional or global partners.
  • Through developing relationships with important partner stakeholders you will independently identify growth opportunities for Stripe and enable cross-functional projects.
  • For these cross-functional projects you will often take a leadership role in driving the work cross-functionally and will secure the right level of support to execute partnerships initiatives.
  • Synthesize and interpret payments industry structures and trends to inform conversations with our users and drive toward better outcomes for Stripe. In addition you will help anticipate changes in partner strategies or policies that could impact our products or users financial outcomes or operations.


Basic Qualifications
  • At least 10 years of total work experience and at least 3+ years of partnerships experience working with financial institutions / banking partners.
  • A proven track record of working effectively in a product-centric environment with significant internal and external dependencies leading and driving cross-functional projects.
  • A proven track record of partnering with external stakeholders to successfully identify and execute on growth opportunities.
  • Ability to independently drive negotiations to completion and identity blockers and potential tradeoffs.


Preferred Qualifications
  • Strong critical thinking and problem solving skills with a scale mindset and focus on impact.
  • Sense of urgency to deliver impact for users or customers at scale and ability to transition between work streams based on given priorities.
  • Proactively seeks and provides feedback from immediate team and wide range of stakeholders across the company.
  • Having a mindset of contributing to the success of the team and overall company outside of individual goals and objectives.

Job Title: Digital Business Analyst - Data Management and Analytics
Job Description:
The Government Technology Agency (GovTech) aims to transform the delivery of Government digital services by taking an "outside-in" view putting citizens and businesses at the heart of everything we do. We also develop the Smart Nation infrastructure and applications and facilitate collaboration with citizens and businesses to co-develop technologies.

Join us as we support Singapore’s vision of building a Smart Nation - a nation of possibilities empowered through info-communications technology and related engineering.

We are looking for Business Analysts (Data Analytics) who's interested in using data to help the government design solutions that address its policy and business problems and stay close to the needs of the general public. The applicant will be responsible for demonstrating how better use of data can help recommend new policies streamline operations or bring more customised solutions for citizens. He/she should have some training and working experiences on data analytics and should be comfortable with hands-on data manipulation data modelling and data visualisation.

What To Expect
  • Provide data analytics consulting services to the government agencies including data analytics planning and strategy – perform data analytics visioning and road-mapping business case development implementation planning organisational planning budget and risk management planning
  • Work closely with stakeholders to understand their needs/pain points scope the problem and develop business case on how to turn data into critical information and knowledge that can be used for policy making streamlining operations or developing solutions for citizens.
  • Advise stakeholders on the key ICT trends and best practices in data analytics assess applicability for adoption and recommend solution that best fits stakeholders’ needs
  • Perform data cleaning pre-processing and feature engineering that facilitate meaningful analysis
  • Work closely with data scientists to mine insights from structured and unstructured data and to resolve complex statistical modelling problems to answer pertinent business questions.
  • Design dashboards and interactive visualization as tools for data exploration as well as for storytelling. Present analytics insights to business users and stakeholders
  • Work with stakeholders to ensure smooth deployment and adoption of new solution

How To Succeed
  • Degree/Master in any discipline; Diploma graduates with relevant experience will also be considered.
  • Minimum 3 years of relevant working experience
  • Ability to take a broad strategic perspective as well as drill deep to understand business needs and challenges
  • Understand key concepts techniques and considerations in Machine learning and Data analytics
  • Training and relevant experience in one or more of the following areas:
    • Statistical modelling tools such as: R Python RapidMiner Knime SAS Matlab or SPSS
    • Data manipulation using scripting languages like Python or using ETL tools
    • Visual analytics technologies like Tableau Qlikview or D3.js
    • End-to-end analytics architecture preferably with some working knowledge of big data stack
  • Excellent communication skills both oral and written with ability to pitch ideas and influence stakeholders
  • Strong analytical conceptualisation and problem solving skills
  • Team player with strong organization and people handling skills
  • Passion for the use of analytics and data to improve public service

Looking For Candidates With The Following Qualities
  • Relishes work challenges
  • Task oriented work style
  • Able to work independently
  • Good communicator
  • Likes working with people
  • Proactive committed and ability to work independently under tight schedule
  • Possess strong technical and problem solving skills
  • Past HR experience will be an advantage
  • Leadership experience is preferred
  • Familiarity with Microsoft office suites functions (Words Excel Power points etc) essential

Job Title: Consumer Bank Operations| 2021 Full Time Associate| Singapore
Job Description:
You’re ready to bring your knowledge from the classroom to the boardroom and Citi wants to help you get there. Whether it’s honing your skills or building your network we know that success can’t come without growth. Our programs equip you with the knowledge and training you need to play a valuable role on your team and establish a long-term career here. At Citi we value internal mobility and career growth is not a question of if but when. Citi’s Consumer Bank Operations group is looking for experienced Associates to work with the regional teams in Singapore as part of a two-year rotational program comprising of development-focused rotations continuous skills training dedicated mentorship and access to senior leaders. Consumer Bank Operations is the business behind Citi’s retail presence across the globe. It is committed to delivering quality products services and business solutions that align to the consumer requirement and Citi’s strategy. It provides world class consumer business process outsourcing services and banking related consulting for Citi’s business globally. Be it in the area of customer onboarding customer service portfolio risk management transaction services or credit operations it drives efficiency and productivity in the processes that will impact the customer experience.
Your time here will look something like this...
Here at Citi we will give you access to valuable intelligence decades of experience and a wealth of perspectives on the future of the financial industry. So whether you will be advising on million-dollar mergers scrutinizing banking practices or opening a child’s very first account you can make an impact and help make the right decisions at the right time. And it’s these decisions that help us all make progress - for our clients for every employee and for the business.

Skills

During the two-year program you will complete 3 rotations across Consumer Business and Operations to deepen your knowledge base and develop your forward compatible skills
  • You will be involved in strategic projects involving digitalization data analytics and process automation.
  • You will learn about consumer product and exposure to sales or client experience
  • You will play a key role in supporting our consumer clients through our Citiphone credit operations branch operations core operations or risk and controls
  • You will work in partnership with all teams from across the Bank help develop and manage products processes and services in ways that maximize profitability while minimizing risk
  • You will support Citi’s goal to Be the Best for Our Clients through the development of product expertise and processes that create consistent exceptional & client centric services.
We provide you with the knowledge and skills you need to succeed.
As a GCB Operations Associate you will benefit from Citi orientation program and business induction training which will provide a platform of knowledge and experience upon which you will build your career with Citi. You will also receive ongoing training and development opportunities including but not limited to business speaker series cross-team projects mentoring and coaching and dedicated program management support.
We want to hear from you if...
  • Master's or MBA candidates with 3-5 years of work experience prior to graduate school
  • Studying from a top academic institution working towards a minimum GPA of 3.3 or above or at least 2nd upper class honors equivalent.
  • You apply a continual focus on improving productivity and efficiency; while seeking new and innovative ways to support our clients changing needs
  • You bring a fresh perspective to actively drive change
  • You have effective written and oral communication skills and strong analytical skills
  • You have a strong record of achievement (academic and otherwise)
  • You have a passion for exquisite customer and client service
  • You have a flexible and hardworking approach with the ability to perform well in a dynamic fast paced environment.
Who We Think Will Be a Great Fit...

Extensive work experience is not a requirement; but dedication to learning and a true passion for the business are vital. As industries all over the globe continue to restructure and grow; we are hiring professionals who have a global perspective on the future of banking; and want to make an impact on the corporate level. We value diversity and so do you. We will also be looking for the following:
  • Commitment to personal growth and career development; a strong desire to learn and be successful in a team environment
  • Knowledge of the global or domestic business landscape (preferred; but not required)
  • Strong communication planning and organizational skills
  • Analytical and quantitative skills
  • Desire to develop a deep understanding of the financial industry
  • Unquestioned commitment to integrity and ethical decision

Neuron is the fastest growing micromobility operator in Asia Pacific and the leading shared e-scooter company across Australia and New Zealand. We partner with cities to connect people and places in a safe convenient and fun way. We are driven to help the world build a more prosperous and sustainable future through new ways of moving and connecting.


Neuron started the world’s first scooter sharing platform in Singapore in 2016. We develop our own industry-leading e-scooters which are purpose built for sharing and safety. We also set the industry standard for technology that manages them. Neuron has launched an impressive range of world firsts particularly when it comes to safety. We currently operate in six cities (Brisbane Adelaide Darwin Auckland Canberra and Townsville) in the ANZ market and have recently also launched in the UK (Slough). 



The Role   


You will be reporting to the Head of Data. You would have the opportunity to bridge the critical gap between Product City Operations and Users directly impacting strategic business decisions.


What you’ll do:


  • Partner with a cross-functional team (Engineering Design Product Customer Service) to ship major features and product improvements to grow the business. 
  • Discover growth opportunities in the product from funnel conversion rates and user experience by exploring transaction data customer activity within apps and actual customer insights
  • Drives the prioritization strategy and focus on solutions to solve user problems
  • Work with the local markets and other functional teams (Customer Service Operations Marketing) to help identify and understand key roadblocks and opportunities
  • Surface key insights for product improvement and advise the product team on the feasibility of the features in pipeline
  • Understand the competitive landscape in various markets of play and spearhead the ideas on product differentiation 

 

What you'll need:


  • Relevant 3-6 years of experience as a Data Analyst ideally exposure in two-sided marketplace e.g. ride hailing food delivery e-commerce is a plus
  • Experience working with product and engineering teams is preferred
  • Experience with these is a must:
  • Python SQL web crawler Tableau
  • Agility to excel in a constantly changing and rapidly growing workplace
  • Someone with a keen interest in driving growth across cities of operations 
  • A keen interest in shared mobility and a growth mindset is essential to this role



Our Values


Make It Happen - We are driven by results make commitments with integrity and consistently make an impact.


Be Proactive - We take ownership of tasks that help us build sustainable growth.


Trust Facts Over Opinions - Whenever possible we make the logical choice based on data and known truths.


Stay Curious - We embrace the habit of asking questions challenging assumptions and revisiting convictions.


Do More With Less - Profit allows us to continue serving our users. We must be efficient and resourceful.

 

If you are passionate about making a real-time impact and want the opportunity to play an instrumental part in our growth story we want you riding for our team!

 



*Neuron Mobility is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to making all employment decisions including recruitment appointment and promotion decisions on the basis of business needs individual qualifications and merit. 


The company prohibits discrimination and harassment of any kind. We are dedicated to the continued personal and professional growth of our employees. We protect all of our employees regardless of race nationality ethnicity politics sex sexual orientation gender identity social origin physical and mental disability religion or belief marital or domestic partnership status family or parental status and any other status recognised and protected by the law and regulations of where we operate.

It's an exciting time at Netflix as we continue to expand our business globally. We are revolutionizing the way people watch their favorite shows and movies and building our own library of original Netflix content for all to enjoy. Feel free to take a look at our Culture Memo to learn more about our unique Netflix culture as well as an overview of our long-term view.

The Contingent talent team is responsible for the strategy operations and guidance across the Temp-Worker Independent Contractor and Vendor space internationally. Our team makes it easy for Netflix managers to engage with the contingent workforce by providing training education and guidelines to minimize Netflix's risk. We offer data and insights on contingent worker planning hiring and strategy which enables our business partners to make informed decisions and engage the right contingent talent quickly through a great experience.

We are growing rapidly and looking for a Contingent Talent Program Manager to join our Talent organization in Singapore supporting the entire APAC region (Singapore Korea Japan India and emerging countries). You would partner closely with hiring managers supplier partners and contingent workers globally potentially working across time zones. As a member of the team (and single point of contact for the region) you will be owning program reporting including performance metrics ad-hoc requests and maintaining data integrity while utilizing various software systems and databases. Your responsibilities encompass understanding the contingent talent landscape providing strategic direction to hiring managers and embedding yourself in the Netflix culture. This is a hands-on manager level role without direct reports.

In this role you will manage by
  • Partnering closely with Hiring Managers staffing partners and contingent workers.
  • Owning and juggling multiple contingent requisitions and maintain high quality/maximum traction for Hiring Managers at all times.
  • Working closely with business leaders to influence sourcing approach strategy and determine appropriate classification of workforce needs.
  • Assisting hiring leaders with development and execution of Independent Contractor/Freelancer agreements.
  • Developing job descriptions hosts sync calls with agency partners screen resumes and drive selection of contingent personnel.
  • Ensuring that contingent workers understand and embrace our unique culture.
  • Assisting in new supplier vetting and supplier performance management.
  • Building relationships with program staffing partners by providing timely updates and feedback on their candidates.
  • Conducting contingent worker orientation on a weekly basis ensuring contingent workers have the resources they need to succeed.
  • Assisting managers with contingent worker issues feedback offboarding and assignment terminations.

You will also analyse by
  • Monitoring service level agreements with global supplier partners
  • Managing ongoing optimization of suppliers rates markups and utilization
  • Gatheriing data create reports analyze reports and be able to paint a story
  • Supporting global users with requests on contingent talent data & metrics

To be successful you are
  • Equal parts creative and analytical
  • Always actively seeking to understand the business and are energized when learning about challenging creative & technical problems
  • An expert on industry trends and can leverage data to influence
  • Dedicated and ambitious; takes initiative and follows-through
  • The first to roll up your sleeves when something needs to get done
  • Resilient in the face of change
  • Attentive to detail but able to step back and look at the big picture
  • Self-directed and autonomous yet able to collaborate effectively with a global team
  • Proactive you take initiative and you always follow through
  • Inclusive; you collaborate effectively with people of diverse backgrounds and cultures
  • Curious about Netflix’s and the initiatives of the various organizations globally
  • You thrive on offering creative solutions to challenging situations

Skills And Experience
  • 10+ years HR ATS VMS systems experience. Preferably Workday
  • You have prior staffing recruiting HR or client relationship management
  • You have intermediate experience with Google Suite (Gmail GCal Google Calendar etc) and recruiting systems. You’re also proficient in tools that help eliminate manual steps by automating and integrating to ensure greater operational efficiency.
  • Understanding of how to prioritize and respond accordingly
  • You are a good problem solver you know the right questions to ask to take on the situation at hand using the resources available to you
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • This position will require travel throughout the APAC region

About Us

Sembcorp Industries is a leading energy marine and urban development group operating across multiple markets worldwide. As an integrated energy player Sembcorp is poised to benefit from the global energy transition. With a strong track record in developing and developed markets we provide solutions across the energy and utilities value chain with a focus on the Gas & Power Renewables & Environment and Merchant & Retail sectors. We have a balanced energy portfolio of over 12400 megawatts including thermal power plants renewable wind and solar power assets as well as biomass and energy-from-waste facilities.


In addition Sembcorp is a world leader in offshore and marine engineering as well as an established brand name in urban development. Sembcorp Industries has total assets of over S$23 billion and over 7000 employees. Listed on the main board of the Singapore Exchange it is a component stock of the Straits Times Index several MSCI and FTSE indices as well as the SGX Sustainability Leaders Index and the Dow Jones Sustainability Asia Pacific Index.

Sembcorp Graduate Program 2020

7 Program Tracks 2 Years 1 Sembcorp experience

Depending on your chosen track you will participate in two to three functional rotations that will provide you both on-the-job learning as well as formal training opportunities. You will also be exposed to stimulating hands-on cross functional projects and expand your network within the organization.


Depending on your field of study and career aspiration you can choose to specialize in any one of the following tracks:


Digital & Technology

Through the program graduates will develop solid foundations in Infrastructure and Networking before deep diving into the Cyber Security function. Graduates will get an opportunity to hone their technical skills and potentially graduate from the program as a professional cyber threat detection and response analyst and work closely with global stakeholders.


Power

Jumpstart your engineering career through building a solid foundation in power plant operations and maintenance. Leveraging our best-in-class power solutions graduates will get a chance to learn about the complexity of energy generation and experience cutting edge technology that allows for greater efficiency and lower carbon emissions.


Water Innovations

Enter the exciting world of water innovation and advanced water technologies. Experience the full spectrum of water management solutions including integrated water supply wastewater treatment and water reclamation.


Environmental

As the leading solid waste management service provider in Singapore you will get a chance to learn how we utilize advanced technologies and customized solutions to treat and harness energy from a wide variety of waste streams. Graduates in this track will experience both operational and commercial aspects of our environmental business.


Group Sustainability & Corporate Communications (Filled & Closed)


Finance (Filled & Closed)


Human Resources (Filled & Closed)



Requirements:

  • Fresh graduates or graduates with less than 1 year of working experience
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving ability
  • Good communication and presentation ability
  • Personable with a positive attitude
  • Genuine sense of curiosity
  • Passionate about the energy industry
