Job Title: Assistant / Manager (PACT)| Office for Organisational Transformation (Contract)
Job Description:
Job Description

You will facilitate collaborations between various institutions and industry partners and be involved in the co-development of solutions under the Partnership for Capability Transformation (PACT) programme. You will be involved in project management including budgeting and coordination with external stakeholders on project funds and administration. You will collaborate with various stakeholders and assist with cluster-wide innovation projects. You will also contribute to the Health Technology Innovation through executing outreach events and networking sessions to engage all relevant internal and external stakeholders. In addition you will promote the culture of innovation within SingHealth by organising workshops events and forums. You will also provide support in the preparation of budgetary requirements for the PACT programme and assist with the department’s daily operations. 


Job Requirements

  • Bachelor’s degree in Biomedical Sciences Bio-Engineering Engineering Data Analytics or related fields
  • At least 6 years of working experience preferably in healthcare or innovation related industries
  • Knowledge in Medical Device Regulatory Standards ISO13485 healthcare technology Artificial Intelligence in Healthcare will be an advantage
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to communicate with all levels of staff
  • Proficient with Microsoft Office application (MS Word Excel and Powerpoint)


We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

Build the best people org at Stripe.

In People Operations you’ll use your eye for detail and tireless commitment to process improvement to work with teams across Stripe to implement programs that help all Stripes succeed. As our HR Operations Specialist you’ll be part of our People Team working on our internal HR systems and working closely with Payroll Legal and Stripe managers to make incoming and existing Stripes’ experiences seamless as they onboard transfer teams or relocate. You will also be utilizing our People systems and searching for ways to streamline/optimize how we work.

You Will
  • Provide HR support to the business answering employee and manager questions about HR programs policies and other HR-related topics.
  • Support the HR Business Partners as they build and drive People Programs globally.
  • Work with the HR Business Partner(s) to ensure that Stripes in the APAC region feel supported and have positive People experiences.
  • You’ll be an integral part of the People Partner team in APAC driving projects and initiatives across the region.
  • You will be an employee facing member of the People Partner team working closely with employees across the region.
  • Assist in the maintenance of Workday by auditing data entered during the employee lifecycle.
  • Run various regular and ad-hoc reports for HR Business Partners and for our cross functional teams - compensation benefits recruiting and leadership (including headcount reports demographic reports diversity reports etc.).
  • Assist other Stripes by responding to employment verifications and other people-related data requests.
  • Be a critical component of the roll out of People related programs that affect Stripes globally for example our compensation or bi-annual Performance Management program.


Our Ideal Candidate Will Have
  • Global or APAC HR Coordinator/Generalist experience.
  • Demonstrated client-service orientation with a clear approachable and friendly communication style and customer service attitude.
  • Effective interpersonal teamwork and organizational skills.
  • Experience with a HRIS system (preferably Workday) & excellent excel skills.
  • A mind for detail—you are detail oriented and have patience to audit and dive deep into HR data to determine patterns and check for inaccuracies .
  • Strong analytical skills proven ability to execute processes and a flexible approach to problem solving.
  • Technical curiosity and interest in evolving trends in HR products and services.


PMA-LI-1

Be part of the Kuehne + Nagel Sea Logistics team!
Your Role
You will be involved in implementing and developing the regional LCL strategy as well as monitoring and analyzing the finance performance to identify areas of improvements.
Your Responsibilities
  • Co-operates in the development and implementation of business operation and reporting systems
  • Support in determining the regional business strategy and execute its implementation in close liaison with the country LCL managers
  • Be the first line of escalation for operational issues addressed to the regional LCL team
  • Review and manage cargo flow’s to ensure development of new lanes & services focus on efficient utilization
  • Ensure efficient gateway and multi-country consolidation operations in cooperation with gateway managers
  • Ensure rate procurement efficiency on gateways
  • Monitor/analyze country performance in terms of volume/revenue/GP/EBIT identify performance gaps vs. budget and provide recommendations for improvement
  • Perform customers volume and profitability analysis and working closely with countries to improve performance

Your Skills And Experiences
  • Master/Degree in Supply Chain Management/ Business Management
  • 3-4 years experience in leading a small team
  • 5 years experience in Sea Logistics preferably in LCL
  • Good business finance acumen
Good Reasons to Join
We are looking for commercially-minded people leaders who possess a global outlook and are innovative problem solvers. In return you will gain access to professional development opportunities and international exposure in a team-based environment.

Job Title: AWS APJ Next Gen Internship Program – Singapore (May to August 2021)
Job Description:
Description

At Amazon our mission is to be the earth’s most customer-centric company. To achieve this we need exceptionally talented bright and driven people. Amazon is continuously evolving and is a place where motivated employees thrive and where employee ownership and accountability lead to meaningful results.

Amazon Web Services (AWS) an Amazon company is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. Millions of customers - including the fastest growing startups largest enterprises and leading government agencies - trust AWS to power their infrastructure. Founded in 2006 AWS offers over 175 fully featured services for compute storage databases networking analytics robotics machine learning artificial intelligence Internet of Things mobile security hybrid virtual reality augmented reality media and application development deployment and management from 77 availability zones within 24 geographic regions spanning the globe.

AWS APJ Next Gen Internship Program – Singapore

The AWS APJ teams are looking to hire and develop the next generation of leaders for our organization. We are seeking talented and enthusiastic students who are passionate about solving business problems innovating and building new processes and leading high-impact initiatives. The Next Gen Internship Program allows you to gain exposure to the AWS business and our unique Amazonian culture through a rewarding learning experience. For this summer internship (May to August 2021) interns will be based in our Singapore office and will be assigned to one of the following teams.
  • Sales
  • Channels and Alliances
Subject to the business’ needs a limited number of opportunities are available in the following teams.
  • Business Development
  • Sales Strategy Operations & Enablement
As an intern you will independently own a key business project that can drive business value and tasks to support your assigned team. You will hone your leadership and presentation skills and apply your creativity to innovate for our business. At the end of your internship all interns will present their project learnings and proposal to a panel of key business leaders.

Join us! It is as simple as ‘come build the future with us.’

About The Functions
  • Sales: The sales teams develop and execute against a territory plan to drive revenue and market share. Our sales teams work directly with customers and drive business growth by articulating compelling value propositions for AWS services drive customer adoption of AWS and ensure customer satisfaction.
  • Channels and Alliances: The channels and alliances team recruits enables and develops consulting and technology partners to drive their business growth. The AWS Partner Network (APN) is a global partner program that focuses on helping APN partners build successful AWS-based businesses or solutions by providing business technical marketing and go-to-market support. Our consulting partners are professional services firms that help customers design architect and migrate their workloads and applications on AWS. Our technology partners provide software solutions that are hosted or integrated on the AWS platform.
  • Business Development: The business development team incubates business initiatives with an impact that will shape how the business will look like in the next 5 to 10 years. The team creates go-to-market strategies for identified business opportunities and collaborates with other functions to implement these strategies to accelerate customer adoption of AWS.
  • Sales Strategy Operations and Enablement (SSOE): The SSOE team works closely with the management team to develop implement and manage business processes reports and strategies that optimize business functions to meet organizational goals.
Who are we looking for?

The Ideal Candidate
  • Has business acumen and is able to work independently and as part of a team
  • Strong interpersonal skills required
  • Is curious to learn and has a ‘can-do’ attitude with strong ownership
  • Adept at problem-solving and can come up with creative and innovative solutions
  • Results driven with analytical capability to provide data-driven insights
  • Able to multi-task and prioritize competing stakeholder requests
  • Exceptional written and verbal communication skills
  • Is comfortable working independently in a fast-paced and dynamic environment

Basic Qualifications
  • Penultimate year student working towards a bachelor’s or master’s degree
  • Candidates must be able to legally work in Singapore
  • Able to commit to a full-time internship from May to August 2021
  • Analytical and quantitative skills with the ability to use Excel or other software to provide data to support analyses
  • Excellent English written and verbal communication skills

Preferred Qualifications

Important Note for Application

Skills

As written communications skills are an important aspect of the culture at Amazon please choose and respond to one of the two questions below for your application

You must attach a one page written response with your resume (saved in PDF or Microsoft Word format) and upload this as part of your application. For this one page written response (do not use bullet points) please follow the instructions below:
  • Define innovation using anecdotal examples and professional experiences.
  • Why is it always Day 1?
The questions are designed so that they can be interpreted in multiple ways. You must respond in narrative form (do not use bullet points). Do not include any confidential information in your responses. We will evaluate your writing based on your clarity of thought and expression and the organization and structure of your written response.

Note: We will only consider applications with the one page written response and uploaded together with your resume.

Job Title: Project Manager| AppleCare Business Process Reengineering (BPR)
Job Description:
Summary
Imagine what you could do here! At Apple new ideas have a way of becoming extraordinary products services and customer experiences very quickly. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could accomplish!


An opening exists in the Asia-Pacific Business Process Reengineering Team of Apple Support for a Project Manager & Business Analyst including testing management. This role spans across the Asia-Pacific region on projects pertaining to Enterprise systems and processes. The role supports the following business areas - Field services repair management warehousing freight service parts planning and procurement online services service contracts business development/sales contact centre operations and others.


Key Qualifications
You have 8 or more years of demonstrated experience on the below :


Knowledge and demonstrated experience in project management including management of scope time and schedule with balance of quality and risk management.

Effective communicator with proven success at all levels of business communication.

Facilitation negotiation and conflict resolution skills and demonstrated success at building teams and relationships with key people in local and remote sites.

Demonstrated sound interpersonal and communications skills.

Understanding of the business processes and ability to detail them as needed by the project.

Skilled in analysing and reengineering business processes and recommending solutions.

Experience in facilitating workshops and brainstorming sessions to gather business requirements.

Experience and exposure to resolving complex project situations including issues and working to represent the project to senior leadership layers such as Directors Senior Directors.

Proficient with MS Word MS Excel and basic project planning tools.


Description

Job Title: Associate / Assistant Manager| Marketplace and Strategic Insights| Singapore
Job Description:
Job Description:

Get to know the team:

The Singapore Operations team oversees shapes and grows the business in Grab Singapore. We contribute towards Grab’s vision of being Southeast Asia’s superapp by providing everyday services that matter most to consumers in Singapore. We develop and execute business strategies that help us achieve our vision in serving our community.

The Singapore Insights and Marketplace team is housed within Singapore Operations. We focus on delivering insights to inform business strategy as well as optimizing the 3-sided marketplace made up of driver/delivery partners passengers/ eaters and merchants across the various business verticals in Singapore - including Transport Food Express and Mart. Our work contributes to timely and affordable rides for customers enhances the incomes of our driver partners and merchants while supporting business growth and profitability.

Get to know the Role:

  • Plan and structure research and experiments on demand supply pricing levers to optimize for business objectives (e.g. A/B testing on-the-ground engagement with driver-partners focus group studies)
  • Deliver valuable business insights and recommendations to senior management to act upon (e.g. promo & incentive spend optimization pricing optimization churn analysis customer segmentation merchant profitability etc) with the use of various data visualization tools
  • Make use of rich datasets and statistical tools to support senior management in performing analyses that help with data driven decision making (e.g. clustering forecasting)
  • Work with cross functional teams and senior management across multiple business lines including GrabFood GrabCar Grab Express Grab Rewards etc to deliver high-impact initiatives arising from insights generated
  • Minimal travel required (<5%)
The must haves:

  • A bachelor’s degree in Economics
  • Minimum 2 to 3-years of relevant working experience (for example in management/strategic consulting eCommerce and/or start-ups)
  • Strong business sense - ability to articulate complex analyses results to a wide range of audiences and translate these to actionable business insights
  • Strong quantitative skills
  • Ability to dive into problems and understand root-causes
  • Working understanding of SQL and Python/R
  • Attention to detail
  • Start-up attitude – willing to learn and work hard to get things done in a dynamic ultra-fast-paced VUCA environment

Job Title: Employee Relations and Investigations Partner| People Operations
Job Description:
Due to the current health crisis related to COVID-19 and the escalating visa/travel restrictions in place we're currently unable to extend offers to anyone who cannot work from Singapore due to lockdown visa/travel restrictions or other restrictive measures until further notice. Consequently we will be prioritizing candidates who can start in this location by set date as expected. We're keeping the situation under review and would adjust our position should the restrictive measures be removed later on.

Minimum Qualifications
  • Experience establishing cross-functional relationships at all levels and geographies.
  • Experience conducting investigations and advising on local disciplinary and investigation processes.
  • Experience in APAC employment law and in one or more APAC market.


Preferred Qualifications
  • Experience with stakeholder management in a global organization.
  • Experience consulting directly with employees and management.
  • Ability to navigate ambiguity and complexity and apply an intersectional lens to work.
  • Ability to operate with empathy and diffuse/de-escalate difficult conversations and situations.
  • Ability to collaborate across teams regions and time zones.
  • Excellent communication analytical influencing and writing skills.


About The Job

People Operations strives to revolutionize human resources the same way that Google has revolutionized search. We are helping to find grow and keep the remarkable assemblage of talent who are our Googlers. You'll be an advocate of Google's culture and values partnering with our business leaders to help them build their organizations and make sure all people decisions are based on data. Whether coaching our clients on how to lead their teams navigating and resolving employee relations issues or managing programs that help develop our Googlers you are exceptionally focused on putting them first and being as clear and transparent as possible to help Googlers understand how people decisions get made.

As an Employee Relations and Investigations Partner you will rely on your expertise of applicable employment laws and best practices to interpret and apply Google policies to address workplace concerns.

Great just isn't good enough for our People Operations team (known elsewhere as "Human Resources"). We bring the world's most innovative people to Google and provide the programs that help them thrive. Whether recruiting the next Googler refining our core programs developing talent or simply looking for ways to inject some more fun into the lives of our Googlers we bring a data-driven approach that is reinventing the human resources field. You’ll play an essential role advancing a more diverse accessible equitable and inclusive Google through our hiring promotion retention and inclusion practices.

Responsibilities
  • Conduct fair thorough and timely investigations into allegations of violations of Google’s HR policies or local law and policies to ensure fair treatment of all employees.
  • Consult with partner teams on local investigation processes and advise on local disciplinary processes for non-HR policy violations.
  • Advise on and help to resolve other workplace concerns to determine the appropriate approach and to ensure fair treatment of all employees. De-escalate and resolve matters as appropriate using listening and conflict resolution skills.
  • Review complex performance management situations and fairness of decision making and local processes for reorganizations and restructuring exercises.

Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race color ancestry religion sex national origin sexual orientation age citizenship marital status disability gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation please let us know by completing this form .

Job Title: Market Specialist| GO Markets| Pacific Islands
Job Description:
Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world gives them ways to share what matters most to them and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating solving problems and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.
GO Markets' focus is on supporting our users through both direct support interactions as well as scalable solutions and on improving the health of our products by helping people understand how to use them. Those who join our teams are very passionate about solving people’s issues and are strong advocates for the Facebook community. We need influencers who can align cross-functional partners to ensure the best possible experience for our platforms. If you like helping people GO Markets is for you.

The GO Markets team is seeking a solutions-oriented data-savvy Market Specialist who is passionate about providing a great support experience for our community of users. The successful candidate will work with the Pacific Islands markets team to review content reported for potential abuse resolve user account issues improve the overall support experience for that market as well as solve thematic global issues. The Market Specialist will be part of a data-driven analysis culture and will also help scale our operations by optimising and automating processes solving challenging problems and most importantly helping to prevent them. This position is full time and is based in our Singapore office.

  • Liaise closely with our vendors to ensure all operational KPIs meet and exceed targets and work collaboratively to improve processes and tools and scale solutions
  • Analyze key metrics to improve our operational workflows
  • Be the Subject Matter Expert and Go-to-Person for specific complex topics
  • Use market specific knowledge signals and insights to spot and scope scalable solutions to improve the support of our community of users in the Pacific Islands market
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to improve our processes and tools
  • Use your problem solving skills to resolve large and complex business problems
  • Remain up to date on key workflow changes operational guidelines policy updates and our Community Standards
  • Investigate and resolve issues that are reported on Facebook such as requests for account support and reports of potentially abusive content including but not limited to graphic images videos and writings offensive or derogatory language and other objectionable material
  • Bachelors degree and/or masters or equivalent experience
  • 2+ years of professional experience within an operations environment
  • Fluency in written and conversational in English and one or more of the following Pacific Islands languages is essential: Maori Tok Pisin Samoan or Fijian
  • Strategic thinker with strong analytical and creative problem-solving skills
  • Passion for supporting the Facebook and Instagram community
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills
  • Self-starting intellectually curious and creative individual comfortable operating in a fast-paced ever changing environment
  • Technical and data skills such as Excel and SQL are a plus

At Deloitte we offer a unique and exceptional career experience to inspire and empower talents like you to make an impact that matters for our clients people and community. Whatever your aspirations Deloitte offers you a highly inclusive collaborative workplace and unrivalled opportunities to realize your full potential. We are always looking for people with the relentless energy to push themselves further and to find new avenues and unique ways to reach our shared goals.

Work you will do

We are seeking exceptional highly skilled individuals to join Japanese Client Services / Japan SEA Collaboration .

Recognizing the strong momentum of investment by Japanese companies’ in ASEAN our Consulting groups in Southeast Asia and Japan launched a collaboration in 2012 to provide a wide range of business consulting services for over 100 Japanese clients across the region including some of the biggest manufacturing companies in the world.

In response to the expansion of Japanese businesses in Southeast Asia there have been numerous collaboration initiatives between Deloitte Southeast Asia and Japan since 2012. Now there are over 100 consultants of diverse nationalities across the ASEAN region focusing on Japanese clients. We also have a joint training program for new consultants and through the engagements with multinationals and ASEAN companies we are able to build their capabilities and experience and provide our people with meaningful experiences and a unique career path.

Technology does not stand still. It takes innovative approaches to transform modernize and run existing technology platforms. The key is knowing when to take advantage of the new technologies to drive product and service enhancements improve financial performance and accelerate speed to market.

When it’s time to reinvent how the wheels turn in your organization—to react innovate and reconfigure your business our Operations Transformation professionals’ deep sector knowledge coupled with our operational and technical expertise bring your strategy to life in delivering lower-cost more effective and fit-for-the-future operations that underpin profitable growth. We plan and deploy game-changing cognitive and digital technology to reduce costs maximize efficiency transform payments and revenue processes and benefit from innovative and emerging business models.

You will support our clients in their transformation journey by:
  • Identifying opportunities for efficiencies in work process and innovative approaches to completing scope of work.
  • Participating in team problem solving efforts and offer ideas to solve client issues.
  • Conducting relevant research data analysis and create reports.
  • Maintaining responsibility for completion and accuracy of work products.
  • Assessing restructuring operating models organizational structures and business processes to streamline core operations’ service delivery.
  • Assisting in proposal development as requested.
  • Actively expanding consulting skills and professional development through training courses mentoring and daily interaction with clients.


Your role as a leader

In Addition To Living Our Purpose Managers Across Our Firm Are Expected To

At Deloitte we believe in the importance of empowering our people to be leaders at all levels. We expect our people to embrace and live our purpose and shared values challenging themselves everyday to identify issues that are most important to our clients our people and the communities and to make an impact that matters.
  • Understand the goals of our clients and Deloitte align our people to these objectives by setting clear priorities and direction.
  • Influence clients teams and individuals positively. Lead by example and provide equal opportunity for people to grow develop and succeed.
  • Establish positive relationship with senior stakeholders.
  • Delivers exceptional client service. Maximizes results and drives high performance from people while fostering collaboration across businesses and geographies.
  • Manage diverse teams within a highly inclusive team culture where people are respected and valued for their contribution.
  • Develop high-performing teams through challenging and meaningful opportunities and recognize them for the impact that they make.


If You Are Someone With

Enough about us let's talk about you
  • Minimum tertiary qualification in a business or finance discipline.
  • Minimum 8 years of working experience in a transformation or consulting role in Financial Services industry for front/middle/back-office processes market infrastructure regulations instruments and products.
  • Experience leading business model design and implementation with exposure to banking sectors
  • Experience with budgetary responsibilities related to projects or resources.

  • Proven experience effectively prioritizing workload to meet deadlines and work objectives.
  • Ability to travel (both locally and abroad) for short-term and long-term project assignment.

Next Steps

This position sits in the Product Team and reports to Lead Homepage Operator. It is full-time and is based in our Singapore office.

  • Using a data-driven process synthesize multiple and potentially competing key priorities into actionable product development and operational frameworks to increase efficiency of the overall homepage

  • Proficient in Excel and PowerPoint

Description

Amazon’s Global Workforce Strategy and Innovation (AGWS) team is seeking a highly skilled and motivated Manager of Workforce Operations to lead our Singapore high volume hiring program. This manager leads a broad set of teams that plan execute and analyze the critical labor acquisition functions for hourly hiring in existing and newly launching businesses. From capacity forecasting candidate engagement to labor delivery execution through various supply chains and risk forecasting this team collaborates across a wide spectrum of business partners to improve Amazon’s labor cost capacity and customer experience. A newly formed team within Global Workforce Staffing AGWS is pioneering solutions to our toughest workforce challenges across the globe building innovative labor models and infrastructure that improve Amazon’s employment value proposition and scale over time.
The ideal candidate will possess a strong analytics background that enables him/her to manage quantitative planning and a demonstrated ability to think broadly and strategically about the talent supply chain. This individual will lead the analysis of labor supply and demand across Singapore composed of multiple Amazon business lines. He/she will collaborate with the centralized applicant sourcing advertising analytics business operations and finance teams to deliver effective delivery of workforce strategies across different employee types.

Core Responsibilities And Skills
  • Ability to work in highly ambiguous environments and build solutions that have the ability to flex with the business needs and ultimately scale
  • Identify effective talent supply chain partners onboard and manage against execution cost and compliance
  • Anticipates future business needs and identifies investments needed and builds the infrastructure to ensure optimization capability is geared toward (or even ahead of) business demand
  • Builds labor acquisition strategy inclusive of employee class recommendations labor pool utilization talent pool conversion and other channel resources across different Amazon businesses
  • Ability to translate customer service requirements into logistics/supply chain requirements
  • Lead initiatives to optimize hiring lead times costs and service levels
  • Must be able to systematically escalate problems or variance in the labor plan to the relevant owners and teams and follow through on the resolutions to ensure they are delivered
  • Work within various time constraints to meet critical business needs while measuring and identifying activities performed and ensuring service requirements are met
  • Excellent communication both verbal and written as you will be required to convey updates on issues operational status and business drivers throughout the activity cycle and during daily/weekly reviews
  • Develop performance metrics to assist with driving business results
  • Engage other Amazon business units globally to share planning best practices and improve end-to-end outcomes for Amazon customers.
Expected Deliverables
  • Management and ownership of cost per hire through oversight of labor advertising and other talent acquisition costs
  • Management of the talent supply chain utilizing lean methodology
  • Management of candidate cycle time conversion rates and applicant funnel metrics to benchmark or above
  • Alignment with finance and operations partners to optimize labor acquisition strategy
  • Demonstrated return on investment from community engagement strategies
  • Meet or exceed associate experience service levels and KPI’s measured by hiring activity results and defect reduction
  • Growth of team’s core and advanced skills sets measured by progression in their career path

Basic Qualifications
  • Minimum Bachelor’s Degree
  • 4+ years Management experience in a global workforce planning / supply chain / operations management environment
  • Ability to lead teach and develop associates and managers to deliver key organizational goals.
  • Demonstrated success with program & portfolio management in highly matrixed rapidly changing business environments.
  • Exceptional analytical skills comfortable working with large amounts of data and communicating data findings experience establishing and tracking program metrics including return on investment
  • Experience identifying and resolving issues independently will take initiative even under unfamiliar or ambiguous circumstances
  • Ability to develop and implement planning processes and procedures across geographically distributed teams.
  • Demonstrated ability to think strategically and translate strategy into operational plans and business results.
  • Experience with managing large-scale organizational change.
  • Experience defining technical requirements and working with systems resources
  • Up to 50% regional travel
Preferred Qualifications
  • Bachelor’s Degree in Operations Supply Chain Analytics or related field as well as a MBA is a plus
  • Proven ability to influence others without having positional authority
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills are a must
  • Ability to Deep Dive and develop innovative ideas for process challenges

Job Title: Manager| Operations Planning and Programme (ACE Group) - Contract

It aims to provide Assurance to migrant workers living in dormitories and workers working in the dormitories including the dormitory operators. It will also provide Care for workers through a comprehensive medical support plan and make health services more accessible to migrant workers. In addition it will enhance Engagement with workers and other stakeholders to foster stronger partnerships with Singaporeans workers’ groups employers and dormitory operators.

The Senior Strategy Lead Analyst is a strategic professional who drives to directional strategy by considering their application in own job and the business. They will become a recognized technical authority for operational resilience within Citi's central Operational Resilience team. Requires commercial awareness and developed communication and diplomacy skills are required in order to guide influence and convince others in particular colleagues in other areas and occasionally external clients and industry groups. The Senior Strategy Lead Analyst will have significant impact on Citi's approach to operational resilience through complex deliverables and will provides advice and counsel related to it to other teams within Citi.

Responsibilities

Will lead globally on efforts to develop a robust analytical model for Impact Tolerances that incorporates external benchmarks and competitor analysis as well as changes in our clients’ operating models and our growth of product sales.

Will act as the Asia Pacific (APAC) lead for the central Operational Resilience team. This includes being responsible for educating and briefing APAC subsidiary boards regional leadership (APAC Operating Committee) and country management teams. This requires strong organizational savvy and emotional intelligence to ensure Operational Resilience becomes built into “everyday muscle-memory” and thought of as a foundational element of any body of work or engagement with clients.

Will be responsible for ensuring direct incorporation of Operational Resilience into other Citi initiatives and programs such as Client Obsession TTS Production Resiliency and Data Quality.

Will support key elements of the Citi-Wide Key Initiative such as Culture and Mind-set Change and the evolution of “utility” programs and frameworks such as Continuity of Business and control frameworks such as the Manager’s Control Assessment (MCA).

Will lead efforts to explore a data-driven and real-time approach to Impact Tolerances through the exploration of Big Data data analytics and data science as tools to develop new forms of management information metrics and reporting to develop an innovative way of understanding the resilience of Citi that incorporates future evolutions in our business model and world we operate in.

Assist in the development of understanding our concentration risk and use of third parties along with developing an end-to-end approach to dependency mapping of Citi’s Business Services including the people skillsets data 3rd parties FMIs countries legal entities technology systems applications processes FMIs etc. that are required for the normal delivery of the service.

Attributes

A dedication to learning and a true passion for driving improvement is vital. We value inclusion and diversity and so do you. We’ll also be looking for the following:

Awareness of Citi and/or other financial services institutions

Varied background / experience across and exposure to multiple disciplines such as Risk & Controls Corporate Banking Markets & Securities Services Payments Trade Finance Risk Treasury or Operations & Technology through direct experience or via program/project delivery.

Strong understanding of Citi’s regional cluster and country management approach. It is critical the role holder understand the importance of a legal entity view of the bank and how this differs from a “line of business” view of Citi.

Strong understanding of financial services products and Citi's organizational construct.

Highly motivated and with enthusiasm for Financial Services industry and desire to master the business.

Mind-set

Able and willing to be bold and imagine a different future state motivate inspire and work with others to craft and build it. Self-starter and creative problem solver who is willing to think ‘out of the box’. Must have a strong client and innovation focus and ability to step outside regular job functions and comfort zone.

Must be able to “step into the shoes of” a CEO or board member to understand their needs and their perspective of Citi.

Curiosity to learn about new businesses technology developments and geopolitics.

Desire and ability to seek consider and connect operational resilience external trends and developments to product and function strategies in other words an ability to ‘connect the dots’ and communicate the ‘big picture’.

Must demonstrate integrity and the ability to balance logic and analytical thinking with empathy and compassion.

Efficiently solve complex ambiguous problems/situations and can multi-tasks productively and reliably while managing conflicting priorities.

Collaboration

Strong regional cultural awareness and valuing of a diverse workforce. Strong appreciation of differences in style and/or perspective utilizing them to inform and enhance decisions or actions and organizational success.

Actively collaborates with partners across the bank and world and achieve actionable results through others.

Promotes a culture of collaboration and teamwork across organizational boundaries breaking down silos and encouraging the sharing of ideas and lessons learned.

Ability to work virtually and with a global team in multiple time zones.

People

Leadership presence; commands respect and will earn (and maintain) the trust of senior leaders.

People-focused attitude with demonstrated positive relationship management and interpersonal skills with colleagues of all levels background and across all teams.

Contribute to continuous team improvement and management e.g. provide leadership in recruiting coach junior staff etc.

Excellent influencing and diplomacy skills with experience of communicating negotiating and partnering with more senior colleagues.

Delivers

Identify opportunities to add value beyond the scope of formal projects.

Proven ability to work independently in a fast paced multi-tasking environment.

Accountability and results oriented with impeccable attention to detail and accuracy.

Ability to take an agile approach to development and make ad hoc changes to project plans.

Experience with producing and distributing publicly facing materials.

Excellent communications and customer service skills. Ability to explain technical or complex issues and concerns in non-technical ways.

Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup its clients and assets by driving compliance with applicable laws rules and regulations adhering to Policy applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior conduct and business practices and escalating managing and reporting control issues with transparency.

Qualifications

6-10 years’ experience in financial services.

Client and/or product experience.

Outstanding analytical and quantitative capabilities; history of academic and professional excellence and achievement.

Consistently demonstrates clear and concise written and verbal communication.

Highly proficient in MS PowerPoint and Excel.

Education

Master's/University degree or equivalent experience potentially Masters degree

Job Title: Sales and Supply Support Specialist| IKEA Jurong
Job Description:
Company Description

The IKEA vision is to create a better everyday life for the many people. We do this by offering a wide range of well-designed functional home furnishing products at prices so low that as many people as possible can afford them. We operate in Singapore Malaysia Thailand and Philippines – and have an ambitious expansion plan to bring a little bit of Sweden to new markets in the region. We are part of the Ikano Group of companies and the only IKEA franchisee owned by the Kamprad family that founded IKEA.

We also develop own and operate Shopping Centres that are anchored by IKEA and create walkable communities by including residential office and other types of real estate in our development plans.

We work towards making sustainability a natural part of our everyday work. We are active in our communities driving and supporting social initiatives that benefit children women and the environment.

Job Description

About the job

IKEA Jurong is a unique city centre store in a popular shopping mall. It is a smaller store with a big turnover and with 3 milion visitors. It will be lead by an ambitious team consisting of the Store Commercial Operations IKEA Food and a Retail Foundation Manager.

In your role as a Sales and Supply Support Specialist you will create and constantly improve excellent availability range management and forecasting at the lowest possible costs. Together with the Sales and Supply Support Manager you will support the commercial team and act as a communication link between the store and the Retail Supply Integration department.

Your assignment
  • Secure the highest possible goods availability in partnership with the commercial team and taking into account country-specific positioning campaigns the commercial calendar and local store activities.
  • Working actively with sales in the area of range management by securing qualitative and timely administration of the range in the systems and highlight deviations on the range frame and parameters.
  • Contribute to successful replenishment by working actively with operational forecasting and ordering together with Sales to maximise sales potential and customer experience.
  • Produce necessary follow-ups for the commercial and management team regarding operational processes in the store including phasing in and out overstock and concrete activities and non-central shortages.
  • Work actively with the commercial team with the range change process by providing information regarding sales space parameters expected sales start quantity and remaining outgoing quantities.
  • Support the Operations Manager with stock discrepancies analysis as part of the inventory management process.

Qualifications

Your profile
  • You have minimum 2 years experience in Retail Supply Chain and operational excellence in order to contribute to the Retail Logistics business.
  • Skilled in retail and/or logistics processes tools and working methods with high analytical skills and numerical skills.
  • You are able to make objective decisions based on monitoring and reviewing of the in-store Logistics system and other available information.
  • You are a team player with strong interpersonal skills and confidence in approaching and communicating to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner able to establish and maintain effective work relationships with cross-departmental colleagues.
  • You are equipped with MS Office proficiency knowledge.
  • You are able to commit to work on public holidays and weekends.

Additional Information

Please apply by 30 September 2020.

About The Job

The APAC Go-to-Market team partners with multiple stakeholders to create and deploy product and business strategies that drive customer success and Google’s growth. We partner closely with Product Sales gTech Marketing Policy and other teams to shape the product roadmap and drive the commercialization strategy for critical products and initiatives.

As a Deals Strategy and Planning Lead you will partner closely with local sales and specialist teams across APAC to drive Apps growth through strategic partnerships. Our Deals Team supports Large Customer Sales across APAC to drive Ads growth while deepening our partnerships with advertisers providing benefits and strategic value ads to grow their business. We shape the strategy and best practices around structuring annual agreements with Google’s biggest brand advertisers.

The Go-to-Market Operations (GtM) team ensures Google's complex and ever-evolving Ads business runs smoothly. We are instrumental in setting go-to-market strategy and ensuring flawless execution and operations against the strategy. We have teams embedded in each of the major Ads business areas as well as global teams that work across the business areas. Team members are analytical and strategic with a pragmatic sense of how to get things done.

Responsibilities
  • Oversee Apps incentive program and approval including adherence to global policies/exception handling processes.
  • Design agreement strategy and go-to-market approach in partnership with cross functional teams across APAC while adapting global guidelines to local needs.
  • Support teams in end to end contract process: input of agreement terms in internal tools follow up on internal agreement approvals work closely with legal teams on agreement creation and management activation of agreements benefit activation and quarterly milestone revisions and accountability.
  • Partner closely with key global crossfunctional stakeholders across finance compliance accounting legal Product GTM etc to align on program directions (quarterly product selection) and adaptations for APAC.
  • Develop and implement a process for future program improvement incorporating feedback from different stakeholders.

Job Description:

Get to know our Team:

The Operational Excellence team within Grab Singapore is responsible for championing business process re-engineering automation data analytics as well as other value improvement solutions in order to provide the efficiency leverage for our business to grow sustainably.

We operate on a project-based nature from generation of a business case for change scoping of requirements and facilitation of As-Is understanding workshops through to the development of To-Be processes automation solutions and analytical dashboards as well as the tracking of benefits realized.

Additionally the team also undertakes ad-hoc strategic projects aimed at improving the top-/ bottom-line performance of Grab.

Get to know the Role:

This is an exciting opportunity within the wider Operations organisation in Grab Singapore. As the Assistant Manager for Performance Improvement you will be responsible for transforming the way business works across Verticals including Transport Food Rentals etc.

You will co-manage a team of cross-functional Associates on multiple concurrent projects which involve understanding the needs of our business stakeholders identifying key issues and potential areas for improvement designing and implementing process and policy changes and evaluating the outcomes with business users.

You will have the opportunity to oversee and streamline operational “business-as-usual” (“BAU”) processing activities under an “Operate-Transform-Transfer” model.

You will also be responsible for tracking and managing work delivery against Objectives & Key Results (OKRs) set for the team as well as supporting initiatives to enhance the capabilities and competencies of Performance Improvement team members.

You should possess very strong analytical problem-solving and organizational skills on top of excellent communication interpersonal and leadership skills. Familiarity with computer programming languages and experience working with software engineers in a technology-based environment will be very helpful for you to excel in this role.

The day-to-day activities:

You will collaborate with your peers in the Digital Enablement and Planning & Analytics teams to engage stakeholders in various business Verticals for their end-to-end improvement and automation needs:

  • Analyze the strategic and operational requirements of Grab Singapore’s businesses
  • Engage key stakeholders in various business Verticals and Departments to identify opportunities for process improvement automation and analytics
  • Recommend and lead the development of effective end-to-end solutions to resolve key business pain points
  • Managing and ensuring the long-term sustainability security and maintenance of all developed tools and solutions
  • Work with the regional Business Process Improvement & Automation team to rollout effective business solutions to other countries

The must haves:

  • Relevant Bachelor’s Degree; background in Computer Science Computer Engineering Systems Engineering or Information Technology will have an advantage
  • Minimum 4-5 years of professional experience including managing a combination of strategic analysis operational improvement process automation and data analytics projects
  • Strong communication skills and excellent team player
  • Self-starter and an engineer at heart who is passionate about leveraging technology to help business operations drive change and improve growth.
The good-to-haves:

  • Professional certification on project management (PMP/ PRINCE2) LEAN Six-Sigma
  • Good understanding of Robotic Process Automation (RPA) software

Bringing convenience to your everyday’ - that’s our mission at foodpanda (small ‘f’).

So whether it’s by delivering food on our signature pink bikes providing insights into the newest food trends or getting you the groceries you need we’re all about keeping you fed. As we move to grow throughout the Asia-Pacific region we’re on the lookout for talent who are excited about making a tangible impact with a fast-growing organisation looking to redefine how food people culture and technology are connected.

However this doesn’t happen without some really awesome people making it happen. As of that we are looking for a Senior Analyst Operations to work in our regional APAC team. You will be responsible for supporting the APAC countries to provide a better experience to our customers through more efficient logistics.

What You Will Do
  • You will be empowered to take full responsibility for improving business operations.

Description

At Amazon we are working to be the most customer-centric company on earth. To get there we need exceptionally talented bright and driven individuals. If you would like to help us build the place to find and buy anything online this is your chance to make history.
The Workforce Staffing (WFS) team is looking for a Staffing Lead. The Staffing Lead is the primary candidate facing members of our field teams serving in both executional and decision making roles. The Staffing Lead will be responsible for ensuring that our candidates and stakeholders experience the highest level of Customer Obsession. In this high volume hiring space you will manage the delivery of Associate labor through direct sourcing channels vendor suppliers daily vendor management and engagement initiatives. The Staffing Lead will focus on owning the tactical development and delivery of community engagement plans supporting labor demand planning for multiple sites across the node and execution of candidate engagement activities. You will be an analytical thinker who can see around corners and demonstrate a passion for process improvement candidate experience and seamless onboarding. You will work with a team of Staffing Leads who thrive in an innovative fast-paced environment.

Core Responsibilities And Skills
  • Serves as the lead to pre plan execute and audit New Hiring Events (NHE) based on labor projections to meet the labor order demands and fill on time. Completes post audit of event and communicates event metrics to leadership
  • Partners with business operations and finance regional leaders to align labor strategy plans and mitigate risk due to labor fulfillment with weekly Labor Assumption and Labor Planning meetings
  • Vendor management of labor suppliers and associated KPIs delivery of standard work and forecasting
  • Ensures 100% compliance for work authorization documentation for associates
  • Guides applicants through the hiring process in accordance with Amazon’s policies and procedures
  • Monitor labor market health and provide advanced insights into changes that will affect the business
  • Effectively executes NHE activities including Greeter Welcome Event Presenter Candidate Care Specialist Computer Assistance Badge Photo and/or Test Administrator.
  • Serves as the lead to pre plan execute and audit New Hire Orientation (NHO) (proctored) or (virtual). Communicates and coordinates with site HR and Operations Leadership team for proctored NHO greeting. Completes post event audit of proctored NHO event and communicates event metrics to site and staffing leadership
  • Utilizes Applicant Tracking System to move candidates through the application process and updates appointment arrival status for NHE and NHO
  • Resolves candidate escalation issues by contacting them to identify issues offering to reschedule them or assisting candidates who are having virtual NHO technology issues or assistance with any other concerns
  • Partners with Staffing Manager to support community groups to leverage grassroots sourcing channels to develop talent communities to fill positions
  • Ensures all documents are scanned into the digital file management system
  • Must be able to travel as needed to conduct events in various locations within your designated Node or assigned geographical area. Transports NHE supplies and materials to/from off-site hiring events
  • Staffing Leads are required to work a flexible schedule. While the role by and large will require working in a regular shift (i.e. 9am to 6pm) occasionally and during Peak season employees may have to stretch or work during weekends.
  • Local travel up to 25% required.

Basic Qualifications
  • Bachelor’s degree or 2+ years of internal Amazon experience in lieu of degree
  • 3+ years of experience in a fast paced customer oriented environment such as operations administrative support customer service retail hospitality staffing recruiting human resources or other related field
  • Intermediate to advanced level proficiency with Microsoft Office (Word and Excel) required
  • Fluent verbally and in writing English
Preferred Qualifications
  • Working knowledge of HRIS or Applicant Tracking Systems are preferred.
  • Prior experience managing multi stakeholder programs vendor management experiences and operational management
  • Exceptionally strong interpersonal verbal/written skills
  • Ability to work with very diverse groups of people at all levels of authority.
  • Flexibility and adaptability in dealing with rapidly changing priorities and demands necessary including daily work location and business line support.
  • Ability to work in a complex organization that is fast-paced and constantly changing to meet current challenges. This position must function in this environment on a daily basis and react quickly to meet pressing needs.
  • Must have strong initiative and the ability to work independently with minimal direction/supervision.
  • Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to meet competing deadlines under pressure while maintaining accuracy and strong attention to detail

This position has the overall operations responsibility for the start-up of a new Singapore Single Use Technology (SUT) site.

This position is responsible for managing the successful manufacturing and delivery of Single Use Systems (Bio-Process Containers) to Thermo Fisher Scientific’s customers in the Bio Processing Production industry. The manufacture of these products must be in accordance with all regulatory requirements such as GMPs ISO or other requirements as necessary. The main goal of this position is to ensure that Thermo Fisher Scientific’s customers receive the highest quality products on time and in a responsive efficient manner. To achieve this it requires a highly motivated workforce which pays strict attention to detail can identify develop and implement robust harmonized processes and procedures along with methods to ensure procedural compliance.

Key Responsibilities

Plan and direct operational activities of the site to achieve shorter term business targets as well as benchmark performance in the areas of quality delivery and cost.
  • Create a long term vision and plan to achieve that vision communicate the vision and ensure staff alignment to work towards that vision
  • Develop and manage an operational strategy which is aligned with and achieves overall long term Thermo Fisher Scientific BPD business goals.

Job Description:

Get to know the team:

The Singapore Operations team oversees shapes and grows the business in Grab Singapore. We contribute towards Grab’s vision of being Southeast Asia’s superapp by providing everyday services that matter most to consumers in Singapore. We develop and execute business strategies that help us achieve our vision in serving our community.

The Singapore Insights and Marketplace team is housed within Singapore Operations. The team focuses on delivering insights to inform business strategy as well as optimizing the 3-sided marketplace made up of driver/delivery partners passengers/ eaters and merchants across the various business verticals in Singapore - including Transport Food Express and Mart. Our work contributes to timely and affordable rides for customers enhances the incomes of our driver partners and merchants while supporting business growth and sustainability.

Get to know the role:

  • The role reports to Managing Director Strategy for Singapore
  • The successful candidate will lead coach and build a team of business & data analysts to partner with the Singapore business
  • You will set the direction for the team and be responsible for delivering business insights to help guide Grab Singapore’s business strategy (partnering with our Strategy team)
  • Your team is also responsible for ensuring a well functioning marketplace for our business verticals (e.g. Transport Food Express Mart) which involves optimizing short term marketplace management tools (e.g. customer promotions driver incentives delivery fees & surcharges job allocation logic) and longer term programmes (e.g. driver loyalty programs subscription programmes pricing schedule)
  • The team’s work will involve both data analysis as well as rapid experimentation (e.g. A/B testing) in a real world environment
  • The role involves regular direct interaction with key Singapore and Regional stakeholders

The must haves:

  • A Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Economics
  • Minimum 7+ years relevant working experience in high growth start-ups management/strategic consulting applied economics roles
  • Minimum 3+ years experience leading & coaching a team with a hands-on leadership style
  • Self driven and highly motivated able to thrive under pressure in a startup environment that is dynamic ultra fast-paced and VUCA (Volatile Uncertain Complex Ambiguous).
  • Convincing executive presence and strong stakeholder management / influencing skills comfortable in playing the role of thought partner to senior leaders
  • Strong logical thinking and business orientation - able to guide a team to use data to solve business problems translate these to actionable business insights and operationalize deployment of solutions
  • Intellectually curious willing to challenge the status quo when needed
  • Strong statistical knowledge - ideally having utilized controlled experiments in previous role and familiar with common statistical techniques
  • Proficient in SQL Python R
The good-to-haves:

  • Experience in engaging across Asian markets and cultures
  • A creative flair to accompany strong logical thinking

Summary

We are focused on managing our supply chain as efficiently as possible in order to maximise sell through while driving for a frictionless order fulfilment experience for our partners.


Within the Reseller Operations team the Order Fulfilment Specialist is responsible for end to end channel order management from order induction to delivery and ensuring transactions in between are SOX and operationally compliant.


Key Qualifications
Real passion for Operations with relevant experience in Order Management / Customer Service / Logistics Services roles.

Japanese language fluency is advantageous

Self driven but a collaborator with the ability to build and strengthen relationships.

Working knowledge of transactional systems and processes. SAP background preferred.

Demonstrate strong attention to detail and ability to shine under compressed timelines.

Adaptable flexible and open minded to work in a dynamic fast paced environment that undergoes constant change.

Deep understanding of customs and/or regulations within Asian countries.

Familiarity with Project Management methodologies and frameworks

Expertise on productivity tools such as Excel is an added advantage.

Positive energy takes initiative with a thirst for personal growth


Description
Independently process orders/RMA and handle order exceptions (block management NPI conversions cancellation credit/debit notes) according to SOP within set SLAs and SOX requirements.


Manage inbound inquires and provide active close loop communication.


Understand and ensure Key Performance Indicators and order fulfilment goals are met on a consistent basis.


Participate in order fulfilment initiatives/UAT aimed at improving processes and tools and/or systems.


Root cause and work with DRIs on order fulfilment exceptions.


Support New Product Introduction (NPI) execution activities as/when required.



Education & Experience
Bachelor’s Degree Preferred

Summary
The right product at the right place and at the right time. That’s our mantra at Pacific Operations. Want to be a part of what it takes to bring Apple’s products to the hands of millions of customers across Greater China North East Asia South East Asia and Australia & New Zealand? Read on to learn more.


The Product & Launch Readiness (PLR) team is responsible for leading cross functional teams to align on the product launch strategy (timing volume channel coverage etc) and closely track execution ensuring operational risks are raised and mitigated.


We are looking for an extraordinary stitcher and a driven individual who will passionately bring people together see things with a holistic view and is able to effectively engage with senior leadership on launch planning and execution. You will work with worldwide and regional teams globally to ensure a timely launch across all of Apple’s Routes-to-Market (Online Retail and Channel). You will also provide thought leadership and project leadership on continuous improvement to seek efficiency and effectiveness in the launch process. An extraordinary attention to detail is required as we strive to execute precisely in order to offer the best customer experience when we launch new products.


Key Qualifications
Excellent Communication and Influencing skills

- Aptitude to clearly present the thought process have debates and ability to influence without authority


Relationship Management

- Extraordinary EQ and partner management skills with cross-functional teams of all levels in a matrix organization

Critical Thinking

- Ability to connect the dots and handle project plans timelines and risks effectively

- Capacity to deliver results under deeply tight and high-pressure timelines in a highly ambiguous environment


Strong Analytical skills and attention to details

- Ability to craft detailed execution plans for strategies with landmarks dependencies DRIs timelines and mitigation plan for execution risks.

- Sharp eye for details with a “hands-on” and continuous improvement mindset to identify inefficiencies and design improvement solutions


Description
Upon joining Readiness you will start off by owning the launch efforts for a product (iPhone/iPad/Watch etc.) in one of the Apple's Route to Markets. You will program manage activities covering country launch schedule plans end to end supply chain execution from factory to Point of Sale infrastructure / tools readiness while focusing on delightful customer experience and risk mitigation.


In this role you will quickly build your experience by your exposure to the breadth of Apple Operations. You will also drive alignment across all Operations teams (e.g. Product Localization Management (PLM) Supply Demand Management (SDM) Logistics Reseller Operations (RO) Retail Fulfillment Ops (RFO)) as well as other functions (Product Marketing Sales IT Pricing etc at Global Regional and Country levels. In a nutshell your role is to bring alignment and clarity in a highly dynamic environment making sure that all the teams are up to date and driving towards the same strategic launch objective.


You will be responsible for the success of your product launch and will be the key point of contact to the senior leadership team during the launch health reviews and drive risk mitigation under tight timelines.


Post launches you are expected to devise and lead opportunities for business process improvements and influence internal change management. You will also get involved in key strategic business expansion projects (e.g Geo expansion Speed to market Telco on-boarding)


Education & Experience
Experience and knowledge of multiple disciplines within supply chain operations (order to fulfillment supply/demand planning logistics manufacturing etc.) and product management (localization certification and new product launches) are pluses preferred.


BS/BA degree required; MBA or advanced degree is a plus.

Job Title: Consultant - Core Business Operations - Operations Transformation (Japan Collaboration) - SG
Job Description:
At Deloitte we offer a unique and exceptional career experience to inspire and empower talents like you to make an impact that matters for our clients people and community. Deloitte offers you a highly inclusive collaborative workplace and unrivalled opportunities to realize your full potential. We are always looking for people with the relentless energy to push themselves further and to find new avenues and unique ways to reach our shared goals.

Work You Will Do

We are seeking exceptional highly skilled individuals to join Japanese Client Services / Japan SEA Collaboration .

Recognizing the strong momentum of investment by Japanese companies’ in ASEAN our Consulting groups in Southeast Asia and Japan launched a collaboration in 2012 to provide a wide range of business consulting services for over 100 Japanese clients across the region including some of the biggest manufacturing companies in the world.

In response to the expansion of Japanese businesses in Southeast Asia there have been numerous collaboration initiatives between Deloitte Southeast Asia and Japan since 2012. Now there are over 100 consultants of diverse nationalities across the ASEAN region focusing on Japanese clients. We also have a joint training program for new consultants and through the engagements with multinationals and ASEAN companies we are able to build their capabilities and experience and provide our people with meaningful experiences and a unique career path.

When it’s time to reinvent how the wheels turn in your organization—to react innovate and reconfigure your business our Operations Transformation professionals’ deep sector knowledge coupled with our operational and technical expertise bring your strategy to life in delivering lower-cost more effective and fit-for-the-future operations that underpin profitable growth. We plan and deploy game-changing cognitive and digital technology to reduce costs maximize efficiency transform payments and revenue processes and benefit from innovative and emerging business models.

You will work alongside our clients to help them make decisions and implement solutions based on "Heart of the Business" transformation strategies to drive business value. Ninja Van is a tech-enabled logistics company on a mission to provide hassle-free delivery services for businesses of all sizes across Southeast Asia. Launched in 2014 we started operations in Singapore and have become the region's largest and fastest growing last-mile logistics company partnering with over 35000 merchants and delivering more than 1000 parcels every minute across six countries.

At our core we are a technology company that is disrupting a massive industry with cutting-edge software and operational concepts. Powered by algorithm-based optimisation dynamic routing end-to-end tracking and a data-driven approach we provide best-of-class delivery services that delight both the shippers and end customers. But we are just getting started! We have much room for improvement and many ideas that will further shape the industry.

With increasing number of acquisitions and accounts to manage the Partnerships team is looking for a Regional Partnership Associate/Analyst to work on inbound sales activities and groom/farm the onboarded accounts to achieve groupwide revenue and volume targets for Ninja Van. The candidate will also be working closely with other members of the Regional Partnerships team to drive key strategic projects for the organization.

The candidate will be managing client expectations by working with multiple local country stakeholders to finetune commercials and ops processes and also efficiently communicate the same with external stakeholders/clients to sustain and grow volumes from assigned client.

    • Cross sell Ninja Van’s services to assigned clients to ensure maximum value extraction by securing additional volumes

Job Title: Director of Trust & Safety Operations| APAC
Job Description:
TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy.


TikTok is based in Los Angeles with global offices in New York London Dublin Paris Berlin Dubai Mumbai Singapore Jakarta Seoul and Tokyo. In early 2018 TikTok was one of the most downloaded apps in the world. TikTok is available worldwide for iOS and Android.


The Trust & Safety Operations team at TikTok help ensure that our global community is safe and empowered to create and enjoy content across all of our apps while protecting our brand.


As the Director of Trust & Safety Regional Operations you work to balance user behavior growth and safety through systems and operations to ensure our platform’s health. You will think strategically about scaling regional operations as well as tactically about enforcement integrity. This senior role must balance internal operational realities with external policy pressures enhance operational teams and culture while communicating complex ideas to management and creating internal alignment.


This is an exciting opportunity to join a rapidly expanding international team and a unique chance to be one of the first members in our newly opened office.


Responsibilities:

- Manage all regional content moderation operations teams and sites (in-house outsourced quality assurance) an organization of over 300 FTE with significant vendor OPEX budget

- Know and be accountable for all user experience metrics within your region

- Own the strategic and operational relationship via the Partner Manager with our BPO partners ensuring adherence to the contractual agreements

- Align with the Regional Head of Trust & Safety the Head of Trust & Safety Global Operations and Regional Operations peers to ensure continued efficiency scalability and quality across all workflows

- Define launch and manage cross-functional projects to ensure continued operational excellence within your region

- Act as a global escalation point for your region aligning with all stake-holders to respond to emergency content safety-related cases and provide suitable follow-up reports (root cause analysis and action plan)


Requirements:

- 15+ years of overall experience and 7+ years in Trust & Safety

- Experience leading large scale content moderation operations in an internet company

- Extensive team management experience with both senior contributors and managers

- Experience interfacing with Public Policy Legal and Product teams

- Respect for other cultures and deep empathy for users


Preferred Requirements:

- Proven track record of consistently exceeding operational targets

- In-depth knowledge of the content moderation outsourcing/offshoring business processes and vendor management landscape within your region

- Experience with crisis management

- High comfort with data analysis capable of in-depth interpretation and insights extraction
