Consequently we will be prioritizing candidates who can start in this location by set date as expected. We're keeping the situation under review and would adjust our position should the restrictive measures be removed later on.

Minimum Qualifications
  • Experience in project management driving process improvements and working with cross-functional teams.
  • Experience building tools or automation solutions for operational workflows.
  • Experience coordinating events or managing logistics.
  • Experience building and maintaining relationships with stakeholders/clients.


Preferred Qualifications
  • Experience with team leadership operations management Key Performance Indicators team building coaching and mentoring.
  • Attention to detail and the ability to consistently and positively contribute in a fast-paced changing work environment while prioritizing multiple functions and tasks and manage time efficiently.
  • Demonstrated discretion and excellent judgment with the ability to interact comfortably and professionally with all levels of candidates and clients.
  • Excellent analytical and problem solving skills with the ability to analyze high amounts of data to drive business strategies and decisions.
  • Excellent communication skills a customer-service orientation and a welcoming helpful attitude.


About The Job

Google is known for our innovative technologies products and services — and for the people behind them. Our Recruiting Coordinators within Staffing Services are at the front line of all hiring activities at Google. Whether the team is expertly taking care of our candidates and their bespoke scheduling needs or providing exceptional logistical and travel services they bring a magical experience to every interaction.

Partnering with our recruiters to deliver a candidate-centric hiring experience requires a cool head and expert judgment. In this role you will problem solve in real-time and make data-driven decisions. Focusing on using technology you’re always looking for new ways to improve or automate processes at scale. You possess a highly attentive eye for detail and are passionate about delivering superb client and customer service.

As a Senior Staffing Services Associate you will be a specialist for interviewing operations ensuring a seamless candidate-friendly hiring process. You'll be responsible for keeping interviewing processes organized and efficient while actively maintaining clear lines of communication with recruiters hiring managers and candidates - from entry-level to senior leadership hires. You will work on improving both operational efficiencies and candidate experience to contribute to the overall success of the Staffing team.

Great just isn't good enough for our People Operations team (known elsewhere as "Human Resources"). We bring the world's most innovative people to Google and provide the programs that help them thrive. Whether recruiting the next Googler refining our core programs developing talent or simply looking for ways to inject some more fun into the lives of our Googlers we bring a data-driven approach that is reinventing the human resources field. You’ll play an essential role advancing a more diverse accessible equitable and inclusive Google through our hiring promotion retention and inclusion practices.

Responsibilities
  • Develop tools process improvements and automation solutions focused on improving both operational efficiencies and candidate experience.
  • Manage relationships with key business and Staffing stakeholders to ensure efficiency in the management of the APAC interviews.
  • Develop data-driven strategies and conduct complex data analysis present to peers and managers and highlight trends and insights to influence business decisions.
  • Coordinate complex interview schedules hiring events and organize interviewing logistics liaising with candidates and Googlers across all functions.
  • Partner with leadership to arrange interview schedules and provide an excellent experience for senior leadership candidates.

Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race color ancestry religion sex national origin sexual orientation age citizenship marital status disability gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation please let us know by completing this form .

We are currently looking for a budding Supply Chain fanatic to join the Lazada family managing the Redmart portfolio. This is a fantastic opportunity for young supply chain professional with 1+ years of experience and have a huge passion in Supply Chain Optimization. At Lazada we use technology to delight our customers; we innovate to make our customers’ lives better. As the Supply & Demand Analyst you will be charged to leverage on such technology with your experience knowledge and ideas to ensure an exceptional level of product availability to our customers through effective (SUPPLY) planning (DEMAND) forecasting and management of suppliers’ relationships.


Central to this role is a set of KPIs that you are expected to lead and make change for the products. Having sole ownership and accountability in your portfolio to drive supply chain performances. These KPI include product availability customer fulfilment wastage and inventory level optimisation whilst contributing directly to the business revenue and profitability.

You will manage a range of products and be responsible for improving supplier performance and working closely with Merchandising Marketing Finance and Operations teams. Supply Chain continuous improvement is key. You will use your expertise and knowledge to make change in systems gather insights and improve processes at your disposal.


You will:

● Lead and drive change in your designated portfolio in terms of supply chain optimization.

● Establish strong relationships internally and externally to achieve efficiency of the supply chain.

● Fully own forecast and supply planning across your product range.

● Manage demands of stakeholders internal and suppliers

● Ensure optimal stock levels and availability on the RedMart website

● Follow up on technical and procedural disruptions in the supply chain.

● Analyse promotional seasonal and event plans for your range of products.

● Identify opportunities for process change communicate sound ideas and implement them effectively.

● Report on trends and improve performance for your products and suppliers.

● Meet with suppliers to discuss performance metrics to provide performance feedback or to discuss production forecasts or changes.

● Ensure accurate timely and efficient purchase order management.

● Optimise supply plans while integrating constraints such as inbound capacities product receiving specifications and supplier MOQs.

● Work unsupervised and remotely.


Requirements:

To be successful in this role you must be fast on your feet and focused on getting things done. You must be able to embrace the unexpected and dispense challenges with grace and finesse. You are able to appreciate the need for structure and processes but are also flexible to changes and improvements. Most importantly you care about never ever seeing the words ‘out-of-stock’ on the Redmart website.

An extra awesome candidate will show:

● Perseverance. The pace is fast and challenges will get more complex but we never ever give up.

● A love for numbers. You will see lots of them. You will need to embrace them. Maybe even dream of them.

● Strong attention to detail. Is there a spelling mistake in this document?

● Teamwork and relationship management skills. You will need to work with many internal stakeholders and suppliers to achieve the best possible outcome.

● Sound logic and reasoning even under pressure. Decisions need to be handled rationally in the best interest of our customers and exceptions will need to be managed with extreme discretion.

● Distaste for ignorance. The best decisions are also informed ones. A good supply & demand manager will know his/her portfolio well and will plan according to constraints and/or business requirements.

● Foresight. This role has significant downstream impact and every decision will send ripples throughout the business. We will always need to put the customers first but without creating unsustainable business practices.

● Tolerance for ambiguity and ability to take informed risks. You will not have perfect information and that’s just life. We do not just talk about theories or concepts we implement them in situations that we do not have 100% control.

● Financial savviness. You will be spending the company’s money and making decisions that affect business costs. The weight of this responsibility cannot be overstated.

● Ownership. You will be empowered to make decisions and follow through with all responsibilities.

● Excellent verbal and written communication skills. There is a saying that “if you cannot convince them confuse them”. We do not want confusion so good communication is a must.

● The ability to bend time to your will. Or be really good at time management. There will be lots to do and being ruthless about prioritising is key to getting things done.

● A sense of humour. Because your manager needs one.

● Bachelor’s degree in supply chain business management engineering or other related fields.

● Minimum of 1+ years’ experience within a supply chain planning

● Leadership experience during schooling days

● Experience in FMCG as a retailer or supplier preferred

● Excellent understanding of replenishment and forecasting processes techniques and systems

● Intermediate to advanced level of skill in Microsoft Excel

● Fluent in English and conversant in at least one or more of the major languages: Mandarin Bahasa Melayu or Tamil

Job Title: Process Specialist| Actor Enforcement| Commerce Operations
Job Description:
Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world gives them ways to share what matters most to them and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating solving problems and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.
Commerce Operations is a rapidly growing team within our Global Operations function. Its mission is to build and deliver operations to provide the integrity experience and support for Commerce users across the Facebook Family of Apps. We’re growing this team to develop new operational capabilities to support Facebook’s growing Commerce products and are looking for people with both the passion and ability to build new operational teams processes and programs which focus on supporting the customer experience.We partner closely with several cross-functional teams including product engineering and data science to ensure high quality and safe experiences for both people and businesses across the Facebook family of apps. Successful candidates for this team are adaptable creative have a bias toward action aren't afraid of being wrong and can successfully work across various teams & countries.

  • Demonstrate in-depth knowledge of process design driving efficiencies identifying gaps and implementing scalable solutions and improvements. Apply the experience in a fast paced & growing operations environment for developed and new products
  • Build and maintain workflow processes in response to evolving adversarial behaviors regulatory/policy changes and product iterations
  • Investigate & define clear business problems and prioritize solutions using data-driven analytics developing success metrics to measure project performance and alignment with team mission and goals
  • Drive internal and external process improvements consulting with cross-functional teams to understand needs and pain points related to tools support solve workflow problems and ensure internal tools and automation systems are fully leveraged
  • Partner with Data Science Product Engineering and Operations teams to establish processes for core workflows at scale
  • Become the go-to partner for vendor management and scaled operations teams to understand workflow process and tooling needs across varied review types formats and priorities
  • Bachelor's degree in Business Science Engineering Economics or equivalent practical experience
  • 3+ years experience doing quantitative analysis and process design and development
  • Proficient at designing optimizing and scaling complex and ambiguous processes
  • Experience manipulating large data sets in SQL or equivalent and drawing actionable insights from data
  • Experience communicating with a variety of audiences
  • Demonstrated critical thinking and problem-solving experience at scale
  • 5+ years working in a fast-paced operations environment
  • Experience in at least one scripting language (PHP Python Perl) statistical software (R SAS SPSS) or data visualization tool (Tableau)
  • Experience in the business analysis of processes metrics workflows or operations

Summary
Apple’s Pacific Supply Demand Management (SDM) group is responsible for the finished goods planning for the entire Pacific Region (Asia Australia/New Zealand and Japan). By using both Supply and Demand levers we aim to position products at the right place right time and at optimal cost to maximise end consumer sales and achieve customer satisfaction.


An opportunity exists for a bold highly motivated professional to join the SDM team as a Regional Planner. You will support Pacific Countries on an assigned product in the iPhone Mac iPad Apple Watch and Accessory product lines either as a Supply Planner or Demand Planner.


You will be assigned to either Supply or Demand planning and will be offered the possibility of rotation between these roles as part of our continued career development opportunities.


Key Qualifications
Strong analytical skills meticulous with strong eye for business and consumer focus.

Able to remain focused and work efficiently under pressure while handling multiple tasks

Demonstrate initiative adaptability and problem-solving skills in an ambiguous and dynamic environment

Ability to both think strategically and execute tactically

A persistent attention to detail

High level of comfort in working with numbers

Strong sense of urgency to resolve issues.

Strong knowledge of excel (advanced level) preferred


Description
A Regional Planner plays a highly visible role. The Planner is a conductor within the Operations organization:

- analysing consumer demand and supply production plans

- coordinating new product launch

- rationing/balancing supply during constraints

- managing/positioning inventory forward in all markets

- supporting all Sales actions with sufficient supply


A Planner will provide clear communication with numerous cross functional teams: WorldWide Supply/Demand Management in Cupertino OEMs/Vendors Product Launch Readiness Route to Market (RTM) teams such as Reseller Operations and Retail Fulfilment Operations Logistics Finance Sales and Senior Management.


A Demand Planner will use trend analysis and other forecasting techniques to generate a demand forecast for all routes to market: Apple owned stores (Online and Retail) Online stores and Resellers. The Planner will then use this forecast to derive the most optimal inventory allocation plan and execution according to the plan.


The Supply Planner works with his/her demand counterpart to derive optimal supply and production plan on both short and long term. You will do this while ensuring execution of the plan with WW SDM OEMs and Vendors.


Both Supply and Demand Planners will have to work cross functionally and provide timely updates to Management. By controlling inventory and allocation Planners have a direct influence over the performance of Apple business both top and bottom line for their assigned products within the Pacific region.


Key Deliverables:

- Provide accurate and timely supply demand and inventory position plans to routes to market (RTM) and other teams.

- Handle operational issues associated with supply or demand volatility including - but not limited to - supply constraints production or transportation issues compliance issues or rework unexpected demand swings or market regulatory changes.

- Provide accurate reporting to WW SDM and Executive team.

- Drive support and participate in SDM projects -both regional and global- and provide inputs on process improvements.


Education & Experience
Bachelor Degree (or higher) holder with preferably around 2-4 years of work experience in an analytical role. Preferred background in a high tech or FMCG industry with supply chain management experience. MBA is a plus

Ninja Van is a tech-enabled logistics company on a mission to provide hassle-free delivery services for businesses of all sizes across Southeast Asia. Launched in 2014 we started operations in Singapore and have become the region's largest and fastest growing last-mile logistics company partnering with over 35000 merchants and delivering more than 1000 parcels every minute across six countries.

At our core we are a technology company that is disrupting a massive industry with cutting-edge software and operational concepts. Powered by algorithm-based optimisation dynamic routing end-to-end tracking and a data-driven approach we provide best-of-class delivery services that delight both the shippers and end customers. But we are just getting started! We have much room for improvement and many ideas that will further shape the industry.

About The Job

Our PeopleDev team works hard to ensure every Googler has access to the resources they need to become their best personal and professional selves. We leverage tools technology and innovative formats to scale learning and support Googlers at all stages of their careers — from Noogler Orientation to manager training to leadership development and more. We have four key beliefs about learning — that it is personal social a process and happens in real life — and we infuse these beliefs throughout the wide array of learning and development opportunities at Google. As a PeopleDev team member you'll always be thinking about new ways to help others grow and you share a passion for empowering Googlers to unlock their full potential.

As a Talent and Organizational Development Consultant you will support critical sites leaders and talent. You will be responsible for the acceleration of regional critical talent as well as designing and delivering high quality organizational development solutions aligned to client People Plans and broad Organizational Development strategies. You will work flexibly across many client groups and will demonstrate breadth of expertise across all practice areas.

Great just isn't good enough for our People Operations team (known elsewhere as "Human Resources"). We bring the world's most innovative people to Google and provide the programs that help them thrive. Whether recruiting the next Googler refining our core programs developing talent or simply looking for ways to inject some more fun into the lives of our Googlers we bring a data-driven approach that is reinventing the human resources field. You’ll play an essential role advancing a more diverse accessible equitable and inclusive Google through our hiring promotion retention and inclusion practices.

Responsibilities
  • Lead diagnosis scoping and delivery of complex talent and organizational challenges for Google in the region/market.
  • Make recommendations and influence decisions about the People Operations market Talent and Organizational Development portfolio.
  • Be informed on market insights and priorities including Google-wide business strategy as it relates to market opportunities and challenges.
  • Partner with market/site leads Market HR and the Talent and Organizational Development teams to drive global talent strategy in regions and support critical regional talent needs.
  • Build credibility and be seen as an expert and thought partner to People Operations Directors VPs and Business sponsors in these markets.

WE ARE LOOKING FOR AN OPERATIONS MANAGER WITH FACILITIES MANAGEMENT EXPERIENCE AND/OR TECHNICIAN MANAGEMENT EXPERTISE

TO JOIN A LEADING SERVICES STARTUP.

About Servishero Group

ServisHero has been recognized as one of Southeast Asia’s game-changing apps having been featured on CNN Channel News Asia Forbes and the BBC. The vision of the company is “to increase human productivity and connectivity to uplift lives and businesses in Southeast Asia”. We do this by providing an intuitive consumer application to hundreds of thousands of users across the region as well as deploying workforce management solutions to our network of service providers. In addition to our consumer application we develop innovative solutions to allow large enterprises to deliver amazing customer experiences to their customers including: Allianz Insurance Samsung Eelctronics Sime Darby Property and MQDC Thailand. In 2020 we also launched Disinfection2U which quickly became one of Southeast Asia’s most prominent COVID-19 Prevention and Containment solutions companies.

ServisHero Group (“SHG”) consists of four business units:
  • ServisHero Consumer (B2C)
  • ServisHero for Enterprises (B2B and B2B2C Solutions)
  • WorkMagic (Labour Management SAAS)
  • Disinfection2U.com (Covid-19 Virus Containment Solutions)

SHG is invested in by leading VCs and Enterprises including: Golden Gate Ventures (backers of Carousell Redmart and 99.co) Cradle Seed Ventures YTL Corporation. SHG is led by a leadership team with experience launching and scaling some of the world’s largest technology companies.

JOB INTRODUCTION - OPERATIONS MANAGER

We are looking for an operations manager to join our small but growing Singapore office.

Your Day Will Be Varied And Could Include

This role requires hands-on work - you’ll be managing our network of service providers as well as training and managing a new in-house team of home-service technicians (from handymen to electricians).
  • Managing a deployment of technicians to install air-con system for a large building;
  • Brainstorming on how software systems can be used to enhance operations for building maintenance
  • Managing customer relationships
  • Recruiting and training new technicians.
  • And more!

Working in a fast-paced startup environment the work will be varied and challenging. If you are up for the challenge there is unlimited room for career development.

Responsibilities
  • Managing day-to-day client and supplier operations to ensure superb customer service
  • On-boarding of new vendors
  • Manage train and supervise team of technicians (quality control)
  • Supporting the Founder and Singapore Country Manager to achieve business goals in a wide-range of entrepreneurial activities.


Requirements
  • Experience managing teams of technicians
  • 5+ years Building Maintenance Maintenance Engineering or similar experience
  • Entrepreneurial spirit (you can hustle!)
  • Diploma from technical school or above favourably considered
  • Team spirit; strong communication skills to collaborate with various stakeholders

OUR PEOPLE AND CULTURE

We are a group of extraordinary individuals with a mission to make Southeast Asians more productive through technology. Our team consists of talented people with a wide range of experiences and nationalities. We believe in a culture of Respect Extraordinariness Resilience Integrity Solutions-focus Execution-first.

Please send your resume to info@servishero.com with an accompanying cover letter on why you think you should join us on our mission.

Job Description:

Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world gives them ways to share what matters most to them and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating solving problems and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.
Facebook is looking for a strategic and analytical policy manager with experience in tech/business/government policy and/or risk management to join our Strategic Response Policy team. The team’s mission is to handle policy crisis situations that require cross-functional coordination in order to mitigate serious risks to the company or the community; and to proactively identify current and future risk and develop mitigation plans particularly relating to content issues. The Strategic Response Policy team sits within our Global Content Policy Organisation. You will work with a highly talented and experienced team of subject matter experts on content policies as well as country policy managers Lawyers communications professionals and operational teams. You will need to be adept at managing multiple internal stakeholders balancing differing opinions and perspectives and weighing up risk in order to provide effective policy advice to leadership. Successful candidates will be clear thinkers and excellent communicators who can articulate complex issues in a multi-tasking and fast paced environment. Candidates must be able to work at pace to make difficult decisions under pressure use critical thinking skills have strong written communications and demonstrate strong leadership and interpersonal skills to organize and build relationships with teams across the company. The successful applicant will also be asked to provide insights that contribute to the management of high-risk events that may affect FB and IG and to shape content policies in international markets. For this role we are looking for someone who has a strong understanding of political security or socio-cultural issues in Asia.You should be passionate about Facebook’s values the services we provide and the people we serve across Facebook's family of platforms.This is a full-time position.

  • Lead global cross-functional coordination for high priority Policy escalations and critical incidents working closely with Communications Public Policy Legal Operations and Security teams.
  • Produce and present internal communications for senior leadership to inform them of ongoing situations and provide recommendations and decision support.
  • Proactively identify and assess potential risks and work with policy legal and operational teams to develop risk mitigation approaches and drive cross-functional implementation.
  • Inform content policy development work partnering with subject-matter experts to develop global content policy standards.
  • Bachelor’s degree in public policy law political science international relations risk management or related discipline.
  • 8+ years of experience in policy legal risk or crisis management.
  • Working knowledge of policy issues affecting technology companies.
  • Experience providing decision support and advice to leadership
  • Effective at consensus-building and communicating with internal and external audiences.
  • Experience working on political security or socio-cultural issues in Asia
  • Experience in Trust & Safety Strategic Response or Crisis Management.
  • Experience or knowledge in global Internet/social media content policy issues.
  • Deep specialisation in South East Asia North East Asia or South & Central Asia.

At foodpanda we're on a mission to redefine how tech food people and culture are connected operating in 12 countries worldwide. Our team is working on big challenges and complex scalability problems as we grow 6X annually processing millions of orders a year. You’ll be part of a highly collaborative cross-functional agile squad that always includes frontend and backend engineers design and product owners. Our squads operate in an open and fast-paced environment with very flat structures where everyone has a say.

We work on a large scale complex systems where you can reach users on a global scale whilst enjoying a high level of autonomy and influence and a flexible working environment. Here you can learn thrive and become a better engineer designer and product manager.

Product Analyst APAC

We are looking for a Product Analyst APAC based in our exciting Singapore office to support our growing regional Product and Engineering teams that are based in Singapore. You will be part of an international team of highly talented and motivated people.

As a Product Analyst APAC you will be working closely with the Global Product Analytics team based in Berlin and the Product and Tech squads in Singapore. You will have end-to-end ownership of data: define and implement tracking requirements set up A/B tests analyse large datasets to provide actionable insights and communicate the results to relevant stakeholders. You will be a critical member in defining the product strategy and continued success of foodpanda.

What's On The Menu
  • Tracking & QA: Determine what needs to be tracked and measured. You will be responsible for tracking user interactions and clickstream data to understand customer behaviour.
  • Product Strategy: Evaluate and define product and business KPIs and metrics along with Product Managers and Product Designers.
  • Data Visualization: Democratize data by building customized dashboards & reports for relevant stakeholders.
  • Analysis: Offer deep dive analysis to key stakeholders across all teams and products in order to determine product features and UX optimization strategies.


What You Can Bring To The Table
  • Overall 5 years of experience with at least 4 years of experience specifically in Product Analytics preferably in e-commerce
  • You've completed a degree in statistics mathematics economics computer science or an equivalent education or possess relevant practical experience
  • Very good communication skills in English both written and oral
  • Data Analysis: Strong experience in SQL (BigQuery) and Python (alternatively R)
  • A/B Testing: Experience designing experiments and analyzing results with a solid background in statistics
  • Tracking Technologies: Google Analytics (Preferably IQ certified) or similar alternatives e.g. Adobe Analytics/Omniture SnowPlow etc.
  • Tag Management Systems: Preferably Google Tag Manager or similar alternatives e.g. Tealium Adobe Dynamic Tag Management etc.
  • Data Visualization Technologies: Preferably Google Data Studio or Tableau or similar alternatives e.g. Looker QlikView etc.
  • QA Technologies: Preferably Android Studio Charles Web Debugging Proxy or similar alternatives Observepoint etc.


About Foodpanda

foodpanda (small ‘f’) is the world’s favourite way to order food online from the comfort of your home or office. Whether it’s getting your hands on your favourite pasta kebab or pizza we believe that no one should have to suffer from hunger attacks ever again.

Our parent company Delivery Hero is a global leader in the food delivery industry processing over 3 million orders every day and operating in 40+ markets in the world with 18000 employees and approximately 500000+ restaurant partners. In APAC foodpanda operates in over 150 cities across 12 countries. Trivial problems can always become large technical challenges at scale. If you love technology efficiency and simplicity as much as we do there is no better place to experience this than in foodpanda.

We always genuinely care about experience efficiency and scalability. We do not just solve technical problems but build the foundations for foodpanda’s operations with the best tools on hand.

Summary
The mission of Pacific Reseller Operations is to be the voice of Reseller Channel within Operations to ensure our products are in the right places at the right time supporting Sales and our Partners to achieve Apple’s financial goals. We are focused on managing our supply chain as efficiently as possible in order to maximise sell through while driving for a frictionless order fulfilment experience for our partners.


Within the Reseller Operations team the Order Fulfilment Specialist is responsible for end to end channel order management from order induction to delivery and ensuring transactions in between are SOX and operationally compliant.


Key Qualifications
Real passion for Operations with relevant experience in Order Management / Customer Service / Logistics Services roles.

Self driven but a collaborator with the ability to build and strengthen relationships.

Working knowledge of transactional systems and processes. SAP background preferred.

Demonstrate strong attention to detail and ability to shine under compressed timelines.

Adaptable flexible and open minded to work in a dynamic fast paced environment that undergoes constant change.

Deep understanding of customs and/or regulations within Asian countries.

Familiarity with Project Management methodologies and frameworks.

Ability to communicate read and write in English.

Expertise on productivity tools such as Excel is an added advantage.

Positive energy takes initiative with a thirst for personal growth


Description
Independently process orders/RMA and handle order exceptions (block management NPI conversions cancellation credit/debit notes) according to SOP within set SLAs and SOX requirements.


Manage inbound inquires and provide active close loop communication.


Understand and ensure Key Performance Indicators and order fulfilment goals are met on a consistent basis.


Participate in order fulfilment initiatives/UAT aimed at improving processes and tools and/or systems.


Root cause and work with DRIs on order fulfilment exceptions.


Support New Product Introduction (NPI) execution activities as/when required.

Ninja Van is a tech-enabled logistics company on a mission to provide hassle-free delivery services for businesses of all sizes across Southeast Asia. Launched in 2014 we started operations in Singapore and have become the region's largest and fastest growing last-mile logistics company partnering with over 35000 merchants and delivering more than 1000 parcels every minute across six countries.

At our core we are a technology company that is disrupting a massive industry with cutting-edge software and operational concepts. Powered by algorithm-based optimisation dynamic routing end-to-end tracking and a data-driven approach we provide best-of-class delivery services that delight both the shippers and end customers. But we are just getting started! We have much room for improvement and many ideas that will further shape the industry.

Passionate about high-growth startups and have strong analytical skills? Are you a proven team player strategic thinker and executor? Do you live and breathe to turn large amounts of raw data into meaningful business information? Then let’s talk.

As an early member of Ninja Van's Regional Operations team you will help to develop organisational structure for scale and support operational excellence throughout the region. The ideal candidate for this role should have exceptional analytical skills a marked taste for operational challenges and the ability to present information clearly.

Responsibilities
    • Put together dashboards to monitor performance and to flag potential issues before they become problems for all teams across the region
    • Develop and execute analytical tools to measure operational excellence and be expected to concisely explain both what the numbers are saying and what we should be doing to senior leadership
    • Develop and share best practices to scale operations of cities
    • Coach our growing team of operations managers including supporting local teams for major strategic initiatives and new project launches
    • Develop analytical frameworks for continuous process improvement and to lead subsequent relevant projects
    • Document finalised initiatives into standardised operating procedures expeditiously
    • Lead and manage operations improvement projects to increase efficiencies finalising initiatives into standardised operating procedures expeditiously
    • Communicate product/process needs to HQ work with product/engineering to deliver on them

Requirements
    • Bachelor's Degree from a recognised university
    • At least 3 years of experience in a relevant field
    • Absolute team player with strong communication and organisational skills
    • Possess a data-driven decision mentality to make sound business judgment through strong analytical thinking
    • Balance attention to detail with swift execution - we need to do things quickly and we need to do them well. Balancing those can be challenging and this should be a strength
    • Can do attitude - we are a lean team and many times responsibilities may fall out of one’s exact job description; we are looking for folks that are willing to roll up their sleeves to get the job done
    • Explorer - the ability to self-serve investigate and get the data we require will make you much more effective in this role. Self-starter attitude is a must!
    • Exceptional Excel/data management skills - many say they are great in Excel fewer truly are. Ideal candidate brings some impressive know-how (and the understanding that there’s always more to learn)
    • Willingness to travel for up to 3 days per week

Preferred
    • Experience using SQL

In this role you will be equipped with the skill sets needed in a customised and structured program to bring you up to speed in learning about the business and building relationships with our brands and sellers. You will also work with data that helps us to drive strategic business decisions.

Your background:

Job Title: Strategy and Commercialization Lead| Apps Ads
Job Description:
Due to the current health crisis related to COVID-19 and the escalating visa/travel restrictions in place we're currently unable to extend offers to anyone who cannot work from Singapore due to lockdown visa/travel restrictions or other restrictive measures until further notice. Consequently we will be prioritizing candidates who can start in this location by set date as expected. We're keeping the situation under review and would adjust our position should the restrictive measures be removed later on.

Minimum Qualifications
  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 4 years of experience working in digital marketing.


Preferred Qualifications
  • MBA or similar advanced degree in a management or technical field.
  • Experience presenting to key stakeholders and influencing without authority.
  • Experience working in or with Asia-Pacific markets and exposure to the mobile app and gaming business.
  • Ability to juggle multiple work-streams in a fast-paced environment while paying close attention to detail.
  • Distinctive problem-solving and analysis skills combined with excellent business judgment.
  • Effective communication skills.


About The Job

Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes sizes and market caps and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills you provide Google-caliber client service research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.

As a Strategy and Commercialization Lead you'll create and execute effective Go-to-Market plans that include delivering ad products that satisfy users and advertisers equipping activation specialists and Sales teams to drive adoption and optimal use of those products and also collaborating with Global Product Leads to provide feedback and insights that improve our products and drive further innovation.

In this role you will partner with and influence Sales teams and sales communities to drive adoption and growth of Apps Ads business. This will include building partnerships at various levels of the organization with particular focus on partnering with Global Product Leads and Specialist Sellers.

The Go-to-Market Operations (GtM) team ensures Google's complex and ever-evolving Ads business runs smoothly. We are instrumental in setting go-to-market strategy and ensuring flawless execution and operations against the strategy. We have teams embedded in each of the major Ads business areas as well as global teams that work across the business areas. Team members are analytical and strategic with a pragmatic sense of how to get things done.

Responsibilities
  • Create execute and refine the APAC Go-to-Market strategy for Apps Ads.
  • Drive adoption of key products by influencing and equipping sales specialists sales communities and pods across the organization.
  • Identify gaps in products and build business cases based on advertiser needs. Partner with Global Product Leads on the product roadmap.
  • Partner with cross-functional teams to develop and execute regional programs and initiatives.

Job Title: Platform Policy and Integrity Enforcement Specialist
Job Description:
Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world gives them ways to share what matters most to them and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating solving problems and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.
The Developer Operations team ensures that applications integrated with our platforms are high-quality and trustworthy. Working closely with other Facebook teams we investigate and detect apps not compliant with our Platform Policies. Depending on the nature of the violation and the best user experience we may take a variety of actions; everything from helping the developer/publisher fix the problem to permanently removing the developer/publisher and application from our platform. We are committed to improve the platform experience for users publishers and developers through the use of automated detection tools strategic manual review data analysis guidance and coordination with product teams. Our team is looking for an experienced team player to connect with internal and external teams investigate and take action on violating apps and ensure the best possible experience on our platform. In this position you will interface with internal teams such as Partnerships Policy Legal Marketing and Engineering as well as with external teams. Successful candidates will have strong data skills and a bias toward action enjoy finding patterns amid chaos making quick decisions and are up for a challenge. The position is available in Singapore.

  • Drive strategy to mitigate abuse from malicious developers on the Facebook Platform
  • Proactively investigate suspicious developer behavior and take action where appropriate
  • Leverage critical thinking to effectively prioritize known and unknown potential risk vectors
  • Develop and coordinate with cross functional teams including Legal Policy Product and Engineering to implement enforcement efforts at scale
  • Effectively educate and influence leaders and partners on the enforcement and risk landscape to gain alignment and establish consensus through the use of sound analysis and impact metrics
  • Analyze data and conduct in-depth investigations leveraging large and complex data sets
  • Manage coordinate and support projects within the policy enforcement team
  • Coach and mentor members of our growing Platform Policy team and enhance Developer Operations presence within Singapore
  • BA/BS degree with 8+ years working experience in operations program/project management legal public policy risk management or related fields
  • Strategic thinker self-starter intellectually curious and creative individual comfortable operating in ambiguity
  • Experience building connections within the team through effective communication and collaboration and in delivering results in a goal-oriented environment
  • Leadership and interpersonal skills with a proven track record of building strong relationships with cross-functional teams
  • Experience in analysis by sourcing and driving insights from internal and external data sets and manipulating large data sets in SQL or equivalent to provide business insights and solve for business problems
  • Experience in assessing analyzing and resolving complicated issues and distilling complexity into simple and concise communication in presenting business cases
  • Experience with providing project support by collaborating with project team to establish project goals across multiple projects simultaneously
  • BA/BS or advanced degrees in Economics Information Systems Finance Public Policy Criminal Justice Intelligence Studies International Relations
  • Solid project management skills: create project outlines plans scope timelines and deliverables as well as multitasking and executing projects based on business priorities
  • Experience in coaching mentoring or management
  • Experience in policy abuse investigations consulting or online operations environment
  • Experience in at least one scripting language and/or data visualization tool a plus

Do you love food and convenience put together? Then you just might love foodpanda.


foodpanda is the leading on-demand food delivery company in Singapore bringing thousands of your best loved restaurants online into your home or office - fast! 


Recently foodpanda has launched its own grocery service pandamart delivering more than 3000 SKUs in less than 20m 24/7. We’re all about bringing on the smartest folks as we continue to grow with an “all hands on deck” environment and hire those who can thrive in a startup culture. This role will be based in Singapore and will be reporting to the Head of Operations.


Responsibilities:

  • Lead the warehouse operation team to ensure timely customer orders dispatch accurate inventory management and efficient operations
  • Proactively identify and address process breakpoints and capitalize on process improvement opportunities
  • Provide lead for expansion of foodpanda’s pandamart business by providing planning and strategy for sourcing and new site selection
  • Leverage data by analysing and building key metrics to track evaluate and provide strategic feedback to drive team success and productivity
  • Continuously managing and reviewing SOPs with cross functional teams to develop and optimize plan for warehouse operations supply chain and logistics
  • Build a high performing team to become the central spine of pandamart


Requirements:

  • Degree/Diploma in Logistic/Supply Chain or any other relevant field of studies 
  • At least 4 years of operations experience
  • At least 2 years of experience in logistics/warehouse operations and leading operations teams
  • Programming skills in SQL Python or similar preferred but not a must 
  • Self-motivated and able to work independently
  • Strong business acumen
  • Outstanding communication and people skills


﻿What we offer:

  • Challenging and fulfilling steep learning curve
  • Vibrant dynamic & international workplace
  • Periodic fun & engaging company events & team activities
  • Tasty Thursdays
  • Birthday Leave
  • Work Anniversar(ies) Leave
  • Opportunity to be a value-adding contributor to this fast-growing global company

Summary
Apple is a place where extraordinary people gather to do their best work. Together we create products and experiences people once couldn’t have imagined — and now can’t imagine living without! If you’re excited by the idea of making a real impact and joining a team where we pride ourselves in being one of the most diverse and inclusive companies in the world a career with Apple might be your dream job… Just be prepared to dream big!


An opportunity exists for a highly motivated professional to join the service team within the growing Operations area.


Key Qualifications
At least 4-6 years experience in a planning and/or procurement role

Experience in Reverse Logistics or Service Parts industry is preferable

Able to remain focused and work under pressure prioritize challenging demands and deadlines whilst multi-tasking

Demonstrate initiative flexibility and problem solving skills in a changing dynamic environment

Able to work independently and work with regional and global teams to deliver results

Superb communicator in English; able to communicate in Mandarin fluently -- both verbally and in writing

Ability to work effectively across functions (Materials Quality Engineers Finance & Logistics) and at all levels as well as with virtual teams

Meticulous with a strong business sense and customer satisfaction focus

Experience with SAP in particular R3 MM/PP and Excel is preferred


Description
- Achieve target fill rate minimize backlog and expedite backlog recovery

- Daily update of backlog recovery plan updates

- Manage parts repair turnaround by expediting and streamlining repair cycle and drive parts return from channel

- Manage external goods shipments and receipt resolving discrepancies

- Drive replenishment and local procurement/repair management

- Manage procurement and repair activities validating pricing and payment requirements

- Improve inventory turns reduce new buys by maximizing repairs

- Responsible for inventory accuracy physical reconciliation and drive towards optimum inventory entitlement recommending obsolete and excess inventory for disposition

- Prepare reporting for Inventory & Excess Repair Cycle Time Backlog Status and Production Order for management review

- Maintain data integrity and system data

- Work with Global Materials and Engineering for material changes


MEASUREMENTS

- Fill Rate > 97%

- No Aging Back Orders > 10 days

- Overall Backlog < 225 units

- Inventory Turns > 6

- KBBI Inventory < 1 WIOH

- No Past Due Payment > 45 days (excluding discrepancy invoicing)

- No Past Due Open POs > 5 days

- OTV Reconciliation: reconcile all discrepancies

- No overdue PR Conversions


Education & Experience
Masters/Bachelors degree ideally however applicants with 3-5 years relevant experience in this area will also be considered.

We also take affirmative action to offer employment and advancement opportunities to all applicants including minorities women protected veterans and individuals with disabilities. Job Description:

The Singapore Operations team oversees shapes and grows the business in Grab Singapore. We contribute towards Grab’s vision of being Southeast Asia’s superapp by providing everyday services that matter most to consumers in Singapore. We develop and execute business strategies that help us achieve our vision in serving our community.

As part of the Singapore Operations team the GrabFood team looks at connecting Singapore eaters and customers to the vast array of merchants (from the familiar favorites to the up and coming stars) within our sunny island-home of Singapore through our many delivery-partners.

Be part of the dynamic Merchant Acquisition team which is responsible for acquiring and growing GrabFood’s huge and diverse merchant network to bring even more exciting brands value and options to eaters in Singapore!

Get to know the role:
Oversee the entire process within merchant acquisition and onboarding

The day-to-day activities:

  • Meet pitch and lead negotiations with assigned/prospected merchant leads to acquire and onboard them unto GrabFood
  • To market and champion GrabFood’s strong value proposition as the leader of choice for merchants
  • Deal with merchants from a diverse range of F&B establishments - Local Heroes Hotel Groups Cafe & Restaurant chains and Michelin awarded establishments
  • Build relationships/partnerships with merchants and manage their performance and contribution to building the GrabFood merchant network
  • Handle day-to-day merchant queries (commercial & operational) and ensure a smooth and efficient onboarding and post-onboarding process
  • Be accountable for merchant activity and engagement throughout the merchant’s onboarding journey
  • Keep abreast of market and industry knowledge as well as competitor activity in order to contribute to strategies in meeting market changes and merchants’ requirements
  • Develop and maintain a solid understanding of all products and services Grab offers
  • Work closely with the Account Management Team and other verticals (e.g. GrabPay GrabAds GrabRewards) to align and cross-sell elevating the value GrabFood brings to merchants

The must haves:

  • Bachelor’s Degree or higher education in business economics or relevant fields
  • 2 to 3 years of experience in sales and/or business development with a successful track record
  • Excellent interpersonal and negotiation skills to build rapport and win over merchants
  • Excellent communication skills in both written and spoken English. Proficiency in Mandarin is an advantage
  • Good creativity resourcefulness and problem-solving skills
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office (MS. Excel MS. Word and MS. Powerpoint)
  • Good business acumen comfortable with numbers and analysing sales data
  • A team player but also able to work independently
  • Self-driven motivated and entrepreneurial; ability to own outcomes and make things happen
  • Upbeat and passionate about making an impact to the business and stakeholders.
  • Accountable and responsible in discharging duties
  • Ability to be flexible and adapt quickly in a fast-paced environment
  • F&B industry background is an advantage

Job Title: Senior Manager - Operations Transformation (Japan Collaboration) - SG
Job Description:
At Deloitte we offer a unique and exceptional career experience to inspire and empower talents like you to make an impact that matters for our clients people and community. Deloitte offers you a highly inclusive collaborative workplace and unrivalled opportunities to realize your full potential. We are always looking for people with the relentless energy to push themselves further and to find new avenues and unique ways to reach our shared goals.

Work you will do

We are seeking exceptional highly skilled individuals to join Japanese Client Services / Japan SEA Collaboration .

Recognizing the strong momentum of investment by Japanese companies’ in ASEAN our Consulting groups in Southeast Asia and Japan launched a collaboration in 2012 to provide a wide range of business consulting services for over 100 Japanese clients across the region including some of the biggest manufacturing companies in the world.

In response to the expansion of Japanese businesses in Southeast Asia there have been numerous collaboration initiatives between Deloitte Southeast Asia and Japan since 2012. Now there are over 100 consultants of diverse nationalities across the ASEAN region focusing on Japanese clients. We also have a joint training program for new consultants and through the engagements with multinationals and ASEAN companies we are able to build their capabilities and experience and provide our people with meaningful experiences and a unique career path.

Technology does not stand still. It takes innovative approaches to transform modernize and run existing technology platforms. The key is knowing when to take advantage of the new technologies to drive product and service enhancements improve financial performance and accelerate speed to market.

When it’s time to reinvent how the wheels turn in your organization—to react innovate and reconfigure your business our Operations Transformation professionals’ deep sector knowledge coupled with our operational and technical expertise bring your strategy to life in delivering lower-cost more effective and fit-for-the-future operations that underpin profitable growth. We plan and deploy game-changing cognitive and digital technology to reduce costs maximize efficiency transform payments and revenue processes and benefit from innovative and emerging business models.

You will support our clients in their transformation journey by:
  • Identifying opportunities for efficiencies in work process and innovative approaches to completing scope of work.
  • Participating in team problem solving efforts and offer ideas to solve client issues.
  • Conducting relevant research data analysis and create reports.
  • Maintaining responsibility for completion and accuracy of work products.
  • Assessing restructuring operating models organizational structures and business processes to streamline core operations’ service delivery.
  • Assisting in proposal development as requested.
  • Actively expanding consulting skills and professional development through training courses mentoring and daily interaction with clients.


If You Are Someone With

 Enough about us let's talk about you
  • Minimum tertiary qualification in a business or finance discipline.
  • Minimum 12 Years of working experience in a transformation or consulting role in Financial Services industry for front/middle/back-office processes market infrastructure regulations instruments and products.
  • Experience leading business model design and implementation with exposure to banking sectors
  • Experience with budgetary responsibilities related to projects or resources.
  • Demonstrated ability to write clearly succinctly and in a manner that appeals to a wide audience.
  • Ability to build consensus and foster change in ambiguous settings.
  • Exceptional interpersonal team-building and communication skills.
  • Sense of responsibility to self team and client.
  • Proven experience effectively prioritizing workload to meet deadlines and work objectives.
  • Ability to travel (both locally and abroad) for short-term and long-term project assignment.
  • Proficiency in the Japanese language (Business Level) due to regional project requirements.

The role of Shopee's Regional Operations (Logistics and Warehouse) team is to deliver an excellent experience to buyers and sellers in three areas: (1) swift and accurate shipment of orders from Shopee's warehouses (2) reliable delivery of orders by Shopee's in-house delivery team (Shopee Express) and outsourced delivery service providers and (3) customized fulfillment options and timely order status updates served on the Shopee platform.

E-commerce fulfillment is challenging for Shopee as we deliver millions of orders daily while facing physical and transportation infrastructure constraints. Your work will help maintain Shopee's competitive advantage in this function which is of high importance to our overall business.

What you will be doing:

  • Learn the following skills and knowledge to a high standard: (1) data analytics using large data sets (2) e-commerce platform features (3) e-commerce fulfillment operations (4) business strategy and operations planning (5) project management and (6) effective communications. Your projects will often have a regional scope giving you the opportunity to learn the unique characteristics of each market that Shopee operates in
  • Examples of our projects are: (1) creating a quarterly performance report card with improvement recommendations for each outsourced delivery service provider (2) long-term infrastructure planning for Shopee warehouses (3) identifying buyers whose orders are late or likely to be delayed and recommending the message to display to these buyers via the Shopee app (4) implementing a system to measure and reduce the average distance that Shopee warehouse staff have to walk to retrieve items that have been ordered and (5) improving buyer satisfaction with Shopee Express by identifying and coaching staff that have not followed the established process
  • You will be regularly visiting interesting overseas locations to understand the details of Shopee's e-commerce fulfillment operations. These site visits and interactions with on-site staff are essential to your work because each Shopee warehouse Shopee Express facility and outsourced delivery service provider facility is unique in terms of size layout equipment shift schedule and work processes
  • We place a lot of emphasis on mentor-ship and knowledge sharing. Your managers and teammates will invest significant time to impart their skills and knowledge to you and we expect you to do the same to help future new hires


Requirements:

  • Proficient in data analysis using SQL and/or Python
  • Strong evidence of leadership qualities and ability to deliver excellent results from relevant work experiences co-curricular activities or internships
  • Strong logical thinking skills especially in breaking down an objective into smaller components that can be independently solved
  • Excellent judgement in assessing a situation from other stakeholders' perspectives and hence recommended practical solutions
  • Fluency in English and an additional SEA language is a plus to communicate with SEA market stakeholders
  • Experienced hires with relevant experience in e-commerce logistics (delivery services or warehousing) will be preferred
  • Strong verbal and written communication

Summary
Our team is looking for a project manager to join our Business Process Re-engineering (BPR) group to support the S/4 HANA transformation for the PAC Operations organization working closely together with counterparts in other regions and World Wide.


Are you a strategic thinker who excels at tactical execution? Do you love to solve problems and have an uncanny knack for process optimisation and transformation? As part of our BPR group you will be responsible for implementing strategies tools and processes that enable the business to grow increase efficiencies and drive innovation while improving customer experience. These solutions are typically new technical capabilities and/or the transformation of business processes to support a continuously evolving supply chain. You will be delivering key initiatives that support a broad cohesive operations supply chain strategy.


Key Qualifications
Led projects in transformation for SAP S/4 HANA for Quote to Cash Procure to Pay Make to Build Supply Chain Enablement Customer / Vendor / Material Master Security and roles etc.

Experience with Operations and various Supply Chain functions (Quote to Cash Procure to Pay Make to Deliver Inventory management Forecasting and Reverse Logistics) preferably in the Hi-tech industry

Prior experience in driving process improvement projects

Prior experience in SDLC project management and analysis including scoping / timeline management documenting use cases process flows/swim lane diagrams requirements (BRD) etc UAT change management etc.

Strong communication and presentation skills flexible open working style and an ability to establish trust and credibility quickly.

Self-motivated individual who thrives working in a global matrixed fast-paced environment.

Experience working on projects with multi-cultural multi-regional teams.

Led efforts in solution designs that are scalable stable and efficient with a focus on customer / business voice.

Experience with Project Management methodologies (Agile/Scrum Waterfall)


Description
- We work closely with the business teams to become functional leaders in key supply chain processes and related solutions needs. This includes cross functional processes for enabling OEM onboarding Distribution Centers Logistics Carriers Forecasting and Planning processes Inventory Management Order management including allocation optimisation and fulfilment Reverse logistics Manufacturing setup and management include FAI Quality & defect management Recall processes for quality excursion Product Life cycle management Engineering BOM management and Part setup processes.

- Understanding and analysing the business problems at the root and not just solving for the symptom is critical to the success of this role. You will focus on recommending process innovation and efficiencies through process analysis; use cases observations industry trends standard methodologies (Design Thinking Six Sigma Lean) leading-edge technology and process improvement ideas to challenge the status quo and deliver extraordinary customer-focused solutions.

- Lead technology projects through the full Software Development Life Cycle - from mobilisation to problem definition scoping requirements design business readiness testing and implementation.

- Primary focus will be projects related to S/4 HANA supply chain transformation.

- Negotiate with cross-functional teams and business partners to remove barriers and drive results without compromising the overall quality of the end deliverable.

- Engage with leadership business partners and engineering teams to develop a project timeline key achievements and a communication plan (stakeholder management).

- Prepare the business for the change: Ensuring from the very start of the project there is a change management plan in place and post project sustainment.

- Ensure project objectives have been met and proper project closure with complete lessons learned.


Education & Experience
Bachelor degree or equivalent in Business management Computer Science Engineering or related discipline required.


Additional Requirements
Preferred: PMP Six Sigma certification SAP ECC (SD/MM) S/4 HANA

Job Description:

Get to know our Team:

GrabAds is bringing to market innovative first-of-a-kind advertising products. Encompassing both offline & online you can see our ads platform at work on the outside & inside of vehicles and also in our app. What you can’t see is the data that powers the ads and pretty much everything else at Grab. We’re leveraging our unique data and large growing user base to offer an advertiser experience like no other. At the same time we’re creating value for our users drivers & merchant partners.

Get to know the Role:

As Senior Associate Sales Enablement with GrabAds you will deliver training content and best practises to the Sales teams so they would be able promote and deliver advertising services to Grab’s ecosystem participants. You’ll work directly with the Sales Enablement Manager and cross-functionally with Sales Leaders from GrabAds and Marketing team to package compelling advertising solutions for broad adoption. Key KPIs for this role include reducing ramp-up time for sales team updating sales team product knowledge for both existing and newly launched products increasing sales deals velocity.

The day-to-day activities:

  • Create and deploy appropriate training content/sales messaging processes and best practices to support the sales force.
  • Responsible for aspects of foundational and continuous learning programs for salesincluding but not limited to training content creation scheduling and delivery of the training
  • Create written content to educate the sales team and advance deals such as case studies competitive information fact sheets product collateral and custom work.
  • Supports product launches by preparing and enabling the sales force to understand and sell our solutions.
  • Train sales team on best use of marketing and sales enablement materials. Coaching them on key sales skills and competencies.
  • Customer facing activity from time to time assist on sales calls and demos as needed. Field ad hoc content and support requests from the sales team.
  • Manage the sales enablement content repository and ensure that all information is easily and readily accessible at point of need.
The must haves:

  • Min. 4-7 years in sales and marketing-related roles (sales enablement operations marketing)
  • Sound understanding & experience of sales processes in digital Ads Ecosystem both Online & Offline
  • Knowledge of sales training best practices (analysis instructional design delivery implementation and evaluation)
  • Experience leveraging sales enablement tools (CRM Content Marketing Automation etc…)
  • Demonstrated experience designing implementing and enforcing cross functional processes
  • Excellent communication & presentation skills with the ability to transmit across different level stakeholders
  • Analytical with a strong bias for data-based decisions
  • Team Player with the ability to work across a matrix environment in a fast paced environment
  • Strong organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple concurrent project

Responsibilities
  • Monitoring and Reporting
  • Monitor and track lead time and service quality at every leg of the parcel lifecycle and preparing SLA/inventory reports for both internal and external stakeholders
  • Using the In-House WMS system monitor the data accuracy and generate weekly audit reports.
  • Compile data for biweekly P&L review and periodic budget preparation
  • Generate and confirm the accuracy of invoices bills and other related charges
  • Maintain records and generate reports related to vendors and cross border shipping inbound and outbound from Singapore
  • Perform any other administrative duties related to cross border shipping
  • Coordination
  • Communicate and coordinate with third party vendors and agent
  • Maintain open communication from vendors and clients and perform first level of problem analysis and solutioning
  • Coordinate with warehouse and fulfilment department for Cross Border related operational issues

  • Strong project management and execution abilities.

Summary
The APAC Inbound team is seeking to hire a Senior Business Analyst. The role will be focusing on optimisation projects cross-country initiatives and system developments while encompassing all aspects of International Air & Ocean Bulk operations within the PAC region. The position is based in Singapore and reports to the Senior Manager Inbound. The successful candidate will have a strong background in Air & Ocean operations as well as analytical skills with the ability to dissect data and understand operational capabilities and limitations in order to develop and lead change in line with Apple’s overall Supply Chain goals. This role will require the person to work with various internal partners as well as external suppliers.


Key Qualifications
Solid background in Air & Ocean operations preferably with experiencing in Freight Forwarding or in managing 3PL suppliers

Analytical person with the ability to quickly understand business processes and business drivers

Affinity and experience in operational systems & tools e.g. Transport Management Systems (TMS)

Ability to manage complex projects in a matrix organization

A desire to operate hands on in the role and have excellent verbal analytical written organizational and interpersonal skills

The appetite of a self-starter who is motivated and innovative with a high tolerance of stress in managing multiple priorities and meeting all deadlines

Strong communication skills in English

Ability to travel within APAC and internationally


Description
The successful candidate will be expected to drive assigned projects & initiatives within the APAC Inbound space. These could be APAC specific or under World Wide scope and focus on process or system changes and other optimisations. The person will form part of the APAC Inbound team and work hand in hand with the Regional Supplier Managers who are managing the day to day operations and 3PL suppliers by country. A key part of the role will be to understand and demonstrate the existing Supply Chain concepts and opportunities with a view to drive improvements and standardisations across the region including relevant systems & tools. The candidate will manage the implementation of initiatives on behalf of the entire APAC Inbound team and work closely with the relevant internal and external partners such as Supply Chain and Business Process Re-engineering (BPR) teams. The person will drive innovative and challenging thinking in our approach to Bulk supply chains. Self-Motivated evaluation of current business processes and identification of opportunities to improve will be critical in this role. The candidate must be able to present comprehensive proposals for enhancements based on investigations & analysis undertaken as well as collaboration and brain storming within the Inbound team. The role also includes engagement with Finance to focus on the identification of supply chain cost challenges and opportunities by product and by route to market. The person has a strong ability to maintain and develop relationships within a project and the overall PAC Logistics team.


Education & Experience
Bachelor or equivalent degree with emphasis on logistics and supply chain as well as 5 years of relevant working experience


Additional Requirements
Prior experience with Transport Management Systems (TMS) is beneficial

Job Title: Key Account Manager - Commercial Grab Food
Job Description:
Job Description:

Job Description:

The Singapore Operations team oversees shapes and grows the business in Grab Singapore. We contribute towards Grab’s vision of being Southeast Asia’s superapp by providing everyday services that matter most to consumers in Singapore. We develop and execute business strategies that help us achieve our vision in serving our community.

As part of the Singapore Operations team the GrabFood team looks at connecting Singapore eaters and customers to the vast array of merchants (from the familiar favorites to the up and coming stars) within our sunny island-home of Singapore through our many delivery-partners.

Get to know the role:

As a Key Account Manager you will be responsible in establishing and managing strong business relationships with existing and potential top 50 relationships to drive growth for GrabFood and merchants. You will lead all elements of business identification strategy partnerships account management and execution strategy.

The day-to-day activities:

Working with the Head of Business Development on GrabFood business development strategy

Drive growth in key accounts as measured by deliveries and GMV

Excellent communication skills in both written and spoken English
