Job Title: Market Specialist| GO Markets| South-East Asia
Job Description:
Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world gives them ways to share what matters most to them and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating solving problems and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.
GO Markets' focus is on supporting our users through both direct support interactions as well as scalable solutions and on improving the health of our products by helping people understand how to use them. Those who join our teams are very passionate about solving people’s issues and are strong advocates for the Facebook community. We need influencers who can align cross-functional partners to ensure the best possible experience for our platforms. If you like helping people GO Markets is for you.

The GO Markets team is seeking a solutions-oriented data-savvy Market Specialist who is passionate about providing a great support experience for our community of users. The successful candidate will work with the South East Asia markets team to review content reported for potential abuse resolve user account issues improve the overall support experience for that market as well as solve thematic global issues. The Market Specialist will be part of a data-driven analysis culture and will also help scale our operations by optimising and automating processes solving challenging problems and most importantly helping to prevent them. This position is full time and is based in our Singapore office.

  • Liaise closely with our vendors to ensure all operational KPIs meet and exceed targets and work collaboratively to improve processes and tools and scale solutions
  • Analyze key metrics to improve our operational workflows
  • Be the Subject Matter Expert and Go-to-Person for specific complex topics
  • Use market specific knowledge signals and insights to spot and scope scalable solutions to improve the support of our community of users in the Malaysia & Singapore markets
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to improve our processes and tools
  • Use your problem solving skills to resolve large and complex business problems
  • Remain up to date on key workflow changes operational guidelines policy updates and our Community Standards
  • Investigate and resolve issues that are reported on Facebook such as requests for account support and reports of potentially abusive content including but not limited to graphic images videos and writings offensive or derogatory language and other objectionable material
  • Bachelors degree and/or masters or equivalent experience
  • 2+ years of professional experience within an operations environment
  • Strategic thinker with strong analytical and creative problem-solving skills
  • Passion for supporting the Facebook and Instagram community
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills
  • Self-starting intellectually curious and creative individual comfortable operating in a fast-paced ever changing environment
  • Native fluency in written and conversational English is essential
  • Native fluency in written and conversational Bahasa Melayu or Mandarin is required
  • Technical and data skills such as Excel and SQL are a plus

Ninja Van is a tech-enabled logistics company on a mission to provide hassle-free delivery services for businesses of all sizes across Southeast Asia. Launched in 2014 we started operations in Singapore and have become the region's largest and fastest growing last-mile logistics company partnering with over 35000 merchants and delivering more than 1000 parcels every minute across six countries.

At our core we are a technology company that is disrupting a massive industry with cutting-edge software and operational concepts. Powered by algorithm-based optimisation dynamic routing end-to-end tracking and a data-driven approach we provide best-of-class delivery services that delight both the shippers and end customers. But we are just getting started! We have much room for improvement and many ideas that will further shape the industry.

The Cross-Border Solution team’s objective is to build a world-class transport product to support the various sales teams in winning new deals. He/she is accountable for the development of transportation solutions and to deal with internal and external stakeholders frequently. As a member of the Cross-Border Solutions team the incumbent will be working closely with Project Managers and Regional Solution Manager in driving growth and adoption of cross border products.

Responsibilities
    • Assist Project Managers with the onboarding process and management of vendor
    • Assist Project Managers with developing and implementing processes for new business initiatives / new products from time to time
    • Prepare weekly and monthly reports for the product’s usage and performance
    • Responsible for process mapping and design for existing and proposed operational activities
    • Manage all order enquiries (restrictions rates documents) from different sales channels
    • Communicate with East Asia (EA) vendors via Wechat or email on order enquiries and shipment arrangements
    • Support operations of new Cross Border East Asia (EA) solutions and coordinate first mile shipments
    • Update shipment trackers and monitored backlogs to ensure shipment visibility
    • Work on process improvement projects (e.g. SOPs Restriction List) to streamline cross border's practices with internal and external stakeholders
    • Assist to maintain Standard Operating Procedures and vendor contracts pricing SLA within Solution team

Requirements
    • Bachelor degree in any related field
    • Applicants with minimal work experience but possess strong extra-curricular and internship records are welcomed to apply
    • Working knowledge of MS Word Powerpoint Excel
    • Team player with strong communication and organisational skills - you are able to interact with people at all levels of the organisation
    • Strong analytical skills
    • Able to multi-task with different projects at the same time and focus on meeting deadlines
    • Require to speak mandarin as need to communicate with overseas vendors
    • Self-starter attitude is a must
    • Must be willing to get hands dirty

Submit a job application

Job Title: Manager - Supply Chain & Network Operations - SG
Job Description:
At Deloitte we offer a unique and exceptional career experience to inspire and empower talents like you to make an impact that matters for our clients people and community. Whatever your aspirations Deloitte offers you a highly inclusive collaborative workplace and unrivalled opportunities to realize your full potential. We are always looking for people with the relentless energy to push themselves further and to find new avenues and unique ways to reach our shared goals.

Work you’ll do

Living in a technology world that is fast-paced gone are the days where we used to do things manually. As everything is now connected we now have conversations about Digital Supply Network instead of just about Supply Chain. Technology plays a key role in enabling this. There are many emerging technologies around us - too many in fact; thus one of our role as consultants is to help client mix & match the right tools to enable their ambition and to allow them to have a connected technology landscape.

We want to build a team of supply chain specialists centered on having capabilities in supply chain technologies. We will provide you with a strong and structured career development roadmap to become a Supply Chain Technology expert.
  • Leadership role in at least one of the following function: Supply Chain Strategy Supply Chain Planning Manufacturing Strategy & Operations Sourcing & Procurement Logistics & Distribution.
  • As a senior member of this team you will pursue & lead engagements leveraging various supply chain technologies to help our clients develop and implement strategies and operational improvement projects within their own organization as well as within their extended supply chain with suppliers and channel partners.
  • Responsible for project delivery leadership involved in business development and delivering strong proposals.
  • Responsible for developing thought leadership and eminence addressing the latest in supply chain innovation and digital supply chain.
  • Responsible for supporting the further shaping of the supply chain practice developing and training professional supply chain Technology practitioners across multiple competencies and South East Asian markets.
  • You will use your creativity and knowledge to define the future of supply chain technological landscape leveraging on the art of possible in today’s digital supply chain (e.g. IoT Mobility Cybersecurity Analytics).
  • Work with a variety of high-profile clients across key industries such as Consumer Business Process and Hi-Tech Manufacturing and Energy & Resources.
  • You will work with the senior leadership team to assess evaluate and onboard external Supply Chain Technology Partners/Vendors into our offering.


Your role as a leader

In Addition To Living Our Purpose Managers Across Our Firm Are Expected To

At Deloitte we believe in the importance of empowering our people to be leaders at all levels. We expect our people to embrace and live our purpose and shared values challenging themselves everyday to identify issues that are most important to our clients our people and the communities and to make an impact that matters.
  • Understand the goals of Deloitte align our people to these objectives by setting clear priorities and direction by establishing a positive relationship with a senior stakeholders.
  • Influence teams and individuals positively. Lead by example and provide equal opportunity for people to grow develop and succeed.
  • Delivers exceptional client service. Maximizes results and drives high performance from people while fostering collaboration across businesses and geographies.
  • Manage diverse teams within a highly inclusive team culture where people are respected and valued for their contribution.
  • Develop high-performing teams through challenging and meaningful opportunities and recognize them for the impact that they make.


If You Are Someone With

Enough about us let's talk about you
  • University level degree with strong numerical analytical and excellent story boarding skills.
  • A strong sense of business acumen and ability to write a business case.
  • Minimum 8 years of experience in Supply Chain functions preferably a balanced mix of consulting and industry experience.
  • Ability to quickly identify business challenges and to focus on delivering results and generating business value across different Supply Chain functions.
  • Experience in project delivery environment including but not limited to pace of delivery organizational & people change management stakeholder management.
  • Ability to identify and convert leads into on-sell / cross-sell opportunities write winning proposals and lead bid teams.
  • Excellent interpersonal communication skills and presentation skills (including exposure to public forums / larger audiences)..
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English and in local languages.
  • Working experience in one or more South East Asian countries and travel mobility to serve regional and /or international clients.
  • Manager level candidate must have prior experience in leading multiple medium to large engagements for clients


Next Steps

So what are you waiting for? Join the winning team now.

Due to volume of applications we regret only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Requisition ID: 27226

In Singapore the services are provided by Deloitte and other related entities in Singapore("Deloitte in Singapore") which are affiliates of Deloitte Southeast Asia Ltd. Deloitte Southeast Asia Ltd is a member firm of Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu Limited. Deloitte in Singapore which is within the Deloitte Network is the entity that is providing this Website.

Job Title: Sales - Retail Partners Programs Development Manager
Job Description:
Summary
The people here at Apple don’t just build products — they craft the kind of wonder that’s revolutionized entire industries. It’s the diversity of those people and their ideas that inspires the innovation that runs through everything we do from amazing technology to industry-leading environmental efforts. Join Apple and help us leave the world better than we found it!


The WW Channel Strategy & Operations (WW CSO) team is responsible for the strategic management of Apple’s global channel programs across various routes to market. Apple’s main channel RTM include Telco Consumer Electronics / Mass Merchants mono-brand retail stores and online retailers and marketplaces. We develop retail programs solving for sales customer experience and branding while considering global scale.


As the Retail Programs Development Manager you are an outstanding passionate collaborative and self-driven individual who manage multiple concurrent program deployment and to launch and refresh Apple point of sale throughout the Carrier Channels in South Asia; whilst ensuring that Apple merchandising standards are understood deployed and delivered to schedule by all channel partners and vendors


Key Qualifications
A strong passion and background in retail sales and merchandising understands the key tenets of branding pays outstanding attention to details and passion for Apple’s ecosystem.

Extensive knowledge of the South Asian Telco market and the key players within and go above and beyond with the partners.

You keep current on retail technology trends merchandising trends and in-store opportunities

Outstanding and validated capacity to successfully balance multiple concurrent projects according to scope budget and timeline

Tried and tested ability to handle lead and co-ordinate site managers sub-contractors vendors and all associated resources involved in project delivery.

Demonstrated excellence in project management standards (i.e. progress reports resource management risk identification and mitigation etc.)

Perform well in fast paced situations and are comfortable in a fast-paced sometimes ambiguous environment.

Extensive practical experience in project management of store fit-outs and fixture installations in retail with a keen eye and passion in customer experience.

Excellent written verbal communication and presentation skills.

Proficient in Keynote Pages/Word and Excel.


Description
The role is highly collaborative requiring deep levels of cooperation and influential working relationships. The incumbent will partner with WW regional and country teams and external partners to ensure the channel programs under their management are deployed effectively and in line with the requirements of the channel partner and the sales strategy.


Developing and managing multiple concurrent merchandising and retail programs throughout their lifecycle; including retailer negotiations design budget management supplier liaison and execution; are primary functions of this role. Further and equally important is the ability to proactively manage changes in project scope identifying potential risks and creatively solves problems and executes flawlessly the program deliverables.


High level planning tracking and management reporting associated with store roll-outs and forward deployments of stores are also important aspects of the role


Education & Experience
You have a Bachelor’s degree or equivalent education.


Additional Requirements
Apple is an Equal Opportunity Employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We also take affirmative action to offer employment and advancement opportunities to all applicants including minorities women protected veterans and individuals with disabilities. Apple will not discriminate or retaliate against applicants who inquire about disclose or discuss their compensation or that of other applicants.


We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process to perform essential job functions and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

Job Description:

Get to know our Team:

The Singapore Operations team oversees shapes and grows the business in Grab Singapore. We contribute towards Grab’s vision of being Southeast Asia’s superapp by providing everyday services that matter most to consumers in Singapore. We develop and execute business strategies that help us achieve our vision in serving our community. As part of the Singapore Operations team this role sits in the Grab Transport team. The team is responsible for outserving the needs of our customers.

Get to know the Role:

The Manager Special Projects (Transport) is in charge of embarking on new and untested initiatives that will strategically strengthen the core capabilities of the organization.

The Manager Special Projects (Transport) will be responsible to:

  • Work with stakeholders from the entire organization to ensure flawless and timely delivery of projects
  • Partner closely with Product Business and Regional teams to execute and/or prove these new ideas.
  • Have a combination of data focused analytical thinking strong communication skills and the ability to develop effective processes combined with customer obsessed policies that resonate with our users.
What you will do:

You will be in charge of exploring supporting and embarking on new growth initiatives that benefit the Grab Transport ecosystem along with adjacent areas. You will do this by:

  • Create and Build Awesome Business Cases that identify opportunities size markets and make killer presentations that aid the team to make better decisions and wow the crowd.
  • Exhibit Thought Leadership and drive discussions for alignment across teams within the organization and external stakeholders
  • Innovate and formulate new ideas independently while understanding and creatively thinking of ways to overcome obstacles
  • Develop Executeand Track comprehensive projects ensuring timely delivery within allocated resources
What you need to have:

  • Intellectual Curiosity - You are curious about how things work and obsessed at looking for ways to improve and innovate. You keep asking why and continuously challenge it.
  • Customer Empathy - The ability to quickly change perspective between existing users new users and different stakeholders to come up with the best decisions for them.
  • Data driven - You use quantitative analysis to drive decisions using data to build use cases. Data analysis and strong excel skills are a MUST
  • Process driven - You have a structured way of thinking and solving a problem so you can teach and train other people (define measure analyze improve and control). What you have learnt will be created into a process so you quickly pull it out for analysis when you need it.
  • Excellent communication skills - The ability to listen read write and speak fluently in English is critical as you will be the voice of Hitch to our internal teams and users.
  • Take Charge - You get stuff done. High Energy Passionate self-driven and deeply committed to taking Hitch to the next level. You rise to the occasion to solve problems on your own and have the ability to do so constantly in an ever changing environment.
  • Ability to handle pressure - “The only constant is change” Having the ability to stay calm and assess the situation under difficult unpredictable and fast changing circumstances. Able to make appropriate and assess short term vs long term decisions.
  • Resilience - Keep going not be discouraged when things do not go as planned.
Background and preferred qualifications:

  • Experience in working with a driven high performing diversified and motivated team
  • Operations or Product Management with experience improving and automating processes is a plus
  • 4-6 years of related work experience

Ninja Van is a tech-enabled logistics company on a mission to provide hassle-free delivery services for businesses of all sizes across Southeast Asia. Launched in 2014 we started operations in Singapore and have become the region's largest and fastest growing last-mile logistics company partnering with over 35000 merchants and delivering more than 1000 parcels every minute across six countries.

At our core we are a technology company that is disrupting a massive industry with cutting-edge software and operational concepts. Powered by algorithm-based optimisation dynamic routing end-to-end tracking and a data-driven approach we provide best-of-class delivery services that delight both the shippers and end customers. But we are just getting started! We have much room for improvement and many ideas that will further shape the industry.

Ninja Direct leverages Ninja Van’s pan-regional logistics network to provide small and medium businesses with comprehensive upstream services with the goal of supporting their business. The business unit has seen triple-digit growth over the past year and we are looking to expand our team to lead our business growth across the region.

As a Commercial Strategy Analyst you will drive Ninja Direct’s commercial performance by making proactive recommendations and deriving actionable insights through the analysis of complex data sets. You will also be responsible for empowering our commercial teams through dashboards and customized reports. Over time you will be given direct ownership over various commercial initiatives and work directly with senior leadership in the development and execution of the business’ commercial strategy. This is an exciting opportunity for an entrepreneurial and driven individual to be part of the growth of a fast-growing new business unit within Ninja Van.

Responsibilities
    • Play an active role in the development and implementation of key strategic initiatives to improve commercial performance.
    • Analyze data formulate and test hypotheses to derive actionable insights address key business questions drive customer profiling and enable effective decision making.
    • Build dashboards and customized reports to track key metrics and empower business teams.

Requirements
    • 1 to 3 years of experience a strategy commercial business development consulting or similar role in high-growth environment P&L ownership experience a plus
    • Advanced Excel and Powerpoint skills comfortable analyzing and drawing insights from large data sets.
    • Experience in SQL would be a plus
    • Experience with Salesforce or other CRM software would be a plus
    • Proven track record of using data commercial or otherwise to draw actionable insights and improve business performance.
    • Proven track record of success in high-pressure environments comfortable dealing with ambiguity and change
    • Proven track record of driving complex projects and working with senior stakeholders across the business.
    • Exposure to working across geographies teams and individuals of different cultures particularly across Southeast Asia

Submit a job application

You will be helping a fast-growing startup scale and be given the opportunity to help build a new business. You will also be given the freedom to brainstorm and execute your suggestions to help the company operate more efficiently.

The Operations Manager needs to be capable in communicating with the personnel on the ground so as to relay expectations and instructions clearly. The Operations Manager also needs to possess critical thinking abilities in order to ideate and execute effective plans to better operations.

The following are the responsibilities that you will face on a daily basis:

    Your input and your suggestions will always be taken into consideration. You will be engaging in meaningful and productive discussions with the founders frequently. An extremely exciting journey lies ahead!

Job Description:

  • Analyzing and monitoring operational KPIs across the region

Summary
This is a place where extraordinary people gather to do their best work. At Apple we craft products and experiences people once couldn't have imagined and now can't imagine living without. Every day people do amazing things at Apple. What will you do?


The Pacific Operations Retail Fulfilment Operations (RFO) team is responsible for the Online and Retail direct channel fulfillment. We work with our local and global partners and commit to positive customer satisfaction. We seek precise execution and continuous improvement in our direct channels fulfillment.


Key Qualifications
MBA or Bachelor’s degree plus minimum 6-9 years of relevant experience in project/program implementation in a MNC environment

Expertise in SAP is desirable

Prior experience in program project management and/or business analytics with a proven track record of successfully implementing Promotions and New Product Introductions

Extensive Supply Chain Logistics and/or operations experience with e-commerce and/or Retail is highly preferred

Excellent communication and presentation skills

Attention to details with great analytical skills coupled with the ability to evaluate analyze and present data to executive level

A great team player with a positive attitude

Shown ability to lead and motivate teams lead through influence

Demonstrate initiative flexibility and problem-solving skills in an ambiguous and dynamic environment

Excellent communication interpersonal and negotiation skills.

Ability to build effective relationships in a cross-functional team.


Description
We are seeking a Readiness Lead within RFO to partner with our cross-functional teams across Pacific Operations Apple Online Retail as well as with our World-Wide Retail Fulfillment Operations (WWRFO) teams. In this role you will plan and execute Promotions and New Product Introductions (NPI) for Apple Retail and Apple Online Stores across the Asia-Pacific.


To be successful you should be a proactive driven individual who is comfortable working in a dynamic and sometimes ambiguous environment. You should also be an extraordinary team player and a great communicator.

Key Responsibilities:

- Drive and own Online and Stores launch plans for Pac Ops RFO for Promos and NPI

- End-to-end planning execution reporting and post-mortem for Promos

- Partner closely with Retail and Online store teams to influence align and support our strategy for launch and the requirements

- Transform Online and Store launch strategies into operational and tactical plans

- Work closely with WWRFO to ensure alignment of launch strategy and Plan of Record

- Collaborate closely with Pacific Operations teams to ensure successful implementation of our launch requirements

- Responsible for launch status updates and executive reporting to Regional and WW senior management teams

- Review past launches to identify key wins and opportunities for continuous improvement and takeaways


Education & Experience
Masters of Business Administration or Bachelor degree

Do you love food and convenience put together? Then you would definitely love foodpanda!

foodpanda is the leading on-demand food delivery company in APAC and brings thousands of your best loved restaurants online into your home or office - fast! We’re all about bringing on the smartest folks as we continue to grow with an “all hands on deck” environment and hire those who can thrive in a start-up culture.

Job Title: Assistant Manager| Regional Merchant Product Business Owner
Job Description:
Job Description:

Get to know the Role :

The Regional Merchant Product Business Owner role is part of the Regional Merchant organization in Grab who is focusing to provide the best merchant experience and services in the region as well as to empower our merchant partners to grow and provide opportunities to solve their everyday needs.

Merchant Focused : As the Regional Merchant Product Business Owner you will become a product business partner responsible for ensuring that the product roadmap delivers the objectives to support both internal (Country Sales & Operations team) and external (merchant partners) stakeholders to offer best-in-class experience in the different aspect of merchant lifecycle such as in onboarding settlements & cashout merchant customer support unified merchant view etc.

Product Roadmap Management: As part of the Product Business Owner team you will also be responsible for understanding pain-points and gathering insights from from Country Sales & Operations and Product teams to build a pipeline of features gathering requirements prioritise them based on impact and agree on a rollout approach and schedule. You will also help communicate the progress and support system/feature launches across the region as well as ensuring adoption of the system/features being rolled out. On top of that you will also be exposed to work directly with Grab’s product engineering and data analytics teams.

Regional Scope: The scope of the Product Business Owner team is Regional (across SEA countries) across all businesses (Food Mart Pay Ads etc.). You will be expected to lead Product Business Ownership for one or more businesses across the Region. Though you will be based with the regional team in Singapore you will be expected to travel to local markets to better understand local needs and to help with high-impact deliverables. The exact extent of travel will depend on the travel guidance in Grab.

Ninja Van is a tech-enabled logistics company on a mission to provide hassle-free delivery services for businesses of all sizes across Southeast Asia. Launched in 2014 we started operations in Singapore and have become the region's largest and fastest growing last-mile logistics company partnering with over 35000 merchants and delivering more than 1000 parcels every minute across six countries.

At our core we are a technology company that is disrupting a massive industry with cutting-edge software and operational concepts. Powered by algorithm-based optimisation dynamic routing end-to-end tracking and a data-driven approach we provide best-of-class delivery services that delight both the shippers and end customers. Ninja Van has grown into a company of over 15000. With this there is a need for more systematic consistent performance management processes that empowers managers and the business to maximise the potential of its greatest asset - its people.

The Talent Management Specialist will be responsible for the implementation of new performance management processes and the execution and coordination of those processes across the 6 countries that Ninja Van operates in.

Requirements
    • 3-5 years of working experience implementing and administering performance management processes

Regional Seller Operations sits at the intersection of strategy data analytics and operations. The team is responsible for designing and implementing strategies initiatives tools and features that will help thousands of e-commerce sellers across our markets to scale their operations and grow their businesses on Shopee.

We welcome data-driven problem-solvers and hustlers to be part of our energetic team. Data is core to our work - we work with large data sets to draw insights into sellers' behaviour deep-dive into their pain points and measure the effectiveness of our initiatives. But more than anything we are passionate about problem-solving and creating impact for our sellers.



What you will be doing:

  • Work with large data sets to distill insights into sellers' behaviour using advanced data analytics tools (SQL Python Pandas R etc).
  • Conduct industry analysis into policies tools and initiatives to identify learnings that can be adapted to our users.
  • Develop a deep understanding of our sellers via face-to-face interaction with local teams and sellers. Travel is expected.
  • Communicate ideas and findings in a logical and structured manner to senior management
  • Conceptualize new tools and product improvements for sellers; collaborate with the Product team to translate these into business requirements and launch new products
  • Project manage the rollout and adoption of initiatives and features including coordinating testing developing training material reporting and tracking of impact



Requirements:

  • Degree in STEM or other subjects with a strong analytical component. Fresh grads and experienced hires are both welcomed.
  • Strong data analytical skill sets; SQL and/or Python are highly desirable.
  • Interest to build broad capabilities in strategy operations data analytics and product design in the E-commerce industry.
  • Strong problem-solving skills - able to break down problems draw insights from complex data and design practical and scalable solutions.
  • Experienced hires are expected to have strong slide-writing skills and experience with managing multiple stakeholders.



What will help to set you apart:

  • Strong curiosity to understand the "whys" and "hows" and to develop the "so-what" that will shape policies initiatives and features.
  • Strong ability to learn and navigate ambiguity. This role is suitable for individuals who thrive in a fluid fast-paced and unstructured environment. We take an iterative approach and are not afraid of taking trying and learning from mistakes.
  • Self-motivated with a "can-do attitude"; proactive in finding better ways to get things done and exhibits strong ownership of work. Our culture is fast-paced and impact-focused.

Summary
Do you love hands-on problem solving? Are you passionate about sharing your technical knowledge and guidance with others? As a Genius Admin you help deepen our customers’ trust in Apple by coordinating oversight to one of our many skilled technicians.

Using your amazing diagnostic and people skills you create an extraordinary customer experience that provides them with swift resolutions to their technical issues. You also provide mentorship for our team and build their knowledge about products while individually keeping your own technical know-how up to date. With your passion for delivering outstanding customer service and your empathetic nature you are dedicated to providing the advice and support that help our customers and team members thrive.


Key Qualifications
Adept at creative problem solving.

Motivated to do what’s best for the customer and the team.

Ability to anticipate and adjust for problems and roadblocks.

Can make decisions quickly sometimes under tight deadlines and pressure.

Provide information that team members need to do their jobs and make accurate decisions.


Description
As a Genius Admin you provide insightful advice and friendly hands-on technical support to our customers throughout the different stages of the repair process. You quickly diagnose product issues on the spot clearly explaining situations with patience and compassion. After determining whether repairs can be done or a replacement is needed you offer solutions to get users up and running again. You keep customers informed about their device’s repair status and assist with other customer service issues that may arise during the process. You also coordinate the customer pickup process for all completed repairs by verifying successful repairs contacting customers and managing case notes. Throughout the process you fulfil Apple’s dedication to customer service with style speed and skill. You also earn the trust of customers and co-workers alike by offering mentorship knowledge and even tips and training.

Additionally you will manage end-of-month and new-month paperwork CRU paperwork and document storage. You will collaborate with the Operations team to manage and track service repair inventory and remain highly aware of inventory levels. You will order replacement consumables as needed and supervise the operational activities in the Repair Room.

You will be highly alert to loss-prevention issues using checks and balances based on processes and reports.


Additional Requirements
• You can orchestrate multiple activities simultaneously to accomplish the goal.

• You delegate clearly and comfortably to all team members while sharing responsibility and accountability.

A jewelry operaion manager is responsible for handling the daily operations and management of the store. His role is to oversee the staffing requirements of the store deal with customer service issues prevent theft and handles advertising and promotions of the store.

Duties of a Jewellery operations manager include assisting and managing the daily operations and activities of the jewelry store as well as supervising employees with their daily work requirements. The jewelry store manager also plans and prepares work schedules for jewelry store personnel assigns employees to specific duty requirements of the store prepares and directs personnel with appropriate merchandise and provide performance review. He/she is also responsible for storing display as well as advertising copy performing sales work such as taking inventory recollecting cash with sales receipts and maintaining operating records such as records of store transactions. The jewelry store manager also orders merchandise and stock as needed; and ensures personnel comply with established store security level as well as sales and record keeping procedures and practices.

As a member of the Global Operations team you will support the Lloyd’s Asia Country Manager on projects across the Corporation and in the market and manage the provision and oversight of Lloyd’s International Shared Services.

The Operations Executive is involved in the day-to-day operations of the ship and maintains safety standards and procedures. He/She is involved in the analysis and monitoring of operational data to ensure potential problems are averted. The Operations Executive also provide advice to ship crews and management on cargo requirements tank cleaning stability and stress and to maintain all statutory requirements for the ship in this field. He/She will also be required to analyse operational data to help improve inefficiencies and to predict operational problems.

The Operations Executive is a good communicator and has good negotiation skills. He/She has strong problem solving and analytical skills and may be required to work irregular hours.

Position – General Analyst Operations

Overview

We are Koru Partners a thematically driven alternative investment firm identifying attractive investment opportunities that are backed by macro-holistic themes encompassing forward-looking social economic demographic and technological changes. As a multi-asset investment manager we manage funds ranging from real asset funds in shipping to venture capital. In addition we also provide investment advice to established companies on their strategic opportunities.

We are looking for an Operations Analyst who is looking to grow with us. If you are a recent Singaporean graduate you will be enrolled into the Finance Associate Management Scheme. In this two-year structured programme you will rotate across the operational functions of a fund management firm including Accounts Human Resources Administration and Compliance.

Responsibilities
  • Accounts Management: Ensure that the accounting data accurately reflects the financial position and the performance of the firm in a timely manner.
  • Cash Flow Management: Maintain cash inflows and outflows to mitigate financial and operational risks.
  • Financial Modelling: Assist in forecasting the company financials and operational needs.
  • Effective Administrative Support: Liaise between internal and external parties in a professional manner while learning the context and building knowledge around the firm’s core activities.
  • Human Resource Management: Assist in managing the entire employee lifecycle from recruitment to retention.
  • Compliance Management: Assist in structuring and implementing frameworks that will ensure adherence to applicable laws and regulations in the relevant jurisdictions.
  • Continuous Improvement: Actively participate in the ongoing updates and enhancements of existing processes and internal controls.

Ideal Requirements
  • Less than 12 months graduate with a university degree or equivalent.
  • Basic knowledge in accounting is advantageous but not a prerequisite.
  • Independent learner requiring minimal supervision.
  • Intensely detail oriented.
  • Logical problem solver.
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite Xero (or any other accounting software) and quick to pick up new technologies and SaaS.
  • Singapore Citizen.


About You

We are a firm expecting collaborators to be highly aligned with our core values. Therefore you should be:
  • A Visionary: You are someone who dreams big and unconventionally possessing strong mental maps of how things should be done in order to realize audacious goals.
  • A Practical Thinker: You have a wide range of vision able to see and synergise from the macro-to-micro perspective. You are open-minded and able to hold conflicting thoughts simultaneously and look at them from different angles in order to achieve the best results.
  • Dedicated and Driven: You are passionate about what you are doing and is willing to push through any and every obstacle to go from visualization to actualization. You are undaunted by failure.
  • Ethical and Principled: You have a strong ingrained sense of professional integrity and ethics.

What You Can Expect
  • Competitive salary package
  • Health insurance and medical benefits
  • Clear career growth opportunities
  • Results not face time driven work environment
  • Dynamic fun and supportive team

Koru Partners is an equal opportunity employer. We believe that a team which is representative and inclusive of the talent clients and communities empowers and gives us a competitive advantage in the global marketplace. We support employee wellbeing and a balanced life providing avenues for employees to voice their concerns alongside inclusive employment policies.

Pomelo is leading online fashion company in Emerging Asia. Backed by fashion and technology investors from across the world Pomelo brings its unique fast fashion style to Emerging Asia through a technology-driven vertically-integrated design and production model. Our growth strategy is to merge our online focus of mobile and social with the latest trends and data.

We are looking for a SG & MY Operations Associate who wants to understand how an ecommerce fashion brand works and creates a digital experience for its customers. Are you the kind of person who enjoys working across the supply chain to deliver business result? Proficient in data analysis and Excel? Do you have a passion for operations management and 3PL management? We are looking for a talent to join our team.

You will be the key person executing the charge in day-to-day operations excellence in Singapore and Malaysia. At Pomelo each team member is expected to work autonomously often setting their own objectives and key results.

Responsibilities
  • Assist in executing fulfillment setups methods and processes.
  • Implement quality initiatives process change initiatives and other Lean initiatives to develop supply chain capabilities to enable the business in Singapore and Malaysia.
  • Be the main person to work closely with the warehouse(s) to monitor the end-to-end fulfilment performance drive and provide performance visibility to the team & use that to motivate reward or benchmark the team.
  • Coordinate with 3PL to ensure timely fulfilment processing and delivery from the Singapore logistic hub.
  • Be the contact point for customer experience logistics retail operations and merchandising for any day-to-day operational enquiries and issues related to shipments and delivery.
  • Collaborate closely within Operations team work with other cross functional teams and partner with 3PL to optimize end-to-end processes for both online and retail stores.
  • Follow set frameworks & metrics to monitor supply chain performances for high level of service quality shortest lead-time and best customer experience.
  • Monitoring return statuses to ensure no long pending returns that are not coming back to the warehouse(s).
  • Administer and monitor 3PL claims in cases of damage or loss.

Qualifications
  • Education background in Engineering Operations Management Business Management or related fields from an accredited university.

Our Vision is to be the preferred talent partner in Asia for accurately identifying and integrating high potential talents for our clients and accomplishing career success for our candidates.Over the years we have continued to innovate and improve the way we identify and assess talents to deliver on successful talent strategies for our clients.Our Client a market leader in helping business expand into new markets while providing tailor-made solutions to support the entire value chain of product distributions.This role reports to the Director and will manage and monitor distribution center operations operating departmental budgets and costs.

The Challenges
  • Manage operating departmental budgets and costs according to annual allocation to ensure efficient allocation of resources where applicable
  • Develop and enhance distribution center strategies policies and processes to optimize warehouse capacity enhance productivity and minimize costs
  • Manage the distribution center operations to achieve the organisational goals of “on time - in full and good condition” delivery of customer orders
  • Plan and manage the allocation of manpower resources based on business needs to ensure efficient distribution center operations
  • Monitor the availability and reliability of infrastructure and equipment to minimize downtime and resolve problems/breakdowns immediately
  • Monitor and identify operational cost drivers establish business controls and provide solutions to reduce costs and increase revenue
  • Monitor distribution center operations to ensure warehouse is compliance with good documentation practice (GDP) good manufacturing practice (GMP) quality standards and local regulations
  • Manage quality control measures/procedures to ensure accuracy of stocks/inventory and prevent damages in goods whether in storage or transit
  • Manage root cause analysis and establish corrective actions on stocks holding product quality and trade fulfillment
  • Build effective business relationships with suppliers customers government agencies and service providers
  • Collaborate with internal stakeholders (e.g. Sales Business Development etc.) to develop existing and new business to maximize utilization of warehouse
What It Takes
  • Diploma/Bachelor’s degree in Supply Chain Logistics Management or related field
  • 5 years of relevant experience in managing a Distribution Center
  • Demonstrate in-depth understanding of distribution center distribution and transportation
  • Proven hands-on experience in warehousing inventory management pick and pack functions
  • Demonstrate strong appreciation of customer service requirements and commitment
  • Proven experience and know-how in cost efficiency/reduction and productivity improvement initiatives

Service Market Logistics (SML) is a global organization within UD Trucks that provides end-to-end supply chain to service market business of all brands within UD Trucks. SML covers key processes from the inbound flow of spare parts from suppliers to warehousing parts and the distribution of parts to end customers through dealers. The organization is head quartered in Japan and globally active delivering world-class operational excellence for our customers based on smart logistics solutions we have. Our job is to develop manage and optimize the service market supply chain for all brands and stakeholders.

Our Organization gives you a good opportunity to understand how UD Trucks works from supplier to customer. We strive for an innovative and attractive workplace exercising the UD Trucks values with high focus on customer success. With us you can push your own professional skills and drive change together with committed people. We are in an exciting transformation phase – come learn and create a new future together with us!

Job Description
  • Operations Executive express their operations strategies and objectives to make sure that the company which they are working for reaches its target and operates effectively.
  • Assisting various other higher executives and also the owner of the company or may be the company's Board Of Directors.
  • They might also be given the responsibility for the complete operations of a small business.
  • Professionals doing an Operations Executive job is largely responsible for that particular part of the workplace that instantly manages the entire operations and also looks after the maintenance of equipment and facilities.
  • Has to report to various parts of the organization in which he or she works at like Chief Operations Officer Facilities Executive etc but he or she normally has direct access to the higher management.


Responsibilities

The roles and responsibilities of an Operation Executive have been listed below:
  • Individuals working as an Operations Executive need to communicate with the higher management to prepare a strategy for operations to run efficiently.
  • You also need to assist in developing long term plans to achieve the goals and objectives which are already set.
  • They are also burdened with managing the company's commercial operations and various expenses and budget.
  • An Operation Executive also keeps a check on the performance of the operations of both internal service providers and external service providers.
  • They also monitor the condition of the facility and keep a check on the environmental performance and give suggestions or approve funds or plans for spending.
  • One of the most important tasks is to provide them with a work environment which is favorable for high work productivity.
  • Apart from this they should also monitor the every performance metrics and they should receive and respond to approvals and notifications on a regular basis.

Our Mission
At Glints we are building The #1 full stack tech-enabled career development and human resource ecosystem in Greater Southeast Asia. Our product offering spans across early career discovery continuous skills development and tech enabled local and cross border recruitment.

Glints’ Growth Story by Numbers
Used tech-enabled approach to connect 1 Million+ candidates to their next dream opportunities supported 30000+ companies find great talent achieved double digit enhancements in recruiter efficiency and raised US$10M+ from best venture investors in Asia.

We’re on the look for a Regional Business Operations Associate to join our Business Ops team to help grow that mission in Asia.

Why you should join us:
You will become a part of an exciting fast-growing tech startup in Southeast Asia poised to become the leader of the Edutech and HRTech space in the region. You will have a great influence on our product or the processes and get the chance to work with a driven team backed by experienced investors and advisors in the region. You will also be directly exposed to the fastest growing emerging markets in the region (Indonesia Vietnam Philippines etc.).

What you’ll be doing:
You will be the second hire on the newly established Regional Business Operations team and will have the potential to shape the team’s growth and strategy. You will work directly with our Regional Business Operations & Partnerships lead a former Stanford MBA with operational experience across global education venture capital investing and tech startups. The position will offer significant opportunities for exposure to executive-level decision making.

  • Build data dashboards for business units to analyze their operational metrics in real-time; synthesize business intelligence to provide critical insights
  • Support business unit leads to proactively identify operational problems then develop and execute systems and processes to solve them
  • Deep-dive into core business processes to understand pain points and implement solutions
  • Support the creation of regional playbooks to ensure consistency and best practice as we scale
  • Support special projects and partnerships

This role may be a good fit for you if…

  • You have a passion to learn a business from the inside out and propel its growth
  • You excel at critically analyzing large quantities of data and distilling these into actionable insights to drive business results
  • You are process and systems-oriented
  • You love data analysis but equally enjoy rolling up your sleeves and driving execution
  • You have the ability to work with a high degree of urgency without sacrificing attention to detail
  • You thrive working cross-functionally and are comfortable managing various workstreams simultaneously
  • You are a people person who cares about supporting others
  • You’re a strong communicator who can clearly articulate analytical findings

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s Degree
  • 1-3 years experience as Operations Associate Business Analyst Data Analyst or in similar role
  • This role is open to Singapore or Remote (APAC region)
  • Must-haves:
    • Self-starter
    • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
    • Strong people skills
    • Strong excel modeling skills
  • Nice to haves:
    • Data analytics & visualization skills (SQL database experience (e.g. metabase) google data studio)
    • Previous management consulting experience
Since we’ve started we’ve had a clear mission: realizing human potential. We empower people to build their dreams by helping them hire the right people. Also we help people join the right rocketship that will improve their lives. We have impacted many lives but there’s still plenty to do and we can’t do it alone. Job Title: Operations and Enablement Lead| Professional Services - Singapore
Job Description:
Company Overview

Google is not a conventional company and we don’t intend to become one. True we share attributes with the world’s most successful organizations – a focus on innovation and smart business practices comes to mind – but even as we continue to grow we’re committed to retaining a small-company feel. At Google we know that every employee has something important to say and that every employee is integral to our success. We provide individually-tailored compensation packages that can be comprised of competitive salary bonus and equity components along with the opportunity to earn further financial bonuses and rewards. Googlers thrive in small focused teams and high-energy environments believe in the ability of technology to change the world and are as passionate about their lives as they are about their work. For more information visit www.google.com/careers.

The area: gTech (general)

Google creates products and services that make the world a better place and gTech’s role is to help bring them to life. Our teams of solution-oriented trusted advisors support millions of customers globally. Our solutions are rooted in our technical skill product expertise and a thorough understanding of our customers’ complex needs. Whether the answer is a bespoke solution to solve a unique problem or a new tool that can scale across Google everything we do aims to ensure our customers benefit from the full potential of Google products. To learn more about gTech check out our video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HcjR6ZngQcw.

The role: Operations and Enablement Lead Professional Services - Singapore

gTech’s Professional Services team takes a creative collaborative and customer-centric approach to provide foundational services and forward-looking business solutions to top advertiser and publisher customers. Hugo believes happy prosperous communities are built on healthy financial foundations.

That’s why at Hugo we’re on a mission to make Saving Second Nature.

Through our product vision of Better Budgeting Smarter Spending and Sustainable Saving together we can build a financially healthy and thriving community.

Hugo is a digital banking application and debit card that puts saving first. Our initial market will be Singapore but regional and global expansion will follow swiftly.

Hugo is a brand owned and operated by Atlas Consolidated Pte Ltd.

Who we are looking for and why

We are looking for an experienced Head of Operations to lead the Operations Team and work alongside the Executive Management Team.

We need to define build and implement our operations strategy architecture.

What a “Head of Operations” means to us

Someone who designs and implements comprehensive operations strategies ensuring compliance with local and international regulations oversees operational frameworks like treasury payments both card and banking customer service technology service delivery and drives live operations for the company’s business activities.

The Company depends on the Head of Operations to drive the operations strategy and provide leadership to the operations team including in card payments bank payment processing and reconciliation and excellence in customer service and care.

Requirements

How you can help us

There are certain functions and capabilities we believe are essential to the role:
  • Proven experience and success across the various disciplines of operations specifically in debit (and credit) card payments domestic banking and SWIFT payments - ideally within B2C e-wallet FX and payment services sector;
  • Ability to develop our Operations and Treasury strategy in alignment with strategic business objectives - being hands on with building and optimising processes;
  • Responsibility for building training and developing a team which can scale across SE Asia using cross functional training;
  • Responsibility for implementation of robust internal controls to ensure risk management in the day-to-day running of the Treasury and Operation team which mitigates errors through fostering a dialogue of ‘openness honesty and transparency’;
  • Treasury Management - including debit cards cash FX and physical gold of customer and operational accounts ensuring timely payment processing confirmation and reconciliation;
  • Debit Card Issuing program and operational management - working with card networks eg VISA Mastercard China Union Pay etc to ensure operational adherence on network rules and guidelines complete with knowledge of card settlement processes - fees refunds and charge-backs;
  • Work closely with the finance controller to ensure operational third party payments and aggregated customer accounts net balance to zero each day and meet the regulatory reporting schedules of the relevant regulatory bodies by country notably on meeting strict capital buffer requirements for the customer balances;
  • Previous experience with creating operational flows suggesting product improvements and working on onboarding flows to provide seamless customer experience;
  • Work with the Compliance Product and Technology teams to implement automated solutions for primarily for operations compliance customer onboarding and support;
  • Play a lead role in maintenance of quality assurance processes and implement streamlined processes for customers;
  • Develop and manage vendor relationships their contracts and negotiate commercial terms;
  • Experience working with an ASEAN based product market;
  • Combining market research with a data driven analytical approach to drive the strategy understand the value proposition set goals and demonstrate ROI;
  • Creating competitor and market analysis staying ahead of trends and competitor positioning;
  • Working with the Management Team to set budgets;
  • Working closely with Product Data Customer Support and Management in delivering a better experience for Hugo customers;
  • Create a solid network of strategic partnerships;
  • Propagating our purpose mission vision and values.

What we would consider as added value

Skills And Capabilities We Believe Are Highly Relevant Include
  • 8+ years of proven experience in a lead/senior operations role;
  • Bachelors/Masters degree or equivalent in a relevant subject area;
  • Multidisciplinary experience within multiple operational roles in financial services or fintech;
  • Potential experience with Card networks on acquiring side;
  • Experience with consumer asset management operations equity bonds and FX;
  • Strong knowledge of South East Asian markets (particularly Singapore);
  • Passionate about joining an early stage Fintech;
  • Ability to identify build and enhance key relationships influence and challenge as required;
  • Superior time management and very organized with excellent interpersonal and presentation skills;
  • Fluent English speaker and writer ideally with local language skills – Indonesian Mandarin.

Performance indicators to get you off to a great start

A Touch Down Quick Win (30 Days)
  • Develop an Operations strategy robust for scaling over the first 24 months;
  • Develop Operational Risk Management (ORM) procedures and guideline documentation for team reflecting risk and compliance policies in place for soft launch including preliminary operational continuity business plans;
  • Check account integrity and implement Treasury management processes and reporting.


Found Your Feet (90 Days)
  • Further develop ORM procedures and standards from first 30 days to incorporate a cultural awareness of operational compliance and business risk;
  • Develop robust business continuity plan to be updated based on growth of company and annually;
  • Set budget for expansion in conjunction with executive team.


Well Into Your Stride (180 Days)
  • Continue to develop ORM strategies and implementation including cross functional training of your growing team;
  • Improve and develop Operational Technology systems to improve operational efficiencies - automation and cost benefits.


Benefits

Can accommodate flexi-working schedules

Hugo Values being Responsible Open and Collaborative

We are responsible to our customers community and team to help shape a more open collaborative approach to money. This is the way Hugo hopes to make a difference and help us build better communities.

Shared responsibility is not only part of our approach to money but a key part of how we work together. This shared responsibility allows for openness and candour between us as a team and in our relationship with our customers.

Good ideas can come from anywhere so an open and collaborative dialogue between the Hugo community (customers the team the stakeholders alike) helps get the best from us all and helps make the difference.

Operation Executive Job Description

Although all operation executives oversee daily operations other duties may differ from company to company. One business may hire an operation executive because they believe that his strong sales background will be invaluable while another business may prefer to hire an executive who has experience managing company culture change.

The Management Executive Job Scope May Include These Responsibilities
  • Preparation and oversight of the operational budget.
  • Development of strategies and procedures that increase efficiency and maximize profits.
  • Oversight of day-to-day operations.
  • Creation of sales or production goals often in cooperation with other executives and the chief executive officer.
  • Identification of issues that may affect sales production or delivery of services and creation of solutions to promptly address problems.
  • Supervision of managers and operational staff members.
  • Interpretation of data and analytics and report generation.
  • Presentations to fellow executive team members the CEO employees shareholders the board of directors and the media.

Successful operation executives understand how to motivate and encourage employees to meet and exceed targets and goals. They often have experience in several areas of business in addition to operations such as finance human resources and marketing and they draw on this experience to create realistic goals and strategies for operations.

Titles used for the operations role vary but may include chief operating officer vice president of operations executive director of operations or senior production manager. Regardless of what they’re called operation executives enjoy comparatively high salaries although job security isn’t guaranteed.

If the company surpasses its goals operation executives may be rewarded with praise and hefty bonuses. Unfortunately if sales decline or the company faces a costly product recall the executive’s job and reputation may be at risk.

The operation executive’s ability to succeed in the position is dependent on developing a strong rapport with the CEO. The CEO may rely on the executive to serve as sounding board for ideas or provide expertise in areas in which she is lacking. In some cases a job as an operation executive can lead to an eventual promotion to CEO.

Education and Training

A bachelor’s degree is usually the minimum educational requirement for operation executive positions. A degree in business administration finance accounting supply chain management business analytics or operation management can be helpful. Some companies may prefer to hire candidates who possess master or doctoral degrees.

Much of the training for the position begins long before you ever accept a job as an operations executive. Companies look for candidates who have held high-level positions in the industry and have a strong background in the field.
